Israel]]|}} {{MedalCompetition|[[UEFA European Under-17 Championship|UEFA U-17 European Championship]]|}} {{Medal|1st|[[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2007 Belgium]]|}} }} '''David de Gea Quintana''' ({{IPA-es|daˈβið ðe ˈxea kinˈtana}}; born 7 November 1990) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
Born in [[Madrid]], De Gea began his career aged 13 with [[Atlético Madrid]] and rose through the academy system at the club before making his senior debut in 2009. After being made Atlético's first-choice goalkeeper, he helped the team win both the [[2010 UEFA Europa League Final|UEFA Europa League]] and the [[2010 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]] in 2010. His performances attracted the attention of Manchester United, which he joined in June 2011 for £18.9 million, a British record for a goalkeeper at the time.
Since joining United, De Gea has made over 300 appearances and won a Premier League title, an [[2016 FA Cup Final|FA Cup]], a [[2016–17 EFL Cup|League Cup]], three [[FA Community Shield|Community Shields]] and the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|UEFA Europa League]]. For three consecutive seasons from [[2013–14 Manchester United F.C. season|2013–14]] to [[2015–16 Manchester United F.C. season|2015–16]], he was elected as United's [[Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year]], the first player in the award's history to win on three successive occasions (four in total),<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/POTY-Manchester-United-goalkeeper-David-De-Gea-named-Sir-Matt-Busby-Player-of-the-Year-for-2015-16|title=DAVID DE GEA WINS THIRD SUCCESSIVE PLAYER OF THE YEAR AWARD |date=3 May 2016 |accessdate=3 May 2016 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160503233049/http://www.manutd.com/en/MatchTrackerSeasons/2015-16/United-Today-Live-Blog/2015-16/May-2016/Player-of-the-Year-Awards-2015-16.aspx |archive-date=3 May 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> as well as being included in four consecutive (five in total) [[PFA Team of the Year]] sides from 2015 to 2018. In 2018 he was named in the [[FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XI|FIFA FIFPro World XI]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifpro.org/news/de-gea-kante-mbappe-in-world-11/en/|title=De Gea, Kante and Mbappé in World 11|website=FIFPro World Players' Union|date=24 September 2018}}</ref>
De Gea was the captain for the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21]] national team that won the European Championship in [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2011]] and [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013]], and also competed in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]]. He made his debut for the senior team in 2014 and was selected for [[2014 FIFA World Cup|that year's World Cup]]. He was tipped by many to become the successor to [[Iker Casillas]] as Spain's long-term goalkeeper,<ref name="Future">{{cite news |first=Pete |last=Jenson |title=David De Gea has finally come of age and looks the future for both Spain and Manchester United |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/pete-jenson-david-de-gea-has-finally-come-of-age-and-looks-the-future-for-both-spain-and-manchester-united-9796962.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=15 October 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref> and also is regarded to be one of the best goalkeepers in the world.<ref name="best in the world">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11295641/Wayne-Rooney-Man-Utd-can-win-title-with-best-in-world-David-de-Gea.html |title=Wayne Rooney: Man Utd can win title with 'best in world' David de Gea|publisher=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |last=Ogden |first=Mark|date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref><ref name="best in the world 2">{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11294620/David-de-Geas-performance-sparks-best-goalkeeper-in-the-world-debate-but-who-would-you-vote-for.html |title=David de Gea's performance sparks 'best goalkeeper in the world' debate|publisher=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=15 December 2014|accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref><ref name="best in the world 3">{{cite news|url=https://www.dreamteamfc.com/c/news-gossip/428324/david-de-gea-save-chelsea-man-united-juan-mata-2012/|title=STICKY Reliving the exact moment David De Gea went from Man United flop to world class superstar|website= Dream Team FC|date=18 October 2018|accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Atlético Madrid=== [[File:David de Gea.jpg|thumb|upright|left|De Gea playing for [[Atlético Madrid]] in 2010]] ====Youth and Atlético B==== Born in [[Madrid]] and raised in [[Illescas, Toledo|Illescas]],<ref name="Illescas">{{cite news |last=Hidalgo |first=Dani |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2009/10/05/mas_futbol/1254724047_850215.html |title=Un Illescas orgulloso se volcó con De Gea |trans-title=A proud Illescas turned to De Gea |date=5 October 2009 |accessdate=19 December 2014 |newspaper=Diario AS |location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> De Gea joined [[Atlético Madrid]] at the age of 13 when his then-coach Juan Luis Martín lied to the club that [[Rayo Vallecano]] were set to sign him. A few days later, [[Diego Díaz Garrido]] scouted De Gea and signed him immediately.<ref name="Illescas"/><ref>{{cite news |last=Casáñez |first=Juan |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2009/10/09/mas_futbol/1255069658_850215.html |title=Mentí al Atlético para que fichara a De Gea |trans-title=I lied to bring Atletico De Gea |date=9 October 2009 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Diario AS |location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> He eventually made his way up through the youth ranks at the club before signing his first professional contract in 2008, aged 17, contracting him to Atlético until 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2008/03/11/mas_futbol/1205190021_850215.html |title=De Gea firma contrato profesional con el Atlético hasta 2011 |trans-title=De Gea signs professional contract with Atletico until 2011 |date=11 March 2008 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Diario AS |location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> He spent his second season for [[Atlético Madrid B]] in [[Segunda División B]]. In the summer of 2009, De Gea was approached by [[CD Numancia|Numancia]] and English team [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] with regards to a loan move, with Atlético sporting director [[Jesús García Pitarch]] pushing for him to move to Numancia. De Gea rejected the approach, and was punished by being forced to train by himself.<ref name="DeGeaProfile">{{cite news |last=Mitten |first=Andy |url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/manchester-united/360/blog/post/2200204/in-form-david-de-gea-embodies-manchester-uniteds-upturn-in-fortunes-by-andy-mitten |title=In-form David De Gea embodies Man United's upturn in fortunes |date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref> Weeks later, Atlético manager [[Abel Resino]] noticed De Gea training alone and invited him to train with the first team, where he was rated as the third-choice goalkeeper.<ref name="DeGeaProfile"/> The same summer, Atlético rejected an offer from English team [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] for a permanent transfer for De Gea.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2009/09/01/futbol/equipos/atletico/1251833694.html |title=De Gea rechazó una oferta del Wigan |trans-title=De Gea rejected an offer from Wigan |date=1 September 2009 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref>
====2009–10 season: First team call up==== With first-choice goalkeeper [[Sergio Asenjo]] away on international duty at the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], De Gea was called up to the senior team as cover for [[Roberto Jiménez Gago|Roberto]]. He made his debut for the Atlético first-team at the age of 18 on 30 September 2009, coming on as a substitute after Roberto was injured after 27 minutes of Atlético's [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League group stage|UEFA Champions League Group stage]] match away to [[FC Porto|Porto]]; De Gea conceded two late goals as Atlético lost 2–0.<ref name="whirlwind">{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Bryan |title=De Gea stands tall after whirlwind bow |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=901256.html |publisher=UEFA |date=5 October 2009 |accessdate=1 July 2011}}</ref> Roberto's injury meant that De Gea was given his [[La Liga]] debut three days later, at home to [[Real Zaragoza]]; he gave away a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] in the 19th minute, but immediately redeemed himself by saving [[Marko Babić (footballer)|Marko Babić]]'s attempt in an eventual 2–1 win.<ref name="whirlwind"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2009/10/04/futbol/equipos/atletico/1254610675.html |title=De Gea: "Empezar aquí parando un penalti ha sido un sueño" |trans-title=De Gea: "Starting here by stopping a penalty has been a dream" |date=14 October 2009 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> He described starting at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium]] as a "dream since childhood".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2009/10/01/futbol/equipos/atletico/1254407242.html |title=De Gea: "Debutar en el Calderón es mi sueño desde pequeño" |trans-title=De Gea: "Start at the Calderon is my dream since childhood" |date=1 October 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> In January 2010, De Gea was touted as a possible replacement for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] goalkeeper [[Edwin van der Sar]], who was set to retire in 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2010/01/24/futbol/equipos/atletico/1264325881.html |title=La prensa inglesa sitúa a De Gea en el radar del Manchester United |trans-title=The British press puts De Gea on the radar of Manchester United |date=24 January 2010 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> Days later, however, he signed a new contract which would keep him with Atlético until 2013.<ref>{{cite news |last=Molina |first=Francisco |url=http://www.marca.com/2010/01/28/futbol/equipos/atletico/1264696302.html |title=De Gea, hasta 2013 de rojiblanco |trans-title=De Gea, Atletico until 2013 |date=28 January 2010 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref>
After some costly mistakes by Asenjo, and the arrival of [[Quique Sánchez Flores]] as manager, De Gea finished the [[2009–10 Atlético Madrid season|2009–10 season]] as the starting "number one". He won two [[man of the match]] awards along the way,<ref name="factfile">{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12040_7007619,00.html |title=De Gea factfile |publisher=Sky Sports |date=27 June 2011 |accessdate=27 June 2011}}</ref> against [[Athletic Bilbao]] and [[Valencia CF|Valencia]]. Additionally, he appeared in eight matches in the club's [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League|victorious]] [[UEFA Europa League]] campaign, including the 2–1 [[2010 UEFA Europa League Final|final win]] against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8675486.stm |title=Atletico Madrid 2–1 Fulham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2010 |accessdate=13 May 2010}}</ref> [[Diego Forlán]] later said of his first season, "David was good enough for the top level at 19 and the players had confidence in him."<ref name="DeGeaProfile"/>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Saque de De Gea (5155851125).jpg|thumb|De Gea during the Madrid Derby in November 2010]] {{Quote box |width=25% |align=left |quoted=1 |quote=This boy is as cold as a wolf. He has composure, nerve and self-confidence. The pressures that others might feel don't affect him. |salign=right |source=— Atlético youth goalkeeping coach [[Ángel Jesús Mejías Rodríguez|Ángel Mejías]] in 2010.<ref name="DeGeaQuote">{{cite news |last=Bryan |first=Paul |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=esp/news/newsid=1472959.html |title=Atlético trust in youthful De Gea |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=17 May 2014}}</ref> }}
De Gea started [[2010–11 Atlético Madrid season|2010–11]] in impressive fashion, helping Atlético win [[2010 UEFA Super Cup|the season]]'s [[UEFA Super Cup]]. In the 90th minute of the 2–0 win against [[Inter Milan|Internazionale]], he saved a [[Diego Milito]] penalty kick.<ref>{{cite news |title=Slick Atlético seal Super Cup success |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefasupercup/matches/season=2010/round=2000123/match=2002327/postmatch/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=27 August 2010 |accessdate=28 August 2010}}</ref> In September, it was reported that Manchester United manager [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] had missed a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] match with [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] to travel to Spain to watch De Gea in action against Valencia.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/826143/man-united-linked-with-de-gea-after-ferguson-misses-cup-clash |title=United linked with De Gea after Fergie misses cup clash |date=23 September 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2010/09/23/futbol/equipos/atletico/1285237907.html |title=Ferguson espió a De Gea |trans-title=Ferguson spied on De Gea |date=23 September 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> De Gea played down the rumours, saying, "The important thing is that I have a contract here and I'm an Atletico player until 2013."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/47713.html |title=De Gea not thinking about Manchester United move |date=28 September 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref>
{{Quote box |width=20% |align=right |quoted=1 |quote=Even though he's still growing physically and mentally, he's already on the road to becoming one of the best keepers around. Any other outcome would be a disappointment. |salign=right |source=— Atlético goalkeeping coach [[Diego Díaz Garrido]] in 2010.<ref name="DeGeaQuote"/>}}
Following his "faultless" performance in the [[Madrid Derby]] on 7 November, De Gea was hailed as the heir apparent to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]'s goalkeeper [[Iker Casillas]] for [[Spain national football team|Spain]],<ref>{{cite news |last=Train |first=Rob |url=http://espn.go.com/sports/soccer/blog/_/name/train_rob/id/5791196/spain-very-good-hands |title=Spain is in very good hands |date=11 November 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> a sentiment Casillas agreed with, saying, "In Spain we are lucky to have very good goalkeepers and De Gea soon might be fighting my place in the team," while Spain manager [[Vicente del Bosque]] described De Gea as "the future of the team".<ref>{{cite news |last=Del Estal |first=Sandra |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2010/11/05/mas_futbol/1288911641_850215.html |title=Casillas: "De Gea peleará pronto por mi puesto" |trans-title=Casillas: "De Gea will fight soon in my position" |date=5 November 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=Diario AS |location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> He remained the undisputed starting goalkeeper for the remainder of the season, going on to play in every La Liga match for the team en route to a seventh-place finish.
During his time with Atlético Madrid, De Gea shared a locker with [[Cléber Santana]], who died aboard [[LaMia Flight 2933]] on the way to the first-leg of the [[2016 Copa Sudamericana Finals]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Davie |first=Chris |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/11/29/david-de-gea-pays-tribute-to-former-team-mate-cleber-santana-killed-in-plane-crash-6290378/ |title=David De Gea pays tribute to former team-mate Cleber Santana killed in plane crash |date=29 November 2016 |accessdate=19 December 2016 |newspaper=Metro |location=London}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== ====Transfer==== Throughout the 2010–11 season, speculation regarding how Manchester United would replace their retiring goalkeeper [[Edwin van der Sar]] was widespread, and much attention focused on De Gea as United's key target.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ducker |first=James |url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/sport/football/premierleague/article2812086.ece |title=Manchester United eye David De Gea to succeed Edwin van der Sar |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=8 July 2015 |newspaper=The Times |location=London |subscription=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United close to signing keeper – David Gill |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13403434.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2011 |accessdate=29 June 2011}}</ref> After [[Gary Neville]]'s testimonial against [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] on 24 May, United manager Sir Alex Ferguson claimed that a deal had been done to bring De Gea to [[Old Trafford]], but this was later denied by the player's representatives and the Atlético management, with De Gea stating that he would not consider his future until after the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]].<ref>{{cite news |title=De Gea denies Manchester United deal is imminent |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13535728.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2011 |accessdate=29 June 2011}}</ref> Following Spain's victory in the tournament, De Gea was spotted in [[Manchester]] undergoing a medical with United on 27 June.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/163178m-keeper-de-gea-set-for-united-after-medical-2303700.html |title=£17.8m keeper De Gea set for United after medical |last=Herbert |first=Ian |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=28 June 2011 |accessdate=15 November 2011}}</ref> The next day, he reported that United were making him a contract offer, and the transfer was confirmed on 29 June for a British record fee for a goalkeeper of approximately £18.9 million.<ref name="United confirm signing">{{cite news |title=Manchester United confirm signing of David de Gea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13933241.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 June 2011 |accessdate=29 June 2011}}</ref>
Growing up, De Gea had admired United goalkeeper [[Peter Schmeichel]],<ref>{{cite news |last=Hunter |first=Graham |url=http://espn.go.com/sports/soccer/news/_/columnist/hunter_graham/id/6246962/graham-hunter-why-david-de-gea-manchester-united-keeper |title=Is he the one? Why David De Gea could be Manchester United's next goalkeeper |date=23 March 2011 |accessdate=19 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> and was often compared to Van der Sar, furthered by being dubbed "Van der Gea".<ref>{{cite news |last=Estepa |first=Javier |url=http://www.marca.com/2011/05/26/futbol/equipos/atletico/1306399590.html |title=De Van der Sar a 'Van der Gea' |trans-title=Van der Sar to 'Van der Gea' |date=26 May 2011 |accessdate=19 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== {{Quote box |width=30% |align=left |quoted=1 |quote= De Gea is high, has good feet, comes with authority and is agile... has everything to be one of the greatest goalkeepers in the next ten years. |salign=right |source=— [[Edwin van der Sar]], former Manchester United goalkeeper.<ref>{{cite news |last=Balague |first=Guillem |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2010/10/02/mas_futbol/1286000835_850215.html |title=Van Der Sar: "De Gea tiene un aire a mí cuando yo era joven" |trans-title=Van Der Sar: "De Gea has an air to me when I was young" |date=2 October 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=Diario AS |location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref>}}
De Gea made his first appearance for Manchester United in a 3–1 friendly win over [[Chicago Fire Soccer Club|Chicago Fire]] on 23 July 2011.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ogden |first=Mark |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/8657536/Manchester-United-goalkeeper-David-de-Gea-shines-on-debut-in-3-1-victory-over-Chicago-Fire-on-US-Tour.html |title=Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea shines on debut in 3–1 victory over Chicago Fire on US Tour |date=24 July 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> He made his competitive debut for United against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] on 7 August. Despite being caught out in the first-half by a header from [[Joleon Lescott]] and a long-range [[Edin Džeko]] strike that put City into a 2–0 lead, United rallied in the second half and won 3–2.<ref>{{cite news |last=Bevan |first=Chris |title=Man City 2–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14420151.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2011 |accessdate=7 August 2011}}</ref> De Gea made his league debut for Manchester United against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] a week later, where he received criticism for failing to save [[Shane Long]]'s goal during a 2–1 United victory,<ref>{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |title=West Brom 1–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14435075.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2011 |accessdate=14 August 2011}}</ref> which Ferguson described as "a learning process".<ref>{{cite news |last=Taylor |first=Daniel |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2011/aug/14/football-manchester-united-david-de-gea |title=Nervous start has put David De Gea's Manchester United place in doubt |date=14 August 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> De Gea kept his first clean sheet for United on his Old Trafford debut in the following fixture, a 3–0 victory against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Winter |first=Henry |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/8711607/Manchester-United-3-Tottenham-Hotspur-0-match-report.html |title=Manchester United 3 Tottenham Hotspur 0: match report |date=22 August 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> In the following match, six days later, De Gea saved a penalty from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] captain [[Robin van Persie]], which would have cancelled out United's 1–0 lead. He made further saves to deny Van Persie and [[Andrey Arshavin]] in United's 8–2 victory.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/14606020.stm |title=Man Utd 8–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2011 |accessdate=29 August 2011}}</ref> Teammate [[Wayne Rooney]] backed De Gea to succeed at United and hailed him as a "strong character".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/31/rooney-manchester-united-de-gea |title=Wayne Rooney backs David de Gea to succeed at Manchester United |date=31 August 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
[[File:David de Gea (ManU).jpg|thumb|upright|De Gea playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2012]]
On 18 September, Manchester United beat [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] 3–1 at Old Trafford, with De Gea making a string of impressive saves, particularly from [[Ramires]] – when the midfielder had an empty net to side-foot home, De Gea quickly got across to smother the ball away. De Gea's improvement in form continued in his next appearance, as he made two stunning saves to help his team to a 1–1 draw away at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]],<ref>{{cite news |last=Da Silva |first=Michael |title=Stoke 1–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14958150.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2011 |accessdate=25 August 2011}}</ref> and his overall performance was praised by teammates [[Patrice Evra]] and [[Darren Fletcher]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Mathieson |first=Stuart |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/star-pupil-manchester-united-star-871537 |title=Manchester United star David de Gea's homework pays off |date=26 September 2011 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News}}</ref> De Gea made his first ever [[UEFA Champions League]] start in a 3–3 draw against [[FC Basel|Basel]] on 27 September 2011. On 15 October, De Gea was praised for his efforts at [[Anfield]] as United drew 1–1 against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], providing important saves in a nerve-free performance,<ref>{{cite news |last=Winter |first=Henry |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/8830535/Manchester-United-goalkeeper-David-de-Gea-passes-the-test-of-nerve-at-Liverpools-Kop-End.html |title=Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea passes the test of nerve at Liverpool's Kop End |date=15 October 2011 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> prompting Liverpool manager [[Kenny Dalglish]] to joke, "I thought the press said the boy was struggling."<ref>{{cite news |last=Jolly |first=Richard |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/969751/jolly-ferguson-shuffles-his-pack |title=Ferguson shuffles his pack at Anfield |date=15 October 2011 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref>
On 23 October 2011, De Gea played as Manchester United suffered their worst home defeat since 1955 with a 6–1 loss against cross-town rivals Manchester City,<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Man Utd 1–6 Man City |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/15325536.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2011 |accessdate=5 November 2011}}</ref> the first time United had conceded six goals at home since 1930.<ref>{{cite news |last=Hayward |first=Paul |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2011/oct/23/manchester-city-united-new-era |title=Regal Manchester City destroy United to threaten the old order |date=23 October 2011 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> De Gea was in goal during the league defeat to [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] and was blamed by most media outlets for failing to deal with an aerial ball that led to the conceding of a late goal by [[Grant Hanley]] in a 3–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |last=Stone |first=Simon |url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/premier-league/de-gea-giftwraps-points-for-blackburn-26807060.html |title=De Gea gift-wraps points for Blackburn |date=1 January 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Irish Independent |location=Dublin}}</ref> De Gea was nonplussed by the error, saying, "all keepers make mistakes once in a while and none of us like it when we do. I have every intention of spending many years here at Manchester United. I want to become a great United keeper and I want to earn and deserve the respect I hope to get,"<ref>{{cite news |last=Stone |first=Simon |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-goalkeeper-david-de-gea-relaxed-about-mistakes-6284457.html |title=Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea relaxed about mistakes |date=3 January 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> and spoke of his intentions of surpassing his predecessor: "Hopefully, I will equal or even surpass the performance and contribution Edwin van der Sar made to the club."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/128746.html |title=I can surpass Van der Sar – De Gea |date=3 January 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> After this match, De Gea was dropped and replaced by United's second-choice goalkeeper, [[Anders Lindegaard]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Wallace |first=Sam |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/sam-wallace-manchester-united-are-dogged-by-too-many-problems-6285485.html |title=Manchester United are dogged by too many problems |date=6 January 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> An injury to Lindegaard saw De Gea return to the starting line-up for a 3–3 draw with Chelsea at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] on 5 February 2012.<ref>{{cite news |last=Williams |first=Richard |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/feb/05/premier-league-2011-12-chelsea |title=Manchester United's David de Gea shows true worth in Spanish duel |date=5 February 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> De Gea later cited his last-minute save from [[Juan Mata]] during this match as the turning point in his season, as he went on to play the club's last 19 matches, keeping eight clean sheets.<ref>{{cite news |last=Mathieson |first=Stuart |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/david-de-geas-manchester-united-1298775 |title=De Gea's future is still in his hands |date=7 February 2013 |accessdate=9 May 2014 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News}}</ref>
After a difficult first season in England, De Gea said, "There have been doubts in the first season but I always had faith in my ability. The pressure at an elite club like United is huge but Ferguson just told me to do what I did at Atlético. You have to be as strong when things go wrong but I don't get nervous. Mistakes are normal; everyone makes them."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/1126483/man-uniteds-david-de-gea-i-always-had-faith-in-my-ability |title=Man Utd's De Gea: 'I always had faith in my ability' |date=23 July 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref> His goalkeeping rival Lindegaard, however, promised to fight for the place he lost via injury, saying, "I want the number one spot because I am the best. I am sure he is a bit in front right now because he did well last season, so I need to take every chance I get to prove myself worthy of the number one spot."<ref>{{cite news |last=Stone |first=Simon |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/anders-lindegaard-plans-to-usurp-david-de-gea-as-manchester-united-number-one-7962092.html |title=Anders Lindegaard plans to usurp David de Gea as Manchester United number one |date=20 July 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> De Gea later admitted that he thought about leaving after the first season.<ref>{{cite news |last=Hirst |first=Paul |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/manchester-united-transfer-news-david-de-gea-considered-leaving-united-after-difficult-start-to-life-at-old-trafford-9778799.html |title=David de Gea considered leaving United after 'difficult' start to life at Old Trafford |date=7 October 2014 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== Due to his involvement in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]], De Gea missed Manchester United's pre-season tour, but nevertheless returned to the starting line-up for the opening match of the season against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. Despite some "outstanding" saves from De Gea, United lost 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Everton 1–0 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19240566 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}</ref> In the next match, a 3–2 win at home to Fulham, he made some noteworthy saves from [[Mladen Petrić]], [[Moussa Dembélé (Belgian footballer)|Moussa Dembélé]] and [[Bryan Ruiz]]. In attempting to claim a cross from [[Matthew Briggs]], however, a misunderstanding with [[Nemanja Vidić]] led to the Serbian defender putting the ball in his own net for Fulham's second goal.<ref>{{cite news |last=Magowan |first=Alistair |title=Man Utd 3–2 Fulham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19304316 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2012}}</ref>
{{Quote box |width=25% |align=left |quoted=1 |quote=I've no doubts that David De Gea can be a top goalkeeper, one of the best in the world. He's physically going to mature in the next 18 months and he needs a championship. |salign=right |source=— [[Gary Neville]] in 2013.<ref name="NevCriticism">{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11662/8422165/gary-neville-says-manchester-united-players-will-demand-more-of-david-de-gea-after-tottenham-error |title=Gary Neville says Manchester United players will demand more of David De Gea after Tottenham error |date=22 January 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>}} On 9 December, De Gea made back-to-back saves from Manchester City's [[Carlos Tevez]] and [[David Silva]], helping United to a 3–2 Manchester Derby win at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |last=McCauley |first=Kevin |title=Manchester City vs. Manchester United: Final score 3–2, Robin van Persie wins match marred by crowd trouble |url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2012/12/9/3746476/man-city-vs-manchester-united-final-score-result-match-report-2012-epl |website=SB Nation |date=9 December 2012 |accessdate=14 December 2012}}</ref> In the next match, a 3–1 win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] at Old Trafford, De Gea produced an important double-save from [[Craig Gardner]] and [[Stéphane Sessègnon]]'s follow-up.<ref>{{cite news |first=Stuart |last=Mathieson |title=Manchester United 3 Sunderland 1: Premier League match report |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_united/s/1596257_manchester-united-3-sunderland-1-premier-league-match-report |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=15 December 2012 |accessdate=16 December 2012}}</ref>
De Gea received criticism from former United captain Gary Neville for a punch that allowed Tottenham to score a stoppage time equaliser in a 1–1 draw at [[White Hart Lane]] on 20 January 2013, saying, "You've got to learn the hard way and he's learning in a very unforgiving environment where he's judged continuously at the highest level. There's a theory that he saved Manchester United because he made two or three great saves, but unfortunately that's a waste of time. He played well yesterday, but playing well for 92-and-a-half minutes and then doing that in the 93rd is a problem at a club like that."<ref name="NevCriticism"/> Ferguson responded by saying De Gea's critics were "idiots."<ref>{{cite news |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/25/manchester-united-alex-ferguson-david-de-gea |title=Manchester United's Alex Ferguson calls David de Gea's critics 'idiots' |date=26 January 2013 |accessdate=9 May 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> On 13 February 2013, De Gea made several saves to help United to a 1–1 draw against Real Madrid at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium]] in the first leg of the last 16 of the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], and was praised by manager Sir Alex Ferguson for his "excellent" performance,<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21454728 |title=Sir Alex Ferguson praises David de Gea |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 February 2013 |accessdate=14 February 2013}}</ref> one which was said to have turned him from "villain to hero" and made him "come of age".<ref>{{cite news |last=Ogden |first=Mark |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/9871206/Manchester-United-goalkeeper-David-De-Gea-transported-from-villain-to-hero-in-90-minutes-in-Madrid.html |title=Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea transported from villain to hero in 90 minutes in Madrid |date=14 February 2013 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Herbert |first=Ian |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/did-manchester-united-goalkeeper-david-de-gea-come-of-age-against-real-madrid-8496184.html |title=Did Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea come of age against Real Madrid? |date=14 February 2013 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref>
{{Quote box |width=25% |align=right |quoted=1 |quote=You bring a boy into the Premier League at 20, it's not easy. He's learning in the toughest environment in the world. But the one thing he has is fantastic inner strength. We teach him that the calmest man on the field has to be the goalkeeper. And one of his great strengths is his calmness. |salign=right |source=— goalkeeping coach [[Eric Steele]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite news |last=Taylor |first=Daniel |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/feb/14/david-de-gea-manchester-united |title=David de Gea looking the part in Manchester United's glove department |date=14 February 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>}}
On 23 February, De Gea recorded his second consecutive clean sheet for United, stopping a [[Loïc Rémy]] shot and a [[Christopher Samba]] header to help United to 2–0 victory over Queens Park Rangers.<ref>{{cite news |last=Magowan |first=Alistair |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21482798 |title=QPR 0–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 February 2013 |accessdate=7 May 2013}}</ref> This was followed by a 4–0 win at Old Trafford against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 2 March.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ornstein |first=David |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21556837 |title=Manchester United 4–0 Norwich |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 March 2013 |accessdate=7 May 2013}}</ref> Another clean sheet came on 16 March in a 1–0 victory against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Magowan |first=Alistair |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21724400 |title=Manchester United 1–0 Reading |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 March 2013 |accessdate=7 May 2013}}</ref> De Gea was on the receiving end of a controversial aerial challenge by [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] striker [[Andy Carroll]] that left him "poleaxed", with Ferguson expressing his disbelief at the lack of a red card.<ref>{{cite news |last=Hytner |first=David |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/18/manchester-united-ferguson-west-ahm-allardyce |title=Manchester United bemoan lack of red card for Andy Carroll of West Ham |date=18 April 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
De Gea's form throughout the season was recognised by his peers, culminating in being voted into the [[PFA Team of the Year|PFA Premier League Team of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/news/12040/8679063/ |title=Manchester United dominate PFA team of the year |publisher=Sky Sports |date=28 April 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref> He ended the season with his first [[List of English football champions|Premier League winner]]'s medal with United, making 28 appearances and keeping 11 clean sheets, as the team topped the [[2012–13 Premier League#Table|Premier League table]] by 11 points. This placed him joint-fifth in the race for the [[Premier League Golden Glove]].
====2013–14 season==== {{Quote box |width=25% |align=left |quoted=1 |quote=He has huge faith in himself, which is a really important virtue. He doesn't let anything affect him. The day he makes a mistake he knows he has made a mistake but it never sinks him. He uses it to make sure that he doesn't make the mistake next time. It's a great quality. |salign=right |source=— [[Juan Mata]] in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |last=Lowe |first=Sid |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/may/14/manchester-united-juan-mata-david-de-gea |title=Man Utd's Juan Mata: David de Gea is so calm he is 'almost unconscious' |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>}}
De Gea's season began with a clean sheet in the 2–0 win over Wigan in the [[2013 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Rostance |first=Tom |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23565298 |title=Man Utd 2–0 Wigan |date=11 August 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 5 October 2013, De Gea's save to deny Sunderland's [[Emanuele Giaccherini]] during a 2–1 away win was described by former Manchester United goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel as one of the best saves ever seen in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news |last=Oscroft |first=Tim |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/Peter-Schmeichel-praises-David-De-Gea-save-against-Sunderland |title=Peter Schmeichel praises David De Gea save against Sunderland |date=5 October 2013 |accessdate=6 October 2013 |publisher=Manchester United F.C.}}</ref> Manager [[David Moyes]] agreed with Schmeichel's assessment, describing the save was a "turning point" in a match in which they were losing 1–0 at the time,<ref>{{cite news |last=Murray |first=Ewan |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/oct/06/david-de-gea-manchester-united-sunderland |title=David de Gea's saves give Manchester United a platform at Sunderland |date=6 October 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> and said De Gea "is improving all the time".<ref>{{cite news |last=Bailey |first=Graeme |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11667/8962022/david-moyes-hails-form-of-manchester-united-goalkeeper-david-de-gea |title=David Moyes hails form of Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea |date=7 October 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
On 1 December, De Gea made his 100th appearance for Manchester United in a 2–2 draw against Tottenham.<ref>{{cite news |last=Anderson |first=David |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-uniteds-david-de-gea-2787284 |title=Manchester United's David De Gea looking for more as he closes in on his 100th appearance |date=13 November 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref> He received the backing of teammate Darren Fletcher, when, in the [[2013–14 Football League Cup|League Cup semi-final]] second leg against Sunderland on 22 January 2014, De Gea was deemed to be at fault when he let a weak [[Phil Bardsley]] shot past him deep into extra time;<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/23/darren-fletcher-backs-david-de-gea |title=Darren Fletcher backs David de Gea following semi-final mistake |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11667/9129333/manchester-uniteds-darren-fletcher-backs-goalkeeper-david-de-gea |title=Manchester United's Darren Fletcher backs goalkeeper David de Gea |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> a [[Javier Hernández]] goal soon after left the aggregate score at 3–3, resulting in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]], where De Gea's penalty saves from [[Steven Fletcher (footballer)|Steven Fletcher]] and [[Adam Johnson (footballer)|Adam Johnson]] were not enough to help United advance, losing 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |last=De Menezes |first=Jack |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/the-worst-penalty-shootout-ever-penaltybypenalty-analysis-of-sunderlands-capital-one-cup-victory-over-manchester-united-9080850.html |title=The worst penalty shoot-out ever? Penalty-by-penalty analysis of Sunderland's Capital One Cup victory over Manchester United |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> On 19 March, whilst playing against [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|first knockout stage]] of the Champions League as United came from 2–0 down to win 3–2 on aggregate, De Gea made a crucial double-save before half-time which was said to have defied "all known laws of physics and physiology" in a performance described as "magnificent".<ref>{{cite news |last=White |first=Jim |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/10710956/Manchester-United-goalkeeper-David-De-Gea-stands-tall-as-his-side-progress-to-Champions-League-quarter-finals.html |title=Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea stands tall as his side progress to Champions League quarter-finals |date=20 March 2014 |accessdate=19 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> Teammate [[Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992)|Phil Jones]] claimed that "he's up there with the best goalkeepers in the world".<ref>{{cite web |last=Thompson |first=Gemma |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/phil-jones-hails-world-class-david-de-gea |title=De Gea is world class |date=20 March 2014 |accessdate=19 December 2014 |publisher=Manchester United F.C.}}</ref> De Gea's performances throughout the season saw him named as both the club's Players' Player of the Year and Fans' Player of the Year.<ref>{{cite news |last=Richards |first=Chris |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/david-de-gea-named-manchester-3515935 |title=David de Gea named Manchester United Player of the Year AND Players' Player of the Year |date=8 May 2014 |accessdate=9 May 2014 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== {{Quote box |width=25% |align=right |quoted=1 |quote=We are now seeing a huge improvement in his game. And he is winning United match after match, which is what I expect from a United goalkeeper. He has now become a great goalkeeper. |salign=right |source=— [[Gary Neville]] in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |last=Neville |first=Gary |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/29326/9608317/premier-league-manchester-united8217s-david-de-gea-8216has-now-become-a-great-goalkeeper8217-says-gary-neville |title=Manchester United's David de Gea 'has now become a great goalkeeper', says Gary Neville |date=16 December 2014 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>}} De Gea helped United secure back-to-back victories for the first time under their new manager [[Louis van Gaal]] in a home victory against Everton on 5 October 2014. During the match, De Gea made three important saves, including one penalty from [[Leighton Baines]], to help United secure a 2–1 win in which he was voted by Manchester United fans as man of the match.<ref>{{cite web |last=Grant |first=Ryan |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Oct/David-De-Gea-named-Man-of-the-Match-against-Everton.aspx |title=David De Gea named Man of the Match |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=Manchester United F.C.}}</ref> He became the first goalkeeper to stop a penalty from Baines, who had previously converted all of his 14 Premier League penalties.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-vs-everton-leighton-baines-misses-first-penalty-of-his-premier-league-career-9775336.html |title=Manchester United vs Everton: Leighton Baines misses first penalty of his Premier League career |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> After several vital stops against Everton, West Brom and Chelsea, he was named Manchester United's Player of the Month for October.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Froggatt |first1=M |last2=Tuck |first2=J |date=31 October 2014 |accessdate=1 December 2014 |publisher=Manchester United F.C.}}</ref> On 14 December, De Gea was awarded the man of the match for his "outstanding" performance against Liverpool,<ref>{{cite news |last=Wallace |first=Sam |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-vs-liverpool-report-david-de-gea-outstanding-as-clinical-united-make-liverpool-suffer-9924030.html |title=David De Gea outstanding as clinical United make Liverpool suffer |date=14 December 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> making eight saves in a 3–0 victory,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/man-utd-3-0-liverpool-which-only-game-de-geas-made-more-premier-league-saves |title=Which is the only game De Gea's made more Premier |first=Matthew |url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/sport/columnists/matthewsyed/article4297434.ece |title=David de Gea's wizardry stops opponents and admirers in tracks |date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |newspaper=The Times |location=London |subscription=yes}}</ref> He was hailed by Van Gaal as "unbelievable" for his performances,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/30778/9744574/newcastles-jonas-gutierrez-moved-with-reception-on-his-return-to-action-after-fight-with-cancer |title=David de Gea is an unbelievable goalkeeper, says Louis van Gaal |date=5 March 2015 |accessdate=13 April 2015 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> and was called the "saving grace" for being the one constant in the team throughout the season.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wilson |first=Paul |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2015/mar/14/david-de-gea-manchester-united-goalkeeper-tottenham |title=David de Gea is saving grace of Manchester United's confusing season |date=14 March 2015 |accessdate=13 April 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> Amid rumours of a departure, he said he was "proud" to play for United, and was prompted by Peter Schmeichel and Gary Neville to sign a new contract with the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/manchester-united/story/2316773/david-de-gea-deal-would-send-a-signalsays-man-utd-legend-peter-schmeichel |title=David De Gea deal would send a signal – Man Utd legend Peter Schmeichel |date=24 February 2015 |accessdate=13 April 2015 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Orr |first=James |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/david-de-gea-says-he-is-proud-to-be-a-red-as-gary-neville-warns-the-club-must-keep-the-goalkeeper-at-all-costs-10173003.html |title=David De |location=London}}</ref>
At the end of the season, De Gea was shortlisted for the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] and the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]], before losing out to [[Eden Hazard]] and [[Harry Kane]] respectively.<ref>{{cite news |last=Luckhurst |first=Samuel |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-goalkeeper-de-gea-9060846 |title=Manchester United goalkeeper De Gea nominated for PFA Player of the Year award |date=16 April 2015 |accessdate=16 April 2015 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32342000 |title=PFA awards: Kane, Hazard, De Gea, Coutinho on both shortlists |date=16 April 2015 |accessdate=16 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea's Eden Hazard named PFA Player of the Year|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32472834|accessdate=27 April 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 April 2015}}</ref> On 26 April 2015, De Gea was named in the PFA Team of the Year as its goalkeeper and its only Manchester United player.<ref>{{cite news |title=PFA Team of the Year: Chelsea have six players selected |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32472834 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=26 April 2015 }}</ref> He also won both [[Sir Matt Busby Player of the |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/May/POTY-David-De-Gea-wins-Sir-Matt-Busby-Player-of-the-Year-award.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=19 May 2015 |accessdate=20 May 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Froggatt |title=David De Gea wins Players' Player of the Year |accessdate=20 May 2015 }}</ref> His save against Everton was voted as Premier League Save of the Season by ''[[Match of the Day]]'', the second consecutive year he won the award.<ref>{{cite web |title=What was your Premier League save of the season? |url=http://vote.tectonicinteractive.com/?22#/show-answers/16475 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 May 2015 |accessdate=20 May 2015 ====2015–16 season==== [[File:De Gea (ManUtd).jpg|thumb|upright|De Gea playing for Manchester United in 2016]]
On 7 August 2015, Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal confirmed that De Gea would not be considered for selection for United's Premier League opener against Tottenham the following day, due to the uncertainty surrounding his future.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33816902 |title=Man Utd: David De Gea not the same as last season – Van Gaal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 13 August, Van Gaal revealed that De Gea had requested to goalkeeping coach [[Frans Hoek]] that he be left out of the team.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jolly|first1=Richard|title=Louis van Gaal says David De Gea agreed to be left out against Spurs|url=http://www.espnfc.com/barclays-premier-league/story/2562108/van-gaal-says-david-de-gea-agreed-to-sit-vs-tottenham|publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=14 August 2015|date=13 August 2015}}</ref> De Gea claimed he never expressed a desire not to play, but trained with the reserves soon after.<ref>{{cite web|last=Roan|first=Dan|title=Man Utd: David De Gea is surprised at being left out|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33935204|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=14 August 2015|date=14 August 2015}}</ref> On 31 August, after a summer of speculation, an agreement for a transfer was reached between Manchester United and Real Madrid worth £29 million, including the part-exchange of fellow goalkeeper [[Keylor Navas]]. The deal, however, collapsed due to paperwork not being submitted before the transfer window in Spain closed.<ref>{{cite news |title=David De Gea: Man Utd deny blame for failed Real Madrid deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34117354 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2015}}</ref> After the transfer window closed, Spanish head coach Vicente del Bosque admitted that it would be difficult for him to select De Gea in Spain's European Championship squad if Manchester United continued not to select him.<ref>{{cite news |title=Vicente del Bosque warns David de Gea over Euro 2016 spot |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9976084/vicente-del-bosque-david-de-gea-must-play-to-earn-place-in-spain-squad |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 September 2015 |accessdate=11 September 2015 }}</ref>
On 11 September, De Gea signed a new four-year deal with Manchester United, with an option to extend it for a further year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Sep/David-De-Gea-signs-new-contract-at-Manchester-United.aspx |title=De Gea signs new United contract |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=11 September 2015}}</ref> Twelve days later, in the third round of the League Cup, De Gea [[captain (association football)|captained]] Manchester United for the first time, wearing the armband for the final nine minutes of their win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].<ref>{{cite news|first=Richard|last=Jolly|date=24 September 2015|title=David De Gea 'proud' to captain Man United after Real Madrid transfer saga|accessdate=13 January 2016|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/manchester-united/story/2629446/david-de-gea-proud-to-captain-man-utd-after-real-madrid-saga|publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref> In April 2016, while leading the race for the Premier League Golden Glove with 14 clean sheets, De Gea was the sole Manchester United player named in the PFA Team of the Year.<ref>{{cite news|title=PFA awards: Leicester and Spurs dominate Premier League team|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36106596|accessdate=21 April 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 April 2016}}</ref> On 23 April, in a 2–1 win over Everton in the FA Cup semi-finals, he saved a penalty from [[Romelu Lukaku]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Paul|title=Anthony Martial takes Manchester United past Everton to final at the last|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/23/everton-manchester-united-fa-cup-match-report|accessdate=23 April 2016|newspaper=The Observer |location=London |date=23 April 2016}}</ref>
In May 2016, De Gea became the first player ever to win Manchester United's Player of the Year for a third consecutive season.<ref>{{cite news|title=David de Gea wins Manchester United Player of the Year for record third time|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10267586/david-de-gea-wins-manchester-united-award-for-record-third-time|accessdate=18 May 2016|publisher=Sky Sports|date=3 May 2016}}</ref> During the same month, he also won BBC ''Match of the Day'' Save of the Season for the third consecutive year, for his save against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 21 November 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=BBC MOTD Save of the Season|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/36230500|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 May 2016}}</ref> In the last league match of the season, a 3–1 win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]], De Gea was denied the chance to share the Premier League Golden Glove with Arsenal's [[Petr Čech]] due to a stoppage-time own goal by [[Chris Smalling]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Petr Cech wins Premier League Golden Glove award|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10286338/petr-cech-wins-premier-league-golden-glove-award|accessdate=18 May 2016|agency=Sky Sports|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 May 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== {{Expand section|date=April 2018}} Under new Manchester United manager [[José Mourinho]], De Gea made his first appearance of the season in the [[2016 FA Community Shield|FA Community Shield]] against Premier League winners [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]]. The match ended in a 2–1 victory for United.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36934956|title=Jose Mourinho began his reign as Manchester United manager with a trophy |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2016}}</ref>
On 20 April 2017, De Gea was selected as a goalkeeper in the PFA Team of the Year for the fourth time.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/chelsea-tottenham-dominate-pfa-premier-league-team-year|title=Chelsea, Tottenham dominate PFA Premier League Team of the Year|date=20 April 2017|magazine=FourFourTwo}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Manchester United v Leicester City, 26 August 2017 (09).JPG|thumb|left|De Gea (in black) playing for United against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in August 2017]] On 17 September 2017, at the fifth match of the Premier League against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], De Gea made his fourth clean sheet of the season and 100th overall for Manchester United.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2017/Sept/Video-David-De-Gea-reaches-century-of-clean-sheets-for-Manchester-United.aspx | title=David De Gea's Century of Clean Sheets | publisher=Manchester United F.C. | date=17 September 2017 | accessdate=18 September 2017 |last=Higgins|first=Adam}}</ref>
[[File:CSKA-MU 2017 (9).jpg|thumb|upright|De Gea with manager [[José Mourinho]] during a [[2017-18 UEFA Champions League|2017 Champions League]] match]] On 2 December 2017, in a 3–1 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], De Gea recorded 14 saves and equalled the mark that was shared by [[Tim Krul]] and [[Vito Mannone]] as the Premier League record for the greatest number of saves in a single game and he also won the Man of the Match award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/de-gea-equals-record-for-most-saves-in-a-premier-league-game/a4e0puwgjqfa1r8jh881rzla6|title=De Gea equals record for most saves in a Premier League game|website=Goal.com|date= 2 December 2017|accessdate=25 May 2018}}</ref>
On 18 April 2018, De Gea was selected as a goalkeeper in the PFA Team of the Year for the fifth time as the only Manchester United player.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/de-gea-equals-record-for-most-saves-in-a-premier-league-game/a4e0puwgjqfa1r8jh881rzla6|title=De Gea equals record for most saves in a Premier League game|website=Goal.com|date=2 December 2017|accessdate=2 December 2017|last=Vertelney|first=Seth}}</ref>
On 11 May 2018, after a 0–0 draw against West Ham, De Gea earned his 18th clean sheet of the season and also secured his first [[Premier League Golden Glove]] since he joined Manchester United in 2011.
====2018–19 season==== The 2018–19 season began with De Gea keeping just five clean sheets in his first 25 appearances. The start of 2019, however, saw him manage the same number in just eight appearances, including a 1–0 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 13 January 2019, in which he made 11 saves to keep Spurs off the scoresheet, the second most by a goalkeeper in any one Premier League match, behind only his 14 saves against Arsenal a year earlier.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Tottenham vs Manchester United: David de Gea puts his best foot forward to reach new heights |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-hotspur-vs-manchester-united-result-final-score-david-de-gea-saves-video-epl-a8726441.html |work=The Independent |date=14 January 2019 |accessdate=25 February 2019 }}</ref> His clean sheet against Liverpool on 24 February was his 100th for Manchester United in the Premier League, making him the seventh goalkeeper to reach that milestone for a single club in the competition and the second for Manchester United after Peter Schmeichel.<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Bevan |title=Liverpool held to goalless draw by injury-hit Man United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47268878 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 February 2019 |accessdate=25 February 2019 }}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== [[File:David de Gea at the UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship - 20110622.jpg|thumb|upright|left|De Gea lining up for [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] in 2011]]
De Gea helped [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain's under-17 team]] win the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship|2007 European Championship]],<ref name="destiny">{{cite news |last=Bandini |first=Paolo |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2011/may/25/david-de-gea-manchester-united |title=The 'New van der Sar' fulfils his destiny |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=25 May 2011}}</ref> and finish second at the [[2007 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2007 World Cup]].<ref name="factfile"/> In early May 2010, courtesy of solid Atlético performances, he was named by senior squad manager Vicente del Bosque in a provisional 30-man squad for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]];<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.marca.com/2010/05/10/futbol/seleccion/1273509662.html |title=Valdés, De Gea, Azpilicueta, Javi Martínez y Pedro entran en la preselección de 30 |trans-title=Valdés, De Gea, Azpilicueta, Javi Martinez and Pedro are short listed 30 |date=10 May 2010 |accessdate=16 December 2014 |newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |language=Spanish}}</ref> however, he did not make the final cut.<ref name="factfile"/> In 2011, he was part of the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21]] team that won the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship.
[[File:David De Gea Olympics 2012.jpg|thumb|upright|De Gea playing for the Spanish Olympic Football team during the [[2012 Summer Olympics|London 2012 Olympic Games]].]] On 15 May 2012, De Gea was called up for to the Spanish senior team for two matches against [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] and [[China PR national football team|PR China]].<ref name="factfile"/> He was in consideration for Del Bosque's [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] squad, but did not make the final 23-man group. He was selected, however, to play at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|2012 Summer Olympics]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Euro 2012 trio Mata, Alba & Martinez in Spain Olympic squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/olympics/18693622 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 July 2012 |accessdate=8 July 2012}}</ref> and played all three matches as the nation was eliminated in the group stage. De Gea and Spain under-21 [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|retained their European title in 2013]].
===Senior=== On 13 May 2014, De Gea was selected in Spain's 30-man provisional squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], and later made the final squad. He made his first senior international appearance against [[El Salvador national football team|El Salvador]] in a 2–0 friendly victory on 8 June in preparation for the tournament, replacing Iker Casillas for the last seven minutes of the match at the [[FedExField]] in Washington D.C.<ref>{{cite news |title=El Salvador 0–2 Spain |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383467|accessdate=14 June 2014|publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 June 2014}}</ref> As third-choice goalkeeper behind Casillas and [[Pepe Reina]], De Gea was the only member of the squad not to feature at that World Cup, in which Spain were eliminated in the group stage. On 4 September 2014, he made his first start for Spain, playing the whole 90 minutes against [[France national football team|France]] in a Paris friendly and conceding a goal from [[Loïc Rémy]] to lose 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |title=France beat Spain 1–0 in Paris courtesy of a Loic Remy goal |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/323819/report |date=4 September 2014 |accessdate=12 October 2014|publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> He played his first competitive international on his third cap on 12 October, keeping a [[shutout|clean sheet]] in a 4–0 win away to [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] in [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying Group C|UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]].
He has been tipped by many to succeed Casillas as the long-term number one goalkeeper,<ref name="Future"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/spain/story/2080939/david-de-gea-should-replace-iker-casillas-as-spains-no-1-marca-poll |title=David De Gea should replace Iker Casillas as Spain's No. 1 |date=10 October 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=ESPN FC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Balague |first=Guillem |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12087/9515709/spain-guillem-balague-says-david-de-gea-has-toppled-iker-casillas-as-no-1 |title=David De Gea has toppled Iker Casillas as No. 1 |date=13 October 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> including Casillas himself.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/casillas-tips-de-gea-greatness |title=Casillas tips De Gea for greatness |date=2 June 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2014 |magazine=FourFourTwo}}</ref> On 31 May 2016, he was named to Vicente del Bosque's final [[UEFA Euro 2016 squads#Spain|23-man Spanish squad]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36416575|title=Euro 2016: Arsenal's Hector Bellerin in Spain squad after injury forces out Dani Carvajal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=1 June 2016}}</ref> He started their opening match against the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] in [[Toulouse]], keeping a clean sheet in a 1–0 [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group D#Spain vs Czech Republic|victory]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gerard Pique heads late winner as holders Spain edge past Czech Republic|url=http://sport.bt.com/football/euro-2016/gerard-pique-heads-late-winner-as-holders-spain-edge-past-czech-republic-S11364067719337|accessdate=13 June 2016|publisher=BT Sport|date=13 June 2016}}</ref> He followed up with another clean sheet against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] as Spain [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group D#Spain vs Turkey|won]] 3–0.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/36335617 |title=Spain 3-0 Turkey |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Tom Rostance |date=17 June 2016 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> The following match, however, he conceded twice to [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] as his team [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group D#Croatia vs Spain|lost]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36524210 |title=Croatia 2-1 Spain |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Mandeep Sanghera |date=21 June 2016 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> Spain was [[UEFA Euro 2016 knockout phase#Italy vs Spain|eliminated]] in the round of 16 on 27 June, with their opponent [[Italy national football team|Italy]] scoring the only two goals of the match.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jim |last=Foulerton |title=Dominant Italy brush aside champions Spain |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000744/match=2018002/postmatch/report/index.html |website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |date=27 June 2016 |accessdate=27 June 2016 }}</ref>
[[File:ESP-RUS (13).jpg|thumb|upright|left|De Gea with [[Spain national football team|Spain]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].]] On 21 May 2018 he was called up to Spain's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2777080-david-de-gea-isco-headline-spains-full-2018-world-cup-provisional-squad-roster|title=David De Gea, Isco Headline Spain's Full 2018 World Cup Provisional Squad Roster|publisher=Bleacher Report|author=Christopher Simpson|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> In Spain's first game of the tournament on 15 June, De Gea was at fault for [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]]'s second goal, letting a [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] shot slip through his grasp; Ronaldo completed a hat-trick during the eventual 3–3 draw, with his first goal coming from a penalty, and his third from a free-kick, which were Portugal's only other shots on target.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup report: Portugal 3 Spain 3|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/news/105/main/2018/06/16/45555222/portugal-3-spain-3-brilliant-ronaldo-hat-trick-earns}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/world-cup/news/spain-vs-portugal-final-score-crazy-draw-as-ronaldo-becomes-oldest-to-score-world-cup-hat-trick/amp/|title=Spain vs. Portugal final score: Crazy draw as Cristiano Ronaldo becomes oldest to score World Cup hat trick|author=|date=|website=www.cbssports.com|accessdate=16 June 2018}}</ref> In Spain's second group match against [[Iran national football team|Iran]] on 20 June, he kept a clean-sheet in a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44439093 |title=Iran 0-1 Spain |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Luke Reddy |date=20 June 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> De Gea continued to struggle in Spain's final group match against [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]] on 25 June, however, which ended in a 2–2 draw;<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44439235 |title=Spain 2-2 Morocco |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Mike Whalley |date=25 June 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> his unsteady performances in the group stage drew criticism in the media, who noted that he had only made one save in the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/en/world-cup/2018/06/26/5b320cb0468aeb97738b4620.html |title=De Gea: One save and a thousand doubts |publisher=Marca |author1=Javier Estepa |date=26 June 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> On 1 July, De Gea also failed to make a save during Spain's 4–3 penalty shootout loss to hosts [[Russia national football team|Russia]] in the Round of 16; the match had ended in a 1–1 draw after extra-time, with De Gea being beaten by an [[Artem Dzyuba]] penalty in the first half.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Coleman |first1=Joe |title=ABSOLUTE DISGRACE' Fans turn on Manchester United star David De Gea after shock World Cup exit for Spain |url=https://talksport.com/football/393451/spain-manchester-united-david-de-gea-world-cup/ |website=talksport.com |publisher=TalkSPORT |accessdate=1 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976553 |title=Catch-up: Fifa World Cup - Spain v Russia |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Stephan Shemilt |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref> De Gea ended the tournament having conceded six goals from seven shots on target, excluding the four goals he conceded in the penalty-shootout; with only one save, he recorded fewer saves than any other goalkeeper who had played at least three matches in a single edition of the tournament since [[1966 FIFA World Cup|1966]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.beinsports.com/us/fifa-world-cup/news/de-gea-leaves-world-cup-with-just-one-save-to/917825 |title=De Gea Leaves World Cup With Just One Save To His Name |publisher=www.beinsports.com |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018 }}</ref>
De Gea criticised the [[Adidas Telstar 18]] official match ball, calling it "really strange" and claiming that "it could have been made a lot better."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/worldcup/fifa-world-cup-2018-ball-adidas-telstar-18-football-a-problem-for-goalkeepers-a3864336.html|title=Fifa World Cup 2018 ball: Adidas Telstar 18 football 'a problem for goalkeepers'|publisher=Evening Standard|first=Jaime|last=Teather|date=15 June 2018|access-date=15 July 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Regarded as a highly promising prospect in his youth,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/de-gea-makes-manchester-united-claim|title=De Gea makes Manchester United claim|publisher=FourFourTwo|date=10 December 2010|accessdate=17 January 2018}}</ref> De Gea soon developed into one of the best goalkeepers in the world, with some in the sport even labelling him as the current best keeper in the world.<ref name="best in world">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11295641/Wayne-Rooney-Man-Utd-can-win-title-with-best-in-world-David-de-Gea.html |title=Wayne Rooney: Man Utd can win title with 'best in world' David de Gea|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |last=Ogden |first=Mark|date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref><ref name="best goalkeeper">{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11294620/David-de-Geas-performance-sparks-best-goalkeeper-in-the-world-debate-but-who-would-you-vote-for.html |title=David de Gea's performance sparks 'best goalkeeper in the world' debate|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=15 December 2014|accessdate=15 December 2014}}</ref> An elegant<ref>{{cite web|url=https://it.eurosport.com/calcio/premier-league/2017-2018/manchester-united-proposto-un-maxi-rinnovo-a-david-de-gea_sto6474077/story.shtml|title=Manchester United, proposto un maxi rinnovo a David De Gea|publisher=Eurosport.com|language=Italian|date=13 January 2018|accessdate=18 January 2018}}</ref> and athletic keeper, De Gea is known in particular for his outstanding reflexes, agility, and shot-stopping ability between the posts, as well as his penchant for saving the ball with his feet, which enable him to produce acrobatic dives and spectacular saves.<ref name="main man">{{cite
