Mainly a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]], he can also play as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Simeon |last=Gholam |title=Who is Victor Lindelof? Manchester United's new signing assessed |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10676154/who-is-victor-lindelof-manchester-uniteds-new-signing-assessed |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=25 June 2017}}</ref>
Lindelöf began his career in Sweden at [[Västerås SK Fotboll|Västerås SK]], making his debut in September 2010. In December 2011, he agreed to move to [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in Portugal, initially representing the club at [[S.L. Benfica Juniors|youth]] and [[S.L. Benfica B|B]] levels. After making his first-team debut in September 2013, he continued to appear for the club at B level, while also winning three [[Primeira Liga]] titles. He joined Manchester United in July 2017.
Lindelöf has represented Sweden at [[Sweden national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Sweden national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Sweden national under-21 football team|under-21]], and senior levels. He was a member of the under-21 side that won the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]]. He made his senior international debut in March 2016 and represented his country at [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Lindelöf played in numerous [[Västerås]]-based clubs in his youth such as [[IK Franke]],<ref>{{cite news |date=22 November 2016 |title=Victor Nilsson Lindelöf vann årets back|trans-title=Victor Nilsson Lindelöf won defender of the year |url=http://www.ikfranke.com/News/4865639/Victor-Nilsson-Lindelof-vann-arets-back?firstRef |language=Swedish |publisher=[[IK Franke]]|access-date=24 January 2017}}</ref> [[Västerås IK Fotboll|Västerås IK]] and [[Västerås SK Fotboll|Västerås SK]].
===Västerås SK=== In September 2010, at the age of 16, Lindelöf made his debut for Västerås SK, when the team won 3–0 against [[BK Forward]].<ref name="First game">{{cite news |url=http://www.vskfotboll.nu/index.php?fot=nyh&newsno=2568 |title=VSK Fotboll klipper till med en ny back |publisher=VSK Fotboll |date=12 September 2010}}</ref> In the same season, he helped his team advance a step higher in the [[Swedish football league system|Swedish league system]], as they were promoted to the [[Superettan|second highest league]].<ref name="Superettan">{{cite news |url=http://www.vskfotboll.nu/index.php?fot=nyh&newsno=2635 |title=VSK FOTBOLL TILL SUPERETTAN! |publisher=VSK Fotboll |date=17 October 2010}}</ref>
===Benfica=== [[File:Benf-Zen 2016 (5).jpg|thumb|right|Lindelöf with Benfica in 2016]] On 1 December 2011, Lindelöf signed for Portuguese club [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]],<ref name="Victor">{{cite news |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/fotboll/internationell/ovrigaligor/article14017555.ab |title=Storklubb värvar svensk 17–åring |publisher=Sportbladet |date=1 December 2011}}</ref> and on 8 June 2015, the contract was extended until 2020.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/42058/language/pt-PT/.aspx |title=Victor Lindelöf renova contrato |language=Portuguese |trans-title=Victor Lindelöf renews contract |date=8 June 2015 |publisher=[[S.L. Benfica]] |access-date=9 June 2015}}</ref> In the 2012–13 season, he played for the [[S.L. Benfica Juniors|youth team]] and won the [[Campeonato Nacional de Juniores|Portuguese under-19 championship]].<ref name="uefa">{{cite web |url=http://pt.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=2260709.html |title=Lindelöf preparado para travar Bernardo Silva |language=Portuguese |trans-title=Lindelöf prepared to stop Bernardo Silva |date=23 June 2015 |publisher=UEFA |access-date=3 July 2015}}</ref> On 19 October 2013, he debuted for the first team in a 1–0 [[Taça de Portugal|Portuguese Cup]] win against CD Cinfães, playing the full match. In the 2013–14 season, he scored 2 goals in 33 matches for the [[S.L. Benfica B|reserve team]].<ref name="uefa"/> In the [[2015–16 S.L. Benfica season|2015–16 season]], he returned to the first-team in a 1–0 win against [[C.D. Nacional|Nacional]] in the [[2015–16 Taça da Liga|Taça da Liga]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.foradejogo.net/match.php?match=2016154700197020101&language=2 |title=Taça da Liga – 3ª Fase |publisher=ForaDeJogo.net}}</ref> On 16 February 2016, he played the entire match for Benfica in a 1–0 home win against [[FC Zenit Saint Petersburg|Zenit Saint Petersburg]] in the first leg of [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]]'s [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|round of 16]].<ref>{{cite news |date=16 February 2016 |title=Jonas strikes late to earn Benfica narrow win |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000635/match=2015763/index.html |website=UEFA.com |access-date=19 February 2016}}</ref> Four days later, he scored his first goal for Benfica, in a 3–1 [[Primeira Liga]] victory at [[F.C. Paços de Ferreira|Paços de Ferreira]].<ref>{{cite news |date=20 February 2016 |title=Benfica: Lindelof celebra primeiro golo pela equipa principal |trans-title= |url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/liga/victor-lindelof/benfica-lindelof-celebra-primeiro-golo-pela-equipa-principal |language=Portuguese |website=Maisfutebol |access-date=22 February 2016}}</ref> On 28 May 2017, he played in the [[2017 Taça de Portugal Final|Taça de Portugal final]], which Benfica won over [[Vitoria S.C.|Vitória de Guimarães]] (2–1).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.abola.pt/jogodireto/index.aspx?id=251730 |title=A Bola - Jogo em direto |publisher=}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== On 10 June 2017, [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] announced that they had agreed a deal with Benfica to sign Lindelöf for a fee of €35 million (with a potential €10 million in add-ons),<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/Portals/0/Documentos/ComunicVendaLindelofJun17.pdf |title=Comunicado|trans-title=Communication |date=10 June 2017|access-date=15 June 2017 |publisher=S.L. Benfica |language=Portuguese}}</ref> pending the agreement of personal terms and the player passing a medical.<ref>{{cite news |title=Reds agree transfer for Victor Lindelof |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Jun/manchester-united-agrees-transfer-with-benfica-for-sweden-defender-victor-lindelof.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=10 June 2017 |accessdate=10 June 2017}}</ref> Lindelöf passed his medical at the [[Trafford Training Centre]] on 14 June, with the Swede signing a four-year contract with the option of an extra year; Manchester United announced that the contract would begin on 1 July.<ref>{{cite news |title=UNITED COMPLETE SIGNING OF VICTOR LINDELOF |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Jun/victor-lindelof-completes-move-to-manchester-united-from-benfica-on-four-year-contract.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=14 June 2017 |accessdate=14 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Victor Lindelof: Manchester United sign £31m Benfica defender |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40236474 |website=BBC Sport |date=14 June 2017 |accessdate=14 June 2017}}</ref>
He made his official debut for the club against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the [[2017 UEFA Super Cup]]; however, it was more than two months before his [[Premier League]] debut, brought on during added time against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 14 October.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho slammed by Rio Ferdinand for bringing Victor Lindelof on in the 92nd minute against Liverpool |url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/10/14/manchester-united-manager-jose-mourinho-slammed-by-rio-ferdinand-for-bringing-victor-lindelof-on-in-the-92nd-minute-against-liverpool-7000213/ |website=[[Metro (website)|Metro]] |date=14 October 2017 |accessdate=21 October 2017}}</ref> Lindelöf scored his first goal for Manchester United on 29 January 2019, scoring their second goal in a 2–2 league draw at home to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Matthew |last=Henry |title=Manchester United 2-2 Burnley: Hosts rescue late point |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46955253 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 January 2019 |accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Lindelöf made his debut for the [[Sweden national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] on 14 October 2014, in the second leg of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|qualification play-offs]] against [[France national under-21 football team|France]].
Although Lindelöf was not named in the final squad for the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|UEFA European Under-21 Championship]], on 15 June 2015 he replaced defender [[Emil Krafth]] who was ruled out of the tournament after a back injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://svenskfotboll.se/landslag/u21-herr/arkiv/landslag/2015/06/krafth-missar-u21-em/ |title=Krafth missar U21-EM |date=15 June 2015 |accessdate=15 June 2015 |publisher=Svenskfotboll |language=Swedish}}</ref> He made his debut in the tournament in the first game against [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy]]. On 30 June 2015 he successfully converted Sweden's fifth and last penalty against [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal]] in a 4–3 [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] victory in [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship Final|the final]] to become European under-21 champion.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000411/match=2015383/index.html |title=Sweden see off Portugal on penalties |date=30 June 2015 |publisher=[[UEFA]] |access-date=30 June 2015}}</ref> He was named in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the tournament|Team of the Tournament]].<ref name="team of the tournament">{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=2262826.html |title=The official Under-21 Team of the Tournament |date=1 July 2015 |publisher=UEFA.com|access-date=1 July 2015}}</ref>
Lindelöf received his first call up to the senior [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] squad in March 2016 for friendlies against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] and [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.internationalsoccerteams.com/team-news/europe/hamren-names-sweden-squad-for-turkey-czech-rep-friendlies/ |title=Hamren names Sweden squad for Turkey, Czech Rep friendlies |date=18 March 2016 |publisher=internationalsoccerteams.com |accessdate=21 March 2016}}</ref> He debuted for the country in a 2–1 away loss to Turkey on 24 March 2016.<ref>{{cite news |date=24 March 2016 |title=Lindelof estreia-se pela seleção principal da Suécia com derrota |trans-title=Lindelof debuts for Sweden's main squad with defeat |url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/euro-2016/turquia/lindelof-estreia-se-pela-selecao-principal-da-suecia-com-derrota |language=Portuguese |website=Maisfutebol |access-date=30 March 2016}}</ref>
He was selected in Sweden's squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] in France, where he started all three of their [[UEFA Euro 2016#Group E|group games]], although Sweden failed to progress to the round of 16. Lindelöf was also selected in Sweden's 35-man provisional squad for the [[2016 Summer Olympics]] in Rio de Janeiro,<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://svenskfotboll.se/landslag/u21-herr/arkiv/landslag/2016/06/ericsons-bruttotrupp-till-os/ |title=Ericsons bruttotrupp till OS – svenskfotboll.se |website=svenskfotboll.se|access-date=14 December 2016}}</ref> but was prevented from participating in the tournament by his club Benfica, who believed that the involvement of their players in the Olympics would harm their chances for the following season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/fotboll/landslagsfotboll/herrlandslaget/article22932188.ab |title=Nilsson Lindelöf stoppas från OS |publisher=}}</ref>
Lindelöf scored his first international goal for Sweden in a 3–0 win over [[Bulgaria national football team|Bulgaria]] in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group A|2018 FIFA World Cup]] qualifier at [[Friends Arena]] in Stockholm on 10 October 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2018/matches/round=2000717/match=2017626/index.html |title=Sweden 3–0 Bulgaria |website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |accessdate=19 July 2017}}</ref>
In May 2018, he was named in Sweden's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb |title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref> Lindelöf missed the first game against [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]] due to illness, but was a regular starter in defense alongside fellow central defender [[Andreas Granqvist]] for the remainder of the tournament.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player/395283/ |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Players - Victor LINDELOF - Victor Lindelof - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=2019-02-04}}</ref> Lindelöf and Sweden were eliminated in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Sweden vs England|quarter final]] against [[England national football team|England.]]<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331541/ |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - Sweden - England - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=2019-02-04}}</ref>
In March 2019, Lindelöf was called up for Sweden's [[UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying]] matches against Romania and Norway. However, he chose to withdraw from the squad, citing personal reasons. He was replaced by [[Anton Tinnerholm]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/fotboll/a/vm4pzL/janne-andersson-om-lindelofs-aterbud-kan-kraftigt-dementera-detaccess-date=2019-03-19}}</ref>
==Personal life== Following his move to Manchester United in 2017, Lindelöf announced his engagement to his long-time girlfriend Maja Nilsson.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-united-victor-lindelof-engaged-10669145 |title=Victor Lindelof and Maja Nilsson announce their engagement in style |first=Mick |last=Gadd |date=22 June 2017 |work=Daily Mirror}}</ref> They got married at the end of May 2018, in Sweden.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.expressen.se/sport/fotbollsvm/karleksforklaring-efter-brollopet-vackra-fru/ |title=Fotbollsstjärnans kärleksord till hustrun Maja |publisher=}}</ref>

{{For|people of a similar name|Eric Bailey (disambiguation){{!}}Eric Bailey}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Eric Bailly | image = Eric Bailly - ManUtd.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Bailly warming up for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2017 | fullname = Eric Bertrand Bailly<ref>{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|4|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bingerville]], Ivory Coast | height = 1.87 m<ref>{{cite web |title=Eric Bailly |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/12937/Eric-Bailly/overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=27 September 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre-back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | clubnumber = 3 | youthyears1 = 2011–2013 |youthclubs1 = [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]] | years1 = 2013–2014 |clubs1 = [[RCD Espanyol B|Espanyol B]] |caps1 = 21 |goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014–2015 |clubs2 = [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]] |caps2 = 5 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015–2016 |clubs3 = [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] |caps3 = 35 |goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2016– |clubs4 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps4 = 49 |goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2015– |nationalteam1 = [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] |nationalcaps1 = 33 |nationalgoals1 = 1 | pcupdate = 23:06, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 16:33, 29 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Eric Bertrand Bailly''' ({{IPA-fr|eʁik bɛʁ.tʁɑ̃ baji}}; born 12 April 1994) is an Ivorian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast national team]]. Mainly a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]], he can also play as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Jose Mourinho: Why I signed Eric Bailly|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Jul/manchester-united-manager-jose-mourinho-discusses-eric-bailly-strengths.aspx|website=ManUtd.com|publisher=Manchester United |date=6 July 2016 |accessdate=6 July 2016 }}</ref>
Bailly began his professional career at Spain's [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]], before transferring to [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]]. He spent two seasons at the club before signing for Manchester United in June 2016.
He made his international debut for the Ivory Coast in 2015 and helped them win [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations|that year's]] [[Africa Cup of Nations]].
==Club career== ===Espanyol=== Born in [[Bingerville]], Bailly joined [[RCD Espanyol]]'s youth system in December 2011, aged 17.<ref>[http://rcdespanyol.com/principal.php?modulo=detalleNoticia&idnoticia=12440&idseccion=29&idmenu=9&idsubmenu=109 Dos nous fitxatges per al futbol base (Two new signings for the youth setup)]; Espanyol's official website, 1 December 2011 {{ca icon}}</ref> Bailly was spotted by Espanyol’s Emilio Montagut after taking part in a youth tournament in [[Burkina Faso]], organised by Spanish company Promoesport.<ref>{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Wilkes |title=Eric Bailly: The Villarreal rock who Jose's made his first signing |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/eric-bailly-villarreals-defensive-rock-who-pep-wants-manchester-city |publisher=FourFourTwo |date=8 June 2016 |accessdate=15 June 2017 }}</ref> Some records of that time erroneously list his name as Eric Bertrand (his [[middle name]] misinterpreted as his [[Spanish naming customs|paternal surname]]). He only received a work permit in October of the following year,<ref>[http://www.diariolagrada.com/noticias/futbol-base/eric-bertrand-ya-tiene-papeles-puede-debutar_1913.html Eric Bertrand ya tiene los papeles y puede debutar (Eric Bertrand already has the paperwork and can debut)]; Diario La Grada, 6 October 2012 {{es icon}}</ref> and made his senior debut in the [[2013–14 Segunda División B|2013–14 campaign]] with [[RCD Espanyol B|the reserves]], in [[Segunda División B]].
On 5 October 2014, Bailly made his first-team – and [[La Liga]] – debut, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 2–0 home win against [[Real Sociedad]].<ref>[http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_7/esp_rso/ El Espanyol pone a Arrasate contra las cuerdas (Espanyol puts Arraste against the wall)]; [[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]], 5 October 2014 {{es icon}}</ref> He was promoted to the main squad shortly after.<ref>[http://www.sport.es/es/noticias/espanyol/eric-perla-millones-3768267 Eric, la perla de 20 millones (Eric, the pearl of 20 million)]; [[Sport (Spanish newspaper)|Sport]], 13 December 2014 {{es icon}}</ref>
===Villarreal=== On 29 January 2015, Bailly signed a five-and-a-half-year contract with fellow La Liga team [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] for a [[Euro|€]]5.7 million fee, mainly as a replacement to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]-bound [[Gabriel Paulista]].<ref>[http://villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/8190-el-villarreal-cf-ficha-a-eric-bailly El Villarreal CF ficha a Eric Bailly (Villarreal signs Eric Bailly)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150131190444/http://villarrealcf.es/noticias/portada-ultimas-novedades/item/8190-el-villarreal-cf-ficha-a-eric-bailly |date=31 January 2015 }}; Villarreal's official website, 29 January 2015 {{es icon}}</ref><ref>[http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20150129/futbol/el-espanyol-traspasa-a-eric-bailly-al-villarreal-por-5-7-millones-de-euros_54425638969.html El Espanyol traspasa a Eric Bailly al Villarreal por 5,7 millones de euros (Espanyol transfers Eric Bailly to Villarreal for 5.7 million euros)]; [[El Mundo Deportivo (newspaper)|El Mundo Deportivo]], 29 January 2015 {{es icon}}</ref> He made his debut for the Yellow Submarine on 22 February, starting in a 1–0 home win against [[SD Eibar|Eibar]].<ref>[http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/la-liga/jornada_24/vil_eib/ Vietto, con licencia para marcar (Vietto, with a scoring license)]; Marca, 22 February 2015 {{es icon}}</ref>
On 19 March, Bailly made his [[UEFA Europa League]] debut, starting and being [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] in a 2–1 away loss against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000589/match=2014619/postmatch/report/index.html Slick Sevilla finish off ten-man Villarreal]; UEFA.com, 19 March 2015</ref>
On 18 October 2015, Bailly was sent off shortly after the interval in a 2–1 loss to [[Celta de Vigo]] at [[Estadio El Madrigal]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Last-gasp Nolito winner helps Eduardo Berizzo's side join Real Madrid and Barcelona at top of La Liga|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3278494/Villarreal-1-2-Celta-Vigo-gasp-Nolito-winner-helps-Eduardo-Berizzo-s-join-Real-Madrid-Barcelona-La-Liga.html|accessdate=8 June 2016|publisher=Daily Mail|date=18 October 2015}}</ref> He made seven appearances as the team reached the last four of the [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League]]; on 22 October he scored his first career goal and only one for the team, to conclude a 4–0 home group win over [[FC Dinamo Minsk|Dinamo Minsk]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bakambu at double as Villarreal beat Dinamo|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000658/match=2016979/index.html|accessdate=8 June 2016|publisher=UEFA|date=22 October 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== [[File:Manchester United v West Ham United, 13 August 2017 (18).JPG|thumb|Bailly playing against [[West Ham United]] in August 2017]] On 8 June 2016, Bailly joined [[Premier League]] side [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for a reported fee of £30 million, signing a four-year contract, with the option of an additional two. He was the first player signed by their new manager [[José Mourinho]].<ref>{{Cite web |first=Arindam |last=Rej |title=Manchester United sign Eric Bailly from Villarreal on four-year contract |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2888513/manchester-united-sign-eric-bailly-from-villarreal-on-four-year-contract |work=ESPN FC |publisher=ESPN Internet Ventures |date=8 June 2016 |accessdate=10 August 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Eric Bailly has passed a medical at Manchester United |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10307005/eric-bailly-has-passed-a-medical-at-manchester-united-sky-sources |publisher=Sky Sports |date=|accessdate=10 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Manchester United sign Eric Bailly|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Jun/manchester-united-complete-signing-of-defender-eric-bailly-from-villarreal.aspx|website=ManUtd.com|publisher=Manchester United |date=8 June 2016 |accessdate=8 June 2016 }}</ref>
He made his competitive debut on 7 August in a 2–1 win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] to win the [[2016 FA Community Shield|FA Community Shield]], and was named [[man of the match]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Froggatt |title=Video: Analysis of Bailly's United debut |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2016/Aug/Video-Analysis-of-Eric-Bailly-debut-in-Community-Shield.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=8 August 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2016 }}</ref> He was again named man of the match on his Premier League debut a week later, a 3–1 win at [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Simeon |last=Gholam |title=Bournemouth 1–3 Manchester United: Zlatan Ibrahimovic nets on debut in victory |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/bmouth-vs-man-utd/report/356336 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=14 August 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2016 }}</ref>
He was voted [[Manchester United]]'s Player of the Month for August 2016. Talking to MUTV, he said "The Man-of-the-Match awards are something I hadn’t thought about but I got them through the hard work I have put in. I hope to see more of that in the weeks ahead of us."<ref>{{Cite web|title=BAILLY IS UNITED'S PLAYER OF THE MONTH|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Sep/eric-bailly-voted-manchester-united-player-of-the-month-for-august-2016.aspx|website=ManUtd.com|publisher=Manchester United |date=7 September 2016 |accessdate=15 September 2016}}</ref> On 23 October 2016, Bailly was substituted off in the 52nd minute after suffering a serious knee injury during the 4–0 loss at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37747087 |title=Eric Bailly: Manchester United defender suffers 'bad knee injury' |date=23 October 2016 |publisher=BBC Sports}}</ref> He made 11 appearances as the Red Devils [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|won the Europa League]], and was named in the Squad of the Season.<ref name=europa/>
On 19 August 2017, Bailly scored the first league goal of his club career, Manchester United's first in a 4–0 away win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], following up after [[Paul Pogba]]'s header came back off the underside of the crossbar.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard |title=Swansea City 0–4 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40908331 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=19 August 2017 |accessdate=20 August 2017 }}</ref>
On 8 November 2017, Bailly suffered an ankle injury where he was sidelined for around 100 days and returned to action on 16 February 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/5602130/eric-bailly-returns-manchester-united-first-time-three-months-ankle-injury/|title=Eric Bailly returns to Manchester United squad for first time in three months after ankle injury|date=2018-02-17|website=The Sun|language=en-GB|access-date=2019-03-10}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.joe.co.uk/sport/report-claims-eric-baillys-ankle-injury-was-actually-caused-by-zlatan-ibrahimovic-153320|title=Report claims Eric Bailly's ankle injury was actually caused by Zlatan Ibrahimovic|website=JOE.co.uk|language=en|access-date=2019-03-10}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Rus-IvoryCoast (3).jpg|thumb|120px|right|Bailly playing for the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] in 2017]] On 29 December 2014, Bailly was included in [[Hervé Renard]]'s 23-man squad for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30625350 2015 Nations Cup: Kolo Toure in squad for last time]; [[BBC Sport]], 29 December 2014</ref> He made his debut on 11 January 2015, in a [[Exhibition match|friendly]] against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]],<ref>[http://www.sl10.ng/news/articles/categories/super-eagles/international-friendly-nigeria-0-1-cote-d-ivoire-11-january-2015/197634 Kalou Hands Cote D'Ivoire Late Win Over Nigeria]; SL10, 11 January 2015</ref> and appeared in all six matches during the competition as his side were crowned champions.
Bailly was again named in the Elephants' squad for the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]] in Gabon.<ref>{{cite news|title=Afcon 2017: Wilfried Zaha in Ivory Coast's final squad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38451141|accessdate=23 December 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2017}}</ref> He played full in all three matches in a campaign which ended in the group stage.
On 12 October 2018, Bailly scored his first international goal in a 4–0 win over the [[Central African Republic national football team|Central African Republic]] in a [[2019 Africa Cup of Nations]] [[2019 Africa Cup of Nations qualification|qualifier]] at the [[Stade Bouaké]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United player Bailly stars for Ivory Coast |url=https://citizen.co.za/phakaaathi/south-africa-soccer-phakaaathi-phakaaathi/2022483/manchester-united-player-bailly-stars-for-ivory-coast/ |accessdate=2 March 2019 |work=Citizen |date=13 October 2018}}</ref>

'''Paul Labile Pogba''' (born 15 March 1993) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[France national football team|French national team]]. He operates primarily as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]], but can also be deployed as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]], and [[Playmaker#Deep-lying playmakers|deep-lying playmaker]].<ref name="Paul Pogba (Manchester United FC)">{{cite news |url=http://www.guineefoot.info/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=343:paul-pogba-le-havre-ac&catid=1:latest-news&Itemid=50 |title=Paul Pogba (Manchester United FC) |website=Guineefoot.info |language=French |date=30 January 2009 |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref>
Born in [[Lagny-sur-Marne]], Pogba showed much promise as a youngster, flourishing as a member of local youth teams. He eventually joined the youth team of [[Ligue 1]] side [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]], before a protracted transfer brought him to Manchester United in 2009. After beginning his senior career with Manchester United two years later, limited appearances persuaded him to depart to join Italian side [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] on a free transfer in 2012, where he helped the club to four consecutive [[Serie A]] titles, as well as two [[Coppa Italia]] and two [[Supercoppa Italiana]] titles. During his time in Italy, Pogba further established himself as one of the most promising young players in the world, and received the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]] award in 2013, followed by the [[Bravo Award]] in 2014. In 2016, Pogba was named to the [[UEFA Team of the Year#Team of the Year 2015|2015 UEFA Team of the Year]], as well as the [[FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XI|2015 FIFA FIFPro World XI]], after helping Juventus to the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final]], their first in 12 years.
Pogba's performances at Juventus allowed him to return to Manchester United in 2016 for a then-[[List of most expensive association football transfers|world record transfer fee]] of €105 million (£89.3 million).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/88963/official-pogba-signs-man-utd |title=Official: Pogba signs for Man Utd for €105m |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |date=8 August 2016 |accessdate=16 August 2016}}</ref> The fee paid for him remains the highest paid by an English club.<ref>{{cite new |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/08/09/paul-pogba-completes-man-utd-transfer-for-world-record-fee/ |title=Pogba Completes Utd Move |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=8 August 2016 |accessdate=2 May 2018}}</ref> In his first season back, he won the [[2017 EFL Cup Final|League Cup]] and the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League]].<ref>https://www.manutd.com/en/players-and-staff/detail/paul-pogba</ref>
Internationally, he captained France to victory at the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and took home the award for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Awards|Best Player]] for his performances during the tournament. He made his debut for the [[French national football team|senior team]] a year later, and featured prominently at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], where he was awarded the [[2014 FIFA World Cup awards#Best Young Player|Best Young Player Award]] for his performances. He later represented his nation at [[UEFA Euro 2016]] on home soil, where he finished as a runner-up, before winning the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] after scoring in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup Final|final]].
==Early life== Pogba was born in [[Lagny-sur-Marne]], Seine-et-Marne, to Guinean parents.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jul/03/france-paul-pogba-brazil-world-cup-germany |title=France's Paul Pogba: a complete midfielder worth 'two Gareth Bales' |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He is Muslim.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/item/e25557ac-e76b-435f-9bfa-b069230fc68b |title=How hard is it to be a Muslim footballer during Ramadan? |publisher=BBC |accessdate=18 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/12/france-has-problem-with-islam-and-there-is-too-much-unwanted-imm/ |title=France has 'problem with Islam' and there is 'too much unwanted immigration', says Hollande in explosive book |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=12 October 2016 |accessdate=18 October 2016 |first=Henry |last=Samuel}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/09/12/27358822/is-pogba-a-muslim-how-tall-is-ibrahimovic-your-manchester-united |title=Is Pogba a Muslim? How tall is Ibrahimovic? Your Manchester United questions answered |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=12 September 2016 |accessdate=18 October 2016 |first=Miles |last=Chambers}}</ref> He has two older twin brothers – [[Florentin Pogba|Florentin]] and [[Mathias Pogba|Mathias]] – born in Guinea, who are also footballers and play for the [[Guinea national football team|Guinean national team]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Sparta Rotterdam heeft Pogba te strikken |url=https://www.voetbalkrant.com/nl/nieuws/lees/2016-08-31/mathias-pogba-broer-van-paul-tekent-bij-sparta-rotterdam |accessdate=10 September 2016 |website=Voetbalkrant.com |date=31 August 2016 |language=Dutch}}</ref> [[Florentin Pogba|Florentin]] currently plays for [[Atlanta United]] and [[Mathias Pogba|Mathias]] plays for [[Tours FC|Tours]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lunion.presse.fr/article/a-la-une/cssa-la-percee-de-pogba |title=CSSA / La percée de Pogba |newspaper=L'Union |location=Reims |language=French |date=11 November 2009 |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref> Growing up, Pogba was a fan of [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/paul-pogba-explains-fan-arsenal-11623715 |title=Pogba explains why he was a fan of Arsenal growing up – and not Man United |last=Prenderville |first=Liam |date=1 December 2017 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=31 December 2017}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== {{Quote box |width=27% |align=right |quote= "[[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] is my footballing role model and the player that made me fall in love with football. I was enthralled by him as I used to play up front when I was younger." |source=Pogba on his idol, former Brazilian forward Ronaldo.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pogba: Ronaldo made me fall in love with football |url=https://www.fifa.com/live-scores/news/y=2016/m=3/news=pogba-ronaldo-made-me-fall-in-love-in-football-2770227.html |accessdate=10 September 2018 |publisher=FIFA}}</ref> }} Pogba began his football career at the age of six playing for US Roissy-en-Brie, a few miles south of his hometown. He spent seven seasons at the club before joining US Torcy, where he served as captain of the club's under-13 team.<ref name="pogba_torcy">{{cite news |title=Manchester United 'vole Paul POGBA' au HAC |url=http://torcyfoot.footeo.com/actualite/2009/07/31/manchester-united-vole-paul-pogba-au-hac.html |language=French |publisher=US Torcy |via=Footeo |date=31 July 2009 |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref>
After one season with Torcy, Pogba joined professional club [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]]. In his second season at the club, Pogba captained its under-16 team to the final phase of its domestic league, the ''Championnat National des 16 ans''. Le Havre finished second to [[RC Lens|Lens]] in the final group phase, finishing ahead of the likes of [[Olympique Lyonnais Reserves and Academy|Lyon]] and [[AS Nancy|Nancy]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fff.fr/champ/autres_championnats/529088.shtml |title=Dernière journée des demi-finales |date=29 May 2009 |publisher=French Football Federation |accessdate=23 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724173355/http://www.fff.fr/champ/autres_championnats/529088.shtml |archivedate=24 July 2012}}</ref> Pogba also established himself as a youth international for his country.
===Manchester United=== {{see also|2009 English football tapping up controversy}}
====Transfer==== {{Quote box |width=30% |align=left |quote= "The player [Pogba] and his parents refused to keep the arrangement because Manchester United offered very high sums of money to the parents of the [player] with the aim of obtaining the transfer of their son." |source= <small>[[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]]'s response to Pogba's decision to join [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref name="pogba_departure">{{cite news |title=Man Utd deny 'stealing' youngster |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/8180042.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2009 |accessdate=9 September 2009}}</ref> </small> }}
On 31 July 2009, Pogba announced that he was departing Le Havre to join the [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|youth academy]] of [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in England. The move surprised his parent club, as it allegedly had a "non-solicitation agreement" with Pogba, which was agreed to by not only the player but also his parents in 2006. The agreement, which was in place until the end of the [[2009–10 in French football|2009–10 season]], allowed Le Havre to sign Pogba to an ''aspirant'' (youth) contract once the player met specific age and scholarship requirements.<ref>{{cite news |title=United leave Le Havre fuming |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11667_5465427,00.html |date=1 August 2009 |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref> On 1 August, Le Havre released an official statement on its website criticising Manchester United and the Pogba family.<ref name="pogba_departure"/> Le Havre also announced its intent to ask [[FIFA]] to probe the situation.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/sep/04/paul-pogba-fifa-manchester-united-le-havre |title=Fifa denies receiving complaint over Paul Pogba's Manchester United deal |date=4 September 2009 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref>
In response to Le Havre's accusations, Manchester United threatened to sue the club, while Pogba denied he was leaving Le Havre for monetary reasons, which Le Havre President Jean-Pierre Louvel had alleged to be £87,000 and a house.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd threaten to sue Le Havre |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/8242430.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 September 2009 |accessdate=9 September 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=United's class of 2011 could be the next Busby Babes |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/uniteds-class-of-2011-could-be-the-next-busby-babes-2288498.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=15 September 2011}}</ref> Le Havre was also accused by Pogba's former club Torcy of using the same tactics it purported Manchester United to have used when the club acquired Pogba from its youth academy. On the same day of Pogba's announcement to depart for England, Torcy released a press release on its official website criticising Le Havre's accusations, stating, "We will not use the term 'steal,' but the recruiters of Le Havre acted the same way with the club in Torcy." The club cited Le Havre's acceptance of allowing Pogba to sign an amateur licence with the club without notifying Torcy as its primary reason why.<ref name="pogba_torcy"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Le Havre et Manchester United se déchirent pour un prodige francilien |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/iledefrance/le-havre-et-manchester-united-se-dechirent-pour-un-prodige-francilien-05-09-2009-628259.php |newspaper=Le Parisien |location=Paris |date=5 September 2009 |accessdate=3 March 2011 |language=French}}</ref> On 7 October, Manchester United were cleared of wrongdoing by a judge appointed by FIFA, with the declaration that Pogba was not contractually linked to Le Havre.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2009/Oct/Pogba-deal-approved.aspx |title=Pogba deal approved |date=7 October 2009 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref> Despite having the option to appeal, on 18 June 2010, Le Havre officials confirmed that the club had reached an agreement with Manchester United for the transfer of Pogba. The terms of the agreement were confidential.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2010/Jun/Reds-reach-Pogba-agreement.aspx |title=Reds reach Pogba agreement |date=17 June 2010 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-reach-agreement-over-pogba-2004018.html |title=Manchester United reach agreement over Pogba |date=18 June 2010 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref>
====Academy and call up to first team==== Pogba completed his transfer to Manchester United on 7 October 2009<ref>{{cite web |first=Steve |last=Bartram |title=Pogba deal approved |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2009/Oct/Pogba-deal-approved.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=7 October 2009 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> and made his debut with the club's under-18 team on 10 October against [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite web |first=Ben |last=Hibbs |title=U18s: Crewe 2 United 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2009/Oct/U18s-Crewe-2-United-1.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=10 October 2009 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> He finished the [[2009–10 Premier Academy League|2009–10 under-18 campaign]] with seven goals in 21 appearances.<ref>{{cite book |title=The Official Manchester United Yearbook 2010 |year=2010 |publisher=Manchester United |page=195}}</ref> The team finished first in their group, but lost to [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal]] 5–3 on [[Penalty shootout|penalties]] in the play-off semi-finals.<ref>{{cite web |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=U18s lose semi shoot-out |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2010/May/U18s-lose-semi-shootout.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=7 May 2010 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> In April 2010, Pogba was a part of the under-18 team that successfully defended their title at the Torneo Calcio Memorial Claudio Sassi-Sassuolo in [[Bologna]], Italy.<ref>{{cite web |first=Ben |last=Hibbs |title=U18s complete Italian job |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2010/Apr/U18s-complete-Italian-job.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=6 April 2010 |accessdate=2 August 2010}}</ref> In the [[2010–11 in English football|2010–11 season]], Pogba remained on the club's academy team in the [[Premier Academy League]] and played with the team during the first three months of the season. In November 2010, he was called up to the club's [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserve team]] and made his debut on 2 November 2010 in a 3–1 win over [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Steve |last=Bartram |title=Reserves: Bolton 1 United 3 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2010/Nov/Reserves-Bolton-1-United-3.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=2 November 2010 |accessdate=6 September 2011}}</ref> On 10 January 2011, in the [[2010–11 FA Youth Cup|FA Youth Cup]], Pogba scored a long-range goal, described as a "piledriver," in the team's 3–2 victory over [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]. The win allowed the team to progress to the fourth round of the competition.<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Bostock |title=FAYC: United 3 Portsmouth 2 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2010/Dec/Youth-Cup-United-v-Portsmouth.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=10 January 2011 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> A month later, Pogba scored a similar goal in a 3–2 defeat to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in the Academy League.<ref>{{cite web |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=U18s: WBA 3 United 2 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2011/Feb/West-Brom-v-United.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=5 February 2011 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref>
On 19 February 2011, Pogba was one of four academy players promoted to the first-team squad by manager [[Alex Ferguson]] ahead of Manchester United's [[FA Cup]] fifth round match against [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]], for which he was assigned the number 42 shirt.<ref>{{cite web |first1=A |last1=Bostock |first2=M |last2=Shaw |title=Video: Squad-list new boys |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/Feb/Squad-numbers-for-young-Reds.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=18 February 2011 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> He continued in the under-18s for the rest of the season, helping the team to a lengthy run in the FA Youth Cup; in the semi-final encounter against [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|Chelsea]] in the competition, Pogba scored a goal in the first leg, a 3–2 defeat,<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=FAYC: Chelsea 3 Man Utd 2 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2011/Apr/Chelsea-v-United-FAYC-semi-final.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=10 April 2011 |accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref> and provided the assist for the opening goal of the second leg, a 4–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=FAYC: United 4 Chelsea 0 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2011/Apr/United-v-Chelsea-FAYC-semi.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=20 April 2011 |accessdate=23 April 2011}}</ref> In the final, Manchester United defeated [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] 6–3 on aggregate to win their tenth Youth Cup title; Pogba started and played the entire match in both legs.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/AcademyReport/0,,10418~2358494,00.html |title=Blades 2–2 Man Utd – match report |date=20 May 2011 |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |accessdate=19 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20110719095157/http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/AcademyReport/0,,10418~2358494,00.html |archivedate=19 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd beat Sheffield Utd to FA Youth Cup final trophy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/13513703 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 May 2011 |accessdate=19 July 2011}}</ref>
====2011–12: Limited senior team appearances==== Ahead of the start of the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]], Ferguson confirmed that Pogba would feature with the senior team during the season, stating, "I mean if we hold Pogba back, what's going to happen? He's going to leave. You know, in a couple of years' time when his contract is going to finish. So we have to give him the opportunity to see how he can do in the first-team and he's got great ability."<ref>{{cite web |first1=A |last1=Marshall |first2=D |last2=Sharrock |title=Boss set to promote Pogba |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/Aug/ferguson-to-promote-pogba.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=12 August 2011 |accessdate=12 August 2011}}</ref> Pogba was promoted to the club's reserve team permanently for the 2011–12 season and made his first appearance of the season on 15 August 2011 in the team's opening [[Premier Reserve League]] match against [[Arsenal F.C. Reserves|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Res: Arsenal 2 United 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2011/Aug/Reserves-v-Arsenal.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=15 August 2011 |accessdate=6 September 2011}}</ref> On 25 August, in the team's second league match against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City reserves]], Pogba scored the second goal in a 6–0 rout.<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Res: Utd 6 Swansea 0 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2011/Aug/Reserves-v-swansea.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=25 August 2011 |accessdate=6 September 2011}}</ref> On 19 September, he was named to the first team to participate in their [[2011–12 Football League Cup|Football League Cup]] tie against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] the following day, with Ferguson proclaiming, "I intend to play him [Pogba] against Leeds United."<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Pogba primed for Leeds chance |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/Sep/Paul-Pogba-primed-for-Leeds-debut.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=19 September 2011 |accessdate=19 September 2011}}</ref> Pogba appeared as a half-time substitute to make his professional debut as Manchester United won the match 3–0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Lyon |title=Leeds 0–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/14893498.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2011 |accessdate=20 September 2011}}</ref> Pogba made his second appearance against [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]] in the Fourth Round of the League Cup on 25 October 2011.<ref>{{cite news |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |title=Aldershot 0–3 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15346355 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 October 2011 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref>
Pogba made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 31 January 2012, replacing [[Javier Hernández]] in the 72nd minute.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=Man Utd 2–0 Stoke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16695910 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2012 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> He made another substitute appearance against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 11 March.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nabil |last=Hassan |title=Man Utd 2–0 West Brom |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17249251 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 March 2012 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref> Four days later, he made his [[UEFA|European]] debut in the second leg of the team's [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] round of 16 tie against Spanish club [[Athletic Bilbao]]; he appeared as a substitute in the 2–1 away defeat, coming on for [[Michael Carrick]] in the 63rd minute as Manchester United lost the tie 5–3 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |title=Athletic Bilbao 2–1 Man Utd (agg 5–3) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17295990 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2012 |accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref>
===Juventus=== ====2012–13: First ''Scudetto''==== [[File:Paul Pogba Juventus (2).jpg|thumb|upright|Pogba playing for [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] against Shakhtar Donetsk in the [[UEFA Champions League]], December 2012]]
On 3 July 2012, Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson confirmed that Pogba had left the club after not signing a new contract.<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Pogba departure confirmed |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2012/Jul/paul-pogba-has-left-manchester-united-says-sir-alex-ferguson.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=3 July 2012 |accessdate=3 July 2012}}</ref> Ferguson stated that Pogba had signed for Italian club [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] "a long time ago as far as we're aware." Ferguson also accused Pogba of disrespecting Manchester United, saying, "It is disappointing. I don't think he showed us any respect at all, to be honest. I'm quite happy that if they [footballers] carry on that way, they're probably better doing it away from us."<ref>{{cite news |title=Sir Alex: Pogba lacked respect |url=http://www.independent.ie/breaking-news/sport/ferguson-pogba-lacked-respect-26872182.html |newspaper=Irish Independent |location=Dublin |date=2 December 2012 |accessdate=23 May 2014}}</ref> On 27 July, Juventus confirmed on their official website that Pogba had undergone a medical at the club,<ref>{{cite web |title=Pogba, medical checkup |url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/27luglio2012_pogba_eng |publisher=Juventus F.C. |date=27 July 2012 |accessdate=27 July 2012}}</ref> and the transfer was completed on 3 August, when he signed a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite web |title=Pogba completes Juventus move |url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/3aug2012_Pogba |publisher=Juventus F.C. |date=3 August 2012 |accessdate=4 August 2012 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120906012911/http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/3aug2012_Pogba |archivedate=6 September 2012}}</ref> He made his first appearance for Juventus in a pre-season friendly against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in [[Geneva]] on 1 August, coming on as a 78th-minute substitute for [[Andrea Pirlo]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Fighting spirit shines through in Geneva |url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/1agosto2012_juventus-benfica_eng |publisher=Juventus F.C. |date=1 August 2012 |accessdate=4 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120804035931/http://www.juventus.com/juve/en/news/1agosto2012_juventus-Benfica_eng |archivedate=4 August 2012}}</ref>
Pogba's first competitive appearance with Juventus came in the [[2012–13 Serie A|Serie A]] match against [[A.C. ChievoVerona|Chievo]] on 22 September 2012, where he played the full 90 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=352049&cc=5901 |title=Juventus 2–0 Chievo Verona |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=22 September 2012 |accessdate=1 November 2012}}</ref> On 2 October, Pogba made his first appearance in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] in a 1–1 home draw against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Juventus-Shakhtar 1–1, i bianconeri stentano in Europa|trans-title=Juventus-Shakhtar 1–1, the bianconeri struggle in Europe |url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/champions/2012/10/02/news/juventus_shakhtar-43740195/ |newspaper=la Repubblica |location=Rome |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=2 October 2012}}</ref> and on 20 October, Pogba scored his first goal for the club in a 2–0 win over [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=352012&cc=5901 |title=Juventus 2–0 Napoli |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=20 October 2012 |accessdate=1 November 2012}}</ref> On 31 October, he started against [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] and scored the game-winning goal in a 2–1 victory. Pogba also contributed to the opening goal scored by [[Fabio Quagliarella]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=351989&cc=5901 |title=Juventus 2–1 Bologna |website=ESPN Soccernet |date=31 October 2012 |accessdate=1 November 2012}}</ref> The midfielder was subsequently praised for his performance in the match by several Italian media outlets such as ''[[la Repubblica]]'', ''[[Il Messaggero]]'' and ''[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/nov/01/paul-pogba-juventus-bologna-seriea |title=Paul Pogba gives Bologna a fright night to spark the superlatives in Italy |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=1 November 2012 |accessdate=1 November 2012}}</ref>
On 5 May 2013, Pogba was sent off in Juventus' ''[[List of Italian football champions|Scudetto]]''-clinching game for spitting towards an opponent after being slapped in the face.<ref>{{cite news |first=Riccardo |last=Pratesi |title=Juventus, scudetto bis: 1–0 sul Palermo. Conte sale ancora sul tetto della Serie A|trans-title=Juventus, second consecutive scudetto: 1–0 against Palermo. Conte is once again on top of Serie A |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Juventus/05-05-2013/juventus-palermo-1-0-sogno-realta-conte-bis-scudetto-tuo-20332458287.shtml |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=5 May 2013}}</ref> On 18 August 2013, Pogba was a key protagonist of Juventus' 4–0 win over [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]], the match that won Juventus the [[2013 Supercoppa Italiana|2013 Italian Supercoppa]]. During the match, Pogba replaced [[Claudio Marchisio]] and scored the first goal of the game; he was elected Man of the Match.<ref>{{cite web |title=POGBA MIGLIORE IN CAMPO IN SUPERCOPPA TIM|trans-title=Pogba voted Man of the Match in the TIM Supercoppa |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/sala-stampa/archivio-dettaglio/-/news/POGBA_MIGLIORE_IN_CAMPO_IN_SUPERCOPPA_TIM/918524 |publisher=Lega Serie A |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=19 August 2013}}</ref> In December, Pogba was named 2013's [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]] for the best young player in Europe.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://football-italia.net/42438/pogba-2013-was-golden-year |title=Pogba: 2013 was a golden year! |date=4 December 2013 |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media}}</ref>
====2014–16: Domestic dominance and Champions League Final==== In January 2014, Pogba was named by ''[[The Guardian]]'' as one of the ten most promising young players in Europe.<ref name="The Guardian">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jan/19/next-10-big-things-europes-top-youngsters |title=The next 10 big things: Europe's top youngsters and stars of the future |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=18 January 2014}}</ref> On 20 February, Pogba scored his first goal in [[UEFA club competitions]] as Juventus defeated [[Trabzonspor]] 2–0 at home in the first leg of the round of 32 of the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Europa-League/20-02-2014/europa-league-juventus-trabzonspor-osvaldo-conte-8099679966.shtml |title=Europa League, Juventus-Trabzonspor 2–0, Osvaldo e Pogba a segno|trans-title=Europa League, Juventus-Trabzonspor 2–0, Osvaldo and Pogba score |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |first=Riccardo |last=Pratesi |language=Italian |date=20 February 2014 |accessdate=11 May 2015}}</ref> On 14 April, Pogba produced an assist in Juventus's 2–0 win over [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]], the same team that Pogba scored two magnificent goals against in the previous season. Later that week, Pogba scored the only goal in Juventus's 1–0 win over [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]]. Pogba was also named the man of the match for his performance.<ref name="whoscored.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.whoscored.com/Players/97752/Fixtures/Paul-Pogba |title=Paul Pogba |website=WhoScored.com}}</ref> Pogba would prove to be a key player for the club that season, breaking into the starting line-up,<ref>{{cite news |first=Guido |last=Vaciago |title=Juve: per superare Pogba, Marchisio deve fare il Pogba|trans-title=Juve: to overtake Pogba, Marchisio needs to be Pogba |url=http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/juventus/2014/02/15-285887/Juve%3A+per+superare+Pogba,+Marchisio+deve+fare+il+Pogba |newspaper=Tuttosport |location=Turin |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=15 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20140327224910/http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/juventus/2014/02/15-285887/Juve:+per+superare+Pogba,+Marchisio+deve+fare+il+Pogba |archivedate=27 March 2014}}</ref> and making more appearances (51) for the club than any other player across all competitions that season, also scoring 9 goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/serie-a/juventus/2014/11/05/news/affare_pogba_marotta-99827818/ |title=Juventus, Pogba il predestinato: colpo di Marotta a parametro zero, ora vale 50 milioni |newspaper=la Repubblica |location=Rome |language=Italian |first=Timothy |last=Ormezzano |date=5 November 2014 |accessdate=1 December 2015}}</ref> He finished the season by winning his second consecutive [[2013–14 Serie A|Serie A title]] under manager [[Antonio Conte]], and reaching the semi-finals of the Europa League.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/04-05-2014/catania-roma-4-1-doppietta-izco-gol-totti-bergessio-barrientos-scudetto-juve-80574716594.shtml |title=Catania-Roma 4–1. Doppietta di Izco, gol di Totti, Bergessio e Barrientos. È scudetto Juve|trans-title=Catania-Roma 4–1. Izco double and goals from Totti, Bergessio and Barrientos. Juve win the Scudetto |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |first=Andrea |last=Pugliese |language=Italian |date=4 May 2014 |accessdate=11 May 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Singapore Selection vs Juventus, 2014, Paul Pogba.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Pogba in a pre-season friendly for Juventus against Singapore in August 2014]]
On 20 September 2014, under new Juventus manager [[Massimiliano Allegri]], Pogba contributed to Juventus's away win against Milan by providing the assist for the only goal of the game, scored by [[Carlos Tevez]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/milan-vs-juventus/1836147/report |title=Milan 0 – 1 Juventus Match report |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=20 September 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> Later that month, on 18 October, Pogba saved Juventus from a defeat against [[U.S. Sassuolo Calcio|Sassuolo]] by scoring a decisive equaliser; he was later named Man of the Match.<ref>{{cite news |first=Stefano |last=Cantalupi |title=Sassuolo-Juventus 1–1: segnano Zaza e Pogba, Roma a −1 dai bianconeri|trans-title=Sassuolo-Juventus 1–1: Zaza and Pogba score, Roma one point behind Juventus |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/18-10-2014/sassuolo-juventus-1-1-segnano-zaza-pogba-roma-1-bianconeri-90778804480.shtml |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=18 October 2014}}</ref> On 24 October, Pogba renewed his contract with Juventus, tying him to the club until 2019.<ref>{{cite web |title=POGBA, RINNOVO! |trans-title=Pogba, contract renewal! |url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/it/news/pogba%20rinnovo |publisher=Juventus F.C. |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=24 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141028133832/http://www.juventus.com/juve/it/news/pogba%20rinnovo |archivedate=28 October 2014}}</ref> On 4 November, on his 100th appearance with the club, Pogba scored Juventus's third goal against [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], helping them to win the match; this was his first ever Champions League goal.<ref name="whoscored.com"/> On 22 November, he scored his first brace of the season in a 3–0 win against Lazio at the [[Stadio Olimpico]] in Rome.<ref>{{cite news |first=Stefano |last=Cieri |title=Lazio-Juventus 0–3: super Pogba e Tevez espugnano Roma|trans-title=Lazio-Juventus 0–3: super Pogba and Tevez take Rome by storm |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/22-11-2014/lazio-juventus-0-3-super-pogba-tevez-espugnano-roma-10025562841.shtml |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=22 November 2014}}</ref> On 28 October, Pogba was named as one of the 23 shortlisted candidates for the [[2014 FIFA Ballon d'Or|2014 Ballon d'Or]]; at 21, he was the youngest on the list.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9538156/fifa-announce-23-man-shortlist-for-2014-ballon-dor-award |title=Ballon d'Or award: Five Premier League players on shortlist but Luis Suarez omitted |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> In 2014, Pogba was awarded the [[Bravo Award]], by the Italian sports magazine ''[[Guerin Sportivo|Il Guerin Sportivo]]'', which is awarded to the best under-23 player who has participated in European competitions.<ref name="canalejuve.it">{{cite web |url=http://www.canalejuve.it/news/pogba-premiato-col-bravo-dal-guerin-sportivo-139511 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20150118183246/http://www.canalejuve.it/news/pogba-premiato-col-bravo-dal-guerin-sportivo-139511 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 January 2015 |title=Pogba premiato col "Bravo" dal Guerin Sportivo |website=Canale Juve |language=Italian |accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref>
On 11 January 2015, Pogba helped Juventus secure their first win against Napoli at the [[Stadio San Paolo]] in 14 years as he scored a volley that helped Juventus beat Napoli 1–3.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30719803 |title=Napoli v Juventus |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 15 January, he scored his first goal in the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]] as Juventus defeated Verona 6–1 in the round of 16 of the tournament.<ref>{{cite news |first=Fabiana |last=Della Valle |title=Coppa Italia, Juventus-Verona 6–1. Giovinco si riprende i bianconeri|trans-title=Coppa Italia, Juventus-Verona 6–1. Giovinco regains the bianconeri for himself |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/15-01-2015/coppa-italia-juventus-verona-6-1-giovinco-si-riprende-bianconeri-100498172393.shtml |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=15 January 2015}}</ref> On 9 March, Pogba scored the only goal in a 1–0 victory against Sassuolo to put Juventus 11 points clear of [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] at the top of the league table.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/premier-league-target-paul-pogba-5305331 |title=Premier League target Paul Pogba nets sublime volley as Juventus close in on Italian title |first=Ben |last=Burrows |date=10 March 2015 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref> In the second leg of Juventus's round of 16 match-up against [[Borussia Dortmund]], Pogba was taken off during the first half after injuring his hamstring, and was later ruled out for two months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/calcio/fantanews/19-03-2015/juve-che-ansia-l-infortunio-pogba-stasera-verdetto-110164496685.shtml |title=Juve ai quarti di Champions senza Pogba: starà fuori 2 mesi|trans-title=Juve in the Champions League quarter-finals without Pogba: he will be out for 2 months |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |language=Italian |first=Alberto |last=Mauro |date=19 March 2015 |accessdate=19 March 2015}}</ref> He returned to the starting line-up on 9 May, scoring in a 1–1 home draw against [[Cagliari F.C.|Cagliari]], as Juventus celebrated winning their fourth consecutive [[2014–15 Serie A|Serie A title]] since 2012.<ref>{{cite news |first=Francesco |last=Bramardo |title=Juventus-Cagliari 1–1: Pogba fa gol al rientro, risponde Rossettini|trans-title=Juventus-Cagliari 1–1: Pogba scores upon his return, Rossettini equalises |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/09-05-2015/juventus-cagliari-1-1-pogba-fa-gol-rientro-risponde-rossettini-110752156639.shtml |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |accessdate=11 May 2015 |language=Italian |date=9 May 2015}}</ref> On 13 May, Pogba set up [[Álvaro Morata]]'s equaliser against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the second leg of the Champions League semi-final; the goal allowed Juventus win the tie 3–2 on aggregate to advance to the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League Final]] for the first time in 12 years.<ref>{{cite web |title=Morata takes Juve through at Madrid's expense |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000551/match=2014430/postmatch/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=14 May 2015 |date=13 May 2015}}</ref> On 20 May, Pogba set up Juventus's first goal as they defeated Lazio 2–1 at the Stadio Olimpico in the [[2015 Coppa Italia Final]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/20-05-2015/juve-infinita-vince-10-coppa-italia-matri-piega-lazio-supplementari-110907305821.shtml |title=Juve infinita, vince la 10ª Coppa Italia: Matri piega la Lazio ai supplementari|trans-title=An infinite Juve wins its 10th Coppa Italia: Matri sinks Lazio in extra-time |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |language=Italian |first=Jacopo |last=Gerna |date=20 May 2015 |accessdate=21 May 2015}}</ref> On 6 June 2015, Pogba started for Juventus in the [[2015 UEFA Champions League Final]] as the club were defeated 3–1 by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] at [[Berlin]]'s [[Olympiastadion Berlin|Olympiastadion]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000552/match=2015227/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Barcelona see off Juventus to claim fifth title |publisher=UEFA |date=6 June 2015}}</ref>
On 15 July 2015, Pogba was named to the ten-man shortlist for the 2015 [[UEFA Best Player in Europe Award]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2265440.html |title=Best Player in Europe Award shortlist announced |publisher=UEFA |date=15 July 2015 |accessdate=16 July 2015}}</ref> For the [[2015–16 Serie A|2015–16 season]], he was awarded the prestigious [[Squad number (association football)|number-10 shirt]], following Carlos Tevez's departure, which had previously been worn by [[Alessandro Del Piero]], [[Roberto Baggio]] and [[Michel Platini]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/juventus/story/2551850/juventus-hand-paul-pogba-10-shirt-after-carlos-tevez-exit |title=Juventus hand Paul Pogba No. 10 shirt after Carlos Tevez exit |website=ESPN FC |first=Ben |last=Gladwell |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 8 August, he assisted a goal in Juventus's 2–0 win over Lazio in the [[2015 Supercoppa Italiana]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/08-08-2015/supercoppa-juventus-lazio-2-0-mandzukic-dybala-allegri-fa-festa-nuovi-120867914905.shtml |title=Juventus-Lazio 2–0: Mandzukic-Dybala, Allegri fa festa con i nuovi|trans-title=Juventus-Lazio 2–0: Mandzukic-Dybala, Allegri celebrates with the new signings |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |language=Italian |first=Stefano |last=Cieri |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 12 August, it was announced that he placed tenth in the [[UEFA Best Player in Europe Award#2014.E2.80.9315|2015 UEFA Best Player in Europe Award]].<ref name="UEFA">{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2270699.html |title=Best Player in Europe: Messi, Ronaldo or Suárez |publisher=UEFA |date=12 August 2015 |accessdate=12 August 2015}}</ref> On 31 October, Pogba made his 100th Serie A appearance in a 2–1 home win over [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] in the [[Turin Derby]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.lastampa.it/2015/10/31/sport/calcio/qui-juve/pogba-fa-in-serie-a-e-vuole-fare-un-regalo-alla-juve-bewd61CIGEkf18sumGRgOP/pagina.html |title=Pogba fa 100 in serie A e vuole fare un regalo alla Juve|trans-title=Pogba makes 100 appearance in Serie A and wants to give a present to Juventus |newspaper=La Stampa |location=Turin |language=Italian |url=http://www.cbssports.com/general/eye-on-sports/25359504/watch-juventus-star-paul-pogba-scores-vicious-strike-in-turin-derby |title=Juventus star Paul Pogba scores vicious strike in Turin Derby |publisher=CBS Sports |first=Roger |last=Gonzalez |date=31 October 2015 |accessdate=31 October 2015}}</ref> On 24 November, Pogba was nominated for the [[UEFA Team of the Year#Team of the Year
