May 2016}}</ref>
===Return to Manchester United=== ====2016–18: Europa League win and fluctuating form==== [[File:Manchester United v Zorya Luhansk, September 2016 (07) - Paul Pogba (edited).jpg|thumb|upright|Pogba playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] during a Europa League game at [[Old Trafford]], September 2016]] On 8 August 2016, Pogba returned to former club, Manchester United, on a five-year contract for a [[List of most expensive association football transfers|then-record for highest football transfer fee]] at €105 million (£89.3 million) plus bonuses of €5 million, surpassing the former record holder [[Gareth Bale]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/88963/official-pogba-signs-man-utd |title=Official: Pogba signs for Man Utd for €105m |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |date=8 August 2016 |accessdate=8 August 2016}}</ref> Paul Pogba's agent, [[Mino Raiola]], received a reported €27 million from Juventus when he re-joined Manchester United;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-united/story/2981543/mino-raiola-earned-27m-when-paul-pogba-joined-man-united-juventus-chief-giuseppe-marotta |title=Paul Pogba's Man United deal earned Mino Raiola €27m – Juventus chief |website=ESPN FC |date=25 October 2016 |accessdate=12 January 2017}}</ref> Juventus disclosed the fee as an auxiliary expense, for €26.154 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.juventus.com/media/native/investor-relations-docs/english/bilanci/1516/Relazione%20finanziaria%20semestrale%20al%2031%20dicembre%202016_eng%20web.pdf |title=Half-yearly financial report at 31 December 2016 |date=10 April 2017 |accessdate=4 August 2017 |publisher=Juventus F.C.}}</ref> [[The Football Association]] announced that Pogba would be suspended for Manchester United's opening Premier League fixture of the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]] against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]], due to two yellow cards he had accumulated in the previous season's edition of the Coppa Italia with Juventus.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10533086/paul-pogba-suspended-for-manchester-united-opener |title=Paul Pogba suspended for Manchester United opener |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref> On 19 August, he made his first appearance since returning to the club in a 2–0 home victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/19/paul-pogba-manchester-united-jose-mourinho |title=Paul Pogba shows he can play big part in José Mourinho's revitalisation project |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |first=Jamie |last=Jackson |date=19 August 2016 |accessdate=20 August 2016}}</ref>
After the 2–1 defeat at home in the first [[Manchester derby]] of the season on 10 September, Pogba was criticised for his lack of discipline in positioning by pundit [[Jamie Carragher]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-uniteds-paul-pogba-slated-8820263 |title=Manchester United's Paul Pogba slated by Jamie Carragher: 'He was like a kid in the school yard' |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=12 September 2016}}</ref> Pogba, however, soon recovered to form and scored his first [[Premier League]] goal for United with a header against defending champions [[Leicester City]] in a 4–1 home win on 24 September.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393483 |title=Manchester United 4–1 Leicester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}}</ref> He then scored twice, once from the penalty spot and then with a strike from distance, in a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] tie against [[Fenerbahçe S.K.|Fenerbahçe]] on 20 October.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/oct/20/manchester-united-fenerbahce-europa-league-group-a-match-report |title=Manchester United demolish Fenerbahce as Paul Pogba gets two |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |date=21 October 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref> Manager [[José Mourinho]] defended Pogba after the game, criticising football's "[[Albert Einstein|Einsteins]]" for being too quick to judge the player.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10625554/jose-mourinho-einsteins-have-judged-paul-pogba-too-quickly |title=Jose Mourinho: 'Einsteins' have judged Paul Pogba too quickly |date=21 October 2016 |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=21 October 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Paul Pogba 9 March 2017 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|left|Pogba playing against [[FC Rostov]] in Russia, March 2017]] In January 2017, Pogba scored in a 2–1 away defeat to [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in the second leg of the [[2016–17 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] semi-final, which allowed Manchester United to advance to the final 3–2 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/01/26/hull-vs-man-utd-efl-cup-semi-final-second-leg-live-score-updates1/ |title=Hull City 2 Man Utd 1 (2–3 on agg): Paul Pogba takes Jose Mourinho one step closer to first trophy at United |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first1=Sam |last1=Wallace |first2=Ben |last2=Bloom |date=26 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> On 24 May 2017, Pogba scored in the 18th minute of the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|final]] against Dutch club [[AFC Ajax]], which proved to be the game-winning goal as Manchester United defeated Ajax 2–0 to win United's first continental trophy in nine years.<ref>{{cite web |title=Pogba, Mkhitaryan on target as Man Utd win Europa League vs. Ajax |url=http://www.espnfc.us/report?gameId=478698 |website=ESPN FC |date=24 May 2017 |accessdate=24 May 2017}}</ref> Manchester United finished the 2016–17 Premier League season in sixth place, with Pogba being involved in 30 games, scoring five goals and providing four assists.<ref>{{cite web |title=Paul Pogba Soccer Stats |url=https://www.foxsports.com/soccer/paul-pogba-player-stats |publisher=Fox Sports |accessdate=27 March 2018}}</ref>
Pogba scored the fourth goal in a 4–0 victory over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on the opening weekend of the [[2017–18 Premier League]] season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Manchester United 4 West Ham 0 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Aug/match-report-man-united-4-west-ham-0.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=13 August 2017}}</ref> During a 3–0 defeat of [[FC Basel|Basel]] during the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage]], Pogba tore his left hamstring and was expected to miss eight matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/29/paul-pogbas-hamstring-injury-long-term-problem-admits-man-utd/ |title=Paul Pogba's hamstring injury is a 'long-term' problem, admits Man Utd manager Jose Mourinho |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=29 September 2017 |accessdate=27 March 2018}}</ref> He returned to action on 18 November in a 4–1 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], assisting [[Anthony Martial]] with a cross from the flank and scored United's third goal.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Taylor |first1=Daniel |title=Manchester United's Paul Pogba returns in style to cut down Newcastle |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/18/manchester-united-newcastle-united-premier-league-match-report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=27 March 2018 |date=18 November 2017}}</ref> In his first game of 2018, on 1 January, Pogba provided assists for both goals as Manchester United defeated [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Everton 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42411049 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=27 March 2018 |date=1 January 2018}}</ref> Throughout the next few months, Pogba was again the subject of criticism regarding a lack of discipline and for not fulfilling his defensive duties.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Walker |first1=Ron |title=Paul Pogba's 'obvious' issues with Jose Mourinho 'could reach a stand-off', say Sunday Supplement panel |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/11256213/paul-pogbas-obvious-issues-with-jose-mourinho-could-reach-a-stand-off-say-sunday-supplement-panel |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=27 March 2018 |date=18 February 2018}}</ref> He was absent from several pivotal games in favour of [[Scott McTominay]], including Manchester United's 2–1 victory over rivals [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and was only used as a late substitution as his side were eliminated from the Champions League in the round of 16 by [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in March.<ref name="Dobson">{{cite news |last1=Dobson |first1=Mark |title=Paul Pogba ‘cannot be happy’ with treatment at United – Didier Deschamps |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/mar/19/paul-pogba-manchester-united-didier-deschamps-france-jose-mourinho-cannot-be-happy |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=27 March 2018 |date=19 March 2018}}</ref>
The day before the [[Manchester derby]], [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] manager [[Pep Guardiola]] claimed that Pogba's agent, [[Mino Raiola]], had offered Pogba to play for his side, which Raiola denied.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jackson |first1=Jamie |title=Pep Guardiola claims he was offered Paul Pogba this season by Mino Raiola |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/apr/06/pep-guardiola-paul-pogba-mino-raiola-offer-manchester-united-city |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=7 April 2018 |date=6 April 2018}}</ref> In the derby at [[City of Manchester Stadium|Etihad Stadium]] on 7 April, Pogba scored two goals in quick succession as Manchester United came back to defeat their rivals 3–2 after conceding two goals in the first half. The victory also prevented Manchester City from securing the Premier League title against them, which they later did as Manchester United finished the season as runners-up.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Manchester City 2–3 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43602492 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 April 2018 |date=7 April 2018}}</ref> In the [[2018 FA Cup Final]] against Chelsea, his side were defeated 1–0, with Pogba squandering a chance to equalise with a header in the penalty box.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44091559 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 July 2018 |date=19 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–present: Resurgence in form==== Due to the absence of team captain [[Antonio Valencia]], Pogba took over temporary captaincy of the club in the opening games of the [[2018–19 Manchester United F.C. season|2018–19]] season. Pogba began the season well in the first few weeks, scoring four goals as the new designated penalty taker. However following a series of disappointing results, Mourinho announced that Pogba would not captain the team again.<ref name="Stone1">{{cite news |last1=Stone |first1=Simon |title=Paul Pogba: Jose Mourinho says he has 'no problem' with Man Utd midfielder |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45644719 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 September 2018 |date=25 September 2018}}</ref> In late September, Pogba and Mourinho were filmed having a confrontation during a training session, despite Mourinho's assertion that there was "no problem" between the two.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Stone |first1=Simon |title=Paul Pogba & Jose Mourinho: Where do Manchester United go from here? |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45651608 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 September 2018 |date=26 September 2018}}</ref> Despite this, Pogba continued to play in the starting eleven and scored in United's 2-1 victory over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/man-utd-vs-everton/390853</ref> However, following a spell of poor form and strained relationship with Mourinho, Pogba found himself benched and linked with an exit from Manchester United during the January transfer season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/reports-pogba-wants-to-leave-old-trafford |title=Paul Pogba wants to leave Old Trafford over alleged rift with Mourinho |publisher=www.sportskeeda.com|last=Vaidya|first=Ameya|date=26 September 2018|accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref> Continuing tentions between Pogba and Mourinho saw him branded a "virus" who influenced United’s bad form by the manager.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/12/02/jose-mourinho-brands-paul-pogba-virus-manchester-united-dressing/ |title=Mourinho brands Pogba as "Virus" in United dressing room|publisher=www.telegraph.co.uk|date=2 December 2018|accessdate=30 January 2019 }}</ref> Pogba continued to be benched throughout the next few games up until and including United's match against Liverpool where Manchester United lost 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46497598 |title=Shaqiri scores twice as Liverpool beat Manchester United 3–1|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McNulty|first=Phil|date=16 December 2018|accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref> Shortly after this match however Mourinho was sacked as Manchester United manager,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46603018 |title=Manchester United sack José Mourinho|publisher=BBC|accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref> and [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]] was appointed as the caretaker manager one day later.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46616768 |title=Solskjaer appointed as Manchester United’s caretaker manager until the end of the season|publisher=BBC|date=19 December 2018|accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref>
Under new manager, Ole Gunnar Solskjær, Pogba saw a revival in his form as he scored twice consecutively against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46615149|title=Pogba scores double as Solskjaer records first home win as manager|publisher=BBC|last=Hafez|first=Shamoon|date=26 December 2018|accessdate=31 January 2019}}</ref> and [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46663363|title=Manchester United 4–1 Bournemouth|publisher=BBC|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|date=30 December 2018|accessdate=31 January 2019}}</ref> In January 2019, Pogba assisted [[Marcus Rashford]]'s game-winning goal against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/tottenham-vs-man-utd/390975|title=Tottenham Hotspur 0–1 Manchester United|publisher=www.skysports.com|last=Jack |first=Wilkinson|date=14 January 2019|accessdate=31 January 2019}}</ref> with consecutive goals in the following matches against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/man-utd-vs-brighton/390982</ref> and [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/man-utd-vs-burnley/390991</ref> Pogba then scored a brace in a 3–0 away win over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], and was named man of the match;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/manchester-united/360/blog/post/3769991/pogba-and-martial-star-as-man-united-ease-past-lowly-fulham |title=Pogba and Martial star as Man United ease past lowly Fulham |publisher=ESPN FC |last1=Dawson |first1=Rob |date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2019/feb/09/fulham-v-manchester-united-premier-league-live |title=Fulham 0–3 Man Utd |work=The Guardian |last1=Murray |first1=Scott |date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019 }}</ref> his two goals brought his seasonal tally to a personal best of 11 league goals and 13 in all competitions.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/big-teams-stay-in-the-top-four-pogba-lays-down-challenge-to-manchester-united |title=Big teams stay in the top four - Pogba lays down challenge to Manchester United |publisher=www.sportskeeda.com |date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019 }}</ref> Pogba continued this trend by scoring again in United's [[FA Cup]] fifth round tie against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] where United won 2-0.<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/Chelsea-vs-Man-Utd/405684</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== [[File:Pogba (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Pogba with France in the 2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]
Pogba began his international career for France with the [[France national youth football team|national youth football team]] and earned caps at all levels for which he was eligible. Prior to his international debut, Pogba was named [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the under-16 team by coach Guy Ferrier. He made his youth international debut on 23 September 2008 in the team's opening match of the campaign against [[Wales national football team|Wales]] in [[Llanelli]]. France won the match 4–2.<ref>{{cite web |title=Début de parcours victorieux (4–2) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/463979.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=23 September 2008 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref> Under Pogba's leadership, the team recorded impressive victories over [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] and [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in the Tournoi du [[Val-de-Marne]], and defeated the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] by a combined score of 8–2 over the course of two matches.<ref>{{cite web |title=Première victoire contre l'Uruguay (2–0) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/473168.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=28 October 2008 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Victoire face à l'Italie (4–0) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/474346.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=1 November 2008 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Premier succès face à l'Irlande (3–0) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/528183.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=10 March 2009 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Deuxième victoire tricolore (5–2) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/528198.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=12 March 2009 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref> On 31 January 2009, he scored his first youth international goal in the 2009 Aegean Cup Final against [[Norway national football team|Norway]]. The goal gave France a 1–0 lead and the team won the match 2–1 to win the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |title=La France remporte le tournoi ! |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/actualite/527781.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=31 January 2009 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |language=French}}</ref>
He was a part of the team that played at the [[2010 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] scoring both of his goals with the team at the tournament. He scored the only goal in the team's 1–0 victory over [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal]] in the group stage and netted his second in the team's 2–1 loss to England in the semi-finals.<ref>{{cite web |title=Pogba proves decisive for France |url=http://en.uefa.com/under17/matches/season=2010/round=15342/match=2002333/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=21 May 2010 |accessdate=1 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100522140221/http://en.uefa.com/under17/matches/season%3D2010/round%3D15342/match%3D2002333/index.html |archivedate=22 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Wickham shoots England into final |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/matches/season=2010/round=15343/match=2002342/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=27 May 2010 |accessdate=1 August 2010}}</ref> Following the departure of Ferrier as the team's youth international coach, Pogba was re-instated as captain at his age level by new coach [[Pierre Mankowski]]. Mankowski had previously been the assistant manager of the [[France national football team|senior national team]] under the reign of [[Raymond Domenech]]. Pogba made his under-18 debut on 27 October 2010 at the Tournio de Limoges against [[Greece national football team|Greece]] in a 4–1 victory.<ref>{{cite web |title=Festival offensif pour débuter (4–1) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m18ans/actualite/535426.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=27 October 2010 |accessdate=3 March 2011 |language=French}}</ref> On 24 March 2011, Pogba scored his first goal with the team netting the game-winning goal in a 2–1 win over [[Germany national under-18 football team|Germany]]. The goal was scored from over {{convert|30|m|yd}} out.<ref>{{cite web |title=Victoire tricolore pour conclure (2–1) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m18ans/actualite/536863.shtml |publisher=French Football Federation |date=24 March 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2011 |language=French}}</ref>
Pogba made his debut with the [[France national under-19 football team|under-19 team]] in its first match of the season against [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy]] on 6 September 2011. In the match, he assisted on two goals, scored by [[Jean-Christophe Bahebeck]] and [[Anthony Koura]], in a 3–1 victory.<ref>{{cite web |title=Premier succès face aux Italiens (3–1) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/539077_premier-succes-face-aux-italiens-3-1 |publisher=French Football Federation |date=6 September 2011 |accessdate=6 September 2011 |language=French}}</ref> On 29 February 2012, he scored his first goal for the team in a 2–1 defeat to [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite web |title=L'Espagne s'impose à Meaux (2–1) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/541047_l-espagne-s-impose-a-meaux-2-1 |publisher=French Football Federation |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=1 March 2012 |language=French}}</ref> In [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship elite qualification|Elite Round qualification]] for the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]], Pogba scored the fifth goal in the team's 6–0 rout of the [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands]]. The victory qualified France for the competition.<ref>{{cite web |title=Netherlands 0–6 France |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2012/matches/round=2000214/match=2009169/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=30 May 2012 |accessdate=3 July 2012}}</ref> On 11 June 2012, Pogba was named to the squad to participate in the tournament. In the team's opening group stage match against [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia]], he converted a penalty in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |title=France in cruise control against Serbia |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2012/matches/round=2000210/match=2010333/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=3 July 2012 |accessdate=3 July 2012}}</ref> France reached the semi-finals where the team faced Spain. In the match, with France trailing 3–2 in [[extra time]], Pogba scored the equalising goal three minutes prior to the match's completion to send it to [[Penalty shootout|penalties]]. However, despite Pogba converting the opening penalty for France, ''Les Bleuets'' were defeated 4–2.<ref>{{cite web |title=Spain finally see off France in semi-final shoot-out |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2012/matches/round=2000211/match=2010326/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=12 July 2012 |accessdate=12 July 2012}}</ref>
Due to the under-19 team's semi-final appearance in the 2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship, the nation qualified for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], which merited [[France national under-20 football team|under-20 team]] appearances for Pogba. Similar to the previous two seasons, Pogba was installed as captain by Mankowski and made his under-20 debut in a 0–0 draw against [[China national under-20 football team|China]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Match nul face à la Chine (0–0) |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/20ans/actualite/543073_match-nul-face-a-la-chine-0-0 |publisher=French Football Federation |date=7 September 2012 |accessdate=2 October 2012 |language=French}}</ref> In the team's next match against [[North Korea national under-20 football team|North Korea]], Pogba scored the team's second goal in a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite web |title=La France domine la Corée du Nord |url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/20ans/actualite/543107_la-france-domine-la-coree-du-nord |publisher=French Football Federation |date=9 September 2012 |accessdate=2 October 2012 |language=French}}</ref> Pogba was the captain of the team that won France's first ever [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup|FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. In that tournament held in [[Turkey]], he played every minute of all of France's matches except for the final group match against Spain, in which he was an unused substitute. He was named the best player of the tournament.<ref name="Pogba meilleur joueur">{{cite news |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Pogba-designe-meilleur-joueur/385672 |title=Paul Pogba désigné meilleur joueur|trans-title=Paul Pogba elected best player |newspaper=L'Équipe |location=Paris |language=French |date=13 July 2013 |accessdate=14 July 2013}}</ref>
===Senior=== ====Early career and 2014 World Cup==== [[File:Paul Pogba - 2013 - France.jpg|thumb|upright|Pogba making his senior debut for France against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]] in March 2013]]
On 22 March 2013, Pogba made his debut for the [[France national football team|French senior team]] in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying|2014 World Cup qualifier]] against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]]. He played the full 90 minutes in a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008416/index.html |title=France rise to Group I summit with Georgia win |date=22 March 2013 |publisher=UEFA}}</ref> He scored his first international goal against [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]] on 10 September 2013 in a 4–2 victory, once again during a 2014 World Cup qualifier.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/belarus-vs-france/1219715/report |title=Belarus 2 – 4 France Match report |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=10 September 2013 |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref>
On 6 June 2014, Pogba was named in France's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/france/10810384/France-World-Cup-2014-squad.html |title=France World Cup 2014 squad |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=16 June 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> On 15 June, he started in central midfield in the team's first World Cup fixture – a 3–0 victory over [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]] – suffering a foul from [[Wilson Palacios]] which led to a red card for the Honduran and a penalty kick, which was converted by [[Karim Benzema]] to give France the lead.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285092 |title=France 3–0 Honduras |date=15 June 2014 |accessdate=16 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He appeared as a substitute in the team's second match, assisting a goal for Benzema in a 5–2 victory of [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285207 |title=Switzerland 2–5 France |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=28 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> In the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|round of 16]], Pogba scored a 79th minute opening goal and was named man of the match by [[FIFA]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255951/match=300186462/man-of-the-match.html |title=FRANCE 2–0 NIGERIA |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref> as ''Les Bleus'' defeated [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] 2–0 in [[Brasília]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27969976 |title=France 2–0 Nigeria |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2014 |accessdate=1 July 2014}}</ref> France were eliminated in the quarter-finals of the competition following a 1–0 defeat to eventual champions Germany on 4 July with Pogba giving away the free kick from which the Germans eventually scored.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28051800 |title=France 0–1 Germany |date=4 July 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/france-vs-germany/317564 |title=World Cup: Mats Hummels goal gives Germany 1–0 quarter-final win over France |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=18 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255953/match=300186485/live-blog.html |title=2014 FIFA World Cup - Matches |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=18 November 2018}}</ref> On 13 July 2014, Pogba was named the tournament's [[2014 FIFA World Cup#Awards|Best Young Player]].<ref name="hyundaiyoungplayer">{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=7/news=pogba-wins-hyundai-young-player-award-2405061.html |title=Pogba wins Hyundai Young Player Award |publisher=FIFA |date=13 July 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2014}}</ref>
====Euro 2016==== In May 2016, Pogba was named by national side manager [[Didier Deschamps]] to France's 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]], to be played on home soil.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/pogba-leads-france-squad-euro-2016-schneiderlin-and-ben-arfa-miss-out#:wx78ZHCGIE8bVA |title=Pogba leads France squad for Euro 2016 as Schneiderlin and Ben Arfa miss out |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |date=12 May 2016 |accessdate=16 May 2016}}</ref> Although much was expected of Pogba at the upcoming European Championships, in France's opening match of the tournament, a 2–1 win over [[Romania national football team|Romania]] on 10 June, he endured criticism for his perceived negative performance after being played out of position, and was subsequently left on the bench by Deschamps for his nation's second group match, later coming on as a second-half substitute in a 2–0 win over [[Albania national football team|Albania]].<ref name="Pogba propels five-star France back into form">{{cite web |url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/the-euros/pogba-propels-fivestar-france-back-into-form/news-story/f36e85b24ecaf8b055f4706699b1fe57 |title=Pogba propels five-star France back into form |publisher=Fox Sports |date=3 July 2016 |accessdate=4 July 2016}}</ref> In the round of the 16, he was once again the target of media scrutiny for conceding an early penalty against [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Ireland]], prompting former England international [[Gary Lineker]] to tweet: “Is Pogba the world’s most overrated player?”; France eventually came from behind to win the match 2–1.<ref name="Pogba propels five-star France back into form"/>
In the quarter-final match against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] on 3 July, at the [[Stade de France]], Pogba was able to recapture his form, putting on a dominant performance in his new midfield role, as he scored his nation's second goal of the night from a header following [[Antoine Griezmann]]'s corner, which he had previously helped to obtain;<ref name="Pogba propels five-star France back into form"/> he later started the play which led to Griezmann's goal, as the host nation advanced to the semi-finals of the competition following a 5–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/jul/04/talking-points-france-iceland-euro-2016 |title=France 5–2 Iceland: five talking points from the Euro 2016 quarter-final |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |first=Simon |last=Burnton |date=4 July 2016 |accessdate=4 July 2016}}</ref> In the semi-final match against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] four days later, Pogba was once again started in a deep-lying midfield role alongside [[Blaise Matuidi]] in a 4–2–3–1 formation; following [[N'Golo Kanté]]'s introduction in the second half, he was shifted to a more advanced role, which gave him more tactical freedom, and he subsequently helped to create Griezmann's second goal of the match, as the hosts defeated the reigning World Cup Champions 2–0 to advance to the [[UEFA Euro 2016 Final|final]] of the tournament,<ref>{{cite news |first=Jason |last=Burke |title=Germany 0–2 France: Antoine Griezmann's double fires hosts into Euro 2016 final with Portugal |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/07/07/germany-0-2-france-antoine-griezmanns-double-fires-hosts-into-eu/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=7 July 2016 |accessdate=7 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/07/07/paul-pogba-has-shackles-released-as-euro-2016-finally-begins-for/ |title=Paul Pogba has shackles released as Euro 2016 finally begins for France's poster boy |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Sam |last=Wallace |date=7 July 2016 |accessdate=8 July 2016}}</ref> where they suffered a 1–0 extra-time defeat to Portugal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000451/match=2017907/index.html |title=Portugal 1–0 France |publisher=UEFA |first1=Joseph |last1=Walker |first2=David |last2=Crossan |date=10 July 2016 |accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref>
====2018 World Cup victory==== [[File:Paul Pogba World Cup Trophy.jpg|250px|thumb|Pogba (right) with his brother [[Florentin Pogba|Florentin]] and their mother holding the [[FIFA World Cup Trophy|World Cup trophy]]]] {{Expand section|date=March 2019}} On 17 May 2018, Pogba was called up to the France squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12025/11376691/alexandre-lacazette-and-anthony-martial-on-standby-for-france-world-cup-squad-and-dimitri-payet-out |title=Alexandre Lacazette and Anthony Martial on standby for France World Cup squad and Dimitri Payet out |publisher=Sky Sports |first=Andy |last=Charles |date=21 May 2018 |accessdate=6 November 2018}}</ref> On 16 June 2018, he took the shot that deflected off [[Aziz Behich]] and resulted in the winning goal in France's 2–1 win over [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] in their opening match at the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dw.com/en/world-cup-2018-paul-pogbas-late-goal-rescues-slack-france-against-australia/a-44251335 |title=World Cup 2018: Paul Pogba's late goal rescues slack France against Australia |date=16 June 2018 |accessdate=16 June 2018 |publisher=Deutsche Welle}}</ref> The goal was initially awarded to Pogba, but the following day FIFA re-awarded it as an own goal to Behich.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://global.espn.com/football/france/story/3529869/paul-pogba-goal-for-france-vs-australia-changed-to-aziz-behich-own-goal?src=com |title=Paul Pogba goal for France vs. Australia changed to Aziz Behich own goal |date=17 June 2018 |accessdate=17 June 2018 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref>
In the 59th minute of the [[2018 FIFA World Cup Final]], Pogba extended France's lead over [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] to 3–1 with a strike from the edge of the penalty area after his initial shot had been blocked.<ref>{{cite news |last=Watson |first=Jack |title=World Cup final 2018: Paul Pogba happy to prove critics wrong as he makes history with goal as France beat Croatia |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-final-2018-france-croatia-paul-pogba-manchseter-united-record-a8448786.html |date=15 July 2018 |accessdate=16 July 2018 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> France eventually won the World Cup by a score of 4–2.<ref name=wc/>
==Style of play== Primarily a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]], although he is also capable of playing on the [[Midfielder#Winger|left]], in a [[Midfielder#Holding midfielder|holding]] role, as a [[Midfielder#Deep-lying playmaker|deep-lying playmaker]], in a [[Midfielder#Box-to-box midfielder|box-to-box role]], or even as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]],<ref name="Paul Pogba (Manchester United FC)"/><ref name="Juve's Paul Pogba pressing his claim as the best box-to-box midfielder around">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/italian-serie-a/12/blog/post/2738479/paul-pogba-makes-his-case-for-being-the-best-midfielder |title=Juve's Paul Pogba pressing his claim as the best box-to-box midfielder around |website=ESPN FC |first=Paolo |last=Bandini |date=6 December 2015 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-news-paul-pogba-jose-mourinho-a7380656.html |title=Manchester United news: Jose Mourinho explains Paul Pogba's 'problem' after difficult start at Old Trafford |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |first=Mark |last=Critchley |date=26 October 2016 |accessdate=23 July 2018}}</ref> Pogba has been described by his club Manchester United as a "powerful, skilful, and creative" player who has "an eye for goal and a penchant for the spectacular."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Paul-Pogba.aspx |title=Paul Pogba |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=14 March 2013}}</ref> In Italy, he gained the nicknames ''Il Polpo Paul'' ("[[Paul the Octopus]]") for his long legs that look like tentacles during tackling or running<ref name=festa>{{cite news |url=http://www.lastampa.it/2012/11/01/sport/il-polpo-paul-cattura-palloni-e-decide-le-partite-e2W8cAhjdjl8YLVQyUhrCI/pagina.html |title=Pogba fa festa ballando: "Mai così felice"|trans-title=Pogba celebrates dancing: "Never so happy" |newspaper=La Stampa |location=Turin |language=Italian |date=1 November 2012 |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> and "Pogboom" for his explosive playing style and energy on the pitch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.juventus.com/juve/it/news/9_maggio_2015_juventus-cagliari_match |title=Bentornato PogBOOM! |trans-title=Welcome back PogBOOM! |publisher=Juventus F.C. |language=Italian |date=9 May 2015}}</ref> A large, quick, hard-working and physically strong player, he excels in the air, and is also known for his stamina, as well as his powerful and accurate striking ability from distance; he has also drawn praise for his finesse, technique, flair, and [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] skills,<ref name="Juve's Paul Pogba pressing his claim as the best box-to-box midfielder around"/><ref name="Five ways Paul Pogba has improved since his first stint with Man United">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/manchester-united/360/blog/post/2932673/paul-pogba-manchester-united-five-ways-he-has-improved-since-his-first-stint |title=Five ways Paul Pogba has improved since his first stint with Man United |website=ESPN FC |date=19 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref><ref name="Is he worth the hype? The best Pogba stats ahead of Man United return">{{cite web |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/he-worth-hype-best-pogba-stats-ahead-man-united-return |title=Is he worth the hype? The best Pogba stats ahead of Man United return |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |date=7 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/blog/tactics-and-analysis/67/post/2935015/manchester-united-playing-in-jose-mourinho-style-already-as-pogba-shines |title=Manchester United playing in Mourinho style already as Paul Pogba shines |website=ESPN FC |first=Thore |last=Haugstad |date=22 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref> as well as his ability to hold up the ball.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-man-utd/live/391009 |title=Fulham 0-3 Man Utd recap |publisher=Sky Sports |date=9 February 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019 }}</ref> His characteristics and playing role in [[Midfielder|midfield]] initially led him to be compared with former France international [[Patrick Vieira]] in his youth.<ref name=festa/>
During his final season with Juventus, Pogba was deployed in a more advanced and creative midfield role rather than in his usual box-to-box role,<ref name="Juve's Paul Pogba pressing his claim as the best box-to-box midfielder around"/> which saw him gain more time on the ball, and he excelled as the team's main [[playmaker]], due to his vision, and passing range;<ref name="Juventus crowned Serie A champions after Roma score late against Napoli"/><ref name="Five ways Paul Pogba has improved since his first stint with Man United"/><ref name="Is he worth the hype? The best Pogba stats ahead of Man United return"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/has-paul-pogbas-form-season-proved-him-worthy-giant-transfer |title=Has Paul Pogba's form this season proved him worthy of a giant transfer? |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |first=Greg |last=Lea |date=12 February 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref> his performances in this role saw him develop from a promising youngster into one of the best and most complete midfielders in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/82147/pirlo-pogba-best-world |title=Pirlo: 'Pogba best in world' |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |date=1 April 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/08/18/paul-pogba-wont-score-20-goals-a-season-but-he-is-the-best-midfi/ |title=Paul Pogba won't score 20 goals a season but he is the best midfielder in the world, says Man Utd boss Jose Mourinho |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Ian |last=Whittell |date=18 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref> Upon Pogba's departure from Juventus in 2016, his former teammate [[Gianluigi Buffon]] compared him to French former playmakers [[Michel Platini]] and [[Zinedine Zidane]], and also praised his ability, leadership, work-rate and attitude, both on the pitch and in training, stating that he "...is a tremendous warrior on the pitch but also has so much talent. His control of the ball and the way he can swiftly change the play from defence to attack is special."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/90199/buffon-%E2%80%98hurts-lose-pogba%E2%80%99 |title=Buffon: ‘Hurts to lose Pogba’ |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |date=22 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/90750/buffon-hails-%E2%80%98humble%E2%80%99-balotelli |title=Buffon hails 'humble' Balotelli |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |date=31 August 2016 |accessdate=1 September 2016}}</ref>
==Media and sponsorships== Pogba has a sponsorship deal with sportswear and equipment supplier [[Adidas]]. He wears [[Adidas Predator]] football boots which he has promoted in commercials.<ref>{{cite news |title=Paul Pogba – Adidas Predator Commercial |url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=r3mylxCqqnc |accessdate=17 July 2018 |agency=Adidas}}</ref> He appeared in an Adidas 2018 World Cup commercial along with other players in the Adidas stable, including [[David Beckham]], [[Lionel Messi]] and [[Mohamed Salah]], as well as American singer [[Pharrell Williams]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Adidas release star-studded World Cup advert featuring Messi, Beckham, Mourinho, Pharrell and more |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/adidas-release-star-studded-world-cup-advert-featuring-messi-beckham-mourinho-pharrell-and |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |date=17 July 2018}}</ref>
Appearing in [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'' video game series]], Pogba's [[goal celebration]], '[[dab (dance)|the Dab]]', was first featured in ''[[FIFA 17]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=FIFA 17: Want to do the Dab? Here's how to perform Paul Pogba's famous celebration on Xbox One and PS4 |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fifa-dab-goal-celebration-pogba-11892372 |accessdate=17 July 2018 |newspaper=Birmingham Mail}}</ref> Pogba, with his brothers Florentin and Mathias, attended the [[2017 MTV Europe Music Awards]] in London, where Paul with English actress, [[Natalie Dormer]] were presented the "Best Song" award to Canadian singer, [[Shawn Mendes]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/your-monday-briefing-for-united-fans-on-13-november-2017 |title=Your Monday Briefing: Catch Up Quickly |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=13 November 2017 |accessdate=13 November 2017}}</ref>

Sánchez began his career as a youth player for [[C.D. Cobreloa|Cobreloa]] at age 17, completing a season at the club before relocating to Italy to play for [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] in 2006. He won his first trophies in the following seasons, winning consecutive league titles in loans spells to [[Colo-Colo]] and [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]]. In 2008, he returned to Udinese, becoming an integral member of the team in his first full season at the club. After three seasons in Italy, Sánchez moved to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in a transfer worth €30 million (£25 million), becoming the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|most expensive Chilean player of all time]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Los traspasos más caros de Chilenos |url=http://www.superdt.cl/futbol-internacional/fotos-conoce-los-traspasos-de-futbolistas-chilenos-mas-caros |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
In his first season at Barcelona, Sánchez starred in an attacking trio alongside [[Lionel Messi]] and [[David Villa]], helping the club win the [[Copa del Rey]], [[Supercopa de España]], [[UEFA Super Cup]], and [[FIFA Club World Cup]]. The trio scored a total of 82 goals the following season, as the club won the [[2012–13 La Liga]], as well as retaining the Supercopa de España, before Sánchez enjoyed his highest scoring return at the ''Blaugrana'', ending the season with a total of 21 goals, and 14 assists. Following the high-profile arrival of [[Neymar]] in 2013, Sánchez transferred to Premier League side [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in a deal worth £31.7 million (€35.8 million) a year later.
At Arsenal, Sánchez quickly established himself as the figurehead of the team, completing every season in England with double figures in both goals and assists. He also won the [[FA Community Shield]], as well as the [[FA Cup]] on two occasions, scoring in both finals. In the [[2016–17 Arsenal F.C. season|2016–17 season]], Sánchez scored 30 goals and provided 14 assists, his best return as a professional footballer, while going onto being nominated for the [[FIFPro|FIFPro World XI]]. However, after lacking "inspiration" at the direction of the club, he signed for rivals Manchester United in a swap deal in 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/alexis-sanchez-manchester-united-arsenal-transfer-news-parting-shot-instagram-message-revealed-a8172956.html |title=Sanchez takes parting shot at Arsenal critics before completing move |date=22 January 2018 |publisher=}}</ref>
Popularly dubbed ''"El Niño Maravilla"'' (The Wonder Child),<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/serie-a/8583998/Udinese-forward-Alexis-Sanchez-on-the-road-to-greatness.html |title=Udinese forward Alexis Sanchez on the road to greatness |work=The Telegraph |author1=Rory Smith |date=18 June 2011 |accessdate=3 January 2018}}</ref> Sánchez has been a full international for Chile since 2006, and has earned [[FIFA Century Club|124 caps]], making him the team's most capped player of all-time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/586/copa-america/2016/06/23/24947822/alexis-sanchez-reaches-100-caps-for-chile |title=Alexis Sanchez reaches 100 caps for Chile |publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> With [[List of international goals scored by Alexis Sánchez|41 goals]], he is the country's all-time leading goalscorer.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4358776/Chile-3-0-Venezuela-Match-report.html |title=Chile 3 -1 Venezuela: Alexis Sanchez fires Stunning free kick to become La Roja's joint top scorer |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref> He played in an instrumental role in allowing Chile to reach the final of the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]], while further leading the side to their first international victory at the [[2015 Copa América]], scoring the winning penalty in the [[2015 Copa América Final|final]] against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.genius.com/amp/Alexis-sanchez-alexis-sanchezs-career-achievements-annotated |title=Alexis Sanchez's Career Achievements |publisher=Genius.com}}</ref> He later contributed to a repeat of this triumph, aiding in the side's retention of the trophy at the [[Copa América Centenario]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2707297/Alexis-Sanchez-risen-playing-barefoot-poverty-stricken-Chilean-mining-town-Arsenal-s-30m-signing-light-Premier-League.html |title=Alexis Sanchez |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/aug/15/alexis-sanchez-arsenal-barcelona-premier-league-la-liga |title=Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez: The squirrel who scurried his way to the top |website=The Guardian}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Cobreloa=== [[File:Alexis Sanchez Cobreloa20171.png|thumb|120px|upright|Sánchez in [[C.D. Cobreloa|Cobreloa]] colours, 2017]] Born in [[Tocopilla]], Sánchez was a product of [[C.D. Cobreloa]]'s prolific youth ranks where he was teammate of current Chile national team players such as [[Charles Aránguiz]] and [[Eduardo Vargas]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Calama: El recuerdo de 6 seleccionados que jugaron en Cobreloa |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2012/05/31/543228/el-grato-recuerdo-que-dejaron-en-calama-seis-seleccionados-que-jugaron-en-cobreloa.html |work=Emol |date=31 May 2012 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> In February 2005, Sánchez was promoted to the senior first team by manager [[Nelson Acosta]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Nelson Acosta alaba el nivel de Alexis Sánchez |url=http://www.latercera.com/contenido/656_168489_9.shtml |publisher=La Tercera |date=13 August 2009 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141025224123/http://www.latercera.com/contenido/656_168489_9.shtml |archivedate=25 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Ex técnicos de Alexis aconsejan al tocopillano: "Que se vaya de Barcelona" |url=http://www.latercera.com/noticia/deportes/2014/07/656-585692-9-ex-tecnicos-de-alexis-aconsejan-al-tocopillano-que-se-vaya-de-barcelona.shtml |publisher=La Tercera |date=8 July 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
Sánchez's made his debut against [[Deportes Temuco]] in February<ref>{{cite news |title=Medio catalán homenajeó a Alexis Sánchez a nueve años de su debut |url=http://redgol.cl/2014/2/medio-catalan-homenajeo-a-alexis-sanchez-a/ |work=Redgol.cl |date=12 February 2014 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> and scored his first professional goal in a 2–1 victory over [[Deportes Concepción]] on 18 March,<ref>{{cite news |title=¡Feliz cumpleaños Alexis Sánchez! Recuerda su primer gol como profesional |url=http://www.cdf.cl/2012/12/pid.155361/feliz-cumpleanos-alexis-sanchez-recuerda-su-primer-gol-como-profesional/ |work=CDF.cl |date=19 December 2012 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> allowed him play his first [[2005 Copa Libertadores|Copa Libertadores]] game against [[Once Caldas]] aged 16, which made him one of the youngest players on debut for the tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ganó el que quiso, perdió el que se replegó |url=http://www.espndeportes.com/futbol/cronica?id=174849 |publisher=ESPN Deportes.com |date=22 March 2005 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
After an impressive season with Cobreloa, Sánchez caught the attention of [[Serie A]] club [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]], which signed him for a [[Pound sterling|£]]1.7 million fee, on 21 April 2006.<ref>{{cite web |title=Udinese sería el nuevo equipo de Alexis Sánchez |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/04/21/216979/udinese-seria-el-nuevo-equipo-de-alexis-sanchez.html |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> Udinese, however, began a maturation project with Sánchez and immediately loaned him to Chilean giants [[Colo-Colo]] in a season-long deal.<ref>{{cite web |title=Borghi renovó contrato con Colo-Colo |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/07/10/224692/borghi-renovo-contrato-con-colo-colo.html |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
===Colo-Colo=== [[File:Alexis Sánchez.jpg|thumb|190px|Sánchez on loan at Colo-Colo against [[Audax Italiano La Florida|Audax Italiano]] in the [[2006 Torneo Clausura (Chile)|2006 Torneo Clausura]] final.]] Sánchez debuted for Colo-Colo on 23 June 2006 in a 1–1 draw with [[Deportes Antofagasta|Antofagasta]]; he scored his first goal on 29 October during the [[Chilean football derby]] against [[Club Universidad de Chile|Universidad de Chile]] in a 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Colo Colo se dio un festín y se quedó con el Superclásico en el Monumental |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/10/29/234429/colo-colo-se-dio-un-festin-y-se-quedo-con-el-superclasico-en-el-monumental.html |work=Emol |date=13 October 2006 |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> His good performances allowed him break into the starting lineup after successfully challenging veteran striker [[Mario Cáceres]], so that began partnering [[Humberto Suazo]] in the forward position. On 1 November, he scored a brace in a 4–4 league draw against [[Deportes La Serena]].<ref>{{cite news |title=La Serena tuvo una reacción increíble para frenar la racha de Colo Colo |url=http://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol/colo-colo/la-serena-tuvo-una-reaccion-increible-para-frenar-la-racha-de-colo-colo/2006-11-01/183956.html |publisher=Radio Cooperativa |date=1 November 2006 |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> as well as his first continental goal in a 7–2 thrash over [[LD Alajuelense|Alajuelense]] from Costa Rica for the [[2006 Copa Sudamericana|Copa Sudamericana]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Prensa costarricense destroza a Alajuelense tras derrota con Colo Colo |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/10/11/232425/prensa-costarricense-destroza-a-alajuelense-tras-derrota-con-colo-colo.html |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> Nevertheless, Colo-Colo was runner-up of that tournament after losing the final against [[C.F. Pachuca|Pachuca]] of Mexico.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pachuca se queda con la corona y Colo Colo con las lágrimas |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2006/12/13/238995/pachuca-se-queda-con-la-corona-y-colo-colo-con-las-lagrimas.html |work=Emol |date=13 December 2006 |accessdate=21 July 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> On 23 December 2006, Sánchez won his first professional title after being starter in the [[2006 Torneo Clausura (Chile)|Torneo Clausura final]] against [[Audax Italiano]] which his team won 3–2.
The next season, on 23 March 2007, he scored his first [[2007 Copa Libertadores|Copa Libertadores]] goals against [[Caracas FC|Caracas]] at [[Cúcuta]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Prensa venezolana dice que Caracas fue 'un desastre' ante Colo Colo |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2007/03/21/249922/prensa-venezolana-dice-que-caracas-fue-un-desastre-ante-colo-colo.html |work=Emol |date=21 March 2007 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> where he netted a [[hat-trick]] to a 4–0 away win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Colo Colo golea 4–0 a Caracas FC y sigue vivo en la Copa Libertadores |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2007/03/20/249824/colo-colo-golea-4-0-a-caracas-fc-y-sigue-vivo-en-la-copa-libertadores.html |work=Emol |date=20 March 2007 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> On 12 May, Sánchez scored his first and only one [[2007 Torneo Apertura (Chile)|league goal]] during a 3–1 home win over [[Santiago Wanderers]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Colo Colo olvidó la Libertadores ganando a Wanderers |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2007/05/12/255681/colo-colo-olvido-la-libertadores-ganando-a-wanderers.html |work=Emol |date=12 May 2007 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref> key in the race for title with [[Club Deportivo Universidad Católica|Universidad Católica]] which Colo-Colo finally reached after beat [[CD Palestino|Palestino]] 1–0 at Monumental the last matchday. Noteworthy, it meant the club's 26th league title.<ref>{{cite news |title=Colo Colo sufrió para derrotar a Palestino y consiguió estrella 26 |url=http://www.emol.com/noticias/deportes/2007/06/16/259508/colo-colo-sufrio-para-derrotar-a-palestino-y-consiguio-estrella-26.html |work=Emol |date=16 June 2007 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
After Sánchez's impressive [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|FIFA U-20 World Cup]] (where [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile]] achieved the third place with [[José Sulantay]] as coach), his loan with Colo-Colo expired and on 15 August 2007, he joined Argentina's [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] on loan from Udinese.<ref>{{cite news |title=Alexis Sánchez a River |url=http://www.diario26.com/alexis-sanchez-a-river-47118.html |publisher=diario26.com |date=15 August 2007 |accessdate=25 October 2014 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
===Udinese=== After a successful season in Argentina, Sánchez left South America in July 2008 to join Udinese, where he would meet up with Chilean compatriot [[Mauricio Isla]]. Sánchez made his non-competitive debut in a 3–0 win over [[Bassano Virtus 55 S.T.|Bassano]] and was named the man of match.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.adnmundo.com/contenidos/deportes/gran_debut_chileno_alexis_sanchez_udinese_futbol_italia_27_07_08_deportes.html |title=Gran debut de Alexis Sánchez en Udinese |work=adn mundo.cl |accessdate=27 July 2008 |language=Spanish |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080729043853/http://www.adnmundo.com/contenidos/deportes/gran_debut_chileno_alexis_sanchez_udinese_futbol_italia_27_07_08_deportes.html |archivedate=29 July 2008 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> On 14 September, he played his first Serie A match in a 1–0 loss with [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] and four days later, he made his European debut against [[Borussia Dortmund]]. On 19 October 2008, Sánchez scored his first league goal against [[U.S. Lecce|Lecce]]. After this first goal, Sánchez got into a minor slump, in which he took much criticism. The criticism ended after scoring the winning goal in the 90th minute against [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] in a 1–0 win, being named the man of match.{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} [[File:Udinese2008.jpg|thumb|right|260px|Sánchez (right) and fellow Chilean [[Mauricio Isla]] in a [[2008–09 UEFA Cup|UEFA Cup]] match against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]], on 6 November 2008.]]
The next season, Sánchez played an important role for Udinese in the [[2009–10 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], being a key player in the team that eliminated [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], assisting [[Gökhan Inler]] for the winning goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1036/coppa-italia/2010/01/27/1764330/milan-0-1-udinese-gokhan-inler-sends-milan-packing-from |title=Gokhan Inler Sends The Rossoneri Packing From Coppa Italia |publisher=goal.com |accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> In the semi-final second leg, Sánchez was the man of match after playing a successful game against [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], including scoring his first [[Coppa Italia]] goal in the 81st minute. It was not enough, however, as the aggregate score finished 2–1 in favour of Roma.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.triunfo.cl/prontus_triunfo/site/artic/20100421/pags/20100421143829.html |title=Alexis Sánchez anotó en eliminación de Udinese ante la Roma |publisher=triunfo.cl |accessdate=22 April 2009 |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100424061629/http://www.triunfo.cl/prontus_triunfo/site/artic/20100421/pags/20100421143829.html |archivedate=24 April 2010}}</ref> By the end of this year, Sánchez scored a total of 5 goals (4 at the end of tournament) in 32 appearances.
On 27 February 2011, Sánchez scored four of his team's seven goals as Udinese comfortably defeated [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]] 7–0, playing only the first 52 minutes of the game. This event meant he broke the record of goals scored by a Chilean player (in a single match) in Serie A,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.serieaticketsonline.com/alexis-sanchezs-quart-trick-demolished-palermo/ |title=Alexis Sanchez's Quart-Trick Demolished Palermo |publisher=serieaticketsonline.com |accessdate=27 February 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120326111206/http://www.serieaticketsonline.com/alexis-sanchezs-quart-trick-demolished-palermo/|archive-date=26 March 2012|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> beating the records set by countrymen [[Marcelo Salas]] and [[Iván Zamorano]].
During his successful season at Udinese, Sánchez and Italian striker [[Antonio Di Natale]] became one of the best scoring duos in Serie A; they tallied 39 goals between them, two goals short of the [[Alessandro Del Piero]]–[[David Trezeguet]] duo that completed 41 goals in the [[2007–08 Serie A|2007–08 season]]. In recognition of his achievements, Sánchez was named the world's most promising youngster of the 2011 season by the users of [[FIFA]].com, where users had to choose between Sánchez, [[Gareth Bale]], [[Javier Pastore]], [[Paulo Henrique Ganso|Ganso]] and [[Neymar]] in a poll.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1699/chile/2011/06/17/2536401/udineses-alexis-sanchez-voted-the-worlds-most-promising |title=Udinese's Alexis Sanchez voted the world's most promising youngster in Fifa poll |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=17 June 2011}}</ref> Sánchez ranked 56th in the May 2011 edition of [[Castrol Performance Index]] and 24th among the forwards.
===Barcelona===

his Ultimate XI – and no Arsenal players feature! |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/10577691/alexis-sanchez-picks-his-ultimate-xi-and-no-arsenal-players-feature |accessdate=7 September Barcelona|Barcelona]] confirmed they had agreed to a €26 million fee (including €11.5 million in certain bonuses) with Udinese for the transfer of Sánchez, becoming the first Chilean to play for the club.<ref>{{cite web |title=Barça sign Alexis Sánchez |url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/21/n110720118483.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120729183751/http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/21/n110720118483.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=29 July 2012 |publisher=FC Barcelona |accessdate=25 July 2011 |date=20 July 2011}}</ref><ref name="BBC Barcelona transfer">{{cite news |title=Alexis Sanchez joins Barcelona from Udinese for £23m |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14240148.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 July 2011 |date=21 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721220831/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14240148.stm |archivedate=21 July 2011 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Barcelona confirm £23.75m deal to buy Alexis Sánchez from Udinese |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jul/21/barcelona-buy-alexis-sanchez-udinese |accessdate=26 July 2011 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=21
