"Sánchez is very young," said then-manager [[Pep Guardiola]]; "He can play in all three attacking positions, he shows intense defensive skills, he's direct and from what I've been told, he's a very nice kid."<ref name="BBC Barcelona transfer"/> The transfer was finalised five days later when he passed a medical and signed a five-year contract.<ref name="DM Barcelona transfer">{{cite news |title=Barcelona new boy Sanchez fits straight in... with call for Fabregas to join him |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2018586/Barcelonas-Alexis-Sanchez-wants-team-Cesc-Fabregas.html |accessdate=26 July 2011 |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=25 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20121102130317/http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2018586/Barcelonas-Alexis-Sanchez-wants-team-Cesc-Fabregas.html |archivedate=2 November 2012 |deadurl=no}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Messi and Sanchez miss Barcelona's Stateside clash with Man United |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2018823/Messi-Sanchez-miss-Barcelonas-clash-Man-United.html |accessdate=26 July 2011 |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=26 July 2011}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref> "I want to learn from players like [[Lionel Messi]] and [[Xavi|Xavi Hernández]]—and I want to help the club win more titles," said Sánchez.<ref name="DM Barcelona transfer"/>
[[File:FC Barcelona Team 2, 2011.jpg|thumb|Sánchez (far left) celebrating with his Barcelona teammates after defeating [[Santos FC|Santos]] in the [[2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final]].]] Sánchez's debut season for Barcelona was mired with short-term injuries. He made his debut on 14 August 2011 against archrivals [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the [[2011 Supercopa de España]] first leg away match, suffering a thigh injury after a challenge by [[Marcelo (footballer, born 1988)|Marcelo]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.barcaloco.com/2011/08/alexis-sanchez-sidelined-one-week-with-injury/ |title=Bingo Rooms & Promotions |date=9 March 2017 |website=Barcaloco.com |accessdate=11 October 2017}}</ref> Barcelona won the tie 5–4 on aggregate. He made his return two weeks later as a substitute in the [[2011 UEFA Super Cup]], won by Barca 2–0. Alexis then started the opening match of [[2011–12 La Liga|La Liga]], at home against [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]], and scored his first goal in a 5–0 win. A week later, on 10 September, he was stretchered off after 30 minutes following a challenge from [[Dani Estrada]] in a domestic league match against [[Real Sociedad]]. Sánchez returned on 1 November in an away match against [[FC Viktoria Plzeň|Viktoria Plzeň]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/soccer/report?gameId=331221 |title=Viktoria Plzen vs. Barcelona – Football Match Report – November 1, 2011 – ESPN |website=ESPNFC.com |accessdate=11 October 2017}}</ref> On 10 December, he scored Barça's equaliser against Real Madrid in a match they went on to win 1–3 away at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium]]. On 14 February 2012, Sánchez scored the first and second [[UEFA Champions League]] goals of his career in Barcelona's 3–1 victory against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]].
In the [[2012–13 FC Barcelona season|2012–13 campaign]], on 2 October 2012 Sánchez scored the first goal for Barcelona in a 0–2 away win against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]].<ref>{{cite news |author=Brassell, Andy |title=Clinical Barcelona show mettle at Benfica |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000347/match=2009516/postmatch/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=2 October 2012 |accessdate=17 July 2014}}</ref> On 10 February 2013, then scored his first goal of the [[2012–13 La Liga|Liga season]] in Barça's 6–1 home win against [[Getafe CF|Getafe]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Sanchez relieved to break goal drought |url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1334866/alexis-sanchez-relieved-to-break-barcelona-goal-drought?cc=3436 |date=10 February 2013}}</ref> From February onwards, Sánchez scored in matches against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]], [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]], [[Athletic Bilbao]], [[Real Betis]], [[Atlético Madrid]] and [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]] to end the season with eight league goals.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.barcablaugranes.com/2013/8/1/4552136/fc-barcelona-2012-13-season-in-review-alexis-sanchez |title=FC Barcelona 2012/13 Season in Review: Alexis Sanchez |publisher=Barcablaugranes.com}}</ref> Barcelona won the [[List of Spanish football champions|league title]], ending the season with 100 [[Points (association football)|points]].
On 26 October 2013, Sánchez scored the winning goal as ''Barça'' beat Real Madrid 2–1 at [[Camp Nou]] in the first ''[[El Clásico|Clásico]]'' fixture of the [[2013–14 La Liga]] season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24603052 |title=Barcelona 2–1 Real Madrid |date=26 October 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 5 January 2014, Sánchez scored his first hat-trick for Barcelona in a 4–0 win against [[Elche CF|Elche]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/first-hat-trick-for-alexis-sanchez |title=First hat trick for Alexis Sánchez |date=5 January 2014 |publisher=FC Barcelona}}</ref> He ended the [[2013–14 FC Barcelona season|2013–14 season]] with a career-high 21 goals in all competitions,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/05/18/liverpool-target-wilfried-bony-and-alexis-sanchez-to-add-more-goals-to-their-already-fearsome-attack-4731770/?ITO=news-sitemap |title=Liverpool target Wilfried Bony and Alexis Sanchez to add more goals to their already fearsome attack |date=18 May 2014 |accessdate=18 May 2014 |work=Metro}}</ref> including 19 in La Liga.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/stats/scorers/_/league/esp.1/spanish-primera-division?cc=3436 |title=Spanish La Liga Stats: Top Goal Scorers – 2013–14 |accessdate=18 May 2014 |work=ESPN FC}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Sanchez 2014 1.jpg|thumb|145px|right|Sánchez with Arsenal in 2014]] On 10 July 2014, Sánchez signed for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a long-term contract for a transfer fee of £31.7 million.<ref name="arsenalsite">{{cite news |title=Alexis Sanchez agrees to join Arsenal |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20140710/alexis-sanchez-agrees-to-join-arsenal |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=10 July 2014 |date=10 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal confirm the signing of Alexis Sánchez from Barcelona |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/10/alexis-sanchez-signs-arsenal |work=The Guardian |accessdate=11 July 2014 |date=10 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Alexis Sanchez: Barcelona forward signs for Arsenal |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28177987 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=10 July 2014 |date=10 July 2014}}</ref> Sánchez was given the squad number 17, previously worn by [[Nacho Monreal]], who took the vacant number 18 instead. In a statement released by the club, Sánchez said that he was "so happy to be joining Arsenal, a club which has a great manager, a fantastic squad of players, huge support around the world and a great stadium in London".<ref name="arsenalsite" /> Manager [[Arsène Wenger]] praised Sánchez, saying that the [[Chile national football team|Chilean international]] "has consistently produced top-quality performances at the highest level for a number of seasons now and we are all excited to see him integrate into the Arsenal squad."<ref name="arsenalsite" /> Sánchez made his first appearance for Arsenal on 2 August 2014, as a substitute during a 5–1 win against Benfica in the pre-season [[Emirates Cup]] tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal's Yaya Sanogo hits four in friendly rout of Benfica |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/02/arsenal-benfica-emirates-cup-match-report |author=Doyle, Paul |work=The Guardian |date=2 August 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014}}</ref>
==== 2014–15 season ==== Sánchez's first competitive appearance was against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2014 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]], on 10 August, playing in the first half and helping Arsenal to a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man City 0–3 Arsenal – Match report |url=https://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/man-city-v-arsenal-match-report |first=Chris |last=Harris |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=10 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014}}</ref> On 16 August, he made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], assisting [[Laurent Koscielny]]'s equaliser in a 2–1 home win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 2–1 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718788 |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=16 August 2014}}</ref> He then scored his first goal for Arsenal on 27 August, slotting the ball past [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] goalkeeper [[Tolga Zengin]] in stoppage time of the first half to secure a 1–0 aggregate victory and a spot in the group stage of the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|2014–15 Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 1–0 Besiktas |author=McNulty, Phil |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2014}}</ref> Following the game, Wenger was full of praise for Sánchez, with the Arsenal manager saying, "He had a good game, not only on the technical side but on the fighting side. He was mobile, dangerous and has shown as well he has great fighting spirit, qualities that will be very important in the Premier League."<ref name="profile" /> His first league goal came four days later, netting the opening goal in a 1–1 draw away to newly promoted [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Leicester 1–1 Arsenal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28917059 |first=Mike |last=Whalley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref> He then scored his second league goal in as many games against [[2013–14 Premier League|previous season]] champions Manchester City, demonstrating perfect technique to sidefoot a volley high past goalkeeper [[Joe Hart]] in a 2–2 draw at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 2–2 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090530 |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 September 2014 |accessdate=13 September 2014}}</ref>
Sánchez scored his fourth goal for Arsenal, from a free-kick, as ''the Gunners'' fell to 2–1 defeat to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 1–2 Southampton – Match Report |url=https://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/arsenal-v-southampton-match-report |first=Rob |last=Kelly |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=23 September 2014 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal in the Champions League proper for ''the Gunners'' on 1 October, scoring Arsenal's third goal of their 4–1 home win over [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]] and also provided assists for two goals by [[Danny Welbeck]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Champions League: Danny Welbeck nets hat-trick as Arsenal ease past Galatasaray |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/325335/report |publisher=Sky Sports |date=1 October 2014 |accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref> On 18 October, he scored the opening goal and later assisted a late Welbeck equaliser in a 2–2 draw against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] at home. The following league fixture saw him scoring a brace against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] after capitalising on errors made by defender [[Wes Brown]] and former Arsenal goalkeeper [[Vito Mannone]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Winton |first=Richard |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29671744 |title=Sunderland 0–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 October 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> On 1 November, Sánchez again scored a brace, this time against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in a 3–0 victory. With that brace, he scored his ninth and tenth goals of the season across all competitions.<ref name="bbc.com">{{cite news |last=Gheerbrant |first=James |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29768015 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref><ref name="bbc.com"/> He and [[Yaya Sanogo]] scored against Borussia Dortmund in 2–0 win as Arsenal qualified for the knockout stages of the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |last=Chowdhury |first=Saj |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29363037 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Borussia Dortmund |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> On 3 December, he scored the winner against Southampton in the 89th minute to give ''the Gunners'' a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30204434 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> [[File:Alexis Sanchez parade.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Sánchez during [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s [[2015 FA Cup Final|FA Cup victory]] parade in 2015]] Sánchez scored the first goal in Arsenal's 2–1 home win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 26 December and assisted the second goal for [[Tomáš Rosický]]; earlier in the same match, Sánchez had a penalty saved by goalkeeper [[Robert Green]] after being brought down by [[Armand Traoré]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lewis |first1=Aimee |title=Arsenal 2–1 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30544277 |accessdate=26 December 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2014}}</ref> On 4 January 2015, Sánchez scored and assisted his first ever [[FA Cup]] goals as Arsenal knocked out Hull City, the [[2014 FA Cup Final|previous season's runners-up]] in the third round. Sánchez assisted [[Per Mertesacker]] and scored in the 82nd minute, being substituted two minutes later by [[Chuba Akpom]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Jurejko |first=Jonathan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30614334 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Hull City |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> In Arsenal's next Premier League match, against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], Sánchez was involved in all the three goals as Arsenal beat ''the Potters'' 3–0 at the Emirates. He first assisted Laurent Koscielny and then scored two goals of his own. His performance was praised by [[Thierry Henry]], who called him, "Arsenal's best signing of the last six years."<ref>{{cite news |last=Whaling |first=James |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/alexis-sanchez-arsenals-best-signing-4976056 |title=Alexis Sanchez is Arsenal's best signing in the last six years, says Gunners legend Thierry Henry |newspaper=Daily Mirror |date=14 January 2015 |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref>
On 4 March, Sánchez ended a run of eight games without a goal by scoring Arsenal's second goal as they beat QPR 2–1 at [[Loftus Road]].<ref>{{cite news |author=Farmery, Tom |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/he-never-gives-up--arsenal-manager-arsene-wenger-praises-alexis-sanchez-after-ending-barren-spell-10086913.html |title='He never gives up' – Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger praises Alexis Sanchez after ending barren spell |work=London Evening Standard |date=5 March 2015 |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Barlow |first=Matt |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2979784/QPR-1-2-Arsenal-Olivier-Giroud-Alexis-Sanchez-strike-R-s.html |title=QPR 1–2 Arsenal: Olivier Giroud and Alexis Sanchez strike to down R's |newspaper=Daily Mail |accessdate=4 April 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref> Sánchez scored Arsenal's third goal on 4 April as they beat [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] 4–1 at the Emirates and was chosen as the man of the match.<ref>{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32097847 |title=Arsenal 4–1 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref>
On 18 April, Sánchez scored both of Arsenal's goals in the [[FA Cup semi-finals|FA Cup semi-final]] as Arsenal defeated [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] 2–1 after extra time.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32261616 |title=Holders Arsenal reached a record 19th FA Cup final after two goals from Alexis Sanchez sealed victory over Reading in extra-time |date=18 April 2015 |accessdate=18 April 2015}}</ref> Eight days later, he was the only Arsenal player named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name=PFATOTY1415>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32472834 |title=Chelsea's Eden Hazard named PFA Player of the Year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=7 May 2018}}</ref> On 4 May, Sánchez scored another brace, this time against Hull City in a 3–1 away win.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32476691 |title=Hull City 1 – Arsenal 3 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 29 May, he was voted as the 2015 [[PFA Fans' Player of the Year]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Alexis Sanchez Crowned PFA Fans' Player of the Year |url=http://www.90min.com/posts/2202076-alexis-sanchez-crowned-pfa-fans-player-of-the-year |accessdate=18 July 2015}}</ref>
Sánchez reached his 25th goal of the season in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]] on 30 May with the second goal in a 4–0 defeat of [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], a long-range strike. Sánchez, who also headed an assist for [[Theo Walcott]]'s opening goal, became the first Chilean to score in an FA Cup final since [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]'s [[George Robledo]] [[1952 FA Cup Final|in 1952]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/32563518 |title=FA Cup final – FT: Arsenal 4–0 Villa |date=30 May 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He capped off his first season by winning Arsenal's Player of the Year award.<ref name=ArsenalAward>{{cite web |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20150610/player-of-the-season-the-winner-is.html |title=Player of the season and the winner is.. |publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref>
==== 2015–16 season ==== [[File:Alexis Sanchez Arsenal Vs Burnley (24736448805) (cropped).jpg|thumb|180px|Sánchez playing for Arsenal in 2016]] Sánchez made his first appearance of the [[2015–16 Arsenal F.C. season|2015–16 season]] as a substitute in Arsenal's 2–0 loss to [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on the opening day of the [[2015–16 Premier League]]. The following week, on his first start of the season, Sánchez had a header deflected into the Crystal Palace net by [[Damien Delaney]] to give Arsenal a 2–1 win at [[Selhurst Park]]. The goal, however, was later credited as an own goal by the Palace defender.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33839766 |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Arsenal |date=16 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 26 September 2015, Sánchez ended a run of ten Premier League matches without a goal by scoring his first hat-trick for Arsenal in a 5–2 win at Leicester. This made him the first player to score hat-tricks in each of the Premier League, Serie A and La Liga.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34299596 |title=Leicester 2–5 Arsenal |date=26 September 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Sánchez then scored his first [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal of the season a few days later, in a 3–2 loss to [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]], latching onto a Theo Walcott cross to head beyond Olympiacos goalkeeper [[Roberto Jiménez Gago|Roberto]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/football-live-blogs/11899111/Arsenal-vs-Olympiakos-Champions-League-live.html |title=Arsenal vs Olympiacos Champions League |website=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> The following league match, the last match before the international break, Sánchez scored for the third match in a row, scoring a brace in the first 20 minutes as Arsenal defeated [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] 3–0 at the Emirates Stadium and moved up to second place in the league.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34372498 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Man Utd |publisher=BBC |accessdate=5 October 2015}}</ref> After the international break, Sánchez carried on his fine goalscoring form by netting against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] at [[Vicarage Road]], through a [[Mesut Özil]] assist, in a 3–0 Arsenal win, keeping Arsenal in second-place and grabbing his sixth goal in three Premier League matches for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3277314/Watford-0-3-Arsenal-Alexis-Sanchez-continues-scoring-streak-Gunners-pace-leaders.html |title=Watford 0 – Arsenal 3 |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34493696 |title=Watford 0–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
Following a brief period on the sidelines due to injury, Sánchez returned to full first-team action on 30 January 2016 in the FA Cup fourth round tie against Burnley, scoring Arsenal's second goal of the game following a low cross from [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35389250 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Sánchez netted his first Premier League goal since October with a goal in the [[North London derby]] against rivals [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], eqaulising for Arsenal in the 76th minute and keeping ''the Gunners''' title challenge alive.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35659805 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 2 – 2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> During April 2016, Sánchez scored in four consecutive league matches, with goals against Watford, West Ham, Crystal Palace, and a brace against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/sport/soccer/english-premier-league-alexis-sanchez-double-lifts-arsenal-into-third-place-20160421-gocdq2 |title=English Premier League: Alexis Sanchez double lifts Arsenal into third place |date=22 April 2016 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald}}</ref>
==== 2016–17 season ==== [[File:Arsenal Vs Burnley (24736494805).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Sánchez (pictured [[Goal celebration|celebrating a goal]] against Burnley wearing number 17) was given the number 7 jersey for the 2016–17 season]] When launching their new kit for the [[2016–17 Arsenal F.C. season|2016–17 season]], Arsenal announced that Sánchez will change squad number from 17 to 7, which was vacated by the departing [[Tomáš Rosický]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160520/arsenal-and-puma-reveal-new-home-kit |title=Arsenal and PUMA launch new home kit |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=25 May 2016 |accessdate=25 May 2016}}</ref> Sánchez scored his first goal of Arsenal's campaign and grabbed his first assist in Arsenal's 3–1 away win over Watford.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37139688 |title=Arsenal 3–1 Watford |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Sánchez scored his first Champions League goal of the campaign in a 1–1 draw with [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] on 13 September 2016, latching onto [[Alex Iwobi]]'s rebounded shot, to secure Arsenal a point in the [[Paris|French capital]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37331259 |title=PSG 1–1 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3787688/PSG-1-1-Arsenal-Alexis-Sanchez-rescues-Champions-League-point-Gunners.html |title=PSG 1–1 Arsenal |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref> Sánchez kept up his spectacular run of form throughout September by netting against Hull, then scoring assisting in a 3–0 victory over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37326798 |title=Hull City 1 – 4 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37393486 |title=Arsenal 3–0 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He scored a brace in a 1–4 win at Sunderland's [[Stadium of Light]], bringing his total to 50 goals in 106 appearances across all competitions for Arsenal. <ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/sunderland-1-4-arsenal-alexis-8739321 |title=Sunderland 1–4 Arsenal: Alexis Sanchez stars |newspaper=Daily Mirror}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metro.co.uk/2016/10/29/arsenal-star-alexis-sanchez-reaches-50-goals-in-all-competitions-for-the-gunners-6222356/ |title=Alexis Sanchez reaches 50 goals in all competitions for the Gunners |website=Metro |location=London}}</ref> He also scored a hatrick and provided an assist in a [[Man-of-the-match|man of the match]] display in a 5–1 win at West Ham on 3 December.<ref>{{cite web |last=Jennings |first=Patrick |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38113792 |title=West Ham United 1–5 Arsenal |work=BBC Sport |date=3 December 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> On 22 January 2017, Sánchez scored his first penalty for the club (having missed his previous two) against Burnley in an eventual 2–1 win, which put Arsenal into second place in the Premier League table.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38626832 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Burnley |date=11 October 2017 |accessdate=11 October 2017 |website=Bbc.co.uk}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-vs-burnley-live-stream-what-time-does-it-start-tv-channel-watch-latest-score-a7539976.html |title=As it happened: Arsenal vs Burnley |date=22 January 2017 |website=Independent.co.uk |accessdate=11 October 2017}}</ref> Sánchez scored his first goal in [[2016–17 FA Cup|the season's FA Cup]], in a 5–0 quarter-final win over [[Lincoln City F.C.|Lincoln City]], taking his tally to 21 goals for the season in all competitions.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39162720 |title=Arsenal 5–0 Lincoln City |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Sánchez scored the winning goal in Arsenal's 2–1 win over Manchester City, to send Arsenal through to their third FA Cup final, in four years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://m.bbc.com/sport/football/39612222 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref name=BBC>{{cite news |url=http://m.bbc.com/sport/live/football/38347533 |title=FA Cup: AET: Arsenal 2–1 Man City-Sanchez hits winner |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 13 April, Sánchez was included in the six player shortlist for the [[PFA Player of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39604653 |title=Chelsea 4–2 Tottenham |date=22 April 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He also, in May 2017, won Arsenal's Player of the Season award.<ref name=ArsenalAward* /> Sánchez finished off the season by claiming the man-of-the-match award and scoring Arsenal's opening goal in an eventual 2–1 win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2017 FA Cup Final|FA Cup Final]], ensuring that Arsenal secured a record 13th FA Cup and that manager [[Arsène Wenger]] won a record 7th FA Cup in the process.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39984089 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/may/27/arsenal-v-chelsea-2017-fa-cup-final-live |title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea: 2017 FA Cup Final as it happened |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref> He finished as the club's top goalscorer with 24 Premier League goals, and 30 goals in all competitions, becoming the first player since [[Robin van Persie]] in [[2011-12 Arsenal F.C. season|2011–12]] to score more than 20 goals in the league.
==== 2017–18 season ==== Sánchez returned from the [[2017 Confederations Cup]] with an injury, and therefore had to miss the team's victory over Chelsea in the [[2017 FA Community Shield]] and the team's opening 4–3 win over Leicester City. Sánchez' first start of the season came in the 4–0 away defeat to Liverpool.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40990427 |title=Liverpool 4–0 Arsenal |date=27 August 2017 |accessdate=11 October 2017 |website=Bbc.co.uk}}</ref> But throughout the transfer window, there was increasing speculation about his future, with a huge amount of reports stating his desire to leave, in order to play in the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/alexis-sanchez-arsenal-transfer-news-leave-champions-league-manchester-city-a7843256.html |title=Alexis Sanchez admits he wants to leave Arsenal and play in the Champions League next season |work=The Independent |date=15 July 2017 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> A deadline day move to Manchester City was unsuccessful as Arsenal's deal for Sánchez's replacement [[Thomas Lemar]] was rejected.<ref>{{cite web |last=Ornstein |first=David |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41084876 |title=Alexis Sanchez: Manchester City accept defeat in Arsenal striker pursuit |work=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2017 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the season in Arsenal's 3–1 [[UEFA Europa League]] victory over German side [[1. FC Köln|Köln]], in which he picked the ball up outside the penalty area and curled a shot past goalkeeper [[Timo Horn]], to score Arsenal's second goal of the evening.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41227374 |title=Arsenal 3–1 FC Cologne |date=14 September 2017 |accessdate=11 October 2017 |website=Bbc.co.uk}}</ref> Sánchez also played in Arsenal's 1–0 win over [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] in the League Cup, in which Sánchez provided his first assist of the season, by delivering a cross-field pass which Theo Walcott subsequently put past Doncaster goalkeeper, [[Ian Lawlor]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249728 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Doncaster Rovers |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=11 October 2017 |website=Bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
Sánchez scored his first Premier League goal of the season in a 5–2 win over Everton and he also provided an assist for [[Mesut Özil]] to put Arsenal ahead.<ref>{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41625741 |title=Everton 2–5 Arsenal |work=BBC Sport |date=22 October 2017 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> Sánchez followed up this by scoring the second in Arsenal's 2–0 win against Tottenham on 18 November,<ref>{{cite web |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41951916 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Tottenham Hotspur |work=BBC Sport |date=18 November 2017 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> and a week later scoring a decisive and controversial injury-time penalty in a 1–0 win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42042017 |title=Burnley 0–1 Arsenal |date=26 November 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Sánchez continued his fine goalscoring form by scoring Arsenal's third goal in a 5–0 rout of [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], his third goal in consecutive games.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42075942 |title=Arsenal 5–0 Huddersfield Town |date=29 November 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He also scored with a diving header against Liverpool on 22 December in a thrilling 3–3 draw.<ref>{{cite web |last=Rose |first=Gary |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42362392 |title=Arsenal 3–3 Liverpool |work=BBC Sport |date=22 December 2017 |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref> He scored his last two goals for Arsenal in a 3–2 away win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 28 December.<ref>{{cite web |last=Rose |first=Gary |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42410931 |title=Crystal Palace 2–3 Arsenal |work=BBC Sport |date= |accessdate=24 September 2018}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== On 22 January 2018, it was announced that Sánchez had completed a transfer to Manchester United, in a swap deal that saw [[Henrikh Mkhitaryan]] move the opposite way. Sánchez was given the number 7 shirt.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2018/Jan/official-announcement-of-Alexis-Sanchez-signing-for-Manchester-United.aspx |title=Alexis signs for Manchester United |date=22 January 2018 |accessdate=22 January 2018 |publisher=Manchester United}}</ref> He made his debut for the club in a 4–0 victory against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] in the fourth round of the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42742088 |title=Yeovil Town 0–4 Manchester United |date=26 January 2018 |accessdate=27 January 2018 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> He became the first Chilean to play a competitive match for United.<ref>{{cite news |last=Marshall |first=Adam |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2018/Jan/united-could-have-had-three-other-chilean-first-team-players-in-past.aspx |title=Why United Have Had to Wait for a Chilean |date=24 January 2018 |accessdate=27 January 2018 |publisher=Manchester United}}</ref> He scored his first United goal on 3 February 2018 in a 2–0 home win against Huddersfield Town, after netting in the rebound from his penalty that had been saved by [[Jonas Lössl]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Smyth |first=Rob |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/feb/03/manchester-united-v-huddersfield-leicester-v-swansea-and-more-live |title=Manchester United v Huddersfield, Leicester v Swansea and more – live! |work=The Guardian |date=3 February 2018 |accessdate=3 February 2018}}</ref>
He scored his first goal of the [[2018–19 Manchester United F.C. season|2018–19 season]] on 6 October, scoring a 90th minute winning goal to complete a 3–2 comeback win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], after the club initially went 0–2 down in the first ten minutes.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45689298 |title=Manchester United 3–2 Newcastle United: Fightback relieves pressure on Mourinho |date=2018-10-06 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-10-08 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
==International career== {{see also|List of international goals scored by Alexis Sánchez}} [[File:Alexis Sanchez - Spain vs. Chile, 10th September 2013 (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|145px|Sánchez playing for Chile in 2013]]
Sánchez made his international debut for the [[Chile national football team|Chile national team]] against [[New Zealand national football team|New Zealand]] on 27 April 2006.<ref name=fifa>{{cite news |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/alexis-sanchez_prs146068/person.shtml |title=Alexis Sanchez |work=Eurosport}}</ref> He was called up by the coach [[José Sulantay]] to represent the [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chilean under-20 team]] at the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] held in Canada, where they finished third.<ref name=fifa/><ref name=U20WorldCup>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/alexis-sanchez-10-things-you-3841838 |title=Alexis Sanchez: 10 Things |newspaper=Daily Mirror}}</ref>
After his participation in the youth championship, Sánchez scored his first senior international goal in a 2–1 loss against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] on 7 September 2007. He scored three times during ''La Roja's'' successful [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2010 FIFA World Cup qualification campaign]] and appeared on every match during the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|tournament finals]].<ref name=fifa/> He then participated in the [[2011 Copa América]], scoring once in a 1–1 group stage draw with [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]],<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gonzalez |first1=Roger |title=Uruguay 1–1 Chile: Alexis Sanchez denies La Celeste first victory in the 2011 Copa America |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/uruguay-vs-chile/1049146/report |accessdate=19 April 2015 |publisher=Goal.com |date=9 July 2011}}</ref> as Chile reached the quarter-finals. On 15 November 2013, Sánchez scored both goals as Chile beat [[England national football team|England]] 2–0 at Wembley, repeating the achievement of national team legend [[Marcelo Salas]] in 1998.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ilovechile.cl/2013/11/16/alexis-snchez-repeats-history-wembley/96158 |title=Alexis Sánchez Repeats History at Wembley |date=16 November 2013 |work=I Love Chile |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131128140648/http://www.ilovechile.cl/2013/11/16/alexis-snchez-repeats-history-wembley/96158 |archivedate=28 November 2013}}</ref>
===2014 World Cup=== [[File:Brazil vs. Chile in Mineirão 09.jpg|thumb|left|170px|Sánchez playing against [[David Luiz]] of [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].]] Sánchez scored four times in Chile's [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|qualification campaign]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/southamerica/statistics/topscorers.html |title=Statistics – America |accessdate=23 November 2013 |publisher=FIFA}}</ref>
On 13 June 2014, Sánchez scored Chile's opening goal of the 2014 World Cup, and provided an assist, in a 3–1 defeat of [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] in [[Cuiabá]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285050 |title=Chile 3–1 Australia |accessdate=14 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> During the [[2014 FIFA World Cup round of 16|round of 16]], Sánchez scored the equalising goal in a 1–1 draw against the hosts [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]]. However, he was one of three Chileans to fail to convert their kicks in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]], having his shot saved by [[Júlio César (football goalkeeper, born 1979)|Júlio César]] as Brazil prevailed 3–2.<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile 1–1 Brazil |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27952759 |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 June 2014 |accessdate=28 June 2014}}</ref>
===2015 Copa América=== Sánchez was a member of Chile's squad as they hosted the [[2015 Copa América]]. He assisted [[Eduardo Vargas]] in Chile's 2–0 win over [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] in the tournament opener,<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile 2–0 Ecuador |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33081583 |accessdate=12 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2015}}</ref> then scored a header in their final [[2015 Copa América Group A|group]] game, a 5–0 win against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]] which sent Chile through as group winners – he and [[Arturo Vidal]] were rested by being substituted at half time.<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile 5–0 Bolivia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085629 |accessdate=20 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 June 2015}}</ref>
Sánchez was named [[man of the match]] in Chile's ill-tempered and highly controversial quarter-final win over defending champions Uruguay.<ref>{{cite news |title=Copa America MasterCard Man of the Match winners |url=http://www.ca2015.com/en/gallery/copa-america-mastercard-man-of-the-match-winners/1al11h6ke941e1uf62vujfp6ge/slide/7 |accessdate=4 July 2015 |work=CA2015 |date=14 August 2015}}</ref> In the semi-final against [[Peru national football team|Peru]], he created the opening goal for Eduardo Vargas as Chile progressed to the final with a 2–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile 2–1 Peru |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33327288 |accessdate=7 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2015}}</ref> On 4 July, Sánchez converted the winning kick in the [[2015 Copa América Final|final]] as Chile defeated [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] to win their first major title, executing it in the [[Panenka (penalty kick)|Panenka style]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33085977 |title=Chile 0–0 Argentina |date=5 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
===2018 FIFA World Cup Qualification=== In Chile's first match of [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 World Cup qualification]] on 9 October 2015, Sánchez scored in a 2–0 win over Brazil, Chile's first victory against the opponents since 2000.<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile 2–0 Brazil: Vargas & Alexis consign Selecao to defeat |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/chile-vs-brazil/2116062/report |accessdate=14 October 2015 |publisher=Goal.com |date=9 October 2015}}</ref> Four days later, he scored twice in a 4–3 win at [[Chile–Peru football rivalry|rivals]] Peru.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kalinic |first1=Dejan |title=Peru 3–4 Chile: Sanchez stars in solid win |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/peru-vs-chile/2116069/report |accessdate=14 October 2015 |date=14 October 2015}}</ref>
===Copa América Centenario=== In June 2016, Sánchez was part of the Chile squad that defended their Copa América title at the [[Copa América Centenario]] in the United States. On 14 June, needing a draw to progress to the knockout rounds, Chile fell 1–0 behind to [[Panama national football team|Panama]] before both Sánchez and Eduardo Vargas scored twice in a 4–2 win in [[Philadelphia]] to qualify for the tournament quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Sharma |first1=Rik |title=Chile 4–2 Panama: Alexis Sanchez shines as Chilean strikeforce finally fires to deliver Copa America Centenario last eight place |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3642295/Chile-4-2-Panama-Alexis-Sanchez-shines-Chilean-strikeforce-finally-fires-deliver-Copa-America-Centenario-eight-place.html |accessdate=28 June 2016 |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=15 June 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref>
Four days later, he scored one goal and registered two assists at [[Levi's Stadium]] in a 7–0 rout of [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]], who were previously on a 22-game unbeaten streak.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tucker |first1=Duncan |title=Chile humiliate Mexico in 7–0 thrashing to advance to Copa América semi-final |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/19/chile-humiliate-mexico-7-0-quarter-final |accessdate=28 June 2016 |work=The Guardian |date=18 June 2016}}</ref> In Chile's 2–0 semi-final victory over [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]], he became only the second Chilean – after [[Claudio Bravo]] – to reach [[100 caps]]. Sánchez was involved in Chile's second goal when his shot rebounded off the inside of the post and across the goal, presenting a tap-in for [[José Pedro Fuenzalida]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Edwards |first1=Daniel |title=Alexis Sanchez reaches 100 caps for Chile |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/586/copa-america/2016/06/23/24947822/alexis-sanchez-reaches-100-caps-for-chile |accessdate=28 June 2016 |publisher=Goal.com |date=23 June 2016}}</ref>
In a repeat of the previous Copa América final, [[Copa América Centenario Final|Chile faced Argentina]]. Both teams had a player sent-off before half-time, and after a 0–0 draw, Chile were victorious via penalty kicks (4–2) to retain their title. Sánchez was awarded the Golden Ball as the tournament's best player.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dutton |first1=Tom |title=Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez named Copa America player of the tournament as Chile defend title |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/arsenals-alexis-sanchez-named-copa-america-player-of-the-tournament-as-chile-defend-title-a3281301.html |accessdate=28 June 2016 |work=London Evening Standard |date=26 June 2016}}</ref>
===2017 FIFA Confederations Cup=== In Chile's opening match of the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]] on 18 June, Sánchez, who had been recovering from an ankle injury, came off the bench to set up Arturo Vidal's opening goal in an eventual 2–0 win over [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/fifa-confederations-cup/2017/arturo-vidal-and-eduardo-vargas-score-as-chile-overcome-cameroon-despite-video-referee-mayhem_sto6222741/story.shtml |title=Arturo Vidal and Eduardo Vargas score as Chile overcome Cameroon despite video referee mayhem |publisher=Eurosport |author1=Badshah, Nadeem |date=18 June 2017 |accessdate=3 August 2017}}</ref> On 22 June 2017, Sánchez became Chile's out-right all-time goalscorer when he scored the opening goal in an eventual 1–1 draw against reigning World Cup champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in his team's second group match of the tournament, overtaking Marcelo Salas with his 38th international goal in 112 appearances, and also equalling Claudio Bravo as his nation's joint top appearance holder in the process.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/chile/story/3147182/alexis-sanchez-becomes-chiles-all-time-top-scorer-with-38th-goal |title=Alexis Sanchez becomes Chile's all-time top scorer with 38th goal |publisher=ESPN FC |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=24 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-match/60/post/3144632/germany-second-string-earn-draw-against-chile-that-bodes-well-for-world-cup-defence-in-2018 |title=Germany's second string earn draw vs. Chile that bodes well for World Cup |publisher=ESPN FC |author1=Ogden, Mark |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=24 June 2017}}</ref> Chile defeated [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] on penalties in the semi-final, before losing 0–1 in the final against [[Germany national football team|Germany]], with Sánchez coming close to an equaliser with his injury time free kick saved by German goalkeeper [[Marc-André ter Stegen]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/jul/02/chile-v-germany-confederations-cup-final-live |title=Chile 0–1 Germany: Confederations Cup final – as it happened |last=Harris |first=Daniel |date=2017-07-02 |work=The Guardian|access-date=2018-09-29 |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

hard-working player with an eye for goal, who is known in particular for his energy, skill and work-rate on the pitch.<ref name=stelle>{{cite web |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Rubriche/CalcioEstero/Primo_Piano/2007/03_Marzo/21/cileni.shtml |title=Le nuove stelle arrivano dal Cile |publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport |language=Italian |last1=Carli ==Personal life== Sánchez had a statue erected in his honour within his native town of Tocopilla in March 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/news/picture-see-remarkable-alexis-sanchez-12796003 |title=Picture: See the remarkable Alexis Sanchez statue |website=Football.London.}}</ref>
In October 2015, Sánchez was named as a brand ambassador for [[Huawei]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.primetimesport.com/playersmarketing/?p=2854 |title=Alexis follows James steps in South America |work=Prime Time Sport}}</ref> He appeared in an advert to the tune of [[Blondie (band)|Blondie]]'s "[[One Way or Another]]" for Huawei which made its debut in November 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3325613/Alexis-Sanchez-shows-dance-moves-Arsenal-star-plays-lead-role-Chilean-Huawei-smartphone-advert.html |title=Alexis Sanchez shows off dance moves |newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref>
In February 2017, Sánchez signed a sponsorship deal with [[Pepsi]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/764956/Arsenal-Alexis-Sanchez-contract-talks |title=Arsenal ace Alexis Sanchez signs lucrative deal |website=Daily Express}}</ref>
