Championship]]}} {{Medal|1st|[[2006 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2006 Poland]]|}} | club-update = 16:50, 24 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 15 November 2016 }} '''Juan Manuel Mata García''' ({{IPA-es|xwam ˈmata}}; born 28 April 1988) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]]. He mostly plays as a central attacking midfielder, but he can also play on the [[Midfielder#Winger|wing]].
A graduate of [[La Fábrica|Real Madrid's youth academy]], Mata played for [[Real Madrid Castilla]] in 2006–07, before joining [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in the summer of 2007. He became an integral part of the club's midfield, making 174 appearances over the course of four seasons.<ref name="guillembalague1">{{cite web|url=http://www.guillembalague.com/rumores_desp.php?id=293&titulo=Liverpool,%20City%20and%20Manchester%20United%20show%20interest%20in%20Mata |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426081306/http://www.guillembalague.com/rumores_desp.php?id=293&titulo=Liverpool%2C%20City%20and%20Manchester%20United%20show%20interest%20in%20Mata |archivedate=26 April 2012 |title=Liverpool, City and Manchester United show interest in Mata |publisher=Guillem Balague's website |date=9 May 2011 |accessdate=11 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In August 2011, Mata signed for English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] of the Premier League for a fee believed to be in the region of €28 million, and in his debut season was part of the team that won the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] and the [[2011–12 FA Cup|FA Cup]]. The following year, Chelsea won the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]], making Mata and teammate [[Fernando Torres]] the first players to hold the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]], [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]], and the [[UEFA European Championship|European Championships]] simultaneously. After falling out of favour at Chelsea under [[José Mourinho]], Mata was sold to Manchester United in January 2014, for a fee of £37.1 million.
Mata is a Spanish international, having represented Spain at [[Spain national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[Spain national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Spain national under-20 football team|under-20]], [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21]], [[Spain national under-23 football team|Olympic]] and senior levels. He played for the under-20 side in the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. In June 2009, Mata played at the [[2009 FIFA Confederations Cup]], his first senior tournament. On 9 September 2009, Mata scored his first goal for the senior team, against [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]], securing the nation a place at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa, and was part of Spain's World Cup-winning squad. In 2011, he went back to playing in the under-21 side, helping Spain win the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]] in Denmark. He won the [[UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship#Under-21 Golden Player|Golden Player]] award and was part of the Team of the Tournament. Mata returned to the senior squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and, after coming on as a substitute, scored Spain's fourth goal in the [[UEFA Euro 2012 final|final]] as Spain defeated [[Italy national football team|Italy]] 4–0 to retain their title as champions of Europe.
==Early life== Mata was born in the town of [[Burgos]], [[Province of Burgos|Burgos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rfef.es/index.jsp?nodo=39&ID=3995|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209231402/http://www.rfef.es/index.jsp?nodo=39&ID=3995|archivedate=9 December 2013|title=La culminación del sueño de seis Campeones de Europa|trans-title=The culmination of a dream for six champions of Europe|publisher=rfef.es|date=26 August 2011}}</ref> He inherited his name from his father, Juan Manuel Mata Rodríguez, who was also a footballer, playing as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for nearby [[Burgos CF (I)|Burgos CF]] in the 1980s and early 1990s. Mata was raised in his father's home town of [[Oviedo]], [[Asturias]]. His father later acted as Mata's agent, becoming [[FIFA]]-registered in the process.<ref>[http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2009/08/05/1423346/mata-could-buy-out-valencia-contract-to-complete-barcelona Mata could buy out Valencia contract to complete Barcelona move]. goal.com (5 August 2009)</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2009/07/03/1361140/barcelona-to-move-for-valencias-juan-mata-report|title=Barcelona To Move For Valencia's Juan Mata – Report|first=Lucas|last=Brown|publisher=goal.com|date=3 July 2009|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> In his spare time, Mata enjoys [[table-tennis]], a sport he played as a child.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juanmanuelmata.com/matabio.htm|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090301052037/http://juanmanuelmata.com/matabio.htm|archivedate=1 March 2009|title=Juan Manuel Mata's biography|publisher=Juan Mata|language=Spanish|accessdate=7 February 2008}}</ref> Upon his move to Chelsea, he said he also enjoys sightseeing around [[London]]. He gained a nickname at Chelsea – "Johnny Kills" – the literal translation of his name from Spanish into English.<ref>Rice, Simon. (6 December 2011) [https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/mr-valencia-sad-its-him-or-his-old-mate-mata-going-out-6272746.html Mr Valencia said it's him or his old mate Mata going out – European – Football]. The Independent.</ref>
==Club career==
===Early career=== Mata started his football career at [[Real Oviedo]], where his father spent most of his career. He stayed there for three years before joining Real Madrid's youth academy, [[La Fábrica]], at age 15. After appearing for their ''Cadete A'' team, he swiftly progressed through the junior teams, ''Juvenil C'' and finally [[Real Madrid C.F. (youth)|''Juvenil A'']]. In his last campaign (2005–06), he scored two goals in the league and three more in the ''[[2005–06 División de Honor Juvenil de Fútbol#Final|Copa de Campeones]]'', including the winner in the final against [[Real Valladolid]], adding another three in the Spanish [[2006 Copa del Rey Juvenil|''Juvenil'' Cup]].
Switching to [[Real Madrid Castilla]] in [[2006–07 Segunda División|2006–07]], Mata was given the number 34 shirt in the first team, while wearing number 28 in Castilla. In spite of Castilla's final [[Segunda División]] relegation, he finished the season as the side's second best scorer at ten, behind [[Forward (association football)|striker]] [[Álvaro Negredo]], who registered 18.
===Valencia=== [[File:Juan Manuel Mata García.jpg|thumb|left|Mata at [[Ciudad Deportiva de Paterna|Paterna]] in 2009]] Mata had a release clause at Real Madrid during his last season at the club, and eventually agreed to sign for fellow [[La Liga]] side [[Valencia CF]] in March 2007, with the contract starting on 30 June 2007.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/edicion/marca/futbol/1a_division/valencia/es/desarrollo/750885.html|title=El Valencia le quita al Real Madrid al prometedor y cotizado Mata|trans-title=Valencia ''steals'' promising, highly rated Mata from Real Madrid|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=Spanish|date=17 March 2007|accessdate=7 February 2008}}</ref>
[[File:Juan Mata taronja.jpg|thumb|upright|Juan Mata playing for Valencia in 2010]] Benefitting from constant injuries to [[Vicente Rodríguez|Vicente]] and the ostracism to which then-manager [[Ronald Koeman]] condemned [[Miguel Ángel Angulo]], Mata gradually carved a niche in Valencia's first eleven. On 20 March 2008, he scored twice in the [[Copa del Rey]] [[2007–08 Copa del Rey|semi-final match]] against [[FC Barcelona]] to help Valencia reach [[2008 Copa del Rey Final|the final]] against [[Getafe CF]]<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=674619.html Mata seizes final chance for Valencia]; UEFA, 20 March 2008</ref> where, on 16 April, he netted the opener in a 3–1 win.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=685087.html Morientes glad as Valencia get relief]; UEFA, 16 April 2008</ref> During that first season, he was voted the team's ''Best Young Player'' by fans and players alike.
In the [[2008 Supercopa de España|2008]] [[Supercopa de España|Spanish SuperCup]], Mata scored against his former club Real Madrid in a 3–2 first leg win, but Valencia lost 5–6 on aggregate after a 2–4 away loss in the second game. He started [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09]] well, scoring in the opener against [[RCD Mallorca]] in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/253096/gamecast.html|title=Valencia 3–0 Mallorca|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=30 August 2008|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> He also netted the only goal of the game against [[CA Osasuna]], latching on to a long ball from [[David Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/252834/gamecast.html|title=Valencia 1–0 Osasuna|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=21 September 2008|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref>
On 25 September 2008, Mata proved to be growing in efficiency, as he set up two of his teammate's goals in a 2–0 away win over [[Málaga CF]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/252768/gamecast.html|title=Málaga 0–2 Valencia|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=25 September 2008|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> Three days later, he put in a superb performance against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]], scoring one and creating the other three, in a 4–2 home victory.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=754244.html Villa goals ensure Valencia victory]; UEFA, 28 September 2008</ref>
Towards the end of the campaign, Mata managed to score two very important late goals for Valencia: the first, the 3–2 winner at [[Sporting de Gijón]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/252826/gamecast.html|title=Sporting Gijon 4–3 Valencia|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=12 April 2009|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> and the second a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] against [[Sevilla FC]] at home, to put Valencia 2–1 up (specialist Villa had already been replaced due to injury) in an eventual 3–1 success.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/253093/gamecast.html|title=Valencia 3–1 Sevilla FC|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=19 April 2009|accessdate=24 May 2011}}</ref> He achieved impressive stats during the season, finishing with 11 successful strikes and 13 [[Assist (football)|assists]], behind just Barcelona's [[Xavi]] as the league's best.
In the following two seasons, Mata was an everpresent offensive figure for Valencia, scoring 17 goals in 68 games combined, with the club achieving back-to-back third-league places. On 10 April 2011, he netted two in a 5–0 home win against [[Valencian Community|Valencian]] neighbours [[Villarreal CF]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rthk.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20110411&56&747493|title=Valencia put five past Villarreal|publisher=RTHK|date=10 April 2011|accessdate=2 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714161043/http://rthk.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20110411&56&747493|archivedate=14 July 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/302117/gamecast.html|title=Valencia 5–0 Villarreal|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=10 April 2011|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> On 9 May, England-based Spanish journalist [[Guillem Balagué]] reported interest from several [[Premier League]] clubs.<ref name="guillembalague1"/>
===Chelsea=== On 21 August 2011, Valencia announced they had agreed a £23.5 million fee for the transfer of Mata to [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], subject to a medical.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.valenciacf.com/ver/16298/comunicado-oficial.html|title=Official announcement|publisher=Valencia C.F|date=21 August 2011|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/14600979|publisher=BBC Sport|title=Valencia agree to sell Juan Mata to Chelsea|date=21 August 2011|accessdate=21 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2427778 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130804060834/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2427778 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=4 August 2013 |title=Mata Deal Agreed |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=22 August 2011 |accessdate=2 July 2014 }}</ref> On 24 August 2011, Mata signed a five-year deal with Chelsea. He revealed that compatriot [[Fernando Torres]] helped persuade him to move to [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], saying "Fernando got me excited about the thought of coming here. He said it would be good for me here, and that me and him together could be good. I also talked to my family and friends about it as well."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/14656464|title=Juan Mata completes move to Chelsea from Valencia|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 August 2011|accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref>
On 26 August 2011, [[Yossi Benayoun]] offered Mata his number 10 shirt. The [[Israel national football team|Israeli]] captain said, "I decided to give Mata the number 10 – his favourite. For me, it's just a number, not my lucky 15." ([[Florent Malouda]] wore number 15 for Chelsea at the time.) Mata wore number 10 for Valencia and for Spain's under-21s in the summer, and expressed his gratitude to Benayoun. "It is a very important number to me so I'm pleased to be wearing it. I want to thank Yossi," he said.<ref>[https://twitter.com/juanmata10/status/107019559587942401 Juan Mata Tweet]. Twitter. 26 August 2011. Retrieved 26 August 2011.</ref> Mata follows on from Chelsea players [[Joe Cole]], [[Mark Hughes]], [[Ian Hutchinson (footballer born 1948)|Ian Hutchinson]], and [[Terry Venables]] in adopting the number 10 shirt.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2433219 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140706180440/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2433219 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=6 July 2014 |title=Mata to take 10 |publisher=Chelsea FC |date=26 August 2011 |accessdate=2 July 2014 }}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== [[File:Juan Mata & Jerome Boateng.jpg|thumb|Juan Mata taking on [[Bayern Munich]] defender [[Jérôme Boateng]] in the [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final]]]] Mata made his debut for Chelsea against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 27 August 2011, where he came on as a 68th-minute substitute for [[Florent Malouda]] and scored the club's third goal in the 11th minute of stoppage time. Chelsea went on to win the match 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/317983/gamecast.html |title=Chelsea 3–1 Norwich City |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=27 August 2011 |accessdate=2 July 2014 }}</ref> He started his first game for his new club in their next fixture on 10 September away to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], helping Chelsea secure a 1–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/3807237/Sunderland-1-Chelsea-2.html|title=Sunderland 1 Chelsea 2 |location=London |newspaper=The Sun |first=Martin |last=Blackburn }}</ref> On 14 September, Mata made his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut for Chelsea and netted in stoppage time to help his side defeat [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] 2–0.<ref>[http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/331226/gamecast.html Gamecast: Chelsea v Bayer Leverkusen – UEFA Champions League – ESPN Soccernet]. Soccernet.espn.go.com (13 September 2011). Retrieved 2 July 2014.</ref>
On 29 October 2011, Mata assisted Chelsea's 6,000th league goal with an in-swinging cross which was headed in by [[Frank Lampard]]. In the same game, Mata scored with a spectacular 25-yard strike in a 3–5 home defeat to London rivals [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>[http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2498531 Match report: Chelsea 3 Arsenal 5] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131125012637/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2498531 |date=25 November 2013 }}. Chelsea FC. Retrieved 2 July 2014.</ref> On 26 November, Mata set up the first two goals which were scored by [[John Terry]] and [[Daniel Sturridge]] and also scored the third goal himself in a 3–0 win against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2066486/Chelsea-3-Wolverhampton-0-Andre-Villas-Boas-track.html |title=Chelsea 3 Wolves 0: Juan the man for Blues boss as super Spaniard Mata lifts the gloom over Villas-Boas |work=Mail Online |publisher=Associated Newspapers |date=26 November 2011 |accessdate=26 November 2011 |location=London |first=Rob |last=Draper}}</ref> He was awarded the Man of the Match in a 0–3 away win at [[St James' Park]] for his performance against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/15901588|title=Newcastle 0–3 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 December 2011}}</ref>
On 6 December 2011, during Chelsea's decisive Champions League match against former club [[Valencia CF]], Mata created two assists for both of [[Didier Drogba]] goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/champions-league/8938689/Didier-Drogbas-double-keeps-Chelseas-Champions-League-dream-alive.html |location=London |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |first=Henry |last=Winter |title=Didier Drogba's double keeps Chelsea's Champions League dream alive |date=7 December 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/3982216/Chelsea-3-Valencia-0.html |location=London |title=Chelsea 3 Valencia 0 |newspaper=The Sun |first=Shaun |last=Custis }}</ref> The game ended in a 3–0 win, which resulted in Chelsea qualifying first from their group.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2070758/Chelsea-3-Valencia-0-Didier-Drogba-scores-twice.html |location=London |newspaper=Daily Mail |first=Matt |last=Lawton |title=Chelsea 3 Valencia 0: Top Drog fires Blues through and Andre Villas Boas can breathe a little easier |date=7 December 2011}}</ref> On Boxing Day, Mata scored his side's only goal in a 1–1 draw at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/8973158/Chelsea-1-Fulham-1-match-report.html |location=London |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |first=Jason |last=Burt |title=Chelsea 1 Fulham 1: match report |date=26 December 2011}}</ref> Mata scored Chelsea's first goal of their [[FA Cup]] campaign in a 4–0 win over [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] at Stamford Bridge.
In an [[FA Cup]] Fourth round tie with [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] at [[Loftus Road]], Mata scored his side's only goal from the penalty spot in a 0–1 victory. On 5 February 2012, Mata scored against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in a 3–3 draw.<ref>{{cite web|title=Match: Chelsea v Manchester United |url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/318100/gamecast.html |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714163831/http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/318100/gamecast.html |archivedate=14 July 2014 |df= }}</ref> On 21 February, Mata scored his side's only goal in their 1–3 defeat away at [[Napoli]] in the first leg of the Champions League round of 16.<ref>{{cite web|title=Match: Napoli v Chelsea|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/334832/gamecast.html|publisher=ESPN Soccernet}}</ref>
After the appointment of [[Roberto Di Matteo]] as interim first-team coach, Mata was played as a central attacking midfielder rather than being played on the left wing. Mata scored and had a penalty saved by [[Colin Doyle (footballer)|Colin Doyle]] in the FA Cup 5th round replay against [[Birmingham City]] at [[St Andrew's (stadium)|St Andrew's]], which Chelsea won 0–2, helping them into the quarter-finals of the [[FA Cup]]. He continued his trait of scoring in each round; this run, however, ended against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in the quarter-final, which Chelsea nonetheless won 5–2. On 7 April, Mata scored his 11th goal of the season against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]]; it was a vital goal that gave the Blues a 2–1 victory over the Latics and kept alive Chelsea's fight for a Champions League spot.<ref>Irwin, Mark. (9 April 2012) [http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/4244222/Chelsea-2-1-Wigan-Match-report-pictures-video-highlights.html Chelsea 2–1 Wigan: Match report, pictures & video highlights |Sport|Football]. ''The Sun''. Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref>
On 15 April, in Chelsea's 5–1 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the FA Cup semi-final at [[Wembley Stadium]], Mata scored a controversial goal and assisted [[Ramires]] and [[Florent Malouda]] for their goals, adding to his statistics in the [[2011–12 FA Cup]] with four goals and three assists. Mata started in both legs of Chelsea's Champions League semi-final clash with reigning champions [[FC Barcelona]], helping his side to an unexpected 3–2 win on aggregate.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/18/chelsea-barcelona-champions-league Chelsea 1–0 Barcelona] ''The Guardian'' (London). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/24/barcelona-chelsea-champions-league Barcelona 2–2 Chelsea (2–3 agg)]. ''The Guardian'' (London). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref> and set up a [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final|final]] clash with [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] on 19 May.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=1789583.html Bayern and Chelsea renew rivalry –]. UEFA (26 April 2012). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref>
Mata provided two assists to fellow Spaniard Fernando Torres in the 6–1 thrashing of [[West London derby#Chelsea vs QPR derby|West London rivals]] Queens Park Rangers on 29 April, bringing his tally to 13 Premier League assists on the season.<ref>[http://www.goal.com/en-sg/news/3877/english-premier-league/2012/05/01/3071937/mata-early-goals-were-the-difference-for-chelsea Mata: Early goals were the difference for Chelsea]. Goal.com (1 May 2012). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref> Mata assisted the first goal in the [[2012 FA Cup Final|FA Cup final]], which [[Ramires]] scored, as Chelsea beat [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] 2–1 at Wembley, with Mata picking up Man of the Match award.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2139920/Chelsea-2-Liverpool-1-FA-Cup-final.html Chelsea 2 Liverpool 1 FA Cup final]. ''Daily Mail'' (London). (5 May 2012). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2140321/Juan-Mata-targets-FA-Cup-glory.html?ito=feeds-newsxml Juan Mata targets further FA Cup glory]. ''Daily Mail''. (6 May 2012). Retrieved 12 May 2012.</ref> On 10 May, Mata was rewarded for his consistent form throughout his first Chelsea season by the fans voting him the club's Player of the Year, following on from Chelsea legends such as [[Dennis Wise]] and [[Gianfranco Zola]], whom he had been compared to on various occasions.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2767955 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180820133017/https://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2767955 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=20 August 2018 |publisher=Chelsea FC |title=Mata the main man |date=11 May 2012 }}</ref>
In the [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final]] against Bayern Munich on 19 May, Mata assisted Didier Drogba's headed equalizer from a corner kick in the 88th minute. The match went on to extra-time and penalties, with Mata taking Chelsea's first, which Bayern goalkeeper [[Manuel Neuer]] saved. Chelsea, however, went on to win 4–3 in the penalty-shootout, lifting their first Champions League title.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000267/match=2007693/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Shoot-out win ends Chelsea's long wait for glory |date=19 May 2012}}</ref> Mata finished his first season at Stamford Bridge with 573 passes, creating 66 chances and completing 61 successful crosses, which all contributed to Chelsea's cup-double winning season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/blogs/Euro2012top40players/30/33-juan-mata-spa|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120528043400/http://espnfc.com/us/en/blogs/Euro2012top40players/30/33-juan-mata-spa|archivedate=28 May 2012|title=Top 40 Players of Euro 2012: #33: Juan Mata, SPA|publisher=ESPN FC|date=25 May 2012|accessdate=2 July 2014}}</ref> He finished the Premier League season with 14 assists – second highest in the league after [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s [[David Silva]] – and six goals. <ref>{{cite web|title=Chelsea Statistics 2011/12|url=http://www.kickoff.co.uk/teams/?team_id=11&season=2011&area=squad|work=KickOff.co.uk|publisher=KickOff.co.uk|access-date=12 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621165426/http://www.kickoff.co.uk/teams/?team_id=11&season=2011&area=squad|archive-date=21 June 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== Mata missed all of Chelsea's pre-season games as he was playing for [[Spain national under-23 football team|Spain]] at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in London, but he returned to play in the [[2012 FA Community Shield]] against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and was substituted after 74 minutes for [[Daniel Sturridge]]. Mata assisted his first goal of the season on 22 September 2012 against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], providing a great flick to [[Ashley Cole]], which turned out to be the winning goal as Chelsea won 1–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19615097|title=Chelsea 1–0 Stoke|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 September 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season in the [[2012–13 Football League Cup]] third round against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], with the game finishing 6–0 to Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19632463|title=Chelsea 6–0 Wolves|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 September 2012|accessdate=30 September 2012}}</ref> Four days later, he scored his first [[2012–13 Premier League|Premier League]] goal of the season, assisting [[Fernando Torres]] for the opener and then scoring directly from a free-kick in a 2–1 away win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19684245|title=Arsenal 1–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 September 2012|accessdate=30 September 2012}}</ref> [[File:Mata returning to Chelsea's half.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Juan Mata in action for Chelsea in 2012]]
Mata scored Chelsea's first and third goal in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group E|Champions League]] as Chelsea beat [[FC Nordsjælland|Nordsjælland]] 0–4 away in [[Farum]], Denmark.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19709698|title=FC Nordsjaelland 0–4 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 October 2012|accessdate=3 October 2012}}</ref> He later provided two assists in Chelsea's 4–1 rout of [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], sending [[Eden Hazard]] through on goal and later flicking a delightful ball for defender [[Branislav Ivanović]] to volley in.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19776324|title=Chelsea 4–1 Norwich|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 October 2012}}</ref> In a [[London derbies|London Derby]] game against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]] on 20 October, Mata scored twice and provided an assist for Daniel Sturridge in a 2–4 victory for Chelsea, where he also earned Man of the Match honours.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/tottenham-vs-chelsea/report/261638|title=Juan Mata scores twice as Chelsea overcome Tottenham in six-goal derby thriller |publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 October 2012}}</ref> He next scored in a Premier League match with a beautiful free kick against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. Chelsea, however, lost the match 3–2 after a late controversial goal from [[Javier Hernández]]. Mata went on to win the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award for October after scoring three league goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/4630131/Alex-Ferguson-and-Juan-Mata-scoop-October-awards.html |title=ALEX FERGUSON and Juan Mata have been named Premier League manager and player of the month for October. |publisher=The Sun |date=6 November 2012 }}</ref>
After manager [[Roberto Di Matteo]] was sacked following a 3–0 defeat to [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in the Champions League, Mata scored the first goal of new, interim manager [[Rafael Benítez]]'s reign at Chelsea against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], although Chelsea suffered a 3–1 defeat in this game.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20474474|title=West Ham 3–1 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He scored again in Chelsea's win over Nordsjælland in a Champions League game, but Chelsea still failed to advance to the knockouts despite a 6–1 win at home.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20522151|title=Chelsea 6–1 Nordsjaelland|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 December 2012|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> He added to his tally of goals and his collection of fine performance at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in a 1–3 Chelsea win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20564679|title=Sunderland 1–3 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 December 2012|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> After this game, Chelsea traveled to Japan for the [[2012 FIFA Club World Cup]]. Here, too, Mata continued his top form by scoring Chelsea's first goal in the tournament against [[C.F. Monterrey|Monterrey]] in the semi-final, helping them on their course to the final with a 1–3 victory. The tournament, however, ended in disappointment as Chelsea were beaten 1–0 by Brazilian club [[Sport Club Corinthians Paulista|Corinthians]] in the [[2012 FIFA Club World Cup Final|final]]. The team put the defeat behind them by completing an 8–0 routing of [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], a game in which though Mata did not score a goal, but nevertheless played a very influential part.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20745787|title=Chelsea 8–0 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 December 2012|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref>
On 22 December 2012, Mata signed a contract extension with Chelsea which tied him up with the club until 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last=Stammers |first=Steve |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/juan-mata-new-contract-chelsea-1502569 |title=Juan Mata new contract: Chelsea tie down Spanish star to a new five-year deal – Mirror Online |publisher=Mirror.co.uk |date=22 December 2012 |accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> On Boxing Day, Chelsea traveled to [[Carrow Road]] to face [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], where both Manchester United and Arsenal had suffered defeats earlier in the season. Mata scored a brilliant goal in the 38th minute, taking a pass from [[Oscar (footballer born 1991)|Oscar]] into his stride and launching an unstoppable shot into the goal from 25 yards out. The goal turned out to be the winner.<ref>{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Owen |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20779143|title=Norwich 0–1 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2012|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> Then, on 5 January, Mata provided assists for new acquisition [[Demba Ba]] and Branislav Ivanović to help Chelsea win 1–5 against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the 3rd round of the [[2012–13 FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20863303|title=Southampton 1–5 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 January 2013|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> A week later, he forced an own goal from [[Jonathan Walters]] by putting in a tight corner and earned a penalty which [[Frank Lampard]] converted. Chelsea went on to win the game 0–4, which was Stoke's first home defeat of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20919045|title=Stoke 0–4 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2013|accessdate=30 January 2014}}</ref> Mata scored his eighth goal of the season in the Premier League against Arsenal in a 2–1 home win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/21002559|title=Chelsea 2–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 January 2013|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref>
On 3 March 2013, Mata made his 100th appearance in all competitions for Chelsea in a 1–0 win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.grada360.com/juanmata/en/2013/03/04/un-domingo-en-la-tierrina/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104154849/http://blogs.grada360.com/juanmata/2013/03/04/un-domingo-en-la-tierrina/ |archivedate=4 January 2014 |title=A family Sunday |publisher=Grada360 |date=4 March 2013 }}</ref> On 14 March, Mata scored an opening goal in Chelsea's [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] 3–1 (3–2) win against [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Chase |first=Graham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21696158 |title=Chelsea 3–1 Steaua Buch't (agg 3–2) |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=14 March 2013 |accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> On 19 April, Mata was nominated for [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] in recognition of his contribution to Chelsea's season in all competitions. The PFA's decision was based on his "ability to not only create goals but also score them himself" and saw him nominated alongside teammate [[Eden Hazard]].<ref>{{cite web|author=ThePFA.com |url=http://www.thepfa.com/news/2013/4/19/pfa-nominees-poty-mata |title=PFA Nominees: Juan Mata – News – The PFA |publisher=Thepfa.com |date= |accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> He also netted an 87th-minute winner against Manchester United, a crucial one for Chelsea's Champions League qualification hopes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/22328145|title=Manchester United 0–1 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 May 2013|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/features/dubious-goals-decisions-2012-13.html |title=Dubious Goals Rulings for the 2012/13 season |publisher=Premierleague.com |accessdate=29 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228081242/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/features/dubious-goals-decisions-2012-13.html |archivedate=28 February 2014 |df= }}</ref>
On 15 May, Mata gave a fine performance in the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final]] against Portugal's [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], assisting Branislav Ivanović's injury time winner from a corner kick.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/22445388|title=Benfica 1–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 May 2013|accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> The next day, he was awarded Chelsea's Player's Player of the Year award. He modestly gave the credit to the whole of the squad, saying that, "he felt proud to play for Chelsea," and thanked his teammates. He was also awarded Chelsea's Player of the Year for the second successive season. On winning his second award of the night, he said, "I feel so happy. It's my second season here and winning the trophy two years in a row is amazing for me. I just want to say thank you to all the supporters and all my teammates."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3181667 |title=Double delight for Mata at awards ceremony |publisher=Chelseafc.com |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=29 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104140431/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3181667 |archivedate= 4 January 2014 |df= }}</ref> [[File:Juan Mata Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Mata on tour with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2013]]
====2013–14 season==== Under new Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]], Mata spent a lot of time on the bench. Mourinho preferred [[Oscar (footballer, born 1991)|Oscar]] as a [[playmaker]], and suggested Mata needed to adapt to a wider position and to working harder defensively.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/20/chelsea-jose-mourinho-juan-mata |title=José Mourinho tells Juan Mata to adapt after blasting Chelsea's style |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |newspaper=The Guardian |date=20 September 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}}</ref> On 28 September 2013, Mata came on as a half-time substitute against [[Tottenham Hotspur]] to assist [[John Terry]] to score an equaliser in a 1–1 draw,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/28/tottenham-hotspur-chelsea-premier-league-live |title=Tottenham Hotspur 1–1 Chelsea – as it happened |first=Barry |last=Glendenning |website=The Guardian |date=28 September 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}}</ref> but his appearances in the first team remained infrequent. On 29 October, he scored his first goal of the season in a 2–0 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] victory at London rivals [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/24619361|title=Arsenal 0–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 October 2013|accessdate=3 September 2014}}</ref>
Mata struggled to secure a regular first-team place under Mourinho as he had started just 11 of Chelsea's 22 Premier League matches.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2014/01/22/4562449/mata-on-verge-of-49m-manchester-united-switch-as-he-misses |title=Mata on verge of €49m Manchester United switch as he misses Chelsea training |publisher=Goal.com |date=22 January 2014 |accessdate=29 January 2014}}</ref> Mata scored 33 goals and provided 58 assists in 135 appearances over two-and-a-half seasons with Chelsea.
===Manchester United=== On 24 January 2014, Mourinho said Chelsea had accepted a transfer offer from [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and he allowed Mata to travel to Manchester to undergo a medical, after the player said he was "really happy to go".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25882972|title=Juan Mata: Man United move delayed by Chelsea's Salah wait|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 January 2014|first=David|last=Ornstein}}</ref> Manchester United confirmed later in the day that a transfer fee had been agreed, but that the deal was still contingent on Mata agreeing personal terms and passing a medical.<ref>{{cite news |author=Communications Dept. |title=Reds agree deal for Mata |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Jan/manchester-united-agree-deal-to-sign-juan-mata.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=24 January 2014 |accessdate=24 January 2014 }}</ref> The transfer was completed the following day, with Manchester United paying Chelsea [[List of most expensive association football transfers|a then club record fee of £37.1 million]] (€46 million), with Mata signing a contract until the summer of 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25882972|title=Juan Mata: Manchester United sign Chelsea midfielder for £37.1m|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 January 2014|accessdate=25 January 2014}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== He made his debut against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 28 January and provided one assist in the 2–0 home victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25822391|title=Manchester United 2–0 Cardiff|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 January 2014}}</ref> Mata scored his first goal for United in a 4–1 win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 29 March 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Manchester United 4–1 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26694513|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 March 2014}}</ref> He also went on to score two goals against [[Newcastle United]] in a 4–0 away victory,<ref>{{cite news |title=Newcastle United 0–4 Manchester United |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/Apr/newcastle-united-v-manchester-united-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=5 April 2014 |first=Adam |last=Marshall}}</ref> two more against [[Norwich City]] after coming off the bench in another 4–0 win,<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 4–0 Norwich City |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/Apr/Manchester-United-v-Norwich-Premier-League-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=26 April 2014 |first=Tim |last=Oscroft}}</ref> and the only goal in a 1–1 draw against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the final match of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 4–0 Norwich City |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/May/Southampton-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=11 May 2014 |first=Gemma |last=Thompson}}</ref>
[[File:JuanMata DCTraining.jpg|thumb|right|Juan Mata during a training session in Washington D.C.]] Mata ended the season having scored six goals for Manchester United, all in the Premier League, since he was cup tied and unable to play in the Champions League and other cup competitions due to his participation in the tournaments with Chelsea earlier in the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cup-tied Mata stays home |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2014/Feb/Juan-Mata-blog-24-February.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=24 February 2014 |first=Ben |last=Hibbs}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Mata began the new season in fine form. He scored the only goal in [[Manchester United]]'s second game of the Premier League season, a 1–1 draw against [[Sunderland F.C.|Sunderland]] at [[Stadium of Light]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 1–1 Sunderland |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/Aug/Sunderland-vs-Manchester-United-premier-league-2014-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=24 August 2014 |first=Ian |last=McLeish}}</ref> following it up with a goal against [[Queens Park Rangers]] in a 4–0 thumping, which was also [[Louis van Gaal]]'s first competitive win in charge of United.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 4–0 Queens Park Rangers |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/Sep/Manchester-United-vs-qpr-premier-league-2014-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=14 September 2014 |first=Gemma |last=Thompson}}</ref> He was later dropped to the bench for the following two matches, making cameo appearances against Leicester<ref>{{cite news |title=Confirmed Leicester City vs. Manchester United Lineups |url=http://www.caughtoffside.com/2014/09/21/confirmed-leicester-city-vs-manchester-united-lineups-first-start-for-radamel-falcao-in-three-man-attack/ |work=caughtoffside.com |publisher=CaughtOffside.com |date=21 September 2014 |first=Mark |last=Brus}}</ref> and West Ham,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2014/09/27/confirmed-manchester-united-west-ham-united-line-ups/|title=Confirmed Manchester United vs. West Ham United Lineups|publisher=hereisthecity.com|first=Olly|last=Dawes|date=27 September 2014}}</ref> with van Gaal preferring an attacking trinity of [[Wayne Rooney]], [[Robin van Persie]] and new signing [[Radamel Falcao]] in both games.
Following Rooney's sending off and suspension due to a foul on [[Stewart Downing]] in the match against West Ham,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29289922|title=Manchester United 2–1 West Ham United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 September 2014}}</ref> Mata was reinstated to the starting lineup, and he started the next match against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], a 2–1 win at Old Trafford in which he provided the assist for [[Ángel Di María]]'s goal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 2–1 Everton |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2014/Oct/Manchester-United-vs-everton-premier-league-2014-match-report.aspx |work=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United FC Official Website |date=5 October 2014 |first=Adam |last=Marshall}}</ref> Mata later scored winning goals in home games against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/29860235|title=Manchester United 1–0 Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 November 2014}}</ref> and [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], the former after coming on as a second-half substitute. He made his return to the starting line-ups for the first time, in a 3–0 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] but was substituted in the 77th minute for [[Andreas Pereira]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/31785852|title=Manchester United 3–0 Tottenham Hotspur|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 March 2015|accessdate=18 March 2015}}</ref> On 22 March 2015, Mata scored a brace, including a [[bicycle kick]], in a 2–1 victory over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/31893202|title=Liverpool 1–2 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 March 2015|accessdate=23 March 2015}}</ref> a performance which he rated as his best for Manchester United.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/565634/Juan-Mata-Man-Utd-reaction |title=Juan Mata: Liverpool performance was my BEST for Man Utd after leaving Chelsea |website=express.co.uk |date=22 March 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11667/9772128/thierry-henry-marvels-at-ridiculous-juan-mata-goal-at-anfield |title=Thierry Henry marvels at 'ridiculous' Juan Mata goal at Anfield |publisher=Sky Sports |date=23 March 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2015}}</ref> His second goal against Liverpool was also voted as Premier League Goal of the Month in March 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=March goal of the month|url=http://vote.tectonicinteractive.com/?22#/show-answers/16459|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 May 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150516185523/http://vote.tectonicinteractive.com/?22#/show-answers/16459|archive-date=16 May 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His inspired performances led to him being named as Manchester United's Player of the Month for March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Mar/juan-mata-named-manchester-united-player-of-the-month-for-march.aspx |title=Juan Mata wins Player of the Month award|website=manutd.com |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |date=27 March 2015 |accessdate=28 March 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== Mata, just as he had in the previous campaign, had a fine start to the season, getting an assist in the second game of the campaign against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]],<ref>{{cite web|title = Aston Villa 0–1 Manchester United|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33814865|website = BBC Sport|accessdate = 10 October 2015}}</ref> which helped maintain his side's impressive record at [[Villa Park]].<ref>{{cite web|title = Aston Villa 0 – 1 Manchester United Match preview - 14/08/2015 Premier League - Goal.com|url = http://www.goal.com/en-ie/match/aston-villa-vs-manchester-united/2043060/preview|website = www.goal.com|accessdate = 10 October 2015}}</ref> September was a month to remember for Mata as he scored two goals and made two assists in just three games, as Manchester United claimed wins against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34160795|title=Manchester United 3–1 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 September 2015|accessdate=10 October 2015}}</ref> [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34236981|title=Southampton 2–3 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2015|accessdate=10 October 2015}}</ref> and [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34299545|title=Manchester United 3–0 Sunderland|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=10 October 2015}}</ref> As a result, Mata was crowned the club's Player of The Month.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Oct/Juan-Mata-wins-Manchester-United-Player-of-the-Month-award-for-September-2015.aspx|title=Mata wins September Player of the Month award|website=manutd.com|date=15 October 2015|accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref>
Mata was made [[captain (association football)|captain]] for the home game against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 2 March and scored a free kick, which was also the match-winner.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35647650|title=Manchester United 1–0 Watford|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 March 2016|accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref> On 6 March, in a 1–0 defeat to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Brom]], Mata received his first career [[Ejection (sports)#Association football|red card]] after obtaining two yellow cards in the space of three minutes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35681004|title=West Bromwich Albion 1–0 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 March 2016|accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref> Mata assisted an [[Anthony Martial]] goal against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] in the final game at the [[Boleyn Ground]]; however, United lost 3–2, ending their chances of beating [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] for fourth-place.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36189168|title=West Ham United 3–2 Manchester United|website=BBC Sport|date=10 May 2016|accessdate=24 May 2016}}</ref>
On 21 May 2016, Mata scored for United in the [[2016 FA Cup Final|FA Cup Final]] against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], leveling the score at 1–1 just three minutes after [[Jason Puncheon]]'s 78th-minute goal. Mata was substituted in the 90th minute and replaced by [[Jesse Lingard]], who would score the winning goal for United in extra time.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36292265|title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United (aet)|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 May 2016|accessdate=24 May 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== At the beginning of the summer, Mata was reunited with his former Chelsea manager and the person who sold him to Manchester United, [[José Mourinho]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/May/club-statement-manchester-united-confirm-jose-mourinho-as-new-manager.aspx |title=Mourinho appointed United manager |publisher=Manchester United |date=27 May 2016 |accessdate=27 May 2016 }}</ref> On 7 August 2016, Mata was selected to be on the bench in the [[FA Community Shield]]. Mata replaced [[Jesse Lingard]] in the second half, then was substituted in added time for [[Henrikh Mkhitaryan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36934956|title=Jose Mourinho began his reign as Manchester United manager with a trophy |date=7 August 2016}}</ref> Although there were reports about tensions between the player and manager, after the match, Mata stated that there were no tensions between him and Mourinho.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/08/08/manchester-united-midfielder-juan-matas-latest-row-with-jose-mou/ |title=Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata's latest row with Jose Mourinho may mean no more Mr Nice Guy |date=8 August 2016 |publisher=Telegraph}}</ref> He started in the opening match of the season against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth]] and scored Manchester United's first Premier League goal of the season with a tap-in after [[Simon Francis (footballer)|Simon Francis]]' error.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37001060 |title=Bournemouth 1-3 Manchester United:Jose Mourinho made a winning Premier League start as Manchester United manager |date=14 August 2016 |publisher=BBC Sports}}</ref>
[[File:Manchester United v Burnley, October 2016 (07).JPG|thumb|right|Mata ''(furthest right)'' [[captain (association football)|captain]]ing United against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], 2016]] After José Mourinho dropped captain [[Wayne Rooney]], Mata served as the stand-in captain in the 0–0 draw against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 29 October 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/juan-mata-captains-manchester-united-9151336 |title=Juan Mata captains Manchester United vs Burnley as Henrikh Mkhitaryan again misses out |date=29 October 2016}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Mata netted his third brace of his Manchester United career, scoring both goals for the Red Devils in a Boxing Day fixture against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]]. However, his efforts were cancelled out by a late equalizer from [[Harry Maguire]] which saw the match finish 2-2.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/dec/23/leicester-city-v-manchester-united-premier-league-live|title=Leicester City 2-2 Manchester United: Premier League - as it happened|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=4 March 2019}}</ref> Mata finished the season with 3 goals in 40 appearances for the Red Devils, as United finished 2nd in the Premier League and lost in the [[2018 FA Cup Final]] against his former club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]
====2018–19 season==== On 7 November 2018, Mata scored the equaliser from a free kick in a late comeback 2–1 win over [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in a [[2018-19 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage fixture.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46087302|title=Manchester United stun Juventus|publisher=BBC|accessdate=7 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Torres, Mata and Ramos Euro 2012 trophy 01.jpg|thumb|left|[[Fernando Torres]], Mata and [[Sergio Ramos]] celebrating after winning [[UEFA Euro 2012]]]]
Mata helped [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]] win the [[2006 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]], where he was a key player. He finished the championship second to his teammate [[Alberto Bueno]] (five goals) as top goal scorer of the competition, with four in five matches.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/under19/news/newsid=439617.html Spain sweep into U19 final] UEFA, 26 July 2006</ref>
On 1 February 2007, [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21]] coach [[Iñaki Sáez]] included him on his squad for the friendly against [[England national under-21 football team|England]], alongside [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] teammates [[Roberto Soldado]], [[José Manuel Jurado]], [[Sergio Sánchez Ortega|Sergio Sánchez]], [[Miguel Torres Gómez|Miguel Torres]], [[Esteban Granero]], and [[Antonio Adán]], at just 18 years and 10 months.
On 14 November 2008, [[Vicente del Bosque]] called up Mata for the [[Spain national football team|senior team]] to play in a friendly against [[Chile national football team|Chile]]. He did not leave the bench in a 3–0 home win. On 28 March 2009, he finally made his debut, playing in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|qualifier]] against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]], a 1–0 win in [[Madrid]]. He came on as a substitute for teammate [[David Villa]] in the 63rd minute.
In June 2009, Del Bosque included Mata for the [[2009 FIFA Confederations Cup]], the youngster's first senior tournament. He started in the second group match against [[Iraq national football team|Iraq]] and came on as a substitute for [[Albert Riera]] in the semi-final loss to the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]].
[[File:Juan Manuel Mata, Adrián López, and Alberto Botía, U21 in 2011.jpg|thumb|right|Mata, [[Adrián López]], and [[Alberto Botía]] lining up for [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] in 2011]] On 9 September 2009, Mata scored his first goal for the senior team, as the 3–0 win against [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]] secured a place in the World Cup in South Africa. He followed this up with the winner against [[Armenia national football team|Armenia]] on 10 October, scoring a penalty to steal a 2–1 win.<ref>[https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/worldcup/southafrica2010/news/newsid=1116149/index.html Mata keeps Spain perfect]; FIFA, 10 September 2009</ref> Picked for the final stages, he appeared once for the eventual champions, replacing [[Fernando Torres]] for the final 20 minutes of the 2–0 group stage win against [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]].
In 2011, the following summer, he went back to the under-21 side, playing the role of senior squad member and helped Spain win the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in Denmark. Mata himself was included in [[UEFA]]'s Team of the Tournament and named as the tournament's [[UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Under-21 Golden Player|Golden Player]].
Mata returned to the senior squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and, after coming on as a substitute, scored Spain's fourth goal in the [[UEFA Euro 2012 final|final]] as Spain defeated [[Italy national football team|Italy]] 4–0 to retain their title as champions of Europe.<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/spain/9365288/Spain-4-Italy-0-match-report.html Spain 4 Italy 0: match report]. ''The Daily Telegraph'' (London).</ref>
Mata was included in [[Spain national under-23 football team|Spain]]'s squad for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympic football tournament]] as one of their three designated overage players. Spain, however, failed to score in any of their opening three matches and were eliminated at the group stage.<ref>[http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/4433/2012-olympics/2012/07/30/3276603/juan-manuel-mata-takes-to-twitter-to-apologise-for-spain-olympic-?source=breakingnews Mata: Spain deserved more at Olympics]; Goal.com, 31 July 2012</ref>
==Style of play== A left footed [[attacking midfielder]] who can also be deployed on the [[right winger|right wing]], Mata makes up for a lack of pace with his control, technique, passing and vision, which allows him to register many [[Assist (football)|assists]] (he was the [[Premier League]]'s top assist provider in [[2012–13 Premier League|2012–13]]). At 5'7" he lacks great strength or aerial ability, but is agile and nimble. Mata is also a well-known free kick specialist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/blog/_/name/kickingandscreaming/id/467?cc=5901|title=The 2012–13 Prem Best XI|website=espnfc.com|last=Hirshey|first=David|accessdate=22 May 2013}}</ref>
==Personal life== In November 2012, along with fellow Premier League players [[Santi Cazorla]] and [[Michu]], Mata bought shares in former club Real Oviedo, who were struggling to raise €2 million to stay afloat in the Spanish third division.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sid |last=Lowe |title=Real Oviedo – the remarkable story of a club the world united to save |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/nov/29/real-oviedo-spain-premier-league |website=theguardian.com |publisher=Guardian News and Media |date=29 November 2012 |accessdate=11 January 2019 }}</ref>
On August 2017, Mata announced in an article for [[The Players' Tribune]] that he was pledging one percent of his salary to a pledge-based charitable movement, named [[Common Goal (charity)|Common Goal]], and called for other football players to do the same.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-za/news/common-goal-juan-mata-football-charity/9ebv9emew831k5zs19deolqe|title=WHAT IS COMMON GOAL? JUAN MATA'S NEW CHARITABLE INITIATIVE EXPLAINED|publisher=Goal|date=25 October 2017|accessdate=27 October 2017|}}</ref>

Rupel Boom F.C.|Rupel Boom]] | youthyears2 = 2003–2004 |youthclubs2 = KFC Wintam | youthyears3 = 2004–2006 |youthclubs3 = [[Lierse S.K.|Lierse]] | youthyears4 = 2006–2009 |youthclubs4 = [[R.S.C.
