United - Marcus Rashford|website=UEFA.com|date=March 2019|access-date=7 March 2019}}</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | clubnumber = 10 | youthyears1 = 2003–2005 |youthclubs1 = [[Fletcher Moss Rangers F.C.|Fletcher Moss Rangers]] | youthyears2 = 2005–2015 |youthclubs2 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | years1 = 2015– |clubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps1 = 104 |goals1 = 26<!-- LEAGUE ONLY --> | nationalyears1 = 2012 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 2 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] |nationalcaps2 = 2 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps3 = 2 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2016– |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps4 = 1 |nationalgoals4 = 3 | nationalyears5 = 2016– |nationalteam5 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps5 = 31 |nationalgoals5 = 6 | club-update = 18:49, 10 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 21:21, 13 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Marcus Rashford''' (born 31 October 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
A Manchester United player from the age of seven, he scored two goals on both his first-team debut against [[FC Midtjylland|Midtjylland]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]] in February 2016 and his Premier League debut against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] three days later. He also scored in his first [[Manchester derby]] match, his first [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] match and his first [[UEFA Champions League]] match.
Rashford scored on his England debut in May 2016, becoming the youngest English player to score in his first senior international match. He played at the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] as the tournament's youngest player, and at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Manchester United=== ====Early career==== Rashford was born in [[Wythenshawe]], Manchester, and is of [[Saint Kitts and Nevis|Kittitian]] descent.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.omropfryslan.nl/nieuws/695480-st-juste-opgeroepen-voor-saint-kitts-en-nevis |title=St. Juste opgeroepen voor Saint Kitts en Nevis |date=27 January 2017 |accessdate=3 January 2018 |language=Dutch |publisher=Omrop Fryslân}}</ref> Rashford began playing football for [[Fletcher Moss Rangers F.C.|Fletcher Moss Rangers]]<ref>{{cite news |last=Fordyce |first=Tom |title=Manchester's cold war |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/resources/idt-sh/longform_manchester_cold_war |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=2 March 2017 |date=2 March 2017}}</ref> at the age of five and joined the academy system at [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at the age of seven.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/marcus-rashford-rejected-liverpool-join-10954380 |title=Marcus Rashford rejected Liverpool to join Manchester United |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |date=26 February 2016 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=11 April 2017}}</ref>
Growing up, his idol was Brazilian striker [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] – the first game he saw was Ronaldo scoring a [[hat-trick#Association football|hat-trick]] for [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] against Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]] in 2003, a game when Ronaldo was given a standing ovation by both sets of fans when he left the field.<ref name="Idol">{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Law |title=Marcus Rashford: Ronaldo is my hero, as a kid I saw him destroy Manchester United |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/11/12/marcus-rashford-reveals-tried-emulate-brazil-legend-ronaldo/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |date=12 November 2017 |accessdate=10 September 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Ronaldo ends Man Utd dream |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/champions_league/2965089.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 April 2003 |accessdate=25 May 2012 }}</ref> Rashford states, "I've grown up watching so much of him and his games. He always played free. No matter where he was playing, he played free and went out there and expressed himself. When you do that, that's when you play your best football."<ref name="Idol"/>
====2015–16 season: Debut==== [[File:Marcus Rashford.jpg|thumb|upright|Rashford warming up for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in May 2016]]
Rashford was named on the first-team bench for the first time on 21 November 2015 by [[Louis van Gaal]] for a [[Premier League]] match against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], which Manchester United won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34818136 |title=Watford 1–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 November 2015 |accessdate=26 February 2016}}</ref> On 25 February 2016, Rashford was a late addition to the Manchester United starting line-up for their [[UEFA Europa League]] round of 32, second leg tie against [[FC Midtjylland|Midtjylland]] after [[Anthony Martial]] was injured in the warm-up; Rashford marked his first-team debut with two goals in the second half of a 5–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=Manchester United 5–1 FC Midtjylland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35632870 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2016 |accessdate=25 February 2016}}</ref> Rashford's goals made him Manchester United's youngest ever scorer in European competition, beating a record previously held by [[George Best]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/02/26/five-things-you-need-to-know-about-manchester-uniteds-new-hero-marcus-rashford-5719013/ |title=Five things you need to know about Manchester United's new hero Marcus Rashford |first=George |last=Bellshaw |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=26 February 2016 |accessdate=11 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2016/02/25/sports/soccer/25reuters-soccer-europa-united-rashford.html |title=Manchester United's Marcus Rashford Enjoys Dream Debut |date=25 February 2016 |agency=Reuters |newspaper=The New York Times}}</ref> Rashford made his Premier League debut against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] three days later; he again scored twice and provided the assist for the other goal in a 3–2 home victory, making him the third youngest scorer for United in Premier League history after [[Federico Macheda]] and [[Danny Welbeck]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Jurejko |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35624234 |title=Manchester United 3–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 February 2016 |accessdate=11 April 2017}}</ref> On 20 March 2016, Rashford scored the only goal in the [[Manchester derby]], his team's first away league win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] since 2012.<ref>{{cite news |last=Steinberg |first=Jacob |title=Manchester City v Manchester United: Premier League – as it happened |accessdate=22 March 2016 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2016/mar/20/manchester-city-v-manchester-united-premier-league-live |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=20 March 2016}}</ref> Aged just 18 years and 141 days, Rashford made his mark as the youngest ever scorer in a Manchester derby in the Premier League era.<ref>{{cite news |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |title=Louis van Gaal eyes fourth place after Manchester United close in on City |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/mar/20/louis-van-gaal-manchester-united-city-champions-league |accessdate=22 March 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=20 March 2016}}</ref>
During the [[FA Cup]] sixth-round replay against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] on 13 April 2016, Rashford scored a fantastic curled goal in a 2–1 win to put United through to the semi-finals.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=West Ham 1–2 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35974944 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 April 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> He later led the line in the [[2016 FA Cup Final|FA Cup Final]] against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 21 May, which ended in a 2–1 victory marking United's 12th FA Cup win and Rashford's first piece of silverware.<ref name=2016FAC>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> He wrapped up the [[2015–16 Manchester United F.C. season|season]] with 8 goals in 18 appearances, despite only debuting in February, as well as winning the [[Jimmy Murphy Young Player of the Year]].<ref name=YPOTY>{{cite web |first=James |last=Tuck |title=Marcus Rashford scoops Under-18s Award |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/May/POTY-Manchester-United-Marcus-Rashford-Jimmy-Murphy-Young-Player-of-the-Year-Under-18s-2015-16.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=2 May 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> On 30 May, Rashford signed a new contract with United, keeping him at the club until 2020, with an option to extend for a further year.<ref>{{cite web |title=Rashford signs new deal |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/May/marcus-rashford-signs-new-contract-with-manchester-united.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=30 May 2016 |accessdate=30 May 2016 }}</ref>
====2016–17 season: European success==== [[File:Marcus Rashford September 2016 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|left|Rashford lining up for Manchester United in September 2016]]
For the [[2016–17 Manchester United F.C. season|new season]], marking his place as part of the senior squad, Rashford was given the number 19 by new manager [[José Mourinho]].<ref>{{cite news |title=2016/17 Premier League squad numbers |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Jul/Manchester-United-release-Premier-League-squad-numbers-for-201617-season.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=21 July 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017 }}</ref> Rashford scored his first goal of the season on 27 August 2016 against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in tremendous fashion, scoring in the second minute of injury time after coming on for [[Juan Mata]] in the 71st minute.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Henson |title=Hull City 0–1 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37139627 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> He scored thrice more the next month, on 18 September in a 3–1 league defeat to Watford; on 21 September in a 3–1 victory against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]] third round; and in a 4–1 league win over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 24 September.<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Osborne |title=Watford 3–1 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37331599 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Northampton Town 1–3 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37357878 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 September 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Rostance |title=Manchester United 4–1 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37393483 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2016 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> The following month he came runner-up to Portugal's [[Renato Sanches]] in the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]] award for best European player under the age of 21, on 24 October.<ref>{{cite news |last=Aarons |first=Ed |title=Renato Sanches beats Marcus Rashford to 2016 Golden Boy award |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/oct/24/renato-sanches-marcus-rashford-golden-boy-award |accessdate=31 October 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=24 October 2016}}</ref> As a player however he failed to score until 7 January 2017 when he scored a four-minute brace in the FA Cup against [[Jaap Stam]]'s [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], which ended 4–0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jamie |last=Strickland |title=Manchester United 4–0 Reading |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38474766 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 January 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref>
Rashford won his third trophy on 26 February in the [[2017 EFL Cup Final|EFL Cup Final]], coming on as a 77th-minute substitute in the 3–2 victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref name=2017EFLC>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Manchester United 3–2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39018813 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2017 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> He was an instrumental part of United's 2–0 win over league leaders' [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 16 April, scoring the first goal after 7 minutes from [[Ander Herrera]]'s through ball.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Manchester United 2–0 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39543146 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 April 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> Rashford scored another key goal four days later against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] in the 107th minute of the Europa League quarter-final second leg in a 2–1 win (3–2 on aggregate), sending United into the next round.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Manchester United 2–1 RSC Anderlecht aet (3–2) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39611675 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> He started in the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League Final]] on 24 May against Dutch team [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], which Manchester United won 2–0 thus earning his fourth, and first European, trophy.<ref name=2017UEL>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Ajax 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40004559 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 May 2017 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> Due to the signing of [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]], Rashford spent the majority of the season on the wing. He made the most appearances of any United player during the season, playing 53 times.<ref>{{cite news |title=Marcus Rashford explains his best position at Manchester United |url=http://thepeoplesperson.com/2017/03/26/marcus-rashford-explains-his-best-position-at-manchester-united-177184/ |publisher=The Peoples Person |date=26 March 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=James |last=Tuck |title=Mourinho's Trust Is "Massive" For Rashford |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/May/marcus-rashford-delighted-to-have-earned-jose-mourinho-trust-and-respect-at-manchester-united.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=16 May 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017 }}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Marcus Rashford 2017-11-05 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Rashford playing for Manchester United in 2017]]
Rashford made his first appearance of his [[2017–18 Manchester United F.C. season|second full senior season]] on 8 August 2017 against Real Madrid in the [[2017 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]] as a 46th-minute substitute in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Jurejko |title=Real Beat Man Utd in Super Cup |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40788621 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> He started in a 4–0 home win against West Ham five days later on 13 August, providing the assist for [[Romelu Lukaku]]'s opening goal.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Jurejko |title=Man Utd 4–0 West Ham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40841358 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}}</ref> Rashford scored his first goal of the season on 26 August, the opener in a 2–0 victory over Leicester, three minutes after coming on as a substitute.<ref>{{cite news |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=Manchester United 2–0 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40984017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 August 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref> On 12 September, Rashford scored against [[FC Basel|Basel]] on his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut, the third in a 3–0 win, marking the sixth competition that he has scored in on his debut.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ryan |last=Grant |title=Manchester United 3 FC Basel 0 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Sep/Match-report-Manchester-United-v-FC-Basel-UEFA-Champions-League-Tue-12-Sept-2017.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=12 September 2017 |accessdate=12 September 2017 }}</ref> He scored a brace against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on 20 September in EFL Cup third round, as well as assisting the fourth goal in a 4–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=Manchester United 4–1 Burton Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249725 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref>
On 23 October, Rashford came third in the 2017 Golden Boy award behind winner [[Kylian Mbappé]] and [[Ousmane Dembélé]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Golden Boy 2017: Kylian Mbappé beats Dembélé and Rashford to award |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/23/golden-boy-2017-kylian-mbappe-wins-award |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=23 October 2017 |accessdate=31 October 2017}}</ref> By 28 October, Rashford had contributed to 12 goals in 16 games, with seven goals and five assists, with his most recent goal being against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 21 October and his most recent assist coming against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 24 October.<ref>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Davis |title=Huddersfield Town 2–1 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618803 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2017 |accessdate=31 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard |title=Swansea 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41647091 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2017 |accessdate=31 October 2017}}</ref> On 10 March 2018, Rashford scored both goals in a 2–1 win over rivals [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on his first Premier League start of the year.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/mar/10/manchester-united-liverpool-premier-league-match-report |title=Marcus Rashford's double gives Manchester United victory over Liverpool |date=10 March 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref> Rashford scored in United's last game of the season on 13 May, a 1–0 victory over Watford at Old Trafford.<ref>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Davis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44020156 |title=Manchester United 1–0 Watford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 May 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== In August 2018, prior to the [[2018–19 Manchester United F.C. season|2018–19 season]], Rashford was given the squad number 10, after the release of the club's previous number 10 – Ibrahimović.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/11463015/marcus-rashford-given-manchester-uniteds-no-10-shirt |title=Marcus Rashford given Manchester United's No 10 shirt |date=6 August 2018 |accessdate=2 September 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> On 2 September, Rashford was sent off in a 2–0 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] at [[Turf Moor]] after clashing heads with [[Phil Bardsley]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Matt |last=Bullin |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45312123 |title=Burnley 0–2 Manchester United |date=2 September 2018 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref> Rashford scored his first goal of the season on 29 September, United's only goal in a 3–1 loss to West Ham United.<ref>{{cite news |first=Harry |last=Poole |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45610325 |title=West Ham United 3–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 September 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> On 3 November, he scored again, providing a winning goal in the second minute of stoppage time in a 2–1 win over [[AFC Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Mitchener |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46000542 |title=Bournemouth 1–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 November 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> On 1 December, Rashford provided both assists in United's 2–2 draw with Southampton, with the goals coming from Romelu Lukaku and Ander Herrera.<ref>{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Rostance |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46326038 |title=Southampton 2–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 December 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> The following Saturday against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], he provided two assists for [[Ashley Young]] and Juan Mata before scoring the final goal in a 4–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Emons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46409331 |title=Manchester United 4–1 Fulham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 December 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> On 12 December, Rashford came on as 57th minute substitute for Brazilian midfielder [[Fred Rodrigues|Fred]] and scored a header in the 87th minute in a 2–1 loss to Spanish team [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group H|final group stage]] match of the UEFA Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |first=Patrick |last=Jennings |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46529972 |title=Valencia 2–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 December 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref>
On 22 December, Rashford scored in the 3rd minute of Manchester United's first match under [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]], in which United beat [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] 5–1.<ref>{{cite web |first=Michael |last=Pearlman |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46576165 |title=Cardiff City 1–5 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 December 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> On 30 December, Rashford scored against Bournemouth again in his final game of 2018, also assisting [[Paul Pogba]]'s first goal in United's 4–1 victory over ''the Cherries''.<ref>{{cite web |first=Saj |last=Chowdhury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46663363 |title=Manchester United 4–1 Bournemouth |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 December 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> During United's first match of 2019 on 2 January, Rashford assisted the ''Red Devils{{'}}'' first goal from a free kick and scored the second in a 2–0 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at [[St. James' Park]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Neil |last=Johnston |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46682775 |title=Newcastle United 0–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 January 2019 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref> On 13 January, Rashford scored the only goal in a 1–0 victory over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46772779 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 0–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 January 2019 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref> He scored his eighth Premier League goal of the season on 19 January in a 2–1 win against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Matt |last=Davis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46847683 |title=Manchester United 2–1 Brighton & Hove Albion |date=19 January 2019 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref> On 2 February, Rashford was announced as Manchester United's Player of the Month for January 2019,<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Higgins |title=Rashford Crowned Our January Star |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/amp/news/detail/marcus-rashford-wins-man-utd-player-of-the-month-award-for-january-2019 |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=2 February 2019 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref> as well as winning United's goal of the month for his strike against Tottenham.<ref>{{cite web |title=Your January Goal of the Month |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/videos/detail/marcus-rashford-strike-v-tottenham-voted-january-goal-of-the-month |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=3 February 2019 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref> A day later, he made his 100th league appearance for the club and scored the only goal in a 1–0 away victory over Leicester City. In doing so, he became the second-youngest player, behind [[Ryan Giggs]] to reach the milestone for the club.<ref>{{cite web |first=Matt |last=Davis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47018274 |title=Leicester City 0–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 February 2019 |accessdate=4 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/leicester-vs-manchester-united-live-stream-latest-score-goals-updates-watch-tv-channel-where-a8760666.html|title=Marcus Rashford marks 100th Manchester United appearance with goal in Leicester win|publisher=The Independent|last=Jones|first=Michael|date=4 February 2019|accessdate=5 February 2019}}</ref> His impressive performance in January earned him his first [[Premier League Player of the Month]] title,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/1049447 |title=Rashford named EA Sports Player of the Month |publisher=Premier League |date=8 February 2019 |accessdate=8 February 2019}}</ref> becoming the first United player since Ibrahimović in December 2016 to win the monthly league award.<ref>{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Higgins |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/marcus-rashford-wins-premier-league-player-of-the-month-award-for-january-2019 |title=In-form Rashford Wins Premier League Award |publisher=Manchester United |website=ManUtd.com |date=8 February 2019 |accessdate=15 February 2019}}</ref> On 6 March, Rashford scored from his first competitive penalty to seal a 3–1 win in the second leg of their [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Round of 16|Champions League round of 16 tie]] against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] to send the club through to the quarter-finals on the [[away goals rule]].<ref>{{Cite news|first=Shamoon|last=Hafez|title=Champions League: PSG 1-3 Man Utd (agg: 3-3)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47461886|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 March 2019|accessdate=6 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== ===UEFA Euro 2016=== Rashford's performances in his first senior season led to calls for him to represent [[England national football team|England]] at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. Manchester United academy coach [[Nicky Butt]] dismissed these calls, calling them premature and possibly harmful for the player's development.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ornstein |first=David |title=Euro 2016 too early for Man Utd's Marcus Rashford – Nicky Butt |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35805450 |accessdate=14 March 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 March 2016}}</ref> However, on 16 May, Rashford was named in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s preliminary 26-man squad for the tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Euro 2016: Marcus Rashford makes England provisional squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36300164 |accessdate=16 May 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2016}}</ref> He became part of England's Euro 2016 squad less than four months after making his Manchester United debut.<ref>{{cite news |title=Euro 2016: Marcus Rashford's England rise 'doesn't seem real' |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36487132 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 June 2016 |accessdate=11 April 2017}}</ref> On 27 May, he started in a warm-up match against [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] at the [[Stadium of Light]], and scored the opening goal of a 2–1 win after three minutes, becoming the youngest Englishman to score on his international debut, and the third youngest overall. The previous youngest scoring debutant was [[Tommy Lawton]] in 1938.<ref name="England 2–1 Australia">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 2–1 Australia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36339159 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2016 |accessdate=29 May 2016}}</ref>
On 16 June, he replaced [[Adam Lallana]] in the 73rd minute of England's 2–1 win over [[Wales national football team|Wales]] at UEFA Euro 2016, making his tournament debut at the age of 18 years and 229 days, becoming the youngest ever player to represent England at the European Championships, breaking [[Wayne Rooney]]'s [[UEFA Euro 2004]] record by four days.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/european-championship/story/2895013/marcus-rashford-becomes-youngest-england-player-at-european-championship |title=Marcus Rashford becomes England's youngest ever player at Euros |publisher=ESPN FC |date=16 June 2016 |accessdate=16 June 2016}}</ref> Eleven days later, as England were eliminated 2–1 by [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in the last 16 in [[Nice]], Rashford came on as a substitute for the final four minutes and dribbled past three opponents, making him the best in that statistic for the whole team in that match.<ref>{{cite news |last=Kearns |first=Sean |title=Marcus Rashford dribbled past more players in four minutes than any other player during England's defeat to Iceland |url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/06/27/marcus-rashford-dribbled-past-more-players-in-four-minutes-than-any-other-player-during-englands-defeat-to-iceland-5970522/ |accessdate=28 June 2016 |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=27 June 2016}}</ref>
===2018 FIFA World Cup=== [[File:FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - Photo 106 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Rashford before taking his penalty in the penalty shoot-out against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
Rashford scored his first competitive goal for the senior team on 4 September 2017, with the winning goal in England's 2–1 win over [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]] in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]].<ref name="England 2–1 Slovakia">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 2–1 Slovakia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41070207 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 September 2017 |accessdate=4 September 2017}}</ref> He was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> The tournament saw Rashford make one start in a group stage match against Belgium, plus an additional five appearance as a substitute (in every match except Panama).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mykhel.com/football/fifa-world-cup-2018-england-marcus-rashford-p176297-tp114-l4/ |title=Marcus Rashford FIFA World Cup 2018 Stats, Records, Position – myKhel |website=mykhelcom |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> He scored in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Colombia vs England|Round of 16]] penalty shoot-out against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] which saw England progress to the quarter-finals,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/england-colombia-world-cup-live-12578952 |title=England 1–1 Colombia (4–3 pens): Three Lions through to World Cup quarter-finals |first1=Danny Wittenberg |last1=by Liam Prenderville |first2=4 July 2018 |last2=Updated07:54 |date=4 July 2018 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> with England finishing fourth overall – their best performance since 1990.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44748604 |title=World Cup 2018: England finish fourth after Belgium defeat |date=14 July 2018 |accessdate=6 November 2018}}</ref>
===2018–19 UEFA Nations League=== On 8 September 2018, Rashford scored at [[Wembley Stadium]] in England's [[UEFA Nations League]] opener against [[Spain national football team|Spain]], losing 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |first=Lewis |last=Jones |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12016/11493581/england-1-2-spain-gareth-southgates-men-suffer-wembley-defeat |title=England 1–2 Spain: Gareth Southgate's men suffer Wembley defeat |publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 September 2018 |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> Three days later, Rashford also scored in a 1–0 friendly win over [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] at the [[King Power Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Lewis |last=Jones |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12010/11495331/england-1-0-switzerland-marcus-rashford-strikes-again-as-england-break-losing-run |title=England 1–0 Switzerland: Marcus Rashford strikes again as England break losing run |publisher=Sky Sports |date=11 September 2018 |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> In the October international break Rashford was named for the Nation's League squad to play [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], the match resulting in a goalless draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/oct/12/croatia-england-nations-league-match-report |title=Marcus Rashford fluffs his lines in England's eerie draw with Croatia |first=Daniel Taylor at Stadion HNK |last=Rijeka |date=12 October 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> Later that week, he scored a goal and an assist in the 3–2 away win against Spain.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/oct/15/spain-england-nations-cup-match-report |title=Raheem Sterling's double inspires England to stunning victory in Spain |first=Daniel Taylor at the Estadio Benito |last=Villamarín |date=15 October 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> England's final Nation's League game on 18 November saw Rashford play in a 2–1 win over Croatia.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/england-vs-croatia/teams/399808 |title=UEFA Nations League |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> This win saw England top their group and qualify for the [[2019 UEFA Nations League Finals|Nations League finals]] in June 2019.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46167890 |title=England 2–1 Croatia: Harry Kane seals Nations League finals spot |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 November 2018 |accessdate=6 January 2019}}</ref>

nationalteam-update = 27 March 2018 }} '''Anthony Jordan Martial''' ({{IPA-fr|maʁsjal}}; born 5 December 1995) is a French professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[France national football team|France national team]]. He was the recipient of the 2015 [[Golden Boy Award]] for the best under-21 player in Europe.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Dec/Manchester-United-striker-Anthony-Martial-wins-Golden-Boy-award-for-best-young-player-in-Europe.aspx |title=Anthony Martial wins Golden Boy award – Official Manchester United Website |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=4 August 2017}}</ref>
Playing youth football for [[CO Les Ulis|Les Ulis]], he began his professional career at [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], then transferred to [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] in 2013 for a fee of €6 million. He was a member of Monaco's squad for two seasons, and signed for Manchester United in 2015 for an initial fee of £36 million which could potentially rise to £57.6 million.<ref>{{cite web |title=Anthony Martial could cost Man United £57.6 million – Monaco vice-president |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/story/2594161/anthony-martial-could-cost-man-united-57-6-million-monaco |website=ESPN FC}}</ref> This was the highest fee paid for a teenager in football history even before the potential increase. He scored in his first match for United, and was named the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] in his first month in English football.
A youth international for France from [[France national under-16 football team|under-16]] to [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]] level, Martial made his senior debut in 2015. He was named in their squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Early career and Lyon=== Born in [[Massy, Essonne]], Martial spent his youth years with [[Paris]]-based [[CO Les Ulis]] from 2001,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fff.fr/equipes-de-france/tous-les-joueurs/fiche-joueur/2318054571-anthony-martial |title=Joueur – Anthony MARTIAL |publisher=French Football Federation |accessdate=30 July 2013}}</ref> the same team who produced French internationals [[Thierry Henry]] and [[Patrice Evra]].<ref name=ulis/> Evra closely monitored the progress of Martial, and allowed him to play in one of his pairs of football boots at the age of 12.<ref name=ulis/> At the same age, Martial trialled at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref name=ulis/>
At just 14 years old in 2009 he was spotted by scouts from the [[Olympique Lyonnais]] academy and joined it the same year. During his second season in the Under-17 team he distinguished himself by scoring 32 goals in 21 games, which resulted in a call-up to the [[France national under-17 football team]] for the [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] in Slovenia.
He made his professional debut for Lyon on 6 December 2012, in a [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League group stage|group stage]] match against [[Hapoel Ironi Kiryat Shmona F.C.|Hapoel Ironi Kiryat Shmona]], replacing goalscorer [[Yassine Benzia]] for the final 10 minutes of a 2–0 victory at the [[Stade de Gerland]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Imperious Lyon cruise past Kiryat Shmona |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000356/match=2010027/index.html |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=UEFA |date=6 December 2012}}</ref> His first [[Ligue 1]] game was on 3 February 2013 against [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]], when he came on as a substitute in the 79th minute for [[Rachid Ghezzal]] in a 3–1 away loss.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lyon boit la tasse à Ajaccio|trans-title=Lyon frink from the cup at Ajaccio |url=http://www.franceinfo.fr/sports/football/article/lyon-boit-la-tasse-ajaccio-225365 |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=France Info |date=3 February 2013 |language=French}}</ref> He made two further appearances from the bench that season.
===AS Monaco=== [[File:Anthony-Martial-2015.jpg|thumb|left|Martial playing for [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] in 2015]]
On 30 June 2013, [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] announced they had signed Martial to a three-year contract for a fee of €5 million plus bonuses.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.actusnews.com/documents_communiques/ACTUS-0-32624-olg-010713-cession-martial-acquisition-danic-gb.pdf? |title=Lyon Press Release |accessdate=4 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Anthony Martial sign AS Monaco FC |url=http://www.asm-fc.com/en/news/team/anthony-martial-sign-as-monaco-fc |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130708130906/http://www.asm-fc.com/en/news/team/anthony-martial-sign-as-monaco-fc |deadurl=yes |archivedate=8 July 2013 |publisher=AS Monaco FC |accessdate=8 July 2013}}</ref> On 24 November, he made his first league appearance for the club at the age of 17, replacing [[Radamel Falcao]] after 63 minutes and playing a part in [[Mounir Obbadi]]'s goal which gave victory away to [[FC Nantes]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Nantes 0–1 Monaco |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25049740 |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 November 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the principality club on his first start, a 2–0 win over [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] at the [[Stade Louis II]] six days later.<ref>{{cite news |title=Monaco: Une attaque Rivière-Martial contre Rennes|trans-title=Monaco: A Rivière-Martial attack against Rennes |url=http://www.sports.fr/football/ligue-1/scans/monaco-une-attaque-riviere-martial-contre-rennes-973857/ |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=Sports |date=30 November 2013 |language=French}}</ref> His campaign was disrupted by a sprained ankle against [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]] in December.<ref name=four/> On 27 January 2014, he extended his contract until June 2018.<ref name=four>{{cite news |title=Martial extends Monaco stay |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/au/news/martial-extends-monaco-stay |accessdate=31 August 2015 |magazine=FourFourTwo |date=27 January 2014}}</ref>
In his second season at Monaco, Martial scored nine goals in 36 Ligue 1 games, starting on 5 October 2014 when as a substitute for [[Lucas Ocampos]], he gained a 1–1 draw at reigning champions [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] with a last-minute strike from close range.<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Ames |title=Monaco's Anthony Martial thwarts PSG in battle of Ligue 1 big spenders |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/oct/05/psg-monaco-ligue-1-match-report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2015}}</ref> He scored twice against a 10-man [[SC Bastia|Bastia]] on 13 March 2015 in a 3–0 home victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Monaco 3–0 Bastia |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31826994 |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 March 2015}}</ref> On 26 June, he further extended his link with the team until 2019.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://m.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Martial-prolonge/435754 |newspaper=L'Équipe |location=Paris |title=Martial extends |date=27 June 2015 |accessdate=21 August 2015}}</ref>
On 4 August 2015, Martial scored his first goal in European competition, in a 4–0 home win over [[BSC Young Boys]] in the third qualifying round of the [[UEFA Champions League]]; Monaco advanced 7–1 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |title=UCL round-up: Ajax stunned by Rapid Vienna, Monaco thrash Young Boys to advance with ease |url=http://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/ucl-round-up-ajax-stunned-by-rapid-vienna-monaco-thrash-young-boys-to-advance-with-ease |accessdate=31 August 2015 |newspaper=The National |agency=Agence France-Presse |date=5 August 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== ====Transfer==== On 1 September 2015, Martial completed a move to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for £36 million, potentially rising to £58 million, on a four-year contract with the option of another year.<ref name=GuardianMartial>{{cite news |title=Anthony Martial signs for Manchester United for £36m from Monaco |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/sep/01/manchester-united-sign-monaco-forward-anthony-martial |accessdate=1 September 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |date=1 September 2015}}</ref><ref name=DailyMailMartial>{{cite news |title=Manchester United complete £36m Anthony Martial transfer on four-year deal |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3218622/Manchester-United-complete-36m-Anthony-Martial-transfer-four-year-deal.html |last1=Upal |first1=Sunni |last2=Barlow |first2=Matt |date=1 September 2015 |accessdate=1 September 2015 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}</ref> This was the highest transfer fee paid for a teenager, breaking the previous record of £27 million United paid for [[Luke Shaw]] a year earlier, and that Paris Saint-Germain had paid for [[Marquinhos]] in 2013.<ref name=bbc>{{cite news |title=Anthony Martial: Man Utd sign Monaco forward for £36m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34107092 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2015 |accessdate=1 September 2015}}</ref> United paid £36 million up front for Martial, but his contract contains three bonus clauses worth £7.2 million each, taking the potential fee to £57.6 million. The clauses each relate to certain accomplishments being achieved in the next four years, including if Martial scores 25 goals during that span, racks up 25 caps for [[France national football team|France]] or wins the [[FIFA Ballon d'Or|Ballon d'Or]] before June 2019.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Report: Martial Contract Clauses Emerge |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2561102-manchester-united-transfer-news-anthony-martial-clauses-reported-fresh-rumours |accessdate=5 October 2015 |first=Tom |last=Sunderland}}</ref> Manager [[Louis van Gaal]] called Martial an acquisition for United's future rather than for immediate use, and called the transfer fee "ridiculous", alleging that Manchester United regularly had to pay £10 million more than other teams.<ref name=DailyMailMartial/><ref>{{cite news |title=Paying £58.8m for Anthony Martial 'ridiculous', admits Louis van Gaal |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/sep/10/fee-anthony-martial-ridiculous-louis-van-gaal |accessdate=12 September 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=10 September 2015}}</ref>
Upon signing, Martial said, "I'm so excited to join United, I have always wanted to play in the Premier League and to join the biggest club in the world is what every young footballer dreams of." Van Gaal stated, "Anthony is a naturally talented, young, multi-functional forward with great potential. I believe this is the club for him to continue his development." The fee was reportedly met with astonishment by the French public.<ref name=bbc/>
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Anthony Martial 2015.jpg|thumb|right|Martial playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2015]]
Martial made his debut at [[Old Trafford]] on 12 September as a 65th-minute substitute for [[Juan Mata]], and scored the final goal of a 3–1 win over [[Liverpool F.C.–Manchester United F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 3–1 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34160795 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=12 September 2015 |accessdate=12 September 2015}}</ref> Van Gaal called it a "marvellous goal".<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/premier-league/anthony-martial-goal-v-liverpool-video-de-bruyne-son-make-first-epl-appearances-for-new-clubs/story-e6frf4a3-1227525759043 |title=Fox Sports |date=14 September 2015 |publisher=Fox Sports}}</ref> Eight days later, in his first Premier League start, he scored twice in an away win, 3–2 at [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Rostance |first1=Tom |title=Southampton 2–3 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34236981 |accessdate=20 September 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2015}}</ref> On 23 September, again as a replacement for Mata, Martial scored his fourth goal in four games for his new club, concluding a 3–0 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in the third round of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd 3–0 Ipswich |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34265442 |accessdate=23 September 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 September 2015}}</ref> Martial's early impact was praised by former United manager [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]], who stated that "he can do anything".<ref>{{Cite web |title=Sir Alex Ferguson has had his say on the new Man United scoring sensation |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/sir-alex-ferguson-hails-manchester-6517718 |accessdate=4 October 2015 |first=David |last=McDonnell}}</ref>
Martial won his first individual honour at United as he picked up the 'PFA Fan's Player of the Month' for September, in which he notched up three goals from two matches.<ref>{{cite news |title=Anthony Martial has already won an award at Manchester United |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/anthony-martial-wins-pfa-fans-6581857 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=10 October 2015}}</ref> A few days later, he gained his second trophy at United, as his strike against Liverpool earned him the club's 'Goal of the Month' for September.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Anthony Martial wins Manchester United's Goal of the Month award – Official Manchester United Website |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Oct/video-anthony-martial-debut-v-liverpool-voted-manchester-united-goal-of-the-month-september-2015.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=10 October 2015}}</ref> He was also named [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for September, the third-youngest player to receive the award after [[Micah Richards]] and [[Michael Owen]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34547130 |title=Anthony Martial: Man Utd forward wins player of the month |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 October 2015 |accessdate=16 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Martial and Pochettino win Barclays monthly awards |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2015-16/oct/161015-martial-and-pochettino-win-barclays-monthly-awards-for-september.html |accessdate=16 October 2015 |publisher=Premier League |date=16 October 2015}}</ref>
On 21 October, in a Champions League [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] match away to [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]], Martial gave away a penalty – which [[David de Gea]] saved from [[Roman Eremenko]] – and later equalised to confirm a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=CSKA 1–1 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34129032 |accessdate=21 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2015}}</ref> He was awarded the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]] as Europe's best under-21 player on 19 December.<ref name=swales>{{cite news |last1=Swales |first1=Andy |title=Manchester United's Anthony Martial is Europe's Golden Boy for 2015 |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10104305/manchester-uniteds-anthony-martial-is-europes-golden-boy-for-2015 |accessdate=19 December 2015 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 December 2015}}</ref>
Martial was key in a 2–1 win against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the [[FA Cup]] semi-final at [[Wembley Stadium]] on 23 April 2016: he assisted the first goal by [[Marouane Fellaini]] and scored an added-time winner.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wilson |first1=Paul |title=Anthony Martial takes Manchester United past Everton to final at the last |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/23/everton-manchester-united-fa-cup-match-report |accessdate=23 April 2016 |newspaper=The Observer |location=London |date=23 April 2016}}</ref> He finished the season as the club's top scorer in both the league and overall competitions with 11 goals and 17 goals respectively.
====2016–17 season==== [[File:Manchester United v Wigan Athletic, January 2017 (13).JPG|thumb|left|Martial playing for Manchester United in 2017]]
Martial retained his starting berth at Manchester United under new manager [[José Mourinho]], starting ahead of in-form teammate [[Marcus Rashford]] on the left wing for the opening few games of the season.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-news-martial-mata-11969075 |title=Martial deserves to start at Liverpool and more talking points |last=Luckhurst |first=Samuel |date=3 October 2016 |accessdate=5 October 2016}}</ref> The forward, however, lost his place in the starting line-up after several underwhelming performances, with the club tentatively attributing Martial's difficulties to ongoing problems in his personal life.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/oct/04/manchester-united-anthony-martial |title=Manchester United's Anthony Martial may be emerging from difficulties |last=Jackson |first=Jamie |date=4 October 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian |issn=0261-3077 |accessdate=5 October 2016}}</ref> Nevertheless, on 2 October 2016, Martial came off the bench at Old Trafford to score United's only goal—his first of the new season—against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], a game that ended in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37465187 |title=Manchester United 1–1 Stoke City |date=2 October 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 October 2016}}</ref>
On 30 November 2016, Martial was recalled to the side to face West Ham in the EFL Cup after receiving warnings about his starting spot in previous weeks from manager José Mourinho,<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-news-jose-mourinho-warns-anthony-martial-henrikh-mkhitaryan-a7440521.html |title=Manchester United news: Jose Mourinho warns Anthony Martial his chances are running out |newspaper=The Independent |date=26 November 2016}}</ref> he responded by scoring two goals in a 4–1 win to send United into the semi-final of the competition.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United sink West Ham with Martial and Ibrahimovic doubles |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/nov/30/manchester-united-west-ham-united-efl-cup-match-report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=30 November 2016}}</ref> Being in and out of Martial – Official Manchester United Website |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |accessdate=4 August 2017}}</ref> On 26 February, he was named in the starting XI that faced Southampton at Wembley ====2017–18 season==== {{Expand section|date=October 2018}} [[File:Anthony Martial 27 September 2017.jpg|thumb|right|Martial playing against [[CSKA Moscow]] in the 2017–18 Champions League]]
After a successful spell for Manchester United towards the end of last season, winning the League Cup and Europa League, Martial started the season as a substitute for most matches. Despite this Martial managed to score from the bench in United's first two leage matches against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], and again later against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]; with all three matches ending in a 4–0 win for United. Martial's first start of the season came on 20 September in a 4–1 win over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton upon Trent]] in the League Cup in which he also scored. Martial repeated this a week later in the Champions League, scoring in a 4–1 win over [[CSKA Moscow]]. In October Martial scored United's only goal in their win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] and again in November against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. In January, Martial scored again against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] away, scored against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] and provide the winning goal against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]. However following the January transfer season, Martial began to fall out of favour following the signing of Chilean forward [[Alexis Sanchez]] on 22 January. A lack of game time saw Martial fail to produce another goal for the club all season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=68556&season_id=150 |title=Anthony Martial – Football Stats – Manchester United – Season 2017/2018 – Soccer Base |website=Soccerbase |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> Because of this, there was heavy speculation that Martial would leave Manchester United during the summer transfer season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/28/football-transfer-rumours-atletico-madrid-milan-anthony-martial-manchester-united |title=Football transfer rumours: Atlético or Milan to end Anthony Martial misery? |first=Barry |last=Glendenning |date=28 August 2018 |accessdate=6 December 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/11667/11449281/man-utd-transfer-rumours-anthony-martial-harry-maguire |title=Man Utd transfer rumours: Anthony Martial, Harry Maguire – soccer News – Sky Sports |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://talksport.com/football/421757/transfer-news-gossip-manchester-united-liverpool-rangers-chelsea-arsenal-aston-villa/ |title=Martial to join PL rival, Rashford's future, Rangers bid for Liverpool starlet? |last=161385360554578 |date=13 September 2018 |website=talkSPORT |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref>

December, under new manager [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]], Martial scored his ninth of the season in a 5–1 victory over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/match-report-cardiff-1-manchester-united-5-premier-league |title=Report: Cardiff City 1 Manchester United 5 |publisher=Manchester United }}</ref> On 25 January 2019, Martial scored Manchester United's third goal in a 3–1 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the FA Cup Fourth Round; it was his first goal of 2019 and his 10th of the season.<ref>https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/01/25/arsenal-vs-manchester-united-fa-cup-fourth-round-live-score/</ref>
On 31 January 2019, Martial signed a new five-year contract with Manchester United.<ref>https://www.manutd.com/en/amp/news/detail/manchester-united-announces-new-contract-for-anthony-martial</ref> On 9 February, Martial assisted [[Paul Pogba]]'s opener before scoring United's second goal in a 3–0 win over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-man-utd/391009</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== [[File:Martial v England 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Martial playing for [[France national football team|France]] in 2015]]
Martial scored five goals as France topped their [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification|qualification group]] for the 2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship: two goals in a 5–0 win over the [[Faroe Islands national under-17 football team|Faroe Islands]], and a [[hat-trick]] against [[Northern Ireland national under-17 football team|Northern Ireland]] in Luxembourg.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Babaev |first1=David |title=Last-gasp Luxembourg go forward with France |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=1708361.html |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=UEFA |date=2 November 2011}}</ref> He added two more in [[2015 UEFA European Under-19 Championship elite round|elite round]] victories against [[Switzerland national under-17 football team|Switzerland]] and [[Sweden national under-17 football team|Sweden]] to confirm qualification.<ref>{{cite news |title=EDF/U17 = LA FRANCE EN PHASE FINALE !|trans-title=EDF/U17 = FRANCE IN THE FINALS! |url=http://www.lestitisdupsg.fr/edfu17-la-france-en-phase-finale/ |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=Les Titis du PSG |date=29 March 2012 |language=French}}</ref> He netted once in a group stage exit at the final tournament in Slovenia, a 2–2 opening game draw with [[Iceland national under-17 football team|Iceland]] at the [[Domžale Sports Park]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Ross |first1=Dan |title=Iceland comeback checks France |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=1792810.html |accessdate=31 August 2015 |date=4 May 2012}}</ref>
Martial played all five games for [[France national under-19 football team|France under-19]] at the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2013 European Championship]] in Lithuania, finishing as runners-up to [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Haslam |first1=Andrew |title=Luković strike seals first Serbia triumph |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/news/newsid=1978071.html |accessdate=31 August 2015 |publisher=UEFA |date=1 August 2013}}</ref> He was one of five Frenchmen selected in the Team of the Tournament.<ref>{{cite web |title=Technical Report |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2013/technical-report/tr-under19-2013.pdf |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=11 April 2016 |pages=18–19 |format=PDF}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 26 August 2015, Martial was called up to the senior France squad for the first time, for [[Exhibition game|friendlies]] against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] and [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] in the following month.<ref>{{cite news |title=Deschamps calls up Martial, leaves out Sakho |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/au/news/deschamps-calls-martial-leaves-out-sakho |accessdate=31 August 2015 |magazine=FourFourTwo |publisher=26 August 2015 |date=28 August 2015}}</ref> He made his debut in the former on 4 September at [[Lisbon]]'s [[Estádio José Alvalade]], replacing [[Karim Benzema]] for the final 16 minutes of a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Portugal 0–1 France: Valbuena strikes late to sink Ronaldo & Co |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/portugal-vs-france/1703405/report |accessdate=4 September 2015 |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 September 2015}}</ref> On 11 October, Martial made his first start for ''Les Bleus'' in a 2–1 win against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] at [[Parken Stadium]], Copenhagen, and assisted the opening goal by [[Olivier Giroud]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/finals/news/newsid=2292479.html |title=Giroud at the double as France see off Denmark |date=11 October 2015 |publisher=UEFA}}</ref> Due to Martial performances in the 2015–2016 season with Manchester United, he earned a spot on France's 23-man squad for [[Euro 2016]], in which France were the tournament runners up. On 17 May 2018, Martial was named on the standby list for the 23-man [[French national football team|French squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/12025/11376691/alexandre-lacazette-and-anthony-martial-on-standby-for-france-world-cup-squad-and-dimitri-payet-out |title=Alexandre Lacazette and Anthony Martial on standby for France World Cup squad and Dimitri Payet out – soccer News – Sky Sports |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref> However, he did not make the final squad for the tournament which saw France as champions for the second time.
==Style of play== Aziz Benaaddane, one of Martial's coaches at Les Ulis, told the [[BBC Sport]] in 2015 that as a six-year-old, Martial was able to run in a straight line to the goal: "We've got 400 youngsters playing for us but a talent like that arrives only once every five or six years. We felt it, we saw the potential and we pushed him".<ref name=ulis/> Mahamadou Niakite, another coach, added that Martial was put in higher age groups, as at the age of six he had the ability of most eight-year-olds, and at around the age of 12–13 he was focused on becoming a professional.<ref name=ulis/>
According to journalist [[Philippe Auclair]], Martial plays in a style similar to former French international [[Thierry Henry]], with speed and technical ability both in wide positions and up front.<ref name=bbc/> Henry himself praised Martial after his goalscoring debut,<ref>{{cite news |last=Chick |first1=Alex |title=Thierry Henry praises Anthony Martial goal: 'I love the finish' |url=http://www.eurosport.co.uk/football/premier-league-1/2015-2016/thierry-henry-praises-anthony-martial-goal-i-love-the-finish_sto4908970/story.shtml |date=12 September 2015 |accessdate=13 September 2015 |publisher=Eurosport}}</ref> while Martial himself refuted the comparison, saying "I don't think we have the same type of game – he was very quick whereas I rely more on power and technique. But it's always good to be compared to great players".<ref>{{cite web |last=Leras |first=Marc |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2235158.html |title=Martial seizing the day with Monaco |date=1 May 2015 |accessdate=18 October 2015 |publisher=UEFA}}</ref>
In the aftermath of France's 2–1 win over Denmark in October 2015, Fenerbahçe defender [[Simon Kjær]] was reportedly stunned after playing against him to learn that Martial was just 19. He told French newspaper ''[[L'Équipe]]'', "He's really good for 19. I didn't know him when I was in France. He's very, very hard to mark because he knows how to do a lot of things. Not only is he quick, but he's also technically good."<ref>{{cite web |last=Hover |first=Ashley |url=http://www.squawka.com/news/martial-very-hard-to-mark-says-denmark-defender-kjaer/489787 |title=Martial 'very hard' to mark, says Denmark defender Kjaer |date=14 October 2015 |accessdate=18 October 2015 |website=Squawka}}</ref>
Martial, for his part, has said that he prefers to play [[Forward (association football)|up front]], but that "if the coach puts me on [[Midfielder#Winger|the wing]] then that means it is better for the team and for me that is the most important thing."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://deadspin.com/a-reminder-that-anthony-martial-is-still-a-goddamn-chil-1767586063 |title=A Reminder That Anthony Martial Is Still A Goddamn Child |last=Haisley |first=Billy |date=28 March 2016 |website=Deadspin |accessdate=22 March 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Martial is of [[Guadeloupean]] descent.<ref>{{cite news |title=Un transfert ultra médiatique pour LE [''sic''] Guadeloupéen Anthony Martial|trans-title=A high-profile transfer for the Guadeloupean Anthony Martial |url=http://www.rci.fm/Dispatcher;jsessionid=19BF3D6C0F73DD4165149017F14683B3?action=ArticleAction&id=110229 |accessdate=24 November 2015 |publisher=Radio Caraibe International |language=French}}</ref> His older brother, [[Johan Martial|Johan]], is a professional [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for Israeli club [[Maccabi Petah Tikva F.C.|Maccabi Petah Tikva]], who represented France up to [[France national under-20 football team|under-20 level]]. He has another older brother, Dorian, who is in the senior team at Les Ulis.<ref name=ulis>{{cite news |title=Anthony Martial: The making of Manchester United's star |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34534193 |accessdate=24 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2015}}</ref> The Martial family placed high emphasis on the education of their children.<ref name=ulis/> His youth coaches describe him as a shy and quiet person.<ref name=ulis/> Martial is a [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] and prays before every match.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/bizarre/1493493/worst-case-scenario-for-manchester-united-striker-anthony-martial-as-lover-and-ex-wife-samantha-team-up/ |title=Worst case scenario for Manchester United striker Anthony Martial as lover and ex-wife team up |date=24 July 2016 |accessdate=4 August 2017}}</ref>
