Reserves and Academy|Manchester United]] | years1 = 2014– |clubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps1 = 14 |goals1 = 1<!-- LEAGUE ONLY --> | years2 = 2016–2017 |clubs2 = → [[Granada CF|Granada]] (loan) |caps2 = 35 |goals2 = 5 | years3 = 2017–2018 |clubs3 = → [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] (loan) |caps3 = 23 |goals3 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2010–2011 |nationalteam1 = Belgium U15 |nationalcaps1 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2011–2012 |nationalteam2 = Belgium U16 |nationalcaps2 = 9 |nationalgoals2 = 10 | nationalyears3 = 2012–2013 |nationalteam3 = [[Belgium national under-17 football team|Belgium U17]] |nationalcaps3 = 11 |nationalgoals3 = 2 | nationalyears4 = 2014–2015 |nationalteam4 = [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil U20]] |nationalcaps4 = 8 |nationalgoals4 = 2 | nationalyears5 = 2016– |nationalteam5 = [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil U23]] |nationalcaps5 = 1 |nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2018– |nationalteam6 = [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] |nationalcaps6 = 1 |nationalgoals6 = 0 | club-update = 03:11, 7 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 03:10, 12 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Andreas Hugo Hoelgebaum Pereira''' (born 1 January 1996) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]].
Born in [[Duffel]], Belgium, he began his youth career with nearby [[Lommel SK|Lommel United]]. At the age of nine, he joined Dutch club [[PSV Eindhoven]], before signing for Manchester United in November 2011. Pereira made his first Premier League appearance in March 2015. He has spent time on loan at Spanish clubs [[Granada CF|Granada]] and [[Valencia CF|Valencia]].
He played international football for the youth teams of both the country of his birth, Belgium, and his father's homeland, Brazil, before making his senior debut for Brazil in September 2018.
==Club career==
===Manchester United=== ====Early years==== The son of former Brazilian professional footballer [[Marcos Antônio Pereira|Marcos Pereira]],<ref name="influenced">{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Pereira influenced by dad |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Mar/andreas-pereira-explains-fathers-influence-on-career.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=12 March 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> Andreas Pereira was born in [[Duffel]], Belgium, while his father was a player there. He began his career with nearby [[Lommel United]],<ref>{{cite news |title=United set to clinch deal for Brazilian-born PSV hot shot Pereira |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2058378/Manchester-United-sign-PSVs-Andreas-Pereira.html |publisher=Mail Online (Associated Newspapers) |date=7 November 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> one of his father's former clubs, before moving just across the Dutch border to [[PSV Eindhoven]] in 2005, when he was nine years old. In 2011, after impressing at the [[Manchester United Premier Cup]],<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Pereira making progress |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Exclusive-Interviews/2014/Mar/andreas-pereira-exclusive-interview-with-inside-united-magazine.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=25 March 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> he became a target for several big English clubs, including [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], but a visit from [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] manager [[Alex Ferguson]] in November 2011 convinced Pereira to sign for the [[Old Trafford]] club.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ewan |last=Murray |title=Alex Ferguson seals recruitment of PSV's Andreas Hoelgebaum Pereira |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/nov/07/alex-ferguson-andreas-hoelgebaum-pereira |work=The Guardian |publisher=Guardian News and Media |date=7 November 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref>
Due to regulations regarding international transfers, the move could not be completed until Pereira's 16th birthday on 1 January 2012, and further complications with international clearance meant that his Manchester United debut was delayed until April 2012. He made his debut for the under-18s in a league match away to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on 25 April 2012, but heavy rain meant the match had to be abandoned as a goalless draw after 35 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |first1=Adam |last1=Marshall |first2=Adam |last2=Bostock |title=U18: Sheff Wed A United A |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2012/Apr/academy-sheffield-wednesday-v-manchester-united.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=25 April 2012 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> He made two more appearances that season as the under-18s finished eighth out of 10 teams in their [[Premier Academy League]] group.
After signing as an academy scholar in July 2012, Pereira became a regular in the under-18s in the 2012–13 season, making 20 appearances and scoring five goals. He also got his first taste of reserve team football during the season, coming on as a substitute for [[James Weir (footballer)|James Weir]] in a 3–1 win over [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] in the [[Manchester Senior Cup]], followed by another substitute appearance against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the semi-finals of the [[2012–13 Professional U21 Development League|Professional Development League]]. In recognition of his performances, on 7 January 2013, shortly after his 17th birthday, Pereira received his first professional contract.<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Pereira signs pro deal |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/The-Academy/Academy-News/2013/Jan/andreas-pereira-signs-professional-terms.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=7 January 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> Ahead of the 2013–14 season, Pereira was named as Manchester United's captain for their [[2013 Milk Cup]] campaign, and was named Player of the Tournament for his three goals as Manchester United won the Premier Section.<ref name="profile">{{cite web |title=Andreas Pereira |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Andreas-Pereira.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> He went on to feature heavily for both the under-18s and the under-21s, and was ever present in the inaugural [[2013–14 UEFA Youth League|UEFA Youth League]]; he also scored twice in three appearances in the [[FA Youth Cup]], including a curling, 25-yard effort against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in the third round.<ref name="introducing">{{cite news |title=Introducing: Andreas Pereira |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/United-Uncovered/News/2013/Dec/Issue-47/Introducing-Andreas-Pereira-Manchester-United-Under18s-midfielder.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=20 December 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> For the under-21s, he appeared in 17 out of 21 league matches as Manchester United finished third; he then scored the only goal in the semi-final against Liverpool,<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=U21: Liverpool 0 United 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2014/May/liverpool-v-manchester-united-under-21-semi-final-match-report.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> only for the team to lose to Chelsea in the final.<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=U21s: United 1 Chelsea 2 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2014/May/manchester-united-v-chelsea-under-21-final-match-report.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Pereira began the 2014–15 season with silverware as Manchester United beat [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] 4–1 in the final of the Manchester Senior Cup on 7 August 2014.<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=MSC: City 1 United Reserves 4 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Reserves-News/2014/Aug/match-report-manchester-senior-cup-final-city-v-united.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=7 August 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> He made his senior debut three weeks later, coming on as a half-time substitute for [[Saidy Janko]] in a 4–0 away defeat to [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in the second round of the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=MK Dons 4-0 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28847955 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=26 August 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2014 }}</ref> On 15 March 2015, Pereira made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], coming on as a 77th-minute substitute for [[Juan Mata]] in a 3–0 win for United.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31785852 |title=Manchester United 3–0 Tottenham Hotspur |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=15 March 2015 |accessdate=16 March 2015}}</ref>
On 1 May, he signed a new contract with Manchester United until at least June 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Andreas Pereira signs new contract |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/May/Andreas-Pereira-signs-new-contract.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=1 May 2015 |accessdate=2 May 2015 }}</ref> Eighteen days later, Pereira was voted Manchester United's under-21 player of the year for 2014–15.<ref>{{cite news |first1=Mark |last1=Froggatt |first2=Adam |last2=Bostock |title=Pereira wins U21s Player of the Year award |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/May/Andreas-Pereira-wins-Manchester-United-Under-21s-Player-of-the-Year-award.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=19 May 2015 |accessdate=20 May 2015 }}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== On 21 July, Pereira scored his first goal for Manchester United's senior squad in the 3–1 win against the [[San Jose Earthquakes]] in the [[2015 International Champions Cup]], after coming on as a second-half substitute.<ref>{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=United 3 Earthquakes 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Tour-2015/News-and-Features/2015/Jul/Manchester-United-vs-San-Jose-Earthquakes-match-report-21-july-2015.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=21 July 2015 |accessdate=22 July 2015 }}</ref> He made his first competitive start for the senior team on 23 September 2015, in the third round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]], and scored a free kick in the eventual 3–0 win over [[Ipswich Town]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Man Utd 3-0 Ipswich|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34265442|accessdate=23 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 September 2015}}</ref>
====2016–17 season (loan to Granada)==== On 26 August 2016, Pereira joined Spanish club [[Granada CF|Granada]] on a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Aug/andreas-pereira-set-to-be-loaned-to-granada-in-la-liga.aspx|title=Pereira to seal loan move to Granada|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=26 August 2016|access-date=26 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut in [[La Liga]] two days later, replacing [[Luís Martins (footballer, born 1992)|Luís Martins]] in the 55th minute of a 5–1 loss at [[UD Las Palmas]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Las Palmas es líder 38 años después y presume de pegada|trans-title=Las Palmas is leader for first time in 38 years and makes a mark|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2016/08/28/primera/1472397272_461450.html|accessdate=10 March 2017|work=[[Diario AS]]|date=29 August 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Brazilian Andreas Pereira says he joined Granada for its playing style|url=https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/brazilian-andreas-pereira-says-he-joined-granada-for-its-playing-style|accessdate=10 March 2017|publisher=Sportskeeda|date=30 August 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref>
Pereira scored his first goal for the ''Nazaríes'' on 3 December, opening a 2–1 home win over fellow [[Andalusia]]ns [[Sevilla FC]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Pereira feliz por su primer gol y por la victoria ante el Sevilla|trans-title=Pereira happy with his first goal and victory against Sevilla|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/facebook-ia/20161204/412395504937/pereira-granada-sevilla.html|accessdate=10 March 2017|work=[[Mundo Deportivo]]|date=4 December 2016|language=Spanish}}</ref> On 6 February 2017, he netted the only goal of a win over Las Palmas at the [[Estadio Nuevo Los Cármenes]], with a long-range strike.<ref>{{cite news|title=WATCH: On-loan Man Utd midfielder Andreas Pereira scores stunner for Granada|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10758887/watch-on-loan-man-utd-midfielder-andreas-pereira-scores-stunner-for-granada|accessdate=10 March 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 February 2017}}</ref> Eleven days later, he was again on the scoresheet for a 4–1 victory against [[Real Betis]] at the same ground, but was sent off for a push;<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester United loanee Andreas Pereira scores, assists and gets sent off for Granada in 4-1 win vs Real Betis|url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/02/18/manchester-united-loanee-andreas-pereira-scores-assists-and-gets-sent-off-for-granada-in-4-1-win-vs-real-betis-6456536/|accessdate=10 March 2017|work=Metro|date=18 February 2017}}</ref> he was banned for two games and the club fined €180.<ref>{{cite news|title=Apelación levanta los dos partidos de sanción a Andreas Pereira|trans-title=Appeals committee raises Andreas Pereira's suspension to two matches|url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/granada/2017/02/23/58af2e35e5fdea24798b45b7.html|accessdate=10 March 2017|work=Marca|date=23 February 2017|language=Spanish}}</ref>
====2017–18 season (loan to Valencia)==== On 1 September 2017, [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] announced the arrival of Pereira to the club on a season-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Official Statement Andreas Pereira|url=http://en.valenciacf.com/ver/72853/comunicado-oficial--andreas-pereira.html|work=Valencia CF|date=1 September 2017|accessdate=1 September 2017}}</ref> He made his debut in a 0–0 home draw against [[Atlético Madrid]] eight days later, and scored his only goal for ''Los Che'' on 15 October, with a long-range strike as a substitute to conclude a 6–3 win at [[Real Betis]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kelly|first1=Ciaran|title=Manchester United loan star Andreas Pereira shows class with stunning Valencia goal|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-utd-news-andreas-pereira-13766160|accessdate=14 January 2018|work=Manchester Evening News|date=16 October 2017}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 2 March 2019, Pereira scored his first Premier League goal in a home match against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. He also recorded an assist for Romelu Lukaku in the same match.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=Manchester United 3-2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47340490 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 March 2019 |accessdate=2 March 2019 }}</ref>
On 7 March 2019, Pereira was featured in the starting lineup during the historic [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] Round of 16 (2nd Leg) win vs [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|PSG]], where the team was able to come back from a 2 goal deficit they conceded at home and win on away goals at the [[Parc des Princes]], a record that has never been broken before.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/11656988/paris-saint-germain-1-3-man-utd-3-3-on-agg-var-penalty-seals-history-making-champions-league-comeback|title=Paris Saint-Germain 1-3 Man Utd (3-3 on agg): VAR pen seals historic Champions League comeback|website=Sky Sports|language=en|access-date=2019-03-10}}</ref>
==International career==
Born in Belgium to a Brazilian father and a mother of German descent, Pereira is eligible to represent either Belgium or Brazil at international level. He initially represented Belgium at [[Belgium national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[Belgium national under-18 football team|under-18]] level,<ref name="influenced"/> but has since stated, "My heart is Brazilian."<ref name="introducing"/> He received his first Brazil call-up in 2014, joining the [[Brazil national under-20 football team|under-20s]] on their successful [[2014 Panda Cup|Panda Cup]] campaign in China.<ref name="profile"/>
At the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in New Zealand, Pereira equalised in the final against [[Serbia national under-20 football team|Serbia]], but Brazil lost 2–1 after extra time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Under-20 World Cup: Serbia beat Brazil in Auckland final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33210273|accessdate=20 June 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=20 June 2015}}</ref>
On 17 August 2018, he received his first senior call up for the friendly matches against [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] and [[El Salvador national football team|El Salvador]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12027/11475176/manchester-uniteds-andreas-pereira-called-up-for-brazil-as-four-man-city-stars-miss-out|title=Manchester United's Andreas Pereira called up for Brazil as four Man City stars miss out |website=skysports.com |publisher=Sky Sports |date=17 August 2018|accessdate=18 August 2018}}</ref> He made his debut against El Salvador on 11 September, as the first player in over 100 years to play for Brazil having been born outside of the country.<ref>{{cite news |title=Andreas Pereira makes historic Brazil debut |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/pereira-makes-historic-international-debut |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=12 September 2018 |accessdate=6 March 2019}}</ref>

América|2015 Chile]]|}} {{Medal|RU|[[Copa América Centenario|2016 United States]]|}} }} '''Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo''' ({{IPA-es|ˈmaɾkoz ˈroxo}};{{efn-ua|In isolation, ''Marcos'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|ˈmaɾkos|}}.}} born 20 March 1990) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentine national team]].
He began his career at local club [[Estudiantes de La Plata]], where he won the [[Copa Libertadores]] in 2009 and played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final|Club World Cup Final]] later that year. After a short spell with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] he joined [[Sporting CP]] in 2012, and transferred to Manchester United for £16 million two years later.
Rojo made his first appearance for Argentina at senior level in 2011 and has since earned over 50 caps. He was part of their side which reached the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]], and was the only Argentine included in the [[Castrol Performance Index]] Team of the Tournament. He was also a [[Copa América]] runner-up in [[2015 Copa América|2015]] and [[Copa América Centenario|2016]] and took part at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Estudiantes LP=== Rojo grew up in [[La Plata]], Argentina and joined his local side [[Estudiantes de La Plata]] at the age of ten.<ref name=pickup/>
In 2009, he was promoted to the club's main team, after signing his first professional contract. He spent three years with the club, making 43 appearances and scoring three goals for the team.<ref>http://www.espnfc.com/player/129426/marcos-rojo, Marcos Rojo – Player Profile, [[ESPN FC]]</ref> He played in the [[2009 FIFA Club World Cup Final]], coming on for extra time as Estudiantes lost 2–1 to [[FC Barcelona]] in [[Dubai]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Estduiantes 1–2 Barcelona|url=https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/clubworldcup/uae2009/matches/round=252913/match=300111971/index.html|publisher=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=30 August 2014}}</ref>
During his time at Estudiantes, Rojo won a [[Copa Libertadores]] and an [[Argentine Primera División]] title. The defender spent most matches at [[left back]] and developed a reputation as a capable attacker, scoring his first goal in a 2–1 defeat against [[LDU Quito]] in the [[2010 Recopa Sudamericana]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Liga de Quito gana 2-1 a Estudiantes, en juego de ida de la Recopa Sudamericana|url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-7880081|accessdate=6 April 2018|work=El Tiempo|date=25 August 2010|language=Spanish}}</ref>
===Spartak Moscow=== [[File:Marcos Rojo 6127.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Rojo playing for [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in March 2011.]] In December 2010, Rojo signed a five-year contract with [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]].<ref>{{cite web|script-title=ru:Попов: с Рохо в России можно сравнить разве что Луковича|url=http://www.championat.com/football/news-685686.html|publisher=Championat|accessdate=12 August 2014|language=Russian|date=19 December 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924150333/http://www.championat.com/football/news-685686.html|archivedate=24 September 2015}}</ref> He scored his only goal for Spartak on 20 April 2011, netting the opening goal of a 2–1 defeat of [[FC Krasnodar|Krasnodar]] in the quarter-finals of the [[2010–11 Russian Cup#Quarterfinals|Russian Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/04/20/russia/cup/fk-spartak-moskva/fk-krasnodar/1086566/ |title=Spartak Moskva vs. Krasnodar 2–1 |work=Soccerway |date=20 April 2011 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref>
===Sporting CP=== In July 2012, Rojo moved from Spartak Moscow to [[Sporting CP]] for £3.5 million, signing a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/91/portugal/2012/07/20/3252963/sporting-lisbon-swoop-for-spartak-moscow-defender-marcos |title=Sporting Lisbon swoop for Spartak Moscow defender Marcos Rojo |publisher=Goal |date=20 July 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> Rojo made his [[Primeira Liga]] debut for Sporting on 19 August 2012, playing the entire match and receiving a yellow card in a 0–0 draw with [[Vitória S.C.|Vitória de Guimarães]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/08/19/portugal/portuguese-liga-/vitoria-guimaraes/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1316779/ |title=VITÓRIA GUIMARÃES VS. SPORTING CP 0 – 0 |work=Soccerway |date=19 August 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> He received his first red card for Sporting in a league match against [[FC Porto|Porto]] on 7 October 2012, picking up two cautions within three minutes as Sporting fell to a 2–0 defeat.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/10/07/portugal/portuguese-liga-/futebol-clube-do-porto/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1316817/ |title=Porto vs. Sporting CP 2–0 |work=Soccerway |date=7 October 2012 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> He scored his first goal for Sporting on 28 April 2013, netting the winner against [[C.D. Nacional|Nacional]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/04/28/portugal/portuguese-liga-/sporting-clube-de-portugal/clube-desportivo-nacional/1316982/ |title=Sporting CP vs. CD Nacional 2–1 |work=Soccerway |date=28 April 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> Rojo played mostly at centre-back in his first season in Portugal, occasionally at left-back, as the team had a comparatively bad season,<ref name=four>{{cite news|last1=Kundert|first1=Tom|title=Everything you need to know about... Marcos Rojo|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/everything-you-need-know-about-marcos-rojo|accessdate=8 February 2015|work=[[Four Four Two]]|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> finishing seventh in the [[2012–13 Primeira Liga|league]].
In the second league match of the [[2013–14 Sporting Clube de Portugal season|2013–14 season]], Rojo scored his first goal of the season, netting Sporting's second goal in their 4–0 win over [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica de Coimbra]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/08/24/portugal/portuguese-liga-/associacao-academica-de-coimbra/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1511712/ |title=Académica vs. Sporting CP 0–4 |work=Soccerway |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> On 19 April 2014, Rojo was sent off in a Primeira Liga match against [[C.F. Os Belenenses|Belenenses]], but Sporting held on for a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/19/portugal/portuguese-liga-/clube-futebol--os-belenenses/sporting-clube-de-portugal/1511924/ |title=Belenenses vs. Sporting Club |work=Soccerway |date=19 April 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> In an improved season, he contributed six goals as Sporting finished as runners-up.<ref name=four/>
On 13 August 2014, it was announced that Rojo was being disciplined by his club over his refusal to train after handing in a transfer request to force through a move to [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28763841 |title=Manchester United try to resolve Marcos Rojo stand-off |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 August 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> Sporting president Bruno de Carvalho later alleged that third-party owners of Rojo who were not representatives of Manchester United had pressured his club into selling the player.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester United: Sporting reveal Marcos Rojo sale 'pressure'|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29474696|accessdate=4 October 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 October 2014}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== On 19 August 2014, an agreement to sell Rojo for €20 million (£16 million) was announced by both Sporting and Manchester United.<ref name=sporting_confirmation>{{cite web|title=Da venda de Marcos Rojo para o Man.Utd, 9M€ irão para a construção do nosso Pavilhão|trans-title=From the sale of Marcos Rojo to Man.Utd, €9M will go towards the construction of our Pavilion|url=https://twitter.com/Sporting_CP/status/501788409745403904|website=twitter.com|publisher=Sporting CP|accessdate=19 August 2014|language=Portuguese|date=19 August 2014}}</ref><ref name=cmvm_document1>{{cite web|title=COMUNICADO|url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi2004/emitentes/docs/FR51803.pdf|website=cmvm.pt|publisher=Portuguese Securities Market Commission|accessdate=19 August 2014|language=Portuguese|date=19 August 2014}}</ref><ref name=man_utd_confirmation>{{cite web|title=#mufc has reached agreement with Sporting Lisbon to sign defender Marcos Rojo, subject to a medical and personal terms.|url=https://twitter.com/ManUtd/status/501800168849948672|website=twitter.com|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|accessdate=19 August 2014|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> The next day, United announced that they had signed him on a five-year contract, with [[Nani]] moving to Sporting on a season-long loan. Rojo stated that it was a "dream come true" to play with Manchester United.<ref name="Manchester United sign Marcos Rojo">{{cite web|title=Manchester United sign Marcos Rojo for £16m on five-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28858116|website=bbc.co.uk/sport|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 August 2014| date=20 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Marcos Rojo: Overview |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/10472/Marcos-Rojo/overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=10 January 2018}}</ref>
Rojo missed three matches for United due to difficulties in gaining a [[work permit]], because of pending criminal charges in Argentina, where he is alleged to have had an altercation with a neighbour in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Keegan|first1=Mike|title=Marcos Rojo: Man United signing's debut held up by visa delay|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29000089|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 August 2014|date=30 August 2014}}</ref> On 4 September, he was granted a work permit by the [[UK Border Agency]] to work in England.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-united/story/2019765/marcos-rojo-granted-work-permit-to-play-for-manchester-united |title=Marcos Rojo granted work permit to play for Manchester United |work=ESPNFC |date=4 September 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014 }}</ref> Ten days later he made his debut at [[Old Trafford]] as United won for the first time in the season, playing the entirety of the 4–0 victory over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd 4–0 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29098240 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2014 |accessdate=16 September 2014 }}</ref> Rojo was stretchered off in United's 1–0 defeat in the [[Manchester derby]] on 2 November, sustaining shoulder damage from a tackle on [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s [[Martín Demichelis]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Man City 1–0 Man Utd|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29775977|accessdate=2 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 November 2014}}</ref> It was later confirmed that he had dislocated his shoulder, adding to United's defensive injuries alongside [[Jonny Evans]] and [[Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992)|Phil Jones]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Marcos Rojo: Manchester United defender dislocates shoulder|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29873143|accessdate=3 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 November 2014}}</ref> On 3 February 2015, Rojo scored his first goal for United, heading a ball played by [[Robin van Persie]] for the second goal of a 3–0 win over [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]] in an [[2014–15 FA Cup|FA Cup]] fourth round replay.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cryer|first1=Andy|title=Man Utd 3–0 Cambridge|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30991120|accessdate=3 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 February 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Cskamu 21.jpg|thumb|right|Rojo taking a throw-in for Manchester United in the [[2015-16 UEFA Champions League|2015-16 Champions League]].]] During Manchester United's 2015 pre-season tour of North America, Rojo was expected to join up with the rest of the squad following an extended break granted after competing for Argentina in the Copa América. However, passport issues reportedly caused Rojo to miss pre-season tour entirely, and the matter was said to have "angered" manager [[Louis van Gaal]]. Rojo was resultantly fined £140,000 for failing to join up with the rest of the squad on time.<ref>{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Lovett |title=Marcos Rojo faces £140,000 fine for missing Manchester United's US pre-season tour |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/marcos-rojo-faces-140000-fine-for-missing-manchester-uniteds-us-pre-season-tour-10420525.html |website=independent.co.uk |publisher=Independent Digital News & Media |date=28 July 2015 |accessdate=2 July 2017 }}</ref> In the [[2016 FA Cup Final]], which United won 2–1 after extra time against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], Rojo was booked in the first half for fouling [[Pape Souaré]] and was substituted for [[Matteo Darmian]] after 66 minutes.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265|accessdate=6 April 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 May 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Manchester United v FC Rostov, March 2017 (31).JPG|thumb|left|Rojo (centre) in a Europa League match against [[FC Rostov]] in March 2017]] On 4 March 2017, Rojo scored his first Premier League goal to open a 1–1 home draw against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Chowdhury|first1=Saj|title=Manchester United 1–1 Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39086674|accessdate=6 April 2018|date=4 March 2017}}</ref> He suffered a season-ending cruciate ligament injury on 20 April, during a 2–1 win over [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] in the quarter-finals of the Europa League, a tournament that United ended up winning.<ref>{{cite web|title=Man United's Rojo out for season with cruciate ligament injury – reports|url=http://www.espn.in/football/manchester-united/story/3109139/man-uniteds-marcos-rojo--out-for-season-with-ruptured-cruciate-ligament-reports|publisher=ESPN|date=21 April 2017|accessdate=16 June 2017}}</ref> He made his return on 28 November 2017, in a 4–2 win at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hafez|first1=Shamoon|title=Watford 2–4 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42061044|accessdate=6 April 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 November 2017}}</ref>
On 16 March 2018, Rojo signed a new contract with Manchester United which will keep him at the club until June 2021, with the option to extend for a further year.[https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/marcos-rojo-signs-new-contract-at-manchester-united]
==International career== [[File:Marcos Rojo (L), Ricardo Quaresma (R) – Portugal vs. Argentina, 9th February 2011.jpg|thumb|left|Rojo (left), pictured with Portugal's [[Ricardo Quaresma]], in an international friendly in 2011.]] Rojo was first capped on 9 February 2011, in a 2–1 friendly victory against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at the [[Stade de Genève]], [[Geneva]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Daniel|title=Argentina 2–1 Portugal: Last-gasp Lionel Messi penalty secures entertaining victory after Cristiano Ronaldo equaliser|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/argentina-vs-portugal/1053668/report|accessdate=5 September 2014|work=Goal.com|date=9 February 2011}}</ref> Later that year he was included in Argentina's squad as they hosted the [[2011 Copa América]], and played the opening match on 2 July, a 1–1 draw against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Gonzalez|first1=Roger|title=Argentina 1–1 Bolivia: Kun Aguero saves Sergio Batista's men in Copa America opener|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/argentina-vs-bolivia/1049131/report|accessdate=5 September 2014|work=Goal.com|date=2 July 2011}}</ref> [[Javier Zanetti]] replaced him at left back for the rest of the tournament as Argentina reached the quarter-finals.
[[File:Germany and Argentina face off in the final of the World Cup 2014 -2014-07-13 (27).jpg|thumb|Rojo dribbling past Germany's [[Christoph Kramer]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]]]] In June 2014, Rojo was named in Argentina's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=demichelis-in-argentina-squad-as-trio-miss-out-2353431.html |title=Demichelis in Argentina squad as trio miss out |date=2 June 2014 |accessdate=21 June 2014 |work=FIFA |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701121936/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y%3D2014/m%3D6/news%3Ddemichelis-in-argentina-squad-as-trio-miss-out-2353431.html |archivedate=1 July 2014 |df= }}</ref> He made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut in their 2–1 victory over [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Estádio do Maracanã|Maracanã]], playing the full match in defence, and contributing to [[Sead Kolašinac]]'s own goal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285099|title=Argentina 2–1 Bos-Herce|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|work=BBC}}</ref> In the team's third group match, Rojo scored his first international goal, the winner in a 3–2 victory against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285406|title=Nigeria 2–3 Argentina|date=25 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014|work=BBC}}</ref> The country reached the final before losing to [[Germany national football team|Germany]], and Rojo was the only Argentinean named in the [[Castrol Index]] Top 11 for the tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/statistics/castrol-index/top11.html |title=World Cup 2014: Castrol Index Top 11 |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=14 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141230231236/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/statistics/castrol-index/top11.html |archivedate=30 December 2014 |df= }}</ref>
Rojo was selected by coach [[Gerardo Martino]] for the [[2015 Copa América]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://canchallena.lanacion.com.ar/1796405-gerardo-martino-confirmo-la-lista-de-23-convocados-y-mantuvo-a-casco-para-la-copa-america|title=Gerardo Martino confirmó la lista de 23 convocados y mantuvo a Casco para la Copa América|trans-title=Gerardo Martino confirmed list of 23 selected and kept Casco for the Copa América|publisher=[[La Nación]]|language=Spanish|date=27 May 2015|accessdate=27 May 2015}}</ref> At the end of Argentina's goalless quarter-final against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in [[Viña del Mar]], Rojo missed in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] but his team advanced nonetheless.<ref>{{cite news|title=Argentina 0–0 Colombia|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085867|accessdate=27 June 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 June 2015}}</ref> On 30 June, he opened the scoring in a 6–1 semi-final defeat of [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]] which put Argentina into the [[2015 Copa América Final|final]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Emons|first1=Michael|title=Argentina 6–1 Paraguay|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085956|accessdate=1 July 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 July 2015}}</ref> He played the entirety of the decisive match against [[Chile national football team|the hosts]] at the [[Estadio Nacional de Chile]], which Argentina lost on a [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] after a goalless draw.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Chile 0–0 Argentina|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085977|accessdate=20 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 July 2015}}</ref>
A year later for the [[Copa América Centenario]] in the United States, Rojo was again in Martino's squad.<ref>{{cite news |title=Carlos Tevez omitted from Argentina's Copa America squad |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12026/10289961/carlos-tevez-omitted-from-argentinas-copa-america-squad |accessdate=26 June 2018 |agency=Reuters |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 May 2016}}</ref> In the final on 26 June at [[MetLife Stadium]], he was sent off in the first half for a foul on [[Arturo Vidal]], as both teams ended the goalless game on 10 men and Chile again won on penalties.<ref>{{cite news |title=Marcelo Díaz y Rojo ven la roja ¡en la primera parte!|trans-title=Marcelo Díaz and Rojo see red in the first half! |url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/copa-america/2016/06/27/57707c76e5fdeaf50b8b4623.html |accessdate=26 June 2018 |work=Marca |date=27 June 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
Rojo was named by [[Jorge Sampaoli]] in the Argentina squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced?|work=Goal.com}}</ref> On 26 June, he scored the winning goal in Argentina's 2–1 triumph over Nigeria, which secured the team's qualification for the knockout stage as group runners-up behind [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/06/26/nigeria-vs-argentina-world-cup-2018-live-score-lionel-messi/|title=Marcos Rojo saves Argentina's World Cup dream with late winner to send Nigeria home|work=The Telegraph}}</ref> In the round of 16 match against [[France national football team|France]] on 30 June, he was booked after conceding a penalty in the 10th minute for a foul on [[Kylian Mbappé]], which was later converted by [[Antoine Griezmann]], who opened the scoring. Rojo was later [[Substitute (association football)|replaced]] by [[Federico Fazio]] in the 46th minute. Argentina lost the match 4–3 and were eliminated from the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976007 |title=France 4-3 Argentina |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Emlyn Begley |date=30 June 2018 |accessdate=30 June 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/06/30/france-vs-argentina-world-cup-2018-live-score-lionel-messi-latest/ |title=Kylian Mbappe destroys Argentina to send Lionel Messi and co home in World Cup thriller |work=The Telegraph |author1=Sam Wallace |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/30/sports/world-cup/argentina-vs-france.html|title=Lionel Messi's World Cup ends in a blur of goals by France|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|author=Cristopher Clarey|date=30 June 2018|accessdate=30 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331537 |title=France 4-3 Argentina |date=30 June 2018 |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=30 June 2018 }}</ref>
==Style of play== According to ''[[Four Four Two]]'' magazine, Rojo was more comfortable at [[left back]] rather than [[centre back]] in his first season at Sporting, due to a number of positional errors and mistimed tackles; in his second season, his speed helped him in defence.<ref name=four/> They also attributed a good aerial threat to him, while noting that disciplinary problems remained.<ref name=four/>
In addition to his usual positions at centre-back and left-back, Rojo can play as a [[winger (association football)|winger]]. On signing for Manchester United, it was theorised that he could feature as a [[wing-back (association football)|wing-back]] in [[Louis van Gaal]]'s preferred 3–5–2 formation.<ref name=pickup>{{cite news|last1=Pickup|first1=Oliver|title=Marcos Rojo: 13 things you might not know about Manchester United transfer target|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/11030599/Marcos-Rojo-13-things-you-might-not-know-about-Manchester-United-transfer-target.html|accessdate=8 February 2015|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=19 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Cutler|first1=Teddy|title=Marcos Rojo profile: Who is the £16m Manchester United signing?|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/marcos-rojo-profile-who-is-the-15m-manchester-united-target-9664886.html|accessdate=8 February 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|date=20 August 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== Rojo is married to Eugenia Lusardo, a lingerie model based in [[Lisbon]]. They have a daughter.<ref name=pickup/>
Rojo has a number of [[tattoos]], including the English words "Pride" and "Glory" on each thigh.<ref name=pickup/>
In December 2014, Rojo had an affair with a woman he had met at a night club. He accused her of [[blackmail]] and took out an [[injunction]] to stop newspapers publishing his name in the story. The injunction on his name was lifted in April 2015 due to concerns that other footballers could be suspected of the affair, but it remains in place to prevent the release of images of Rojo.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dearden|first1=Lizzie|title=Manchester United's Marcos Rojo named as footballer in sex scandal court case|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/manchester-uniteds-marcos-rojo-named-as-footballer-in-sex-scandal-court-case-10158407.html|accessdate=9 April 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|date=6 April 2015}}</ref>

[[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Full-back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 1995–2003 |youthclubs1 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | years1 = 2003–2007 |clubs1 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |caps1 = 98 |goals1 = 19 | years2 = 2007–2011 |clubs2 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] |caps2 = 157 |goals2 = 30 | years3 = 2011– |clubs3 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps3 = 173 |goals3 = 15 | nationalyears1 = 2006–2007 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps1 = 10 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2007– |nationalteam2 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps2 = 39 |nationalgoals2 = 7 | club-update = 19:05, 10 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16:53, 8 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Ashley Simon Young''' (born 9 July 1985) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder#Winger|winger]], [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full back]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]]. Born and raised in Hertfordshire, Young started his career at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], making his first senior appearances in 2003 under the management of [[Ray Lewington]]. He became a first-team regular in 2004–05, and was one of Watford's key players in their promotion winning 2005–06 season. Young continued to play well for Watford in the Premier League, and in January 2007 he transferred to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] for an £8 million fee, rising to £9.65 million with add-ons. He established himself in the first team at [[Villa Park]] and won the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award in 2009. On 23 June 2011, Young signed for Manchester United for an undisclosed fee. He has gone on to win every trophy available in English football, winning the [[FA Community Shield]] in 2011, the Premier League in 2013, the [[FA Cup]] in 2016 and the [[EFL Cup]] in 2017. In May 2017, he won European silverware as part of the United squad that lifted the [[UEFA Europa League]]. Young represented England at [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] level and has since earned 39 senior [[Cap (sport)|caps]], scoring 7 goals. ==Club career== ===Watford=== Young joined the [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] academy system at 10 years of age. He developed there until the summer of 2001, when he was informed by the club that he wouldn't receive a full scholarship and could look for another team. Despite being turned away, Young stayed on at the club on a part-time basis and endeavoured to improve himself as a player and prove he could make it to the first team. He started to train with the Under-18s, despite being 16, and was starting games by the end of the season. He progressed on to the Under-21s and was eventually offered a professional deal by the club.{{Cite news |date=26 March 2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/philmcnulty/2011/03/cardiff_england_arrived_in_wal.html |title=Phil McNulty: England ease pressure on Capello |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 March 2011 |first=Phil |last=McNulty}}{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Froggart |title=How early rejection inspired Ashley Young |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fanzone/News-And-Blogs/2015/Jun/Mark-Froggatt-blog-on-Ashley-Young-joining-United-in-2011.aspx |date=23 June 2015 |accessdate=30 November 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201035932/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fanzone/News-And-Blogs/2015/Jun/Mark-Froggatt-blog-on-Ashley-Young-joining-United-in-2011.aspx# |archive-date=1 December 2017 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} The 18-year-old was handed his first-team debut under [[Ray Lewington]] in September 2003, scoring as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].{{Cite news|date=23 January 2007 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/6282041.stm |title=Young tipped for big Villa impact |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 August 2008 |first=Charlie |last=Henderson}} He achieved five substitute appearances that season, scoring three goals, and made his first start for the club in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]]. Young came to prominence in the 2004–05 season, playing a part in 34 of Watford's league matches as they struggled to survive in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]]. Although he failed to find the net, his performance during this season earned him the club's Young Player of the Season award.{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/Y/Ashley-Young |title=Ashley Young |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=25 June 2011}} Under [[Aidy Boothroyd]] in the 2005–06 season, Young was given a new lease of life as a striker and right winger. Young started 41 League matches, finding the net 15 times, including a playoff semi-final goal against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], as Watford qualified for the [[English Football League play-offs|play-offs]] and eventually beat [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] 3–0 to gain promotion to the [[Premier League]]. During that season, Young scored a number of spectacular goals, including free-kicks against [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] and Leeds, a shot into the top corner from 30 yards out against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]], and a curling shot against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]. It was during this season, though, that Young was sent off for the first time in his career, in the local derby away at [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]]. Young began Watford's [[2006–07 Watford F.C. season|2006–07]] Premier League season well, scoring three times in the league, including a last minute strike in a 3–3 draw with [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (he had also scored Watford's second goal in the match), and a goal against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] , in Watford's first win of the season in October. He also scored a free-kick in the League Cup. In the January 2007 transfer window, three unnamed clubs made £5 million offers for the under-21 international.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/united-lead-chase-for-bale-as-young-attracts-1635m-bids-430672.html |title=United lead chase for Bale as Young attracts £5m bids |newspaper=The Independent |date=4 January 2007 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} Watford rejected these approaches, as well as an offer of £7 million, again from an unnamed club.{{Cite news |date=12 January 2007 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/6230073.stm |title=Watford reject £7m bid for Young |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 January 2007}} An improved offer of nearly £10 million from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] was accepted. However, Young rejected the move, opting to wait for offers from clubs for whom relegation was not an issue.{{cite news| date=15 January 2007 |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/premiership/2006-2007/sport_sto1055878.shtml |title=Young rejects Hammers move |publisher=Eurosport |accessdate=15 January 2007}} ===Aston Villa=== [[File:Ashley Young Aston Villa-FH 071.jpg|thumb|upright|Young (right) with [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2008]] On 23 January 2007, Aston Villa completed the signing of Young for a fee of £8 million (rising to £9.65 million with add-ons).{{cite web |title=Young completes £9.65m Villa move |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/6277389.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 January 2007 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} At the time, this was the highest fee Aston Villa had ever paid for a player.{{cite news |title=Aston Villa: Martin O'Neill's signings – where are they now? |url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-martin-onell-transfers-12715345 |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=14 March 2017 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} On 31 January 2007, he scored on his debut for Villa at [[St James' Park]] against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], but Villa went on to lose 3–1.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Newcastle 3–1 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/6309683.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2007 |accessdate=7 February 2007}} Young started the [[2007–08 Aston Villa F.C. season|2007–08 season]] well, receiving several Man of the Match awards, culminating in a call-up to the England squad. In the [[2007–08 Premier League|2007–08 Premier League season]], Young finished second to [[Cesc Fàbregas]] in assists with 17.{{Cite web|title=Statistics|publisher=Premier League|url=http://www.premierleague.com/wiki/Statistics | accessdate=19 August 2008}} Young was included in the Premier League Team of the Year, and apart from [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]'s [[David James (footballer, born 1970)|David James]], was the only other player who did not come from any of the 'Big Four' ([[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]) to make it into the best XI of the season.{{cite news |title=Ronaldo named player of the year |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/7370319.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 April 2008 |accessdate=15 December 2017}} On 20 April 2008, Young scored two goals and assisted two goals for Aston Villa against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] at [[Villa Park]] and Villa went on to win the match 5–1. He also scored the winner against Danish club [[Odense Boldklub]] in Villa's home leg of the [[UEFA Intertoto Cup]] third round. On 10 October 2008, Young won the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award. This was due to his performances in the [[2008–09 Premier League|2008–09 Premier League season]]. Having also won the award in April 2008, Young joins the list of players who have won the award more than once including [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], [[Wayne Rooney]] and [[Steven Gerrard]]. On 7 December 2008, in the 3–2 win over Everton, Young scored two goals, one being an injury time winner after [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]'s [[Joleon Lescott]] had equalised seconds earlier putting his tally for the season up to five. Manager [[Martin O'Neill]] later described the player as being 'world-class' in the post-match press conference. Young signed a new four-year contract until 2012 on 4 November 2008.{{Cite news |date=4 November 2008 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/7708999.stm |title=Young signs four-year Villa deal |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 November 2008}} On 10 January 2009, Young was again awarded the Premier League Player of the Month award for December, along with O'Neill, who won the Manager of the Month award. He became the first ever player to win three Premier League Player of the Month awards in the same year.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/7832673.stm |title=Young handed third monthly award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 January 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2017}} During a match against Sunderland on 18 January 2009, Young was sent off for a two-footed foul on Sunderland's [[Dean Whitehead]].{{cite news |first=Rob |last=Stewart |title=Ashley Young sent off as Aston Villa run continues |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/leagues/premierleague/4278133/Sunderland--Aston-Villa.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=17 January 2009 |accessdate=18 January 2009}} On 26 April 2009, he won the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.{{cite news |title=Giggs earns prestigious PFA award |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8019726.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} [[File:AshleyYoung.JPG|thumb|left|upright|Young training with Aston Villa in 2009]] On 24 August 2009, Young scored a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] as Aston Villa won 3–1 against Liverpool at [[Anfield]]. He did, however, miss a penalty three days later in a home tie in the [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] against [[SK Rapid Wien|Rapid Wien]]. Young won two penalties in the first half of the match (one that he missed, the other that was converted by [[James Milner]]) as Aston Villa were eliminated from the tournament on the away goals rule. During the 2010–11 season, Young became [[captain (association football)|vice-captain]] of the club and played in a new free role behind the striker, allowing him to move from wing to wing and through the centre. Young scored his first goal of the 2010–11 season with a direct free-kick in the Premier League match at home to [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] on 18 September 2010. He ended the season with nine goals and fourteen assists in 39 appearances for Villa in all competitions. With one year left to run on his current contract, Young stated that he would not make a decision on his future until the end of the season. On 20 June 2011, new Villa manager [[Alex McLeish]] admitted that he was resigned to losing Young, stating, "It's not confirmed yet but it does seem likely."{{Cite web|url=http://www.talksport.co.uk/sports-news/football/premier-league/8466/1/exclusive-mcleish-villa-dont-want-lose-downing |title=Exclusive – McLeish: 'Villa don't want to lose Downing' |accessdate=29 April 2017}} He scored his first two goals for United on 28 August in an 8–2 victory against Arsenal at [[Old Trafford]]. Both occurring after cutting inside from the left flank and bending two right foot shots into the far corner. Young made his debut in the [[UEFA Champions League]] on 27 September 2011, scoring a headed goal in the 90th minute to help Manchester United to a 3–3 draw against [[FC Basel|Basel]]. After a long term injury, Young returned on the field at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in a 3–3 Premier League draw against Chelsea on 5 February 2012. On 16 February, he scored a goal for the lead in a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] 2–0 away win against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] at the [[Amsterdam Arena]]. On 4 March 2012, Young scored two goals and made an assist against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]] in a 3–1 Premier League win.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17175777 "Tottenham 1–3 Manchester United"]. BBC Sport. 4 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 2 April, he scored in a 2–0 win against Blackburn Rovers at [[Ewood Park]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17508799 "Blackburn 0–2 Manchester United"]. BBC Sport. 2 April 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Ashley Young 2015.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Young playing for Manchester United in 2015]] After playing the position in pre-season, Young started in [[Louis van Gaal]]'s first competitive game on 16 August 2014 as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing back]] in a 3–5–2 formation, which saw United lose 2–1 to [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]. |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jan/Ashley-Young-injured-in-Manchester-United-draw-at-Stoke.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=1 January 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} ====2015–16 season==== On 7 August 2015, Young signed a new three-year contract with Manchester United, keeping him at the club until June 2018, with the option to extend a further year.{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Aug/ashley-young-signs-new-contract-at-manchester-united.aspx |title=Ashley Young signs new deal with United |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=7 August 2015 |accessdate=7 August 2015}} Young's appearances at the beginning of the season were slim, with him making only one start in United's
