Young scored his only goal of the season on 17 May, the last day of the Premier League, in a 3–1 win against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] after coming on as a substitute for Anthony Martial.{{cite news |title=Manchester United 3–1 Bournemouth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36303698 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 May 2016 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} On 21 May, he won the FA Cup after defeating Crystal Palace 2–1 in the [[2016 FA Cup Final|final]] after extra time, playing at both striker and left back after replacing Marcus Rashford in the 72nd minute - marking his third domestic trophy with the club.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}} ====2016–17 season==== [[File:Ashley Young 2017-03-09.jpg|thumb|upright|Young (left) playing for Manchester United in 2017]] The appointment of [[José Mourinho]] as manager led to Young's game time being limited in the first half of the season. His first appearance was on 15 September 2016 in the Europa League against [[Feyenoord]], coming on as a 63rd-minute substitute for Juan Mata in a 1–0 loss.{{cite news |title=Feyenoord 1–0 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37302380 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 September 2016 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} His first start was against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] in the [[EFL Cup]] on 21 September, with Young playing on the wing in a 3–1 victory.{{cite news |title=Northampton Town 1–3 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37357878 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 September 2016 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} Young featured in the next two games as a substitute, against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in a 4–1 league victory on 24 September and on 29 September against [[FC Zorya Luhansk|Zorya Luhansk]] in a 1–0 win in the Europa League.{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Rostance |title=Manchester United 4–1 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37393483 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2016 |accessdate=30 November 2017}}{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Jurejko |title=Manchester United 1–0 Zorya Luhansk|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37498515 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 September 2016 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} From October to January, Young managed to only make four appearances - all of which came as starts at wing back or at full back. Despite being limited for chances, one of these came against rivals Liverpool on 17 October, in a 0–0 draw at Anfield.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Liverpool 0–0 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37604054 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2016 |accessdate=30 November 2017 }} His next start came against Blackburn Rovers in the FA Cup on 19 February 2017, playing the full 90 minutes in the 2–1 away win.{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |title=Blackburn Rovers 1–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38947530 |date=19 February 2017 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} After this game Young started to play far more regularly, featuring heavily in March and April. He was an unused substitute for the [[2017 EFL Cup Final]] against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 26 February, which United won 3–2.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Manchester United 3–2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39018813 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 February 2017 |accessdate=15 December 2017}} Young made his first assist of the season on 19 March against Middlesbrough, crossing the ball to Marouane Fellaini, who headed in the opening goal of a 3–1 victory.{{cite news |first=Louise |last=Gwilliam |title=Middlesbrough 1–3 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39246750 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 March 2017 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} On 16 April, Young captained Manchester United for the first time in a 2–0 win against Chelsea.{{cite web |url=http://talksport.com/football/manchester-united-fc-news-fans-dont-understand-mourinho-giving-ashley-young-captains |title=Manchester United FC news: Fans don't understand Mourinho giving Ashley Young the captain's armband |publisher=talkSPORT |date=16 April 2017 |accessdate=16 June 2017}} His season ended after suffering an injury against [[Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]] in the Europa League semi-final first leg on 4 May, after coming on for [[Henrikh Mkhitaryan]] in the 78th minute.{{cite news |first=Stephan |last=Shemilt |title=Celta Vigo 0–1 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39743943 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 May 2017 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} ====2017–18 season==== [[File:CSKA-MU 2017 (1) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Young playing for Manchester United in 2017]] Young's first start of the campaign came at right back on 12 September 2017 in a 3–0 win against Basel in the Champions League, assisting with the opening goal with a cross to Marouane Fellaini in the 35th minute, he was also captain for the match.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=Dawkes |title=Manchester United 3–0 FC Basel |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41154816 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 September 2017 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} His performance led him to start at left back in United's 4–0 victory over Everton on 17 September.{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Rostance |title=Manchester United 4–0 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41216714 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 September 2017 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} On 28 November, Young scored a brace for the first time since March 2012 against his former club Watford, the opening two goals, one of them being a 30-yard freekick into the top left corner, in a 4–2 win at [[Vicarage Road]].{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |title=Watford 2–4 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42061044 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 November 2017 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} ====2018–19 season==== In February 2019, after being appointed club captain,{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/02/06/ashley-young-close-agreeing-one-year-contract-extension-manchester/|title=Ashley Young close to agreeing one-year contract extension at Manchester United|first=James|last=Ducker|date=6 February 2019|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}} Young signed a new contract with Manchester United until 2020.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47196809|title=Ashley Young: Manchester United defender signs contract extension|date=11 February 2019|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} ==International career== ===Under-21s=== As a result of his form for Watford during the 2005–06 season, in February 2006 Young earned a call-up to [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s England Under-21 League squad to face an Italian [[Serie B]] squad alongside teammate [[Chris Eagles]]. Young started alongside Eagles in the 1–0 win, playing the first half. His continued form into the 2006–07 season earned him a first [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] call-up to face [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland]] in September 2006. Young played the last 15 minutes of the match as England scored a late goal to win 3–2, topping their group, and reaching a play-off for a place in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]]. At the finals, Young played three times. He took part in the semi-final [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] against hosts [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]], scoring twice in the shoot-out as England lost 13–12. From 2006 to 2007, he earned 10 caps for the under-21s.{{cite web |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/MatchRsl/MatchRslTmU21pg3.html |title=England's matches: The under 21's: 2000–10 |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |date=29 September 2017 |accessdate=7 September 2018}} ===Senior team=== ====Early career==== On 31 August 2007, [[Steve McClaren]] called Young up to the full [[England national football team|England]] squad for the first time, to face [[Russia national football team|Russia]] and [[Israel national football team|Israel]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2008 qualifiers]].{{cite web |title=Young guns for an England place |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=578236.html |publisher=UEFA |date=31 August 2007 |accessdate=29 April 2017}} He was again called up for the Euro 2008 qualifiers to face [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]] and Russia. On 16 November 2007, Young made his international debut, by coming on as a half-time substitute for England in a friendly against [[Austria national football team|Austria]].{{cite web |title=Austria 0–1 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7090216.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 November 2007 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} He has since appeared in the England friendly against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in November 2008, coming on as a second-half substitute. He was also part of the starting XI in [[Fabio Capello]]'s England squad in the friendly against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] at the Amsterdam Arena on 12 August 2009. Young did not make the cut in Capello's 30-man squad for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]] in South Africa.{{cite news |title=England's provisional World Cup squad includes Carragher and King |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/may/11/capello-england-world-cup-squad |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=11 May 2010 |accessdate=11 May 2010}} ====Euro 2012==== [[File:Ashley Young.JPG|thumb|upright|Young lining up for England at [[UEFA Euro 2012]]]] On 12 October 2010, Young made his first start for England in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifying]] match against [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]].{{cite news |title=Young impresses as England year with qualifying draw |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2182459,00.htm |publisher=Aston Vila F.C. |date=13 October 2010 }}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He scored his first international goal in a friendly away to [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] on 9 February 2011 in [[Copenhagen]], which was the winning goal.{{cite news |title=Denmark 1–2 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/9391367.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=26 April 2016}} Young also scored again against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] on 4 June 2011, as he got the equaliser with a volley from the edge of the area, after coming off the bench for [[Frank Lampard]] at half-time.{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Wilson |title=Frank Lampard and Ashley Young save face for slapdash England |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/jun/04/england-switzerland-euro-2012 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=4 June 2011 |accessdate=23 June 2011}} On 6 September 2011, Young scored the only goal for England in a Euro 2012 qualifying 1–0 win against [[Wales national football team|Wales]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England close on Euro 2012 place with win over Wales |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/14780919 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 September 2011 |accessdate=26 April 2016}} On 7 October 2011, he scored England's first goal away against Montenegro, and set up [[Darren Bent]] for the second.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Euro 2012: Montenegro 2–2 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/15195384 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 October 2011 |accessdate=26 April 2016}} England drew the match 2–2 to secure qualification for [[UEFA Euro 2012]]. On 29 February 2012, Young scored his fifth international goal in a 3–2 home loss to the Netherlands in a friendly match played at [[Wembley Stadium]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 2–3 Netherlands |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17167110 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=26 April 2016}} On 26 May 2012, Young scored his sixth, as well as his fourth straight, international goal in a UEFA Euro 2012 warm-up match against [[Norway national football team|Norway]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Norway 0–1 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18184726 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2012 |accessdate=26 April 2016}} He became the first English footballer since Wayne Rooney to score in four straight international appearances. In his next match for England against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] he provided the assist for England's first goal. Young played in all four of England's matches at Euro 2012, culminating with a quarter-final defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] on penalties; Young was one of two England players to miss his penalty as Italy won 4–2 to reach a semi-final against Germany. ====2017–present==== [[File:FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - A Young.jpg|thumb|left|Young for England during the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]] After not being called up to the national team for almost 4 years, he was recalled by [[Gareth Southgate]] for the upcoming friendly matches against Germany and [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] on 2 November 2017.{{cite news |title=Welcome back Young |url=https://twitter.com/england/status/926099101036531712 |publisher=Twitter |date=2 November 2017}} He featured in the latter game on 14 November, coming on for [[Ryan Bertrand]] in the 80th minute, seeing out a 0–0 draw.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 0–0 Brazil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41884888 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 November 2017 |accessdate=30 November 2017}} Young was named in Southgate's 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}} Young was England's first-choice left-back in Russia, playing the entirety of their first two group matches against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]] and [[Panama national football team|Panama]].{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Tunisia 1-2 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44434276 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 June 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }}{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 6-1 Panama |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439183 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 June 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} With qualification for the knockout stage secure after winning both matches, Young was rested for the final game against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]],{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 0-1 Belgium |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439312 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 June 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} before returning for the round of 16 tie against Group H winners [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]. That match went to extra time, but Young was replaced by [[Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990)|Danny Rose]] 12 minutes into the additional period and played no part in the penalty shoot-out after the match finished as a 1–1 draw.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Colombia 1-1 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44610244 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 July 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} England won 4–3 on penalties and progressed to a quarter-final against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]], against whom Young again played the full 90 minutes as England won 2–0, with Young providing the assist for [[Harry Maguire]]'s opening goal from a corner.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Sweden 0-2 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44665445 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} In the semi-final against Croatia, Young again started the match, but was against replaced by Rose at the start of extra time, with the score at 1–1 after 90 minutes.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Croatia 2-1 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44706648 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 July 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} England ultimately lost the match 2–1 after extra time, and Southgate chose to rest Young for the third-place play-off against Belgium.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Belgium 2-0 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44748604 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 July 2018 |accessdate=5 December 2018 }} England lost again, but their fourth place finish was their best performance at a FIFA World Cup since 1990. ==Style of play== Young has played in a variety of positions: though chiefly a [[winger (association football)|winger]], he has also experienced game-time as a [[forward (association football)|forward]]–under Boothroyd at Watford and once under Van Gaal at Manchester United– as well as in a free role behind the striker for Aston Villa. During his later years at United, Young was re-invented as a [[defender (association football)|defender]], deployed as a left-sided full back or wing back. ''WhoScored'''s Martin Laurence stated in 2018 that "[[Luke Shaw]] can’t get a kick at Manchester United and that is down to the form of Ashley Young, who has adapted to another new role superbly. Young is now proving to be an aggressive and intelligent defender, all while still offering a threat going forwards with his delivery into the box. On current form the 32-year-old shouldn’t just make the cut, but be considered as England’s first choice."{{cite news|title=The outsiders who deserve England call-ups – and the regulars who don't|first=Martin|last=Laurence|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=22 March 2018|date=14 March 2018|url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/who-scored-blog/2018/mar/14/england-squad-netherlands-italy-gareth-southgate}} Other than being deployed as a left-back, Young had also being deployed as a right-back. On 12 September 2017 Young was being deployed as a right-back in a 3–0 win against Basel in the Champions League, assisting with the opening goal with a cross to Marouane Fellaini in the 35th minute, Young was also captain for the match. Ashley Young has courted controversy, having been accused of [[Diving (association football)|diving]] by the press and has been spoken to by former managers [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] and [[David Moyes]] about diving to gain an unfair advantage.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/20/alex-ferguson-has-word-ashley-young |title=Sir Alex Ferguson 'has word' with Ashley Young over diving accusations |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |agency=Press Association |date=20 April 2012 |accessdate=16 September 2016}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24097097 |title=Ashley Young: David Moyes in diving warning to Man Utd winger |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2013 |accessdate=28 April 2017}} ==Personal life== Young was born in [[Stevenage]], Hertfordshire.{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/ashley-young-20572/ |title=Ashley Young |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=10 June 2018}} He has one older brother{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/ashley-young-meet-stevenages-second-greatest-sporting-prodigy-952525.html |title=Ashley Young: Meet Stevenage's second greatest sporting prodigy |newspaper=The Independent |first=Brian |last=Viner |date=6 October 2008 |accessdate=15 September 2009 |location=London}} and two football-playing younger brothers, [[Lewis Young|Lewis]], who made his debut for Watford in 2008,{{Cite web |title=Watford team profiles: Lewis Young |url=http://www.watfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10400~43897,00.html |publisher=Watford F.C. |accessdate=20 August 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080918065527/http://www.watfordfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/ProfilesDetail/0%2C%2C10400~43897%2C00.html |archive-date=18 September 2008 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} and Kyle, who in April 2009 was training at the [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal Academy]].{{cite news |date=8 April 2009 |url=http://fourfourtwo.com/news/england/28459/default.aspx |title=Young Gunner Kyle to be better than brother Ashley? |magazine=FourFourTwo |accessdate=8 April 2009}} Young attended [[The John Henry Newman School]] in Stevenage, and played school football alongside [[Formula One]] driver [[Lewis Hamilton]], who was in the same year. Young's Jamaican-born father{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=Ashley Young: 'I knew I had to fight to prove them wrong' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/oct/16/ashley-young-aston-villa-england |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=16 October 2009 |accessdate=11 December 2013}} supports Tottenham Hotspur, while Young himself, like his older brother, favoured Arsenal. March 2017 (UTC) }} '''Ander Herrera Agüera''' ({{IPA-es|ˈandeɾ eˈreɾa aˈɣweɾa}}; born 14 August 1989) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
He began his career at [[Real Zaragoza]], before moving to [[Athletic Bilbao]] in 2011 and then to Manchester United for €36 million in 2014. He has since won four trophies, including the [[2016 FA Cup Final|FA Cup]], [[2017 EFL Cup Final|EFL Cup]] and [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|UEFA Europa League]], and was named the club's player of the year for the 2016–17 season.
He has also won tournaments with Spain at [[Spain national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21]] level and represented the nation at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]]. He made his [[Spain national football team|senior]] international debut in November 2016.
==Club career==
===Real Zaragoza=== Born in [[Bilbao]], Herrera began his football career at [[Real Zaragoza]] and made his professional debut in the [[Segunda División]] in the [[2008–09 Segunda División|2008–09 season]]. He made 19 appearances that season as the Aragonese club made an immediate return to [[La Liga]]. He made his top-flight debut on 29 August 2009, in a 1–0 home win against [[CD Tenerife]].<ref>{{cite news |title=El Zaragoza regresa a Primera con Victoria |trans-title=Zaragoza returns to ''Primera'' with win |url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2009/08/29/mas_futbol/1251496868_850215.html |publisher=Diario AS |language=Spanish |date=29 August 2009 |accessdate=7 April 2014 }}</ref>
During the [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10 campaign]], Herrera was one of Real Zaragoza's most used players as the club managed to retain its top-flight status. He scored his first league goal on 6 December, but in a 4–1 away defeat to [[RCD Mallorca]].<ref> [http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/275931?cc=5739 Mallorca maintain home run]; [[ESPN Soccernet]], 6 December 2009</ref>
In [[2010–11 La Liga|2010–11]], Herrera continued to feature regularly for Real Zaragoza, under both [[José Aurelio Gay]] and his successor [[Javier Aguirre]].
===Athletic Bilbao=== On 7 February 2011, he agreed to join [[Athletic Bilbao]] on a five-year contract for a reported €7.5 million effective as of 1 July. Buyout clauses were set at €36 million in his first three seasons and €40 million in the remainder.<ref> [http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/877509/athletic-bilbao-confirm-deal-to-sign-ander-herrera?cc=5739 Athletic confirm Herrera deal]; ESPN Soccernet, 7 February 2011</ref>
Herrera made his official debut for Athletic Bilbao on 18 August 2011, playing the full 90 minutes in a 0–0 home draw against [[Trabzonspor]] in the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League]]. He appeared in 54 official matches and scored four goals in his first season with the [[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque]] club, who reached the finals of both the [[2012 Copa del Rey Final|Copa del Rey]] and the [[2012 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League]]. In his third and [[2013–14 La Liga|final season]] he played 33 league games as Athletic qualified for the [[UEFA Champions League]] for the first time in 16 years.
===Manchester United=== ====Transfer==== Herrera was the subject of a [[Pound sterling|£]]24 million offer from [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in August 2013, but the bid was rejected by Athletic Bilbao.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United move for Ander Herrera and 'bid for Daniele De Rossi' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/30/manchester-united-ander-herrera-bilbao |publisher=[[The Guardian]] |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=31 August 2013 }}</ref> A year later, Manchester United tried to sign him again. On 26 June 2014, Athletic Bilbao announced on their official website that they had rejected a €36 million (£28.85 million) bid from Manchester United for Herrera.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rechazada oferta del Manchester United |trans-title=Offer from Manchester United dismissed |url=http://www.athletic-club.eus/cas/noticias/14333/rechazada-oferta-del-manchester-united.html |language=Spanish |publisher=athletic-club.net |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014 }}</ref> Athletic Bilbao later confirmed that Herrera had activated his buyout clause, allowing United to sign him.<ref>{{cite web |title=Herrera pays release clause |url=http://www.athletic-club.net/web/main.asp?a=0&b=1&c=1&d=1000&berria=14335&idi=2 |publisher=athletic-club.net (Athletic Bilbao) |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=2 July 2014 }}</ref> Manchester United announced on the same day they had completed the signing of Herrera on a four-year contract, pending the receipt of an International Transfer Certificate.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Jun/ander-herrera-signs-for-manchester-united.aspx|title=Club statement on Ander Herrera|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=26 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== [[File:Ander Herrera MUFC 2014.jpg|thumb|200px|Herrera playing against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in 2014]] Herrera made his Manchester United debut on 23 July 2014, in the first match of the club's pre-season tour of the United States, playing the full 90 minutes and making three assists in the 7–0 win over [[LA Galaxy]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Simon |last=Stone |title=Man Utd beat LA Galaxy: Louis van Gaal off to winning start |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28423344 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=24 July 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014 }}</ref> His competitive debut came in the opening game of the [[Premier League]] season on 16 August, a 2–1 home defeat to [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]. He played 67 minutes before being substituted for [[Marouane Fellaini]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=Man Utd 1–2 Swansea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718345|accessdate=16 August 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=16 August 2014}}</ref> Herrera picked up an injury during training and missed Manchester United's next two games against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] and [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Marouane Fellaini and Ander Herrera face injury scans |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28910370 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 August 2014 |accessdate=15 September 2014 }}</ref> In his first game back after returning from injury, against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 14 September 2014, he scored his first goal for the club and made an assist as Manchester United won the game 4–0.<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd 4–0 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29098240 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2014 |accessdate=15 September 2014 }}</ref> He scored again in United's next game, flicking in [[Ángel Di María]]'s shot with his backheel in their 5–3 defeat to newly promoted [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 21 September.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29196081 |title=Leicester City fought back from 3–1 down to secure a stunning victory over a defensively frail Manchester United. |work=BBC Sport |date=21 September 2014 |accessdate=21 September 2014 }}</ref>
Herrera scored his first [[FA Cup]] goal with a dipping effort in a third round tie against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on 4 January 2015.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Yeovil 0–2 Man Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30614400 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=4 January 2015 |accessdate=4 January 2015 }}</ref> Herrera followed his cup goal against Yeovil with an important equalising goal against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the FA Cup fifth round; United would go on to win the tie 3–1 and progress to the quarter final stage.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31423124 |title=Preston 1–3 Man Utd |work=BBC Sport |date=16 February 2015 |accessdate=19 February 2015}}</ref> Herrera started a Premier League game for the first time since 2 December against Swansea City, scoring United's only goal – his fifth of the season – in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31466678 |title=Swansea 2–1 Man Utd |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=21 February 2015 |accessdate=24 February 2015 |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard}}</ref> On 4 April, Herrera scored the first brace of his career to help United beat [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] 3–1; he was also named [[man of the match]] for his performances.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32097849 |title=Manchester United 3–1 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 April 2015 |accessdate=5 April 2015 |first=Michael |last=Emons}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== On 26 August 2015, in his first start of the season, provided an assist for [[Wayne Rooney]]'s second goal and scored the fourth goal in a 4–0 win (7–1 aggregate) over Belgian side [[Club Brugge K.V.|Club Brugge]] in the second leg of their [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Champions League play-off]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Mitten |title=Wayne Rooney hits hat trick, Man United into Champions League groups |url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-match/60/post/2582868/wayne-rooney-hat-trick-in-man-united-champions-league-win |work=ESPN FC |publisher=ESPN Internet Ventures |date=26 August 2015 |accessdate=27 August 2015 }}</ref> He scored his second goal of the season from the penalty spot in Manchester United's 3–1 home win over Liverpool on 12 September.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Man Utd 3–1 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34160795 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=12 September 2015 |accessdate=12 September 2015 }}</ref> His good form continued with a Man of the Match performance in a 3–0 win against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at Goodison Park, in which he scored United's second – heading in from a [[Marcos Rojo]] cross, and assisting Rooney's goal in the 2nd Half.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34493717|title=Everton 0–3 Manchester United|date=17 October 2015|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref>
On 25 February 2016, Herrera scored his first European goal at Old Trafford – a powerfully converted penalty in the latter stages of a 5–1 defeat of [[FC Midtjylland]], in the Round of 32 of the [[Europa League 2015-16|Europa League.]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.uefa.org/mediaservices/presskits/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/round=2000659/day=8/session=2/match=2017187/index.html|title=Press kits - UEFA Europa League - Media – UEFA.org|last=uefa.com|website=UEFA.com|language=en|access-date=18 April 2017}}</ref> Later that week, on 28 February, Herrera scored the winning goal in a 3–2 victory over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35624234|title=Manchester United 3–2 Arsenal|date=28 February 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 23 April, Herrera featured in United's triumph in the [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup]] Semi-final over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]]; on as an 87th-minute substitute for [[Marouane Fellaini]] with the score tied at 1–1, Herrera played a one-two with [[Anthony Martial]], sending the Frenchman through on goal to score a dramatic injury-time winner to seal a 2–1 win and send United through to the final.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36060627|title=Everton 1–2 Manchester United|date=23 April 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> United went on to beat [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] 2–1 in [[2016 FA Cup Final|the final]], securing the cup and Herrera's first major honour with United.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265|title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United (aet)|date=21 May 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==== 2016–17 season ==== [[File:Ander Herrera 2017-03-09.jpg|thumb|Herrera playing for Manchester United in 2017]] Herrera's role initially remained limited to substitute appearances under new manager, [[José Mourinho]], with Fellaini preferred in midfield alongside world record signing [[Paul Pogba]]. Herrera did, however, start in United's [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] third round tie versus [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]], and duly registered his first goal of the 2016–17 campaign in his side's 3–1 victory.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37357878|title=Northampton Town 1–3 Manchester United|date=21 September 2016|newspaper=BBC Sport|language=en-GB|access-date=19 October 2016}}</ref> He was subsequently retained in the starting lineup for the Premier League game against champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], and helped his side register a comfortable 4–1 win.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37393483|title=Manchester United 4–1 Leicester City|date=24 September 2016|newspaper=BBC Sport|language=en-GB|access-date=19 October 2016}}</ref> Herrera was roundly lauded for his performances both against Leicester City and in the games that followed, and was named man of the match for helping Manchester United restrict free-scoring [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] to a 0–0 draw at [[Anfield]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/548175/Manchester-United-News-Jose-Mourinho-Ander-Herrera|title=Jose Mourinho: This Man United star will be with me almost every match|date=25 September 2016|newspaper=Dailystar.co.uk|access-date=19 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37604054|title=Liverpool 0–0 Manchester United|date=17 October 2016|newspaper=BBC Sport|language=en-GB|access-date=19 October 2016}}</ref>
On 26 February, he was named in the starting XI for the [[2017 EFL Cup Final|EFL Cup Final]] win against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], and contributed an assist for [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]]'s second goal of the match which gave United a 3–2 lead and eventually proved to be the winning goal<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/02/26/manchester-united-vs-southampton-efl-cup-final-live-score-updates/|title=Manchester United 3 Southampton 2, EFL Cup final: Zlatan Ibrahimovic inspires Jose Mourinho's side to cup glory|work=The Telegraph|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> and secured Herrera's second major trophy with United, having also won the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] under then United manager [[Louis van Gaal]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36292265|title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United (aet)|date=21 May 2016|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> Having been sent off against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 13 March at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in their FA Cup quarter-final match,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39260636|title=FA Cup: Manchester United's Ander Herrera sent off after second yellow card|date=13 March 2017|work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> he turned up with a man of the match display on 16 April against the same team at [[Old Trafford]] in the Premier League by shackling [[Eden Hazard]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.us/blog/tactics-and-analysis/67/post/3105680/mourinho-masterclass-haunts-chelsea-as-manchester-united-open-title-race|title=Jose Mourinho masterclass haunts Chelsea as Herrera stifles Hazard|work=ESPNFC.com|access-date=18 April 2017}}</ref> assisting [[Marcus Rashford]] for the first goal, then he himself got on the scoresheet by scoring the second goal which secured a 2–0 win for United which kept them in the hunt for a top-four finish and extending their unbeaten run to twenty-two matches.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/04/16/man-utd-vs-chelsea-premier-league-live-score-updates/|title=Man Utd 2 Chelsea 0: Jose Mourinho tactical masterclass blows title race wide open|work=The Telegraph|access-date=18 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Apr/Match-report-Manchester-United-2-Chelsea-0-Premier-League-Sun-16-April-2017.aspx|title=Report: Manchester United 2 Chelsea 0|website=ManUtd.com|access-date=18 April 2017}}</ref>
On 18 May 2017, Herrera was presented with the [[Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year]] award.<ref name= HerreraAwards>{{Cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/May/Manchester-United-midfielder-Ander-Herrera-named-Sir-Matt-Busby-Player-of-the-Year-for-2016-17.aspx|title=Herrera is the 2016/17 Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year|website=manutd.com|language=en|access-date=18 May 2017}}</ref> After helping Manchester United win the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final]] on 24 May, Herrera was awarded the game's [[man of the match]] accolade, which he dedicated to victims of the [[2017 Manchester Arena bombing]] which occurred a few days earlier.<ref name="motm">{{cite news |title=Herrera named man of the match |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=2470760.html|website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |date=24 May 2017 |accessdate=25 May 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Herrera's chances of playing looked to be diminishing with the arrival of [[Nemanja Matić]], but he remained with the team and fought for his place. On 26 January 2018, he scored his first goal of the season in a 4–0 [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] fourth round win against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Kerr|first=Joshua|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2018/Jan/match-report-yeovil-town-0-manchester-united-4-fa-cup-fourth-round.aspx|title=Yeovil 0 Manchester United 4|date=24 January 2018|accessdate=29 January 2018|publisher=Manchester United|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180127034547/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2018/Jan/match-report-yeovil-town-0-manchester-united-4-fa-cup-fourth-round.aspx|archive-date=27 January 2018|dead-url=yes}}</ref> On 21 April, he scored the winning goal in a 2–1 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester United 2 Tottenham 1|last=Mathieson|first=Stuart|date=21 April 2018|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2018/Apr/Match-report-Manchester-United-v-Tottenham-Emirates-FA-Cup-semi-final.aspx|publisher=Manchester United|accessdate=21 April 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180422063043/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2018/Apr/Match-report-Manchester-United-v-Tottenham-Emirates-FA-Cup-semi-final.aspx|archive-date=22 April 2018|dead-url=yes}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Following the November International Break, Herrera was part of Manchester United's starting eleven to play [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. The match saw Herrera score his first goal of the season, being the equaliser in the 2–2 draw.<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/soton-vs-man-utd/390896</ref> Herrera also started in United's midweek game against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] where he scored the assist for United's first goal by [[Anthony Martial|Martial]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/man-utd-vs-arsenal/390901</ref> Herrera started in United's first match with [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]] as manager, which saw Herrera score the second goal of the match which saw United beat [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] 5–1.<ref>https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/match-report-cardiff-1-manchester-united-5-premier-league</ref> On 18 February 2019, Herrera scored the first in a 2–0 win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], securing United's place in the [[2018–19 FA Cup#Quarter-finals|sixth round of the FA Cup]].<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2019/feb/18/chelsea-v-manchester-united-fa-cup-fifth-round-live</ref> On 1 March, Herrera was anounced as Manchester United's February player of the month.<ref>https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/ander-herrera-wins-manchester-united-player-of-the-month-award-for-february-2019</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ander Herrera Spain U-21 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Herrera playing for [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21s]] in 2011]] Herrera was a member of the [[Spain national under-20 football team|Spain under-20]] squad which won gold in [[football at the 2009 Mediterranean Games]] in [[Pescara]], Italy.<ref name=pescara/>
Herrera was selected by [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spanish under-21]] coach [[Luis Milla]] to the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2011 UEFA European Championship]] in Denmark. On 12 June, in the group stage opener against [[England national under-21 football team|England]], he scored a controversial goal in an eventual 1–1 draw.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/13717143.stm Spain U21 1–1 England U21]; [[BBC Sport]], 12 June 2011</ref> In the final against [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland]], through another header, Herrera netted the first goal in an eventual 2–0 win in [[Aarhus]].<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000005/match=2003419/postmatch/report/index.html Spain crowned European Under-21 champions]; UEFA.com, 25 June 2011 {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> He played for Spain at the 2012 Summer Olympics.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/he/ander-herrera-1.html|title=Ander Herrera Bio, Stats, and Results|website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com|language=en|access-date=25 July 2018}}</ref>
He received his first [[Spain national football team|senior]] call-up on 3 October 2016, for [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 World Cup qualification]] fixtures against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] and [[Albania national football team|Albania]], but did not feature in either game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3820434/Manchester-United-midfielder-Ander-Herrera-gets-Spain-call-up.html|title=Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera gets first full Spain call-up|publisher=Daily Mail|date=3 October 2016|accessdate=3 October 2016}}</ref> He made his senior international debut against [[England national football team|England]], at [[Wembley Stadium]], on 15 November 2016, coming on as a second-half substitute in a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/england-vs-spain/366669|title=England 2–2 Spain: Late Isco equaliser denies Gareth Southgate's side|publisher=Sky Sports|date=15 November 2016|accessdate=16 November 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== Herrera's style of play led to comparisons with former United legend [[Paul Scholes]],<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-midfielder-ander-herrera-9087438 |title=Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera: Paul Scholes was a one-off |work=Manchester Evening News |date=21 April 2015 |accessdate=30 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/man-uniteds-ander-herrera-insists-5559382 |title=Man United's Ander Herrera insists Paul Scholes is a 'one-off' following comparisons between them |work=Daily Mirror |date=21 April 2015 |accessdate=30 April 2015}}</ref> and he was praised by the man himself as United's best signing of the 2014 summer transfer window.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/scholes-ander-herrera-been-manchester-9142036 |title=Scholes: Ander Herrera has been Manchester United's best summer signing |work=Manchester Evening News |date=29 April 2015 |accessdate=30 April 2015}}</ref>
==Personal life== Herrera's father, [[Pedro María Herrera|Pedro María]], was also a footballer and a midfielder. He too played for Real Zaragoza and also for [[Celta de Vigo]] (in a total of three professional clubs), and at both clubs he served as [[General manager#Sports teams|general manager]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://deportes.elpais.com/deportes/2011/06/16/actualidad/1308208921_850215.html|title=Ander Herrera se emancipa |trans-title=Ander Herrera comes of age |publisher=[[El País]] |language=Spanish|date=16 June 2011 |accessdate=26 April 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/2012/05/24/futbol/copa_rey/1337848712.html|title=El padre de Ander ya ganó una final al Barça en el Calderón|trans-title=Ander's father already won a final to Barça at the Calderón |publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=Spanish|date=24 May 2012|accessdate=10 October 2013}}</ref> His girlfriend is Isabel Collado.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Herrera goes for dip after revealing long-term plans at Old Trafford|url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3123489/Manchester-United-midfielder-Ander-Herrera-makes-splash-girlfriend-Ibiza-revealing-long-term-plans-Old-Trafford.html|work= Mail Online|accessdate = 19 October 2015}}</ref>

He made his debut with [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] in the [[Argentine Primera División]] in 2007 and then transferred to Dutch club [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] at the end of the season. He won the [[Eredivisie]] in 2009 and two years later joined Italian side [[UC Sampdoria|Sampdoria]]. In 2013, he joined [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] on a season-long loan. He joined Manchester United in July 2015.
Romero is the most capped goalkeeper in the history of the Argentine national team,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://talksport.com/football/new-manchester-united-goalkeeper-sergio-romero-happy-sit-bench-talksport-told-150729160583 |title=New Manchester United goalkeeper Sergio Romero ‘happy to sit on the bench’ |date=29 July 2015 |work=Talksport}}</ref> playing over 90 times since his debut in 2009. He has represented Argentina at two [[FIFA World Cup|World Cups]] and at three [[Copa América]] tournaments, finishing as runner-up in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], as well as in the [[2015 Copa América|2015]] and the [[Copa América Centenario|2016 Copa América]] tournaments. He also was part of the team that won gold at the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Olympics]].
==Club career==
===Racing Club===
Born in [[Bernardo de Irigoyen, Misiones|Bernardo de Irigoyen]], Argentina, Romero began his youth career at [[Almirante Brown de Isidro Casanova|Almirante Brown]] and [[Comisión de Actividades Infantiles|CAI]] before joining [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]].<ref name="Romero1">{{cite web |url=http://www.sergioromero.net/es/biografia-de-sergio-romero |title=Biografia = Sergio Romero |publisher=Sergio Romero.net |language=Spanish |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100814102003/http://www.sergioromero.net/es/biografia-de-sergio-romero |archivedate=14 August 2010 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
Romero passed from the youth to the first team of Racing Club in 2006, making his debut in the [[Argentine Primera División]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Un estreno sin brillo: quedaron a mano |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/770278-un-estreno-sin-brillo-quedaron-a-mano |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=3 January 2006 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Romero appeared in the substitute bench throughout the 2005 season.<ref name="Romero1"/> Throughout the 2006 season, he continued to be in the substitute bench. Despite this, he signed his first professional contract with the club.<ref name="Romero1"/>
In the 2007 season, Romero found himself competing the first-choice goalkeeper role with [[José Luis Martínez Gullotta]].<ref>{{cite news |title=El primer objetivo del Piojo: ponerse a punto físicamente |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/876892-el-primer-objetivo-del-piojo-ponerse-a-punto-fisicamente |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=21 January 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Romero made his Racing Club debut of Matchday 1 of [[2006–07 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Apertura|Torneo Apertura]], in a 1–1 draw against [[Club Atlético Nueva Chicago|Nueva Chicago]].<ref>{{cite news |title=La Academia, en una visita complicada |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/882647-la-academia-en-una-visita-complicada |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=11 February 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> However, in the following match, Romero lost his first-choice goalkeeper role to [[Gustavo Campagnuolo]] and spent two months on the sidelines.<ref>{{cite news |title=El debut del Piojo López está cada vez más cerca |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/883432-el-debut-del-piojo-lopez-esta-cada-vez-mas-cerca |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=14 February 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Weeks after signing for AZ when he moved in the summer, Romero made his first appearance in two months on 14 April 2007 against [[Club Atlético Colón|Colón]], in a 1–1 draw; followed up by another appearance on 22 April 2007, in a 3–3 draw against [[Club Atlético Belgrano|Belgrano]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Dale para adelante que confiamos en vos |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/900131-dale-para-adelante-que-confiamos-en-vos |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=14 April 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Pasó de todo, pero se fue por lo que se vio en la cancha |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/902447-paso-de-todo-pero-se-fue-por-lo-que-se-vio-en-la-cancha |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=22 April 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> After Campagnuolo suffered an injury, Romero made his last appearance for the club on 17 June 2007, in a 4–2 win over [[Godoy Cruz Antonio Tomba|Godoy Cruz]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Por las canchas |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/917549-por-las-canchas |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=15 June 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Racing triunfó y alimentó su ilusión |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/918247-racing-triunfo-y-alimento-su-ilusion |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=17 June 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
===AZ=== [[File:SergioRomero.jpg|thumb|Sergio Romero with AZ in 2007]] It was announced on 24 March 2007 that Romero signed for [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]], managed by [[Louis van Gaal]], when he joined up the club on 1 July.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pese a todo, apoyo a Merlo y al Piojo |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/894204-pese-a-todo-apoyo-a-merlo-y-al-piojo |publisher=La Nacion |language=Dutch |date=24 March 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> There, Romero was expected to fight for the first-choice goalkeeper role with [[Boy Waterman]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/index.php?module=news&articleID=20863 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070517115526/http://www.az.nl/index.php?module=news&articleID=20863 |title=AZ legt keepers Waterman en Romero vast |archivedate=17 May 2007 |date=29 April 2007 |publisher=AZ |language=Dutch}}</ref>
Due to an injury to Waterman, Romero made his [[Eredivisie]] debut on 30 September 2007 against [[Heracles Almelo]], which went disastrous when he conceded a penalty, resulting in a 2–1 loss.<ref>{{cite news |title=AZ ook onderuit op kunstgras Heracles |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/az-ook-onderuit-op-kunstgras-heracles.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=30 September 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> In his second meeting of the season against [[FC Twente|Twente]] on 23 February 2008, he kept his first clean sheet for the side, in a 0–0.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fctwente.nl/blog/2008/02/fc-twente-pakt-punt-in-alkmaar-2/ |title=FC Twente pakt punt in Alkmaar |publisher=FC Twente |language=Dutch |date=23 February 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324205733/http://www.fctwente.nl/blog/2008/02/fc-twente-pakt-punt-in-alkmaar-2/ |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> From that moment on, Romero eventually becoming a regular as the team came 11th.
In [[2008–09 Eredivisie|2008–09]], Romero established himself as a first-choice goalkeeper at AZ following the departure of Waterman to [[ADO Den Haag]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ontgoochelde Didulica zou het liefst nu nog weggaan |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/ontgoochelde-didulica-zou-het-liefst-nu-nog-weggaan.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=1 September 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Romero kept a 950-minute [[shutout|clean sheet]] for AZ from November 2008 to February 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/feiten-weetjes-(az-willem-ii)5/1 |title=Feiten & Weetjes (AZ – Willem II) |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=21 August 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324203707/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/feiten-weetjes-(az-willem-ii)5/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-op-recordjacht/1 |title=Romero op recordjacht |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=5 February 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324203625/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-op-recordjacht/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> While keeping a clean sheet, Romero signed a contract with the club, keeping him until 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-verlengt-contract-bij-az/1 |title=Romero verlengt contract bij AZ |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=4 December 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> However, on 5 March 2009, he made a mistake which allowed [[NAC Breda]]'s [[Nourdin Boukhari]] to score for a 2–1 defeat in the quarterfinals of the [[KNVB Cup]]; he responded after the match by punching the door and walls of his team's changing room, breaking bones in his hand and ruling himself out at a crucial stage of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bizarre Romero injury blow for AZ |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=ned/news/newsid=807167.html |accessdate=27 July 2015 |publisher=UEFA |date=6 March 2009}}</ref> While on the sidelined, AZ won the [[Eredivisie]] in the 2008–09 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-landskampioen-2008-2009/1 |title=AZ landskampioen 2008–2009 |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=19 April 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324211159/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-landskampioen-2008-2009/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He returned on 26 April 2009 after [[Joey Didulica]] got injured in a clash with [[Luis Suárez]] and played 16 minutes, in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=AZ opgelucht: hoofdblessure Didulica valt mee |url=http://www.fcupdate.nl/voetbalnieuws/119059/az-opgelucht-hoofdblessure-didulica-valt-mee/ |publisher=FC Update |language=Dutch |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> At the end of the 2008–09 season, Romero went on to make 31 appearances in all competitions.
In the 2009–10 season, marked the departure of Van Gaal to [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] and Romero was linked a move away from AZ, with [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] and Bayern Munich keen on signing him, but stayed at the club throughout the summer.<ref>{{cite news |title='Van Gaal wil Romero meenemen naar Bayern |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-gaal-wil-romero-meenemen-naar-bayern.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=14 May 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Juventus aast op Dembélé én Romero |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/juventus-aast-op-dembl-n-romero.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=8 May 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> In the [[2009 Johan Cruyff Shield|Johan Cruyff Shield]], Romero started the season well when he helped AZ win 5–1 against [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]] to win the title.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-wint-johan-cruijff-schaal/1 |title=AZ wint Johan Cruijff Schaal |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=25 July 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324215602/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-wint-johan-cruijff-schaal/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> As he continued to be a first choice goalkeeper, Romero made his [[UEFA Champions League]] on Matchday 1 of the Group Stage, in a 1–0 loss against [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Onrustig AZ debuteert met verlies in Champions League |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/onrustig-az-debuteert-met-verlies-in-champions-league.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=16 September 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> However, a week later, he suffered a knee injury that sidelined for a week.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-doubtful-for-fc-utrecht-clash/1 |title=Romero doubtful for |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324221843/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-doubtful-for-fc-utrecht-clash/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> A week later, he returned to the first team from injury on 3 October 2009, in a 1–0 win over NAC Breda.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/lens-schiet-az-langs-nac-breda/1 |title=Lens schiet AZ langs NAC Breda |publisher=AZ |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> However, in a 1–0 win over [[Sparta Rotterdam]] on 21 March 2010, Romero suffered an injury in the first half and was substituted as a result.<ref>{{cite news |title=AZ houdt het onnodig lang spannend tegen Sparta |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/az-houdt-het-onnodig-lang-spannend-tegen-sparta.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=21 March 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Following this, it was announced that he would be out of the season, putting his place in the World Cup in doubt.<ref name="ArgentinaRomero1">{{cite news |title=Ongelukkige landing kost Romero een paar weken |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/ongelukkige-landing-kost-romero-een-paar-weken.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=22 March 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> At the end of the 2009–10 season, Romero went on to make 36 appearances in all competitions despite injuries.
In the 2010–11 season, Romero missed the start of the season, due to international commitment and injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Verbeek: 'Aktobe zou niet misstaan in de Eredivisie' |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/verbeek-aktobe-zou-niet-misstaan-in-de-eredivisie.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=26 August 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/overzicht-az-internationals-(update)/1 |title=Overzicht AZ-internationals (update) |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=9 August 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324225034/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/overzicht-az-internationals-(update)/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> It wasn't until on 19 September 2010 when he made his first appearance of the season, in a 1–0 win over [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-boekt-in-nijmegen-eerste-competitiezege/1 |title=AZ boekt in Nijmegen eerste competitiezege |publisher=AZ Official Website |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> Eleven days later, on 30 September 2010, Romero made his [[UEFA Europa League]] debut, in a 4–1 loss against [[FC BATE Borisov|BATE Borisov]] in the Group Stage.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-in-de-media-(bate-borisov-az)/1 |title=AZ in de media (BATE Borisov – AZ) |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=1 October 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> However, by February, Romero was out of the first team for the second time this season, due to international commitment<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/resultaten-az-internationals13/1 |title=Resultaten AZ-internationals |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324230208/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/resultaten-az-internationals13/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> and ankle injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-zonder-holman-en-klavan-naar-heerenveen/1 |title=AZ zonder Holman en Klavan naar Heerenveen |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=18 February 2010 After spending a month on the sidelines, Romero returned to the first team from injury on 2 April 2011, in a 1–0 win over [[Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-in-de-media-(feyenoord-az)1/1 |title=AZ in de media (Feyenoord – AZ) |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=4 April 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 went on to make 31 appearances in all competitions.
In the 2011–12 season, Romero was criticised by manager [[Gertjan Verbeek]] for his unprofessional attitude after failing to return to the club following the conclusion of Copa América.<ref>{{cite news |title=AZ-leiding laakt 'eigen agenda' van doelman Romero |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/azleiding-laakt-eigen-agenda-van-doelman-romero.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=27 July 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> As a result, Romero was dropped from the squad at AZ until the transfer window finished.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-gunt-romero-tijd-voor-transfer/1 |title=AZ gunt Romero tijd voor transfer |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=8 August 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324215633/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-gunt-romero-tijd-voor-transfer/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
===Sampdoria=== [[File:Romero.png|thumb|left|160px|Romero pictured during his time at [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] in 2012.]]
On 22 August 2011, Romero was signed for €2.1 million on a 4-year contract<ref>U.C. Sampdoria S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 31 December 2011 {{it icon}}, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.]</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Official: Sergio Romero joins Sampdoria from AZ |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/10/italy/2011/08/22/2630864/official-sergio-romero-joins-sampdoria-from-az |publisher=Goal.com |date=22 August 2011 |accessdate=21 February 2012}}</ref> by [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]], which had been relegated the previous season to [[Serie B]]. Upon joining the club, Romero said his aim is to help the club reach promotion to [[Serie A]].<ref>{{cite news |title='Arrogante' Romero klaar voor debuut bij Sampdoria |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/arrogante-romero-klaar-voor-debuut-bij-sampdoria.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=23 August 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>

blucerchiati, solo un pari all'esordio per Atzori |url=http://www.goal.com/it/match/sampdoria-vs-padova/1180273/report |publisher=Goal.com |language=Italian |date=25 August 2011 |accessdate=25 March per la Spagna |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/altre-notizie/argentina-i-convocati-di-batista-per-la-spagna-225065 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=20 August 2011 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Todo fútbol |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1411326-todo-futbol |work=La Nacion |language=es |date=3 October 2011 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Argentina: i convocati di Batista |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/sudamerica/argentina-i-convocati-di-batista-236485 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=3 November 2011 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> as well as injury and suspension.<ref>{{cite news |title=Todo fútbol |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1409117-todo-futbol |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish In his second season at Sampdoria, Romero continued to remain a first choice goalkeeper this season following the injury of second choice goalkeeper, [[Angelo da Costa Júnior]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Sampdoria, Da Costa tre mesi out: si cerca un vice-Romero |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/sampdoria-da-costa-tre-mesi-out-si-cerca-un-vice-romero-373627 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=1 August 2012 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Romero then made his Serie A debut, in the opening match of the season, where he kept a clean sheet, in a 1–0 win over [[A.C.
