parte Romero |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/esclusiva-tmw-sampdoria-storari-nome-caldo-se-parte-romero-630730 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=6 January 2015 |accessdate=25 January 2017}}</ref> In the January transfer window, Romero's lack of first team opportunities, prompted him to leave the club in January, but this never happened.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sampdoria, Romero: "Magari potessi andar via a gennaio" |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/sampdoria-romero-magari-potessi-andar-via-a-gennaio-602098 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=10 October 2014 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> From that moment on, Romero returned as a second choice goalkeeper and never played again, as he appeared on the substitute bench, as well as, injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sampdoria, partitella con gli Allievi. |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/altre-notizie/sampdoria-partitella-con-gli-allievi-mesbah-rientrato-643477 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=5 February 2015 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> At the end of the 2014–15 season, Romero went on to make eleven appearances in all competitions.
Following this, Romero was released by the club at the end of the 2014–15 season when his contract came to an end, which he confirmed his release on 6 June 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sampdoria, Romero: "Sapevo che quest'anno non avrei giocato" |url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/serie-a/sampdoria-romero-sapevo-che-quest-anno-non-avrei-giocato-688998 |publisher=Tutto Mercato Web |language=Italian |date=6 June 2015 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> It came after when the club allowed Romero to leave the club at the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Romero e Viviano Alla Samp nessuno è messo alla porta |url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it//2015/marzo/04/Romero_Viviano_Alla_Samp_nessuno_ga_0_20150304_69f38110-c23b-11e4-b691-b924edc2da74.shtml |publisher=La Gazzetta Dello Sport |language=Italian |date=4 March 2015 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== [[File:Manchester United v Feyenoord, November 2016 (08).JPG|thumb|left|Romero and [[Paul Pogba]] ahead of the match against [[Feyenoord]] ahead of a [[UEFA Europa League]] on 24 November 2016.]]
On 27 July 2015, [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] completed the signing of Romero on a free transfer. He penned a three-year contract, with the option to extend for a further year, and reunited with his former AZ manager Louis van Gaal.<ref>{{cite news |title=UNITED COMPLETE SIGNING OF ROMERO |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jul/manchester-united-complete-the-signing-of-goalkeeper-sergio-romero.aspx |accessdate=27 July 2015 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=27 July 2015}}</ref> Upon joining the club, Romero was given the number 20 shirt, saying: "There was a misunderstanding between myself and the manager, Van Gaal. He asked me what squad number I wanted, and I said 22. But he must have thought I'd said 21 because he told me if I wanted that number, I would have to go and speak with [[Ander Herrera]]. Anyway, it turned out [[Nick Powell]] had recently changed to 22, so I just said that no.20 would do fine."<ref>{{cite news |title=Sergio Romero reveals weird obsession with his Manchester United kit |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sergio-romero-reveals-weird-obsession-12787517 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=23 March 2017 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
With [[David de Gea]] withdrawn from the squad amidst transfer speculation, and [[Víctor Valdés]] out of favour with manager Van Gaal, Romero made his [[Premier League]] debut on 8 August 2015 as the season opened with a 1–0 victory against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Magowan |first=Alistair |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744640 |title=Man Utd 1–0 Tottenham |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=8 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> His distribution was described as "nervy" but produced two crucial saves that helped United win the match.<ref>{{cite news |last=Brewin |first=John |url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/the-match/60/post/2552213/romero-the-hero-as-united-win |title=Sergio Romero a hero for United as keeper impresses against Spurs |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=8 August 2015 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> He did not concede in his first three league matches for United.<ref>{{cite news |title=Louis van Gaal: Man Utd's Sergio Romero not proven yet |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34092531 |accessdate=30 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150830065929/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34092531|archive-date=30 August 2015|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> After de Gea failed to leave the club in the summer he returned to the first team, which resulted in Romero becoming the second choice goalkeeper. Despite this, Romero was first choice in cup competitions.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United goalkeeper Romero boasts 'huge support' from Van Gaal in De Gea battle |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-goalkeeper-romero-boasts-10009752 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=8 September 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref>
[[File:Sergio Romero17.jpg|thumb|Romero during a [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] match in March 2017]] In his second season at Manchester United, Romero continued to be the first choice goalkeeper in cup competitions, including the club's Europa League campaign, which new manager [[José Mourinho]] explained that he deserved to play in.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mourinho explains why De Gea didn't start for Manchester United vs Zorya Luhansk |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-utd-news-de-gea-11959207 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=30 September 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Romero kept his first clean sheet of the season on 29 September 2016, in a 1–0 win over [[FC Zorya Luhansk|Zorya Luhansk]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 1 – 0 Zorya Luhansk |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37498515 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 September 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Romero's performance in a 4–0 win over Feyenoord was praised by pundits.<ref>{{cite news |title=Romero shows his worth as Man United's second-choice goalkeeper |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/club/manchester-united/360/blog/post/3004464/sergio-romero-shows-his-worth-as-manchester-united-second-choice-keeper |publisher=ESPN |date=25 November 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Following this, Romero kept three more clean sheets in the UEFA Europa League matches, in which he kept two in both legs against [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Así fue el partido de Sergio Romero ante Saint Etienne |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/7246/goal-en-español/2017/02/16/32756712/así-fue-el-partido-de-sergio-romero-ante-saint-etienne |publisher=Goal.com |language=Spanish |date=16 February 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=St Etienne 0–1 Man Utd (0–4 agg): Henrikh Mkhitaryan seals Europa League last-16 place |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/st-etienne-vs-man-utd/report/368275 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=22 February 2017 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> In the second leg of a match against [[FC Rostov|Rostov]], Romero made a crucial save from [[Christian Noboa]]’s free-kick, which helped Manchester United progress to the next round.<ref>{{cite news |title=HOW ROMERO STOLE THE SHOW V ROSTOV |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Mar/Sergio-Romero-claims-Manchester-United-man-of-the-match-award-against-FC-Rostov.aspx |publisher=Manchester United Official Website |date=17 March 2017 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Romero rejected a move back to his homeland with [[Boca Juniors]] in the January transfer window.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sergio Romero rejects transfer home to stay with Manchester United |url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/01/21/sergio-romero-rejects-transfer-home-to-stay-with-manchester-united-6396764/ |publisher=Metro |date=21 January 2017 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> Romero played in the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|2017 Europa League final]] in which he kept a clean sheet in a 2–0 victory over [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].
==International career== ===Youth career=== Romero represented [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] at the [[2007 South American Youth Championship]] in Paraguay and at the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Canada where on 8 August 2007 Romero was first included in the Argentine selection for a friendly match against Norway and against Australia, which Argentina also went on to win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tocalli definió la lista de los 20 jugadores que viajarán a Paraguay |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/872151-tocalli-definio-la-lista-de-los-20-jugadores-que-viajaran-a-paraguay |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=3 January 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=El Sub 20, a la defensa del título |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/919847-el-sub-20-a-la-defensa-del-titulo |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=23 June 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=También ganó en la convivencia |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/928202-tambien-gano-en-la-convivencia |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=23 July 2007 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
After being called up by [[Sergio Batista]] for the Olympics, He replaced injured [[Oscar Ustari]] at the [[2008 Summer Olympics]] [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics|football tournament]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-in-voorlopige-olympische-selectie/1 |title=Romero in voorlopige Olympische-selectie |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Dutch |date=28 June 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=La coronación soñada |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1042921-la-coronacion-sonada |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=24 August 2008 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Prior to that, Romero played in the [[2006 Toulon Tournament]], where they were eliminated in the Group Stage.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ferraro dio la lista para el torneo de Toulon |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/804407-ferraro-dio-la-lista-para-el-torneo-de-toulon |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=8 May 2006 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
===Senior career=== [[File:Argentine - Portugal - Sergio Romero.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Romero in action against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] on 9 February 2011.]] Romero was called up to the full senior side by then coach [[Diego Maradona]] debuting on 9 September 2009 in a 1–0 [[FIFA World Cup]] qualifying loss against Paraguay<ref>{{cite news |title=Maradona dio la lista del exterior, con pocos cambios |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1165170-maradona-dio-la-lista-del-exterior-con-pocos-cambios |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=21 August 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Romero y un buen debut con la selección mayor |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1172766-romero-y-un-buen-debut-con-la-seleccion-mayor |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=10 September 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> and playing in the win against Uruguay in Montevideo that saw Argentina qualify for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tiene poco, le falta mucho |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1186994-tiene-poco-le-falta-mucho |publisher=La Nacion |language=Spanish |date=16 October 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> He played in all five of Argentina's World Cup matches which ended at the quarter-final stage. During in which, Romero found himself competing the first choice goalkeeper role with [[Juan Pablo Carrizo]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Maradona haalt Samuel terug bij selectie Argentinië |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/maradona-haalt-samuel-terug-bij-selectie-argentini.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=28 January 2009 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
Prior to the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], Romero's place in the World Cup was in doubt as result of suffering an injury, whilst at AZ.<ref name="ArgentinaRomero1"/> But Romero managed recover from injury and was included in the squad.<ref>{{cite news |title=Romero is klaar bij AZ en keert terug naar Argentinië |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/romero-is-klaar-bij-az-en-keert-terug-naar-argentinie.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=20 April 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Romero played his first World Cup match in the Group Stage against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]], where he kept a clean sheet, in a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2010: Diego Maradona not worried by Argentina missed chances |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/13/argentina-nigeria-world-cup-2010 |work=The Guardian |date=13 June 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref> Romero continued to remain the first choice goalkeeper throughout the World Cup campaign until their elimination in a 4–0 loss against [[Germany national football team|Germany]].<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2010: Germany dump Diego Maradona and Argentina out |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jul/03/germany-argentina-world-cup-2010 |work=The Guardian |date=3 July 2010 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref>
Romero was part of [[Sergio Batista]]'s [[2011 Copa América|Copa América]] squad in which Argentina the hosts lost to Uruguay on penalties in the quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-uitgeschakeld-op-copa-america/1 |title=Romero uitgeschakeld op Copa America |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Spanish |date=17 July 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324224051/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-uitgeschakeld-op-copa-america/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> During the tournament, Romero kept two clean sheets against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-voorkomt-nederlaag-argentinie/1 |title=Romero voorkomt nederlaag Argentinië |publisher=AZ Official Website |language=Spanish |date=7 July 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324224523/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/romero-voorkomt-nederlaag-argentinie/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> and [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/copa-krijgt-vervolg-voor-romero-(update)/1 |title=Copa krijgt vervolg voor Romero (update) |publisher=AZ Official Website |date=13 July 2011 |accessdate=24 March 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324224105/http://www.az.nl/nieuws/copa-krijgt-vervolg-voor-romero-(update)/1 |archivedate=24 March 2017 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He retained his position as number one choice under new coach [[Alejandro Sabella]] for the ongoing [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] qualifiers.
[[File:Germany and Argentina face off in the final of the World Cup 2014 -2014-07-13 (31).jpg|thumb|left|200px|Romero making a save during the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]].]] Romero was Argentina's starting goalkeeper at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] despite lack of first team opportunities whilst at Monaco.<ref>{{cite news |title=Romero van bank naar spotlights: 'Geniet van grote scherm' |url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/romero-van-bank-naar-spotlights-geniet-van-grote-scherm.htm |publisher=Voetbal International |language=Dutch |date=22 June 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Romero reste numéro un |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Romero-reste-numero-un/448969 |publisher=L'Equipe |language=French |date=12 March 2014 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> In the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Semi-final|semi-final]], he earned himself Man of the Match<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255955/match=300186490/ |title=Netherlands 0–0 Argentina |date=9 July 2014 |accessdate=10 July 2014 |publisher=FIFA}}</ref> by saving kicks from [[Ron Vlaar]] and [[Wesley Sneijder]] as Argentina defeated the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] 4–2 in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] to reach the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Netherlands 0–0 Argentina |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28122293 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=9 July 2014 |accessdate=10 July 2014}}</ref> On 11 July 2014, Romero was named on the three-man shortlist for FIFA's [[2014 FIFA World Cup awards#Golden Glove|Golden Glove]] award for the tournament's best goalkeeper due to his performances that led his team to the final.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2014: Fifa announces Golden Ball shortlist |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28274011 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=11 July 2014 |accessdate=12 July 2014}}</ref>
At the [[2015 Copa América]], Romero saved from [[Juan Camilo Zúñiga]] in the penalty shoot-out at the end of Argentina's goalless quarter-final against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in [[Viña del Mar]]; although three takers did not score their penalties, this was the only save.<ref>{{cite news |title=Argentina 0–0 Colombia (Argentina win 5–4 on penalties) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085867 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=27 June 2015 |accessdate=27 June 2015}}</ref>
[[File:2017 FRIENDLY MATCH RUSSIA v ARGENTINA - Sergio Romero.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Romero playing for Argentina during a friendly against Russia in 2017]] On 21 May 2018, Romero was named in Argentina's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia by manager [[Jorge Sampaoli]], but was later ruled out of the tournament due to a knee injury suffered the day after the announcement.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/soccer/argentina/story/3507486/argentina-and-man-united-goalkeeper-sergio-romero-to-miss-world-cup-with-injury |title=Argentina and Man United goalkeeper Sergio Romero to miss World Cup with injury |date=22 May 2018 |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref>
==Personal life== Despite being {{convert|6|ft|3|in|m|2}} tall, Romero is nicknamed "Chiquito" as he is relatively short compared to his brothers, in particular his professional basketball-playing brother Diego, who is {{convert|6|ft|9|in|m|2}} tall.<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=The lowdown on new boy Sergio Romero |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2015/Jul/sergio-romero-player-profile-and-background.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=27 July 2015 |accessdate=17 August 2015}}</ref>
He is married to fellow Argentine Eliana Guercio, with whom he has a daughter.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sergio Romero |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/world_cup_2010/groups_and_teams/team/argentina/sergio_romero |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |accessdate=27 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160120102859/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/world_cup_2010/groups_and_teams/team/argentina/sergio_romero |archive-date=20 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In September 2012, Romero became a father for the second time when his wife gave birth to a second child, which caused him to miss a match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sampdoria a caccia del tris senza pietà col Pescara |url=http://genova.repubblica.it/sport/2012/09/16/news/samp_a_caccia_del_tris_senza_piet_col_pescara-42604777/ |publisher=Genova Repubblica |language=Italian |date=16 September 2016 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Dramma Sampdoria Romero in Argentina dalla figlia malata |url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it//2012/dicembre/02/Dramma_Sampdoria_Romero_Argentina_dalla_ga_0_20121202_25f03b00-3c4d-11e2-9337-7a4661020ba2.shtml |publisher=La Gazzetta Dello Sport |language=Italian |date=2 December 2012 |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref>

Under-23s and Academy|Southampton]] | years1 = 2011–2014 |clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |caps1 = 60 |goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014– |clubs2 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps2 = 67 |goals2 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2011 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 6 |nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2011–2012 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 8 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013–2014 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps3 = 5 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014– |nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps4 = 8 |nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 19:08, 10 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:56, 13 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Luke Paul Hoare Shaw''' (born 12 July 1995) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Originally a member of [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]'s [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|youth system]], Shaw made his first-team debut for the club in January 2012, and signed his first professional contract in May that year before becoming a regular in the Southampton team over the next two seasons. In June 2014, Shaw was signed by Manchester United for £30 million, then a [[Transfer (association football)#Players|world record transfer fee]] for a teenager.
On 5 March 2014, he made his senior international debut for the England team in a 1–0 friendly win against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]], and later that year was selected in the squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|FIFA World Cup]].
==Early life== Shaw was born in [[Kingston upon Thames]], London,<ref>{{cite news |first=Sami |last=Mokbel |title=Exclusive: Chelsea set to land £10m replacement for Cole – Southampton teen sensation Shaw |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2284192/Chelsea-set-land-10m-Southampton-teenager-Luke-Shaw-replace-Ashley-Cole.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=25 February 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> and attended [[Rydens Enterprise School]] in [[Hersham]], Surrey.<ref>{{cite web |title=Birthday boy Shaw signs on |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/birthday-boy-shaw-signs-on-911473.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=12 July 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> He grew up as a [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] supporter, and has claimed that he originally wanted to play for the London club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/shaw-savouring-chelsea-contest-740468.aspx |title=Shaw Savouring Chelsea Contest |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=29 March 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> As an eight-year-old Shaw played at Chelsea's development centre in [[Guildford]], but was not offered an academy place.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/10514910/Chelsea-expected-to-make-20m-move-for-Southamptons-Luke-Shaw-during-January-transfer-window.html |title=Chelsea expected to make £20m move for Southampton's Luke Shaw during January transfer window |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=12 December 2013 |accessdate=12 December 2013}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Southampton=== ====Early career==== Shaw joined the [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Southampton Academy]] at the age of eight, and became a regular in the under-18 team from the age of 15.<ref name=officialprofile>{{cite web |title=Luke Shaw |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/luke-shaw/23 |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> His first association with the first team came in September 2011, when he was an unused substitute in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]].<ref name=officialprofile/> During the January 2012 transfer window, it was reported that Premier League clubs [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Chelsea, and [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] had shown interest in signing 16-year-old Shaw, with the then-[[EFL Championship|Championship]] club reportedly valuing the defender at £4 million.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Wallace |title=Arsenal face a battle for Saints' £4m teen |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/arsenal-face-a-battle-for-saints-4m-teen-6287747.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=11 January 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> Southampton quickly responded to such claims though, with then-manager [[Nigel Adkins]] assuring the media that "Luke Shaw is a big part of our future plans", and claiming that the club had "no intention … of letting any of [their] young players move on".<ref>{{cite news |title=Luke Shaw will not be sold says Nigel Adkins |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16543255 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 January 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>
At the age of 16, Shaw made his debut for the Southampton first team on 28 January 2012 in the [[2011–12 FA Cup|FA Cup]], replacing winger [[Jason Puncheon]] for the final 13 minutes of the third round tie against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], which finished 1–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16664140 |title=Millwall 1–1 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 January 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> Following the club's promotion to the top flight in May 2012, Shaw was one of four youth players offered a professional contract for their return to the Premier League, along with [[Jack Stephens (footballer)|Jack Stephens]], [[Calum Chambers]] and [[James Ward-Prowse]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton promote academy quartet to first team squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18176183 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 May 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== The defender made his first start for the Southampton first team in August 2012, playing the full 90 minutes of a 4–1 win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] in the League Cup,<ref name=officialprofile/> and on 10 November 2012, he became the youngest Southampton player to start a match in the Premier League when he was chosen to play at left-back against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], completing 74 minutes of the 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dewi |last=Hughes |title=Southampton 1–1 Swansea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20189996 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>
Shaw continued to make regular appearances throughout the season, and in manager Nigel Adkins's final match as Southampton manager on 16 January 2013, he set up the second goal in a 2–2 draw away to Chelsea, providing a cross from the left wing for Jason Puncheon to convert in the 75th minute.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20955084 |title=Chelsea 2–2 Southampton |last=Bevan |first=Chris |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 January 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> In an away match against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in March 2013, Shaw was involved in a collision with striker [[Grant Holt]], which resulted in conceding a penalty in the first minute of injury time at the end of the match, although [[Artur Boruc]] saved the ensuing spot kick to ensure the match ended goalless.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21639524 |title=Norwich 0–0 Southampton |last=Ornstein |first=David |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 March 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> Shaw finished his first professional season with 28 appearances for Southampton, including 25 in the Premier League.<ref name=officialprofile/>
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Luke Shaw v Cardiff.jpg|thumb|upright|Shaw playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2013]]
On 12 July 2013, Shaw's 18th birthday, he signed a new five-year deal with Southampton.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23286316 |title=Luke Shaw: Southampton defender agrees five-year contract |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 July 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/jul/news-in-brief-140713.html |title=Luke Shaw signs five-year deal with Southampton |publisher=Premier League |date=14 July 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> Shaw scored one goal during Southampton's pre-season preparations, scoring the last in an 8–0 win over Spanish team [[Palamós CF|Palamós]] on 20 July 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/palamos-0-8-saints-report-933427.aspx |title=Palamós 0–8 Saints: Report |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=20 July 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>
In the first match of the [[2013–14 Southampton F.C. season|2013–14 season]], Shaw was directly involved in the goal that saw Southampton win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] when he was fouled in the penalty area by [[Youssouf Mulumbu]] in the 89th minute, with [[Rickie Lambert]] converting the resulting spot kick to see the Saints edge victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644676 |title=West Brom 0–1 Southampton |last=Johnston |first=Ben |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>
On 18 April 2014, Shaw was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/18/pfa-player-of-the-year-award-shortlist-gerrard-lallana| |title=PFA Player of the Year award shortlist: Gerrard and Lallana nominated |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He was also selected as left-back in the [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Premier League 5|2013–14 PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name=1314PFA>{{cite news |title=Luis Suarez: Liverpool striker wins PFA Player of the Year award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27180793 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== ====2014–15 season==== On 27 June 2014, Shaw signed a four-year contract (with an option to extend for a further year) with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for an undisclosed fee thought to be in the region of £30 million, becoming the most expensive teenager in world football.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11667/9363721/premier-league-manchester-united-buy-luke-shaw-from-southampton-for-16330m |title=Manchester United buy Luke Shaw from Southampton for £30m |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=De Menezes |first=Jack |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/luke-shaw-to-manchester-united-confirmed-england-defender-completes-30m-move-from-southampton-9568357.html |title=Luke Shaw joins Manchester United: England defender completes £30m move from Southampton |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref> Chelsea were also interested in Shaw, but they backed away from a deal fearing the teenager's excessive pay demands would cause friction in their dressing room.<ref>{{cite news |title=José Mourinho: 'Signing Luke Shaw would have killed Chelsea' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/26/jose-mourinho-chelsea-luke-shaw-wages |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=26 July 2014 |accessdate=14 August 2014}}</ref>
Shaw made his debut in the first match of the club's pre-season tour of the United States, playing the first 45 minutes of a 7–0 win over the [[LA Galaxy]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Simon |last=Stone |title=Man Utd beat LA Galaxy: Louis van Gaal off to winning start |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28423344 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 July 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref> Before the start of the [[2014–15 Premier League|season]], he suffered a hamstring injury that ruled him out for a month.<ref>{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=Manchester United's Luke Shaw out for a month with hamstring injury |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/13/luke-shaw-manchester-united-injured-hamstring |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=James |last=Orr |title=Luke Shaw: Hamstring injury to £30m left-back could accelerate Manchester United moves for Marcos Rojo or Daley Blind |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/luke-shaw-hamstring-injury-to-30m-leftback-could-accelerate-manchester-united-moves-for-marcos-rojo-or-daley-blind-9667250.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014}}</ref> Shaw was named as a substitute for Manchester United for the first time on 14 September 2014 in their fourth league match, and was unused as they recorded their first victory of the season against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Henson |first=Mike |title=Man Utd 4–0 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29098240 |accessdate=27 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 September 2014}}</ref> After again being an unused substitute in the subsequent defeat to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], Shaw made his competitive debut for United on 27 September 2014, playing the entirety of a 2–1 home victory against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Sanghera |first=Mandeep |title=Man Utd 2–1 West Ham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289922 |accessdate=27 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 September 2014}}</ref>
In October 2014, Shaw was named on the 40-man shortlist for the [[Golden Boy (award)|2014 Golden Boy]] award, a prize given to the player considered to be the best European-based player under the age of 21.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Aarons |first1=Ed |title=Five English players on 40-man shortlist for Golden Boy award |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/oct/30/five-english-players-shortlist-golden-boy |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=30 October 2014 |accessdate=9 February 2017}}</ref> On 8 February 2015, Shaw was sent off after receiving a second yellow card during a 1–1 draw with West Ham.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31079343 |title=West Ham United 1–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 February 2015 |accessdate=10 February 2015}}</ref> On 18 April 2015, Shaw made his return to the starting line-up, replacing the injured [[Daley Blind]]. His first match since 9 March 2015 ended in a 1–0 defeat to league leaders Chelsea, but Shaw put up a solid performance and was praised by captain [[Wayne Rooney]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12040/9814690/luke-shaw-joining-manchester-united-from-southampton-has-been-tough |title=Luke Shaw: Joining Man Utd from Southampton has been tough |publisher=Sky Sports |date=20 April 2015 |accessdate=21 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Apr/Wayne-Rooney-believes-Manchester-United-could-have-beaten-Chelsea.aspx |title=Wayne Rooney believes United could have beaten Chelsea |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=18 April 2015 |accessdate=21 April 2015}}</ref>
====2015–present==== Shaw started every league match in the early [[2015–16 Manchester United F.C. season|2015–16 season]] until 15 September 2015, when, during the opening match of the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage against [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], Shaw was caught by [[Héctor Moreno]] with a sliding tackle and suffered a double leg fracture.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34264202 |title=Luke Shaw: Manchester United man suffers double leg fracture |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 September 2015 |accessdate=15 September 2015}}</ref> Shaw was given oxygen and treated by nine medical staff during the nine-minute stoppage in [[Eindhoven]] before he was taken off on a stretcher and taken to hospital. Shaw was expected to be out of action for at least six months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3235800/Luke-Shaw-suffers-horror-injury-Manchester-United-defender-carried-suspected-broken-leg-Champions-League-tie.html |title=Luke Shaw suffer Horror injury |last=Bernstein |first=Joe |date=15 September 2015 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=24 September 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> He returned to training on 4 April 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luke Shaw: Man Utd defender returns to training after broken leg |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35962993 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 April 2016 |date=4 April 2016}}</ref>
On 7 August 2016, Shaw made his first competitive appearance since suffering his double leg fracture in September 2015,<ref>{{cite web |first=Jordan |last=Davies |title=Shaw happy to win first trophy at United |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Aug/Luke-Shaw-happy-to-win-first-trophy-at-United.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=8 August 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> as Manchester United won 2–1 against Leicester City to lift the [[2016 FA Community Shield]].<ref name=2016FACS>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Bevan |title=Leicester City 1–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36934956 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
On 10 August 2018, Shaw scored his first senior goal in the league opener against Leicester City as Manchester United won 2–1.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/match/38313 |title=Man Utd v Leicester, 2018/19 {{!}} Premier League |publisher=Premier League|date=10 August 2018|accessdate=10 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-leicester-city-match-report-luke-shaw-a8487086.html |title=Luke Shaw scores first ever goal as Manchester United edge past Leicester |last=Critchley |first=Mark |date=10 August 2018 |newspaper=The Independent |accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref> He signed a new 5-year deal with United on 18 October 2018.<ref>{{cite news |date=18 October 2018 |title=Man Utd will return to form, says Luke Shaw after agreeing new five-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45904045 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=19 October 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Shaw's first experience of international football came in 2011, when he made six appearances for the [[England national under-16 football team|England under-16 team]].<ref name=englandprofile>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players/S/Luke-Shaw |title=Luke Shaw |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> He made his debut against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in February, before competing in the [[Montaigu Tournament]] in April and scoring his first international goal against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] at the tournament.<ref name=englandprofile/> He later made his debut for the [[England national under-17 football team|under-17 team]] in August against [[Italy national under-17 football team|Italy]], and played in eight matches in a seven-month stint with the national team.<ref name=englandprofile/>
In January 2013, Shaw was set to be called up for the first time to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] for the following month's friendly against [[Sweden national under-21 football team|Sweden]], with then-manager [[Stuart Pearce]] calling the Southampton defender "an outstanding talent".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21060343 |title=Southampton's Luke Shaw set for England Under-21 call – Pearce |last=Hassan |first=Nabil |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 January 2013 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> However, due to an On 12 May 2014, Shaw was named in Roy Hodgson's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2014: England name Ross Barkley in squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27362447 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=13 May 2014}}</ref> He was included at the expense of the experienced Cole, who retired from internationals as a result.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ashley Cole quits England duty after World Cup omission |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27368711 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 May 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}}</ref> He was England's second-choice left-back behind [[Leighton Baines]], and made his tournament debut in the last group match, a 0–0 draw with [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] in [[Belo Horizonte]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=England end disappointing World Cup with barren draw against Costa Rica |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/24/costa-rica-england-world-cup-group-d-match-report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=24 June 2014}}</ref> He also holds the accolade of being the youngest player to appear at the 2014 tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jose Mourinho: Signing Luke Shaw would have "killed" Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28498546 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 July 2014 |date=26 July 2014}}</ref>
==Style of play== As a left-back with a tendency to play attacking football, Shaw has been compared to former Southampton youth product [[Gareth Bale]], with particular focus being placed on his speed, decision-making and defending skills.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/shaw-shapes-up-as-the-new-bale-8434325.html |title=Shaw shapes up as the 'new Bale' |last=Szczepanik |first=Nick |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=31 December 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref> Former England international and FA Director of Football Development [[Trevor Brooking]] has described Shaw as "technically very gifted."<ref>{{cite news |first1=Louise |last1=Taylor |first2=Dominic |last2=Fifield |title=Chelsea to offer £4m for Southampton prodigy Luke Shaw |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/jul/02/chelsea-offer-southampton-luke-shaw |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=2 July 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2013}}</ref>

Primarily a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]], he had previously played as a [[Midfielder#Winger|right winger]] for a large duration of his career. After progressing through the youth system at [[C.D. El Nacional|El Nacional]], Valencia became a first team regular and made over 80 appearances for the club. He won the [[Ecuadorian Serie A]] with them before signing for [[La Liga]] side [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]] in 2005. He only made two league appearances for the Spanish side in between loan spells at [[Recreativo de Huelva|Recreativo]] for the [[2005–06 Segunda División|2005–06 season]] and later English Premier League club [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] from 2006 to 2008. Wigan Athletic later signed Valencia on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee in January 2008. His performances for Wigan Athletic soon attracted attention from several high-profile clubs, eventually signing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in June 2009. Valencia has since won two Premier League titles, an [[FA Cup]], two [[EFL Cup|League Cups]], the [[UEFA Europa League]] and three [[FA Community Shield]]s. Valencia was voted into the [[PFA Team of the Year]] in his [[PFA Team of the Year#Premier League 18|debut season]] with the club. Valencia made his Ecuador debut in 2004 and has represented his country at the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]], the [[2007 Copa América]], the [[2011 Copa América]], the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and the [[Copa América Centenario]]. Since making his debut, Valencia has won over 90 caps and scored 11 goals for his country. ==Early life== Valencia was born on 4 August 1985 in Lago Agrio, near the city of [[Nueva Loja]], |work=BBC Sport |date=13 June 2009 |accessdate=17 August 2009 }} ===Manchester United=== [[File:Antonio Valencia cropped.jpg|thumb|left|Valencia playing against [[CSKA Moscow]] during his first season at Manchester United]] On 30 June 2009, Valencia became Manchester United's first summer signing, having cut his holiday short to have a medical with the club. He signed a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee, rumoured to be in the region of £16 million.{{cite news |title=Valencia joins Man Utd from Wigan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/8127596.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2009 |accessdate=1 July 2009 }} On 29 July 2009, he made his debut for United and scored his first goal in the process, netting United's second in a 2–1 pre-season victory over [[Boca Juniors]] in the [[Audi Cup]].{{cite news |title=Boca Juniors 1–2 United |url=http://www.manutd.com/default.sps?pagegid={3165B97F-681E-4B39-BE53-94EC9521C3DA}&newsid=6636981&page=1&typeReport=1&team= |work=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=29 July 2009 |accessdate=9 August 2009 }} He made his competitive debut for Manchester United in the [[2009 FA Community Shield]], when he came on for the injured [[Nani]] in the 62nd minute.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Chelsea 2–2 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8190061.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2009 |accessdate=11 August 2009 }} On 17 October 2009, he scored his first competitive goal for the club, scoring United's second in a 2–1 league victory against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8305403.stm|title=Man Utd 2–1 Bolton|work=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2009 |accessdate=20 October 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20091019081816/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8305403.stm| archivedate= 19 October 2009 | deadurl= no}} His first [[UEFA Champions League]] goal followed four days later in a 1–0 away victory against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]].{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8314336.stm|title=CSKA Moscow 0–1 Man Utd|work=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2009 |accessdate=21 October 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20091021101620/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8314336.stm| archivedate= 21 October 2009 | deadurl= no}} Valencia provided the assist for [[Wayne Rooney]]'s winning goal in the [[2010 Football League Cup Final|2010 League Cup Final]] against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on 28 February 2010, Valencia was named [[Man of the Match]] as United won 2–1.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/default.sps?pagegid={3165B97F-681E-4B39-BE53-94EC9521C3DA}&newsid=6646939.stm|title=Aston Villa 1–2 Man Utd|publisher=Man Utd |date=28 February 2010 |accessdate=28 February 2010}} On 25 April 2010, Valencia was included in the [[PFA Team of the Year|PFA Premier League Team of the Year]] in his debut season for the club alongside teammates [[Patrice Evra]], [[Darren Fletcher]], and Wayne Rooney.{{cite news |title=Rooney is PFA player of the year |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8643305.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=25 April 2010 |accessdate=27 April 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100429104108/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8643305.stm| archivedate= 29 April 2010 | deadurl= no}} [[File:Antonio Valencia corner kick.jpg|thumb|right|Valencia taking a corner kick in the 2–2 draw away to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 22 August 2010]] On 8 August 2010, Valencia scored United's first goal in their 3–1 win over Chelsea in the [[2010 FA Community Shield|2010 Community Shield]].{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Fletcher |title=Chelsea 3–1 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8893192.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2010 |accessdate=8 August 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100808185557/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8893192.stm| archivedate= 8 August 2010 | deadurl= no}} During a Champions League game against [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] on 14 September 2010, Valencia suffered a break to his left ankle. An operation the morning after the match showed that his left ankle was fractured and dislocated, and that his ankle ligaments were damaged. On 28 February 2011, Valencia returned to training with Manchester United's first team. He played his first game back from injury against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the [[FA Cup]] sixth round on 12 March 2011. On 9 April 2011, he scored his first league goal of the season as he netted the second of a 2–0 home win over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. Days later, he scored the first goal in United's 4–1 victory against the German team [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] in the second leg of the semi-final of the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League]], game in which he was selected as [[player of the match]].{{cite news |title=Clinical United safely through to Wembley |url= http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/matches/season=2011/round=2000121/match=2007744/index.html |work=UEFA.com |publisher= Union of European Football Associations |date=4 May 2011 |accessdate=16 May 2011 }} He became the first Ecuadorian player to win a Premier League medal, in the [[2010–11 Premier League|2010–11]] season.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/21/antonio-valencia-new-contract-manchester-united|title=Antonio Valencia signs new three-year Manchester United contract|publisher=The Guardian|date=21 June 2014|accessdate=14 February 2017}} Valencia was a starter in United's 3–1 defeat to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[2011 UEFA Champions League Final|2011 Champions League Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/13576522|title=Barcelona 3–1 Man Utd|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 May 2011|accessdate=14 February 2017}} On 1 August 2011, Valencia agreed a new four-year deal with Manchester United, keeping him at the club until the summer of 2015.{{cite news |title=Valencia signs new Manchester United contract |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14363958.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=1 August 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011 }} Prior to the start of the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]], Valencia picked up an ankle injury on international duty with Ecuador at the [[Copa América]] during the summer. He missed United's entire pre-season tour of the United States because of the injury. He also missed the first month of the season because of a lack of match fitness. Valencia made his first start of the season away at [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the first group stage match of the [[UEFA Champions League]]. On 18 September 2011, he returned to Premier League action, replacing the injured [[Chris Smalling]] at right back in the 3–1 win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He then continued to play right back in the next three games against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]], away at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], and home against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in the Premier League. Valencia scored his first goal of the season, in a fourth round League Cup tie against [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]], receiving the ball in the middle of the park and then turning and firing in from 25-yards to seal a 3–0 victory. Valencia scored his second goal of the season, the opening goal in Manchester United's Champions League fixture against [[FC Oțelul Galați|Oțelul Galați]]. The game finished 2–0. On 26 December 2011, Valencia scored the fourth goal for Manchester United in a 5–0 home win against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]]. He received the ball on the right hand edge of the penalty area and rifled a shot across goal and into the far corner. On 22 January 2012, Valencia scored the first goal against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] with a header, before later setting up [[Danny Welbeck]] to win the game 2–1. On 2 April 2012, in his 100th appearance for the club in all competitions,{{cite web |first1=James |last1=Martin |title=United's MVP Valencia impresses again |url=http://www.espn.com/sports/soccer/blog/_/name/martin_james/id/7766989/manchester-united-antonio-valencia-impresses-again-james-martin |website=ESPN.com |publisher=ESPN |date=2 April 2012 |accessdate=14 February 2017}} Valencia scored the first goal in a 2–0 win against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], powerfully curling the ball around [[Paul Robinson (footballer born 1979)|Paul Robinson]] and inside the far corner.{{cite web |first1=Steve |last1=Bartram |title=Blackburn 0–2 Man United |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2012/Apr/blackburn-v-manchester-united-match-report.aspx?pageNo=1 |website=manutd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=2 April 2012 |accessdate=14 February 2017}} Five minutes later, Valencia set up the second goal for [[Ashley Young]]. Valencia received the [[Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year]]{{cite news |first1=James |last1=Tuck |first2=Adam |last2=Bostock |title=Fans honour Valencia |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2012/May/antonio-valencia-wins-sir-matt-busby-manchester-united-fans-player-of-the-year-award.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=13 August 2014 }} and the Manchester United Players' Player of the Year awards{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Bostock |title=Players opt for Valencia |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2012/May/antonio-valencia-wins-manchester-united-players-player-of-the-year-award.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=13 August 2014 }} for his contributions in the 2011–12 season. He also won the Manchester United Goal of the Season award for his goal against Blackburn Rovers on 2 April 2012. [[File:Antonio Valencia and Shinji Kagawa, 2012.jpg|thumb|left|Valencia in training on a pre-season tour of South Africa in July 2012]] On 3 July 2012, it was confirmed that Valencia would wear the [[Squad number (association football)|number 7 shirt]], worn by past players such as [[Johnny Berry]], [[Steve Coppell]], [[Bryan Robson]], [[Eric Cantona]], [[David Beckham]] and [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], after [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] offered the number upon [[Michael Owen]]'s departure from the club. The number 25 shirt was given to Valencia's new teammate [[Nick Powell]].{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Coppack |title=New numbers for trio |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2012/Jul/new-squad-numbers-for-valencia-and-new-signings.aspx |work=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=3 July 2012 |accessdate=31 July 2012 }} On 17 April 2013, Valencia scored his first league goal of the season, against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. On 22 April 2013, Valencia won his second Premier League title after Manchester United defeated [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 3–0 home win. After an indifferent [[2012–13 Manchester United F.C. season|2012–13]] season wearing the number 7 shirt, Valencia returned to his former number 25 shirt.{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/08/11/antonio-valencia-ditches-famous-manchester-united-no-7-shirt-3919979/|title=Antonio Valencia ditches famous Manchester United no.7 shirt|date=11 August 2013|work=Metro}} Valencia started the season with a goal against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in [[Rio Ferdinand]]'s testimonial at [[Old Trafford]] in a 3–1 defeat on 9 August 2013. Valencia subsequently appeared in the [[2013 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] against Wigan coming on as a substitute for [[Wilfried Zaha]] in the 62nd minute. Valencia started the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] campaign with a goal against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] the fourth in a 4–2 home victory as well as giving [[Robin van Persie]] an assist for the first on that night on 18 September 2013. Valencia got his first goal of the Premier League season against Fulham on 2 November 2013, the first in a 3–1 away win. Valencia scored the first goal in the 5–0 away victory to Manchester United against Bayer Leverkusen in the group stage of Champions League on 27 November 2013. On 11 January 2014, Valencia scored in the 47th minute against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in a 2–0 home win. On 21 June 2014, Valencia signed a three-year contract extension, which included an option to extend the deal until June 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27954970|title=Man Utd: Antonio Valencia signs new three-year contract|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 June 2014|accessdate=14 February 2017}} The arrival of new manager [[Louis van Gaal]] led to Valencia being deployed in both the right back and right-wing back positions, where he had occasionally played under both Sir Alex Ferguson and [[David Moyes]].{{cite web |title=Antonio Valencia enjoying right-back role |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Apr/antonio-valencia-is-enjoying-his-role-at-right-back.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=25 April 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2017}}{{cite web |title=Antonio Valencia's United story so far|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2017/Jun/Antonio-Valencia-Manchester-United-story-so-far.aspx |website= ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} He made his first start of the season in this position, assisting [[Juan Mata]] in a 1–1 draw against Sunderland on 24 August 2014.{{cite web |title=Sunderland 1–1 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28824549 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} On 25 October 2015, Valencia suffered a foot injury in a 0–0 draw with Manchester City, which required surgery and ruled him out for at least four months.{{cite web|title=Man United's Antonio Valencia out at least three months after foot surgery|url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-united/story/2719486/antonio-valencia-of-man-united-out-at-least-three-months|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=20 November 2015|date=20 November 2015}} He made his return on 17 March 2016 in the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Round of 16 second leg against Liverpool, ending in a 1–1 draw.{{cite news |title=Manchester United 1–1 Liverpool (agg 1–3) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35815538 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 March 2016 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} Valencia played the full 120 minutes at right-back in the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 21 May 2016, in which United won 2–1 after extra-time.{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United (aet)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=19 September 2017}} Manchester United triggered a one-year extension in Valencia's contract on 17 January 2017, keeping him at the club until 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38654276|title=Antonio Valencia: Man Utd trigger defender's one-year contract extension|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 January 2017|accessdate=14 February 2017}} On 19 March 2017, Valencia made his 200th league appearance for United and scored in injury time, after goalkeeper [[Víctor Valdés]] slipped, to complete a 3–1 victory over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10808218/is-antonio-valencia-now-the-best-right-back-in-the-premier-league|title=Is Antonio Valencia now the best right-back in the Premier League?|date=19 March 2017|accessdate=26 May 2017|publisher=Sky Sports}} On 26 May 2017, two days after captaining United in the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final]], his contract at the club was extended until June 2019, with an option to extend for a further year.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10893883/antonio-valencia-extends-manchester-united-contract-until-june-2019|title=Antonio Valencia extends Manchester United contract until June 2019|date=26 May 2017|accessdate=26 May 2017|publisher=Sky Sports}} On 17 September 2017, Valencia scored his first goal of the season in a 4–0 win against Everton with a 20-yard half-volley.{{cite |title=Manchester United's Antonio Valencia to be given club-captain role |date=2018-07-20 |website=Sky Sports |access-date=2018-07-21}} ==International career== [[File:Antonio Valencia Ecu vs. Col.jpg|thumb|150px|Valencia lining up for [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] in 2007]] He made his senior international debut for Ecuador in 2004. On 27 March 2005, he scored his first two international goals, coming in a 5–2 [[2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|World Cup qualifying]] win against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].{{cite news|title=Ecuador 5–2 Paraguay |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary=7302/matches/match=33864/report.html |work=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |date=25 March 2005 |accessdate=25 March 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071023235808/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary%3D7302/matches/match%3D33864/report.html |archivedate=23 October 2007 |df=dmy }} Three days later he scored again in a qualifying match, this time netting in 2–2 draw away to [[Peru national football team|Peru]].{{cite news|title=Peru 2–2 Ecuador |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary=7302/matches/match=33870/report.html |work=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |date=30 March 2005 |accessdate=30 March 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071023235835/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/preliminaries/preliminary%3D7302/matches/match%3D33870/report.html |archivedate=23 October 2007 |df=dmy }} Valencia played in all of Ecuador's [[2006 FIFA World Cup]] matches, and was chosen as a nominee for FIFA's ideal 11 team, which recognises the top stars for every position in the World Cup. He was also shortlisted as one of the six potential candidates for the [[FIFA World Cup awards#Best Young Player Award|Gillette Best Young Player]] award.{{cite news|title=Six Gillette Best Young Player nominees chosen |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/news/newsid=24742.html |work=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |date=4 July 2006 |accessdate=21 March 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080422004745/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/archive/germany2006/news/newsid%3D24742.html |archivedate=22 April 2008 |deadurl=no }} An email broadly circulated in England encouraged votes for Valencia, in an attempt to prevent [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] from winning.{{cite news |title=Supporters 'hijack' Ronaldo vote |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2006/5153870.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=6 July 2006 |accessdate=25 April 2008 }} Valencia ended up receiving the greatest number of votes in the online poll,{{cite news |title=Valencia still on top of FIFA poll |url=http://ecuador.worldcupblog.org/1/valencia-still-on-top-of-fifa-poll.html |work=Ecuador world cup blog |date=3 July 2006 |accessdate=3 July 2006 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060706230447/http://ecuador.worldcupblog.org/1/valencia-still-on-top-of-fifa-poll.html |archivedate=6 July 2006 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} but since the award's winner is determined by a combination of the fan vote and a judging panel, the award was eventually given to [[Lukas Podolski]]. On 27 June 2007, Valencia netted Ecuador's first goal of their [[2007 Copa América]] campaign, however they eventually lost the match 3–2 to [[Chile national football team|Chile]] and finished the tournament bottom of their group.{{cite news|title=Copa América 2007 – Group B |url=http://www.worldsoccer.com/competitions/copa_america/groupb.php |work=Worldsoccer.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110105043917/http://www.worldsoccer.com/competitions/copa_america/groupb.php |archivedate=5 January 2011 }} Valenica received hs first red card for Ecuador on 12 October 2008, during a 1–0 victory over Chile in a [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|World Cup qualifier]].{{cite news |title=Ecuador 1–0 Chile |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=230037&cc=5739 |work=Soccernet.espn |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=12 October 2008 |accessdate=12 October 2008 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081014062043/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=230037&cc=5739| archivedate= 14 October 2008 | deadurl= no}} On 9 September 2009, Valencia scored his first 2010 World Cup qualification goal, netting in a 3–1 away victory over [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]].{{cite news |title=Bolivia 1–3 Ecuador |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/southamerica/matches/round=250491/match=300041132/report.html |work=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |date=9 September 2009 |accessdate=9 September 2009 }} On 10 October 2009, he netted for the second qualifier in a row, this time netting Ecuador's single goal in a 2–1 defeat to the hands of [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]].{{cite news|title=Ecuador 1–2 Uruguay |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/southamerica/matches/round=250491/match=300041137/report.html |work=FIFA.com |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2011/Jul/Valencia-injured-for-Ecudaor.aspx |work=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=4 July 2011 |accessdate=5 July 2011 | June 2014, Valenica was named in Ecuador's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27370881|title=World Cup 2014: Antonio Valencia is named in Ecuador squad|date=12 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014|work=BBC}} In a preparation match, he captained the team to a 2–2 draw with [[England national football team|England]] at the [[Sun Life Stadium]] in [[Miami]]. During the match, he was fouled by [[Raheem Sterling]] and responded by shoving Sterling and grabbing him by the throat. Referee [[Jair Marrufo]] decided to send off both Valencia and Sterling.{{cite news|title=Ecuador 2–2 England – LIVE: Raheem Streling and Antonio Valencia sent off following angry exchange|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2646033/Ecuador-vs-England-LIVE-Follow-action-Miami-Three-Lions-warm-World-Cup.html|accessdate=4 June 2014|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=4 June 2014}}{{cite news|title=Raheem Sterling was sent off and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain suffered a worrying knee injury as England produced a mixed display to draw with Ecuador in their World Cup Sterling|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ecuador/10876898/Antonio-Valencia-sorry-after-sending-off-in-clash-with-Raheem-Sterling.html|accessdate=5 June 2014|work=The |url=http://www.espnfc.com/ecuador/story/1862789/antonio-valencia-sorry-for-grabbing-raheem-sterlings-neck|accessdate=5 June 2014|work=[[ESPN]]|date=5 June 2014}} Valencia captained ''La Tri'' during all three of their matches at the World Cup and was sent off for a foul on [[Lucas Digne]] during their final game against [[France national football team|France]], a goalless draw at the [[Maracanã América|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jun/03/manchester-united-antonio-valencia-miss-ecuador-copa-america|accessdate=15 June 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=3 June 2015}} He was selected in the Ecuador squad for the 2016 [[Copa América Centenario]]{{cite web|title=Ecuador without star Caicedo for Copa America Centenario|url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2016/05/18/ecuador-copa-america-roster-valencia-montero-ayovi-caicedo|publisher=Sports Illustrated|date=18 May 2016|accessdate=14 February 2017}} and on 12 June 2016, he scored in Ecuador's 4–0 victory over [[Haiti national football team|Haiti]] at [[MetLife Stadium]].{{cite web|title=Ecuador routs Haiti, will play USA in Copa America quarterfinals|url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2016/06/12/ecuador-haiti-copa-america-live-score-gamecast|publisher=Sports Illustrated|date=12 June 2016|accessdate=14 February 2017}} ==Personal life== Valencia and his wife, Zoila, have a daughter named Domenica, who was born during the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]]. Along with former Wigan Athletic teammates [[Maynor Figueroa]] and [[Wilson Palacios]], Valencia began taking English lessons. Whilst at Wigan his English lessons would be once a week, however since his move to Manchester United they are sometimes every day. Former Manchester United manager [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] described Valencia as a quiet and shy boy.{{cite news |first=David |last=McDonnell |title=Antonio Valencia has proved a worthy
