Benfica|Benfica]] |caps5 = 56 |goals5 = 6 | years6 = 2014–2017 |clubs6 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps6 = 121 |goals6 = 4 | years7 = 2017– |clubs7 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps7 = 60 |goals7 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2008–2010 |nationalteam1 = [[Serbia national under-21 football team|Serbia U21]] |nationalcaps1 = 11 |nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2008– |nationalteam2 = [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] |nationalcaps2 = 46 |nationalgoals2 = 2 | club-update = 19:10, 10 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 17 November 2018 }} '''Nemanja Matić''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Немања Матић}}, {{IPA-sh|němaɲa mǎːtitɕ|pron}};<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hjp.znanje.hr/index.php?show=search_by_id&id=e1tnXBg%3D|title=Máte|quote=Mátić|website=Hrvatski jezični portal|accessdate=17 March 2018|language=sh}}</ref> born 1 August 1988) is a Serbian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Serbia national football team|Serbian national team]]. Starting his career as an attacking midfielder, Matić shifted to a defensive midfielder during his spell at [[Benfica F.C.|Benfica]].<ref name="Marshall">{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/New-Signings-201718/New-Signings-201718-News/2017/Jul/profile-of-nemanja-matic-career-so-far-prior-to-joining-manchester-united.aspx |title=The lowdown on Nemanja Matic |last=Marshall |first=Adam |date=31 July 2017 |website=Official Manchester United Website |publisher=Manchester United |access-date=29 October 2017 |quote=}}</ref> He is known for his consistent performances on the pitch and his combative style of play.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://afootballreport.com/post/73522592694/zero-to-hero-the-rise-of-nemanja-matic |title=A Football Report – Zero to Hero: The rise of Nemanja Matic |publisher=A Football Report |accessdate=11 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/blogs/pitchside-europe/chelsea-have-europe-s-best-defensive-midfielder-in-nemanja-matic-153129379.html |title=Chelsea have Europe's best defensive midfielder in Nemanja Matic |publisher=Eurosport |date=23 December 2014 |accessdate=11 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Gill |first=Kieran |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2808282/Nemanja-Matic-better-former-Chelsea-defensive-midfielder-Claude-Makelele-constant-threat-insists-Graeme-Souness.html |title=Nemanja Matic is better than former Chelsea defensive midfielder Claude Makelele and is a 'constant threat', insists Graeme Souness |publisher=Mail Online |date=26 October 2014 |accessdate=11 February 2015}}</ref>
Matić began his senior career at [[FK Kolubara|Kolubara]], before joining Slovak side [[FC VSS Košice|Košice]] in 2007. He moved to English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for £1.5 million in 2009. Used sparingly during his first spell at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], he spent the [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11 season]] on loan at Dutch club [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]], and in the summer of 2011, he moved to [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] as part of a swap deal involving [[David Luiz]]. He won the [[LPFP Primeira Liga Player of the Year|Primeira Liga Player of the Year]] award for his performances in the [[2012–13 S.L. Benfica season|2012–13]] season. Matić returned to Chelsea in January 2014, for £21 million. He was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the 2014–15 season. In July 2017, he was reunited with former Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]] after signing for Manchester United.
Matić represented Serbia at [[Serbia national under-21 football team|under-21]] level. He made his senior international debut in 2008 and has since earned over 40 caps. He was part of their squad at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Šabac]], [[Socialist Republic of Serbia|SR Serbia]], SFR Yugoslavia, Matić began playing football at age five with [[Vrelo (Ub)|Vrelo]], coached by his own father.<ref>{{cite news |title=Teenage Kicks: Nemanja Matic |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/11/teenage-kicks--nemanja-matic.html |work=Chelseafc.com |date=19 November 2014 |accessdate=10 June 2017}}</ref> He began his senior career at [[FK Kolubara|Kolubara]], before signing for Slovak club [[FC VSS Košice|Košice]] in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|title=Matic accepts Chelsea contract offer|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/matic-accepts-chelsea-contract-offer |publisher=FourFourTwo|date=15 July 2009 |accessdate=26 June 2017}}</ref> While living in the country, he also received Slovak citizenship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.sme.sk/c/4033074/matic-so-slovenskym-obcianstvom-do-repre-az-o-tri-roky.html |title=Matič so slovenským občianstvom, do repre až o tri roky |publisher=SME |date=2 January 2014 |accessdate=11 February 2015}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== On 18 August 2009, Matić signed for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] from Košice for a fee of around £1.5 million on a four-year contract, having been on trial at [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/8206912.stm|title=Chelsea confirm signing of Matic |date=18 August 2009|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 August 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11661/4658145/matic-impressed-with-boro|title=Nemanja Matić on trial at Middlesbrough|date=14 February 2014}}</ref> He was given the number 24 shirt by Chelsea but was not able to make his debut immediately due to the injury he picked up at the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]]. He was on the bench for Chelsea's [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 23 September 2009, but did not take any part in the 1–0 victory. Matić made his [[Premier League]] debut for Chelsea on 21 November, coming on as a substitute for [[Florent Malouda]] in the 69th minute in a 4–0 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/8365169.stm|work=BBC Sport|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|last=Lyon|first=Sam|title=Chelsea 4–0 Wolves|date=21 November 2009|accessdate=21 November 2009}}</ref>
On 23 August 2010, Matić transferred to [[Eredivisie]] club [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] on a one-year loan, together with teammates [[Slobodan Rajković]] and [[Matej Delač]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/180339-vitesse-huurt-drietal-van-chelsea.html|title=Vitesse huurt drietal van Chelsea|publisher=nos.nl|date=23 August 2010}}</ref>
===Benfica=== [[File:Nemanja Matić.jpg|thumb|upright|Matić playing for [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in 2012]]
On 31 January 2011, Matić agreed to join Portuguese club [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the summer of 2011, as part of a deal for Chelsea to sign Brazilian centre-back [[David Luiz]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea sign David Luiz from Benfica for £21.3m|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/9372540.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 February 2011|accessdate=17 January 2019}}</ref> Under Benfica manager [[Jorge Jesus]], Matić was converted from a [[playmaker]] into a defensive midfielder.<ref name=interview>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/14/nemanja-matic-chelsea-interview|title=Nemanja Matic: 'We spoke for one minute. I had no doubt in coming back'|date=15 March 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref>
On 14 April 2012, Matić started for Benfica in the [[2012 Taça da Liga Final]] against [[Gil Vicente F.C.|Gil Vicente]], where he won his first trophy with the [[Lisbon]]-based club.<ref name=interview/>
On 13 January 2013, Matić scored Benfica's first goal in a 2–2 draw with ''[[O Clássico]]'' rivals [[FC Porto|Porto]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zerozero.pt/jogo.php?id=2256633 |title=Benfica 2:2 FC Porto |publisher=Zero Zero |date=13 January 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 |language=Portuguese }}</ref> The next day, he was awarded with a contract extension lasting until 2018, with the buyout clause set at €45 million.<ref>[http://www.portugoal.net/index.php/more-benfica-news/38833-matic-handed-new-benfica-deal PortuGOAL: Matic handed new Benfica deal] 14 January 2013</ref>
In Benfica's second-leg [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Round of 32|Round of 32]] Europa League clash with [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]], Matić headed in a late goal after a cross from [[Lima (footballer)|Lima]] to seal a 3–1 aggregate victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000357/match=2010056/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Stylish Benfica put an end to Leverkusen |publisher=UEFA |date=21 February 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 }}</ref> Matić was an integral member throughout the [[2012–13 Primeira Liga]] campaign as Benfica looked to claim the club's first league championship since [[2009–10 Primeira Liga|2010]]. Going into the penultimate game of the season against Porto, both teams were undefeated in league play,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/85403/porto-vs-benfica/preview |title=Primeira Liga Preview: Porto – Benfica: Jorge Jesus' men could lift their first Primeira Liga in three years with victory, while the Dragao would go top if they can triumph in front of their own fans. |publisher=Goal.com |date=10 May 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 }}</ref> but a stoppage-time winner from substitute [[Kelvin Mateus de Oliveira|Kelvin]] gave Porto a 2–1 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2323219/Benfica-suffer-crushing-title-blow-just-days-Euro-showdown-Chelsea.html |title=Benfica suffer crushing title blow just days before Euro showdown with Chelsea |publisher=Daily Mail |date=11 May 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1454181/porto-clinches-3rd-straight-portuguese-title?cc=5901 |title=Porto claims 27th title on last day |publisher=ESPNFC |date=19 May 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013}}</ref>
On 15 May, Matić faced former employers Chelsea in the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League]] final in Amsterdam but was on the losing side as Benfica fell to a 2–1 defeat, courtesy of a last minute [[Branislav Ivanović]] header.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22445388 |title=Rafael Benitez's reign as Chelsea's interim manager will end in triumph after Branislav Ivanovic's injury-time header won the Europa League final against Benfica in Amsterdam. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 }}</ref> On 4 July 2013, he was named [[LPFP Primeira Liga Player of the Year|Primeira Liga Player of the Year]] after having won the monthly award three times over the course of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=413063|title=Matic eleito melhor jogador do último campeonato, Vítor Pereira melhor treinador|trans-title=Matic voted best player of the last championship, Vítor Pereira best manager|publisher=[[A Bola]]|language=Portuguese|date=4 July 2013|accessdate=5 July 2012 }}</ref><ref name="Ref1">{{cite web|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga//interior.aspx?content_id=831393|title=Matic foi o melhor jogador da época 2012/13|trans-title=Matic was the best player of the 2012/13 season|publisher=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=Portuguese|date=4 July 2013|accessdate=5 July 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130706173900/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/interior.aspx?content_id=831393|archive-date=6 July 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In the [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14 season]], Matić played half of the season, with 22 matches and 3 goals, he helped Benfica to win the [[2013–14 Primeira Liga|Primeira Liga]] and [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|Taça de Portugal]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Benfica lift cup to seal historic treble |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=por/news/newsid=2107634.html |publisher=[[UEFA]] |date=18 May 2014 |access-date=20 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://pt.fifa.com/world-match-centre/news/newsid/234/083/7/ |title=Benfica conquista Taça e consegue o triplete em Portugal |trans-title=Benfica conquers Portuguese Cup and achieves the treble in Portugal |language=Portuguese |date=18 May 2014 |publisher=[[FIFA]] |access-date=18 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140519023449/http://pt.fifa.com/world-match-centre/news/newsid/234/083/7/ |archivedate=19 May 2014 }}</ref> On 13 January 2014, Matić placed second in the 2013 [[FIFA Puskás Award#2013|FIFA Puskás Award]].<ref>{{cite web|title=FIFA Puskás award 2013 – results|url=https://www.fifa.com/mm/document/ballond'or/pusk%C3%A1saward/02/26/04/11/13_01_2014_puskas_results_neutral.pdf|publisher=FIFA.com|accessdate=11 February 2015}}</ref>
===Return to Chelsea=== [[File:Matic v Arsenal 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Matić playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2014]]
On 15 January 2014, Matić rejoined Chelsea for a fee of £21 million (€25M),<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25743128 | title=Nemanja Matic completes £21m Chelsea return | publisher=[[BBC Sport]] | work=bbc.co.uk/sport | date=15 January 2014 | accessdate=15 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://web3.cmvm.pt/sdi2004/emitentes/docs/FR48184.pdf |title=Comunicado |language=Portuguese |trans-title=Announcement |date=15 January 2014 |publisher=[[Portuguese Securities Market Commission|CMVM]] |format=PDF |accessdate=31 December 2014}}</ref> on a five-and-a-half-year contract.<ref>{{cite web |title=Matic Signs |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3622226/title/matic-signs |work=Chelsea FC |date=15 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117232133/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3622226/title/matic-signs |archivedate=17 January 2014 }}</ref> He made his second debut for the club four days later, replacing [[Willian (footballer)|Willian]] in a 3–1 win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25701613 "Chelsea 3–1 Manchester United"] BBC Sport. 19 January 2014. Retrieved 20 January 2014.</ref>
On 3 February, Matić made his first [[2013–14 Premier League|Premier League]] start in Chelsea's fixture away at championship rivals [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/feb/03/manchester-city-chelsea-player-ratings|title=Manchester City v Chelsea: player ratings|date=3 February 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref> He was named [[man of the match]] by [[Sky Sports]] as Chelsea ended City's unbeaten run at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] with a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287521/report|title=Premier League: Ivanovic strike sees Chelsea beat title rivals Manchester City|date=4 February 2014|work=BSkyB}}</ref>
Matić scored his first Premier League goal on 30 August 2014, in a 6–3 win at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Everton 3–6 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28906778|accessdate=30 August 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=30 August 2014}}</ref> A month later, Matić scored the only goal as Chelsea won away at [[Sporting Clube de Portugal|Sporting CP]] in the group stage of the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]];<ref>{{cite news|title=Sporting 0–1 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29362602|accessdate=30 September 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=30 September 2014}}</ref> on 5 November in the same competition, his goal earned Chelsea a 1–1 draw at [[NK Maribor|Maribor]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sever|first1=Grega|title=Handanovič helps Maribor to Chelsea draw|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000548/match=2014360/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=5 November 2014|publisher=[[UEFA]]|date=5 November 2014}}</ref>
Matić was given a straight red card in Chelsea's 1–1 home draw against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 21 February 2015, for pushing over [[Ashley Barnes]] following a high tackle by him, which resulted in the bending of Matić's shin.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|title=Chelsea 1–1 Burnley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31466726|accessdate=22 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=21 February 2015}}</ref> On appeal, his suspension was shortened to two matches, including the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|League Cup Final]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Nemanja Matic: Chelsea player's ban reduced to two games|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31613184|accessdate=24 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=24 February 2015}}</ref>
On 26 April 2015, Matić was named as one of four midfielders in the [[PFA Team of the Year]], alongside teammate [[Eden Hazard]]. Four more Chelsea players were included in the selection.<ref name=PFATOTY1415/>
[[File:DK-Chel15 (5).jpg|thumb|upright|Matić playing for Chelsea in 2015]]
On 12 September 2015, Matić scored his first goal of the [[2015–16 Premier League]] season against Everton, but it was not enough to save Chelsea from a 3–1 loss.<ref>{{cite|title=Everton 3–1 Chelsea|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/12/england/premier-league/everton-football-club/chelsea-football-club/2043087/|accessdate=1 July 2016|publisher=Soccerway|date=12 September 2015}}</ref> Matić was sent off for two yellow cards in the first half of Chelsea's 2–1 loss at [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 24 October 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=West Ham 2–1 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34558482|accessdate=24 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 October 2015}}</ref>
For the majority of the [[2016–17 Premier League]] season, Matić played as a central midfielder in a 3–4–3 formation. He scored the 4th goal in Chelsea's 4–2 FA Cup semi-final win over Tottenham Hotspur on 22 April 2017.<ref>{{cite|title=Chelsea 4–2 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39604653|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 April 2017}}</ref> On 8 May 2017, he scored his first ever goal at Stamford Bridge, in a 3–0 victory over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite|title=Chelsea 3–0 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39767793|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 May 2017}}</ref>
===Manchester United=== [[File:Nemanja Matić 27 September 2017 cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Matić playing for Manchester United in 2017]] On 30 July 2017, a photo was leaked of Matić wearing a [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] training kit printed with the number 31 vacated by [[Bastian Schweinsteiger]] the previous March, fuelling rumours that Matić was on the verge of a reunion with former Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Callum |last=Davis |title=Picture of Nemanja Matić in a Manchester United kit leaked online |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/07/30/manchester-united-fans-attempt-verify-leaked-photo-nemanja-matic/ |website=telegraph.co.uk |publisher=Telegraph Media Group |date=30 July 2017 |accessdate=31 July 2017 }}</ref> Manchester United confirmed the deal the next day, with Matić signing a three-year contract with an option for an extra year.<ref>{{cite news |title=United sign Nemanja Matić |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Jul/manchester-united-announces-the-signing-of-nemanja-matic-from-chelsea.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=31 July 2017 |accessdate=31 July 2017 }}</ref> Two days after signing, he made his first appearance in a friendly against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]], finishing in a 2–1 win over the Italian side.<ref>{{cite news |title=Report: Manchester United 2 Sampdoria 1 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Aug/match-report-tour-2017-manchester-united-2-Sampdoria-1-aviva-stadium-dublin-2-august.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=2 August 2017 |accessdate= 13 August 2017}}</ref> On 13 August 2017, Matić made his league debut in a 4–0 win over West Ham United at Old Trafford, in which he was named Man of the Match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchster United 4–0 West Ham United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40841358 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=13 August 2017}}</ref> On 5 March 2018, Matić scored his first goal for the club with a half-volley in a 3–2 comeback win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] after being 2–0 down.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/11667/11278100/watch-nemanja-matic-scores-superb-goal-to-secure-man-utd-win|title=WATCH: Nemanja Matic scores superb goal to secure Man Utd win {{!}} soccer News {{!}} Sky Sports|website=www.skysports.com|language=en|access-date=6 March 2018}}</ref>
During the boxing day matches of the [[2018–19 Premier League]], Nemanja Matić scored his first goal of the season and his second for Manchester United in a 3–1 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref>https://www.skysports.com/football/man-utd-vs-huddsfld/390943</ref>
==International career== Matić's debut for the [[Serbia national under-21 football team|Serbia under-21 team]] came in a match against [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]] on 11 October 2008.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/competitions/under21/fixturesresults/round=15085/match=304060/report=lu.html | title = UEFA stats for Denmark U21 vs. Serbia U21 game | accessdate = | date = | publisher = | language = }}</ref> After three matches and two goals for the Serbia under-21 squad, he was called up to the [[Serbia national football team|Serbian senior squad]] and made his debut in a friendly against [[Poland national football team|Poland]] on 14 December 2008, in a 1–0 loss.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.profutbal.sk/clanok67269.htm | title = Matić debutoval v srbskom drese | accessdate = | date = 14 December 2008 | publisher = ''profutbal'' | language = Slovak | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120314093302/http://www.profutbal.sk/clanok67269.htm | archivedate = 14 March 2012 | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
Matić took part in the 2009 UEFA Euro Under-21 Championship, where he played 85 minutes in the first group match against [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy]] in a 0–0 draw. Matić, however, injured himself after contact with Italian forward [[Sebastian Giovinco]]. He broke the fifth metatarsal in his right foot and was forced to undergo surgery.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/competitions/under21/news/kind=1/newsid=838973.html |title=Broken bone robs Serbia of Matić |accessdate=6 July 2009 |date=17 June 2009 |publisher=''[[UEFA]]'' |language= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090620083943/http://www.uefa.com/competitions/under21/news/kind=1/newsid=838973.html |archivedate=20 June 2009 }}</ref>
In December 2012, Matić announced he would not play for the Serbian national team while [[Siniša Mihajlović]] was the coach. The reason he gave for this decision is that he felt he was not given the right opportunity by the coach not playing a single minute in his last five call-ups.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.rts.rs/page/sport/sr/story/36/Fudbal/1206072/Nemanja+Mati%C4%87%3A+Dok+ne+ode+Miha....html | title = Nemanja Matić: Dok ne ode Miha... | accessdate = 30 May 2013| date = 6 November 2012| publisher = ''RTS'' | language = Serbian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.reprezentacija.rs/index.php/en/component/content/article/3068-selektor-treba-da-zove-igrace-ili-oni-njega | title = Selector should be called players or they did? | accessdate = 30 May 2013| date = 21 May 2013| publisher = ''reprezentacija.rs'' | language = }}</ref> On 6 September 2013, Matić returned to his national team on a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group A#Serbia v Croatia|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], being [[Sent off#Association football|sent off]] in the 75th minute.<ref>{{cite web|title=Matic back for Serbia's crunch qualifiers|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/soccer-matic-back-serbias-crunch-qualifiers-125005809--sow.html|work=sports.yahoo.com|accessdate=6 September 2013|date=6 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Serbia 1–1 Croatia|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/europe/matches/round=258374/match=300182196/index.html|work=[[FIFA]]|accessdate=6 September 2013}}</ref>
He scored his first international goal on 29 March 2015, in a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] match away to [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at the [[Estádio da Luz]], equalising via an [[overhead kick]], albeit in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite news|title=Portugal see off Serbia to top Group I|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/qualifiers/season=2016/matches/round=2000446/match=2013943/postmatch/report/index.html#portugal+serbia|accessdate=29 March 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=29 March 2015}}</ref> On 11 October, in a loss against the same opponents by the same score at the [[Partizan Stadium]], Matić received a straight red card within a minute of teammate [[Aleksandar Kolarov]]'s dismissal.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Nikčević|first1=Sonja|title=Moutinho magic seals top spot for Portugal|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/qualifiers/season=2016/matches/round=2000446/match=2014055/postmatch/report/index.html#portugal+seal+spot|accessdate=11 October 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=11 October 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Ser-Swi (27).jpg|thumb|upright|Matić playing for Serbia at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]] In June 2018, he was selected in the Serbian squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]],<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44083365 | title = World Cup 2018: All the confirmed squads for this summer's finals in Russia | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 4 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}}</ref> playing all three group stage matches.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44427970 | title = Costa Rica 0–1 Serbia | publisher = BBC Sport | author = Timothy Abraham | date = 17 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44439145 | title = Serbia 1–2 Switzerland | publisher = BBC Sport | author = Matthew Henry | date = 23 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/27/sports/world-cup/brazil-vs-serbia.html|title=World Cup: Brazil cruises into next round with easy victory|newspaper=The New York Times|author=Andrew Das|date=27 June 2018|accessdate=27 June 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== {{Quote box |quote = "He's a controlling midfielder but what he brings which Michael [Carrick] doesn't is a little bit of aggression. He gets to the ball, he tackles, he allows other people to play.” |source = <small>[[Paul Scholes]]'s comment on Matić's playing style.<ref name="Jepson">{{cite web |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-utd-fixtures-matic-scholes-13476473 |title=Manchester United great Paul Scholes explains what Nemanja Matic has that Michael Carrick doesn't |last=Jepson |first=Anthony |date=15 August 2017 |website=Manchester Evening News |publisher=Manchester Evening News |access-date=30 October 2017 |quote=}}</ref></small> |width = 30% |align = right }}
A left-footed [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]], Matić's poise and power, in addition to his in-game intelligence and tactical awareness, have enabled his attacking teammates to flourish. He is often used at a holding position and screens the defence while providing cover for attacking movements. Just before he joined Manchester United, he had a tackle success rate of 75% in 123 Premier League appearances, a higher rate than [[N'Golo Kante]], [[Ander Herrera]], [[Fernandinho (footballer)|Fernandinho]] and [[Jordan Henderson]].<ref name="Bibby">{{cite AV media |people=Bibby, Stephen |date=31 July 2017 |title=Seven quick facts about Nemanja Matic |trans-title= |medium= |language=English |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/New-Signings-201718/New-Signings-201718-News/2017/Jul/video-seven-facts-on-new-manchester-united-signing-nemanja-matic.aspx |access-date=30 October 2017 |format= |time= |location= |publisher=Manchester United |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }}</ref> [[José Mourinho]] commented on Matić, "At this moment, he is a giant, not for his size but for the way he plays."<ref name="Marshall" /> Matić's qualities have led to comparison to his ex-teammate at Manchester United, [[Michael Carrick]].<ref name="Higgins">{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Exclusive-Interviews/2017/Aug/Former-Manchester-United-captain-Nemanja-Vidic-discusses-fellow-Serbian-Nemanja-Matic.aspx |title=Nemanja on Nemanja: Vidic discusses Matic |last=Higgins |first=Adam |date=28 August 2017 |website=Official Manchester United Website |publisher=Manchester United |access-date=30 October 2017 |quote=}}</ref>
==Personal life== Matić's younger brother, [[Uroš Matić|Uroš]], is also a professional [[association football|footballer]], playing for [[Danish Superliga]] side [[F.C. Copenhagen]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://au.eurosport.com/football/serbian-uros-matic-to-play-for-macedonia_sto4526919/story.shtml |title=Serbian Uros Matic to play for Macedonia |date=27 December 2014 |publisher=Eurosport Australia |accessdate=4 January 2015}}</ref> Matić is of partial [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonian]] descent as his maternal grandfather is from [[Volkovija]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.macedonianfootball.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=7040:interview-with-uro-mati-im-thinking-of-playing-for-macedonia&catid=13:international&Itemid=64|title=Interview with Uroš Matić: I'm thinking of playing for Macedonia|publisher=Macedonian football|work=Jovan Trpcheski|date=21 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.sme.sk/c/7571280/byvaly-hrac-kosic-bude-reprezentovat-macedonsko.html|title=Bývalý hráč Košíc bude reprezentovať Macedónsko|language=Slovak|publisher=Smesk|work=Sita Vydané|date=2 January 2015}}</ref>
Matić has admired former Manchester United midfielder [[Roy Keane]] from an early age.<ref name="Miles">{{cite web |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/4394738/nemanja-matic-manchester-united-roy-keane/ |title='He's a legend' Nemanja Matic reveals his favourite Manchester United player ever is Roy Keane |last=Miles |first=Joe |date=5 September 2017 |website=The Sun |publisher=The Sun |access-date=31 October 2017 |quote=}}</ref>

He began his career at [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], making his senior debut in 2006 at the age of 16 and [[Serie A]] debut in 2007 at the age of 17. In 2009, he joined [[Calcio Padova|Padova]] on loan, whom he helped avoid relegation from [[Serie B]] in his only season there. He then signed for [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]] in 2010, and one year later joined [[Torino FC|Torino]], where he played for four seasons. He moved to Manchester United in July 2015, winning the [[FA Cup]], [[EFL Cup]] and [[UEFA Europa League]] in his first two seasons with the club.
Darmian made his senior debut for the Italy national team in May 2014, and represented his nation at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Early life== Darmian grew up playing football in the main square in [[Rescaldina]]<ref name="earlylife">{{cite web |title=Italy's Darmian living the dream |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=italy-s-darmian-living-the-dream-2383213.html }}</ref> and was trained by his father, Giovanni, who was one of the coaches of [[:it:Oratorio (centro giovanile)|Oratorio]] team, U.S. CARCOR, where players such as [[Marco Simone]] and [[Luigi Pogliana]] also played.<ref name="earlylife2">{{cite web |title=Matteo Darmian e Francesca, tutti i gossip e vita privata del calciatore dei Mondiali 2014 |url=http://www.gossippiu.com/2014/06/matteo-darmian-e-francesca-tutti-i.html |website=gossippiu.com |publisher=gossippiu |accessdate=13 June 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.prealpina.it/pages/da-rescaldina-al-brasile-26460.html |title=Da Rescaldina al Brasile|publisher=Prealpina.it |accessdate=8 August 2015 |language=Italian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ilgiorno.it/legnano/cronaca/2014/06/17/1079783-Darmian-mondiali.shtml |title=Darmian il predestinato: "Ha un dono naturale". La Carcor di Rescaldina si gode il suo Matteo|author=Cristiana Mariani|publisher=ilgiorno.it |accessdate=8 August 2015 |language=Italian}}</ref> He often played as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central]] or [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive]] [[midfielder]] in his youth.<ref name="midfielder ">{{cite web |url=https://www.squawka.com/en/news/matteo-darmian-i-was-a-midfielder-before-joining-ac-milan-as-a-youngster/845976#t70eq5QEs9egUYct.97 |title=Matteo Darmian: I was a midfielder before joining AC Milan as a youngster |publisher=www.squawka.com |author1=Billy Rooney |date=6 December 2016 |accessdate=18 October 2018 }}</ref> His first real break came when he was spotted by [[Beniamino Abate]], a former [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] tasked with scouting [[Lombardy]] for young talent by [[A.C. Milan|Milan]].<ref name="earlylife"/>
==Club career==
===Milan=== In 2000, he joined Milan's [[A.C. Milan Primavera|youth system]].<ref>Brochure Pre Palermo-Inter, Unione Sportiva Città di Palermo, 17 September 2010, p. 5.</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Giovanissimi Nazionali 2003/2004 |url=http://www.acmilan.com/MostraInfo.asp?id_info=18942 |work=acmilan.com |publisher=[[A.C. Milan|Associazione Calcio Milan]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040606084629/http://www.acmilan.com/MostraInfo.asp?id_info=18942 |archivedate=6 June 2004 |accessdate=20 August 2010 |language=Italian}}</ref> He made his first-team debut for the ''Rossoneri'' on 28 November 2006, aged only 16, in the [[Coppa Italia]] against [[Brescia Calcio|Brescia]], replacing [[Kakha Kaladze]] at half-time.<ref name="Profile">{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/LM_Actor.aspx?idSquadra=3&idStagione=15&idPersona=7162&name=Darmian%20Matteo |title=A.C. Milan – Matteo Darmian |work=ACMilan.com |publisher=A.C. Milan |accessdate=9 September 2009 |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090702204911/http://www.acmilan.com/LM_Actor.aspx?idSquadra=3&idStagione=15&idPersona=7162&name=Darmian%20Matteo |archivedate=2 July 2009 }}</ref>
He made his [[Serie A]] debut at the age of 17, in Milan's 3–2 defeat against [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] on 19 May 2007,<ref name="Profile"/> when he entered in the 67th minute to replace [[Giuseppe Favalli]]. During the 2007–08 season he became the leader and [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the [[A.C. Milan Primavera]], collecting another appearance for the first-team in the Coppa Italia. The following season, the 19-year-old defender collected an additional three league appearances. He ended his experience at Milan with four appearances in the top flight.
====Padova (loan)==== On 17 July 2009, Darmian moved to [[Serie B]] club [[Calcio Padova|Padova]] on loan until the end of the [[Serie B 2009–10|2009–10 season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.padovacalcio.it/ultime_news.php?id=2698 |title=Il baby rossonero Darmian in prestito al Padova |date=1 September 2009 |work=padovacalcio.it |publisher=Padova Calcio |accessdate=31 August 2009 |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090823165700/http://www.padovacalcio.it/ultime_news.php?id=2698 |archivedate=23 August 2009 }}</ref> He made his official debut for the club on 28 November 2009, in a home loss against [[Vicenza Calcio|Vicenza]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.padovacalcio.it/archivionews.php?id=2952 |title=Padova–Vicenza 1–2 |date=1 December 2009 |work=padovacalcio.it |publisher=Padova Calcio |accessdate=28 November 2009 |language=Italian}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> He went on to make 20 appearances and score one goal, as Padova finished the season in 19th place and subsequently won the [[2009–10 Serie B#Relegation|relegation play-off]] against [[U.S. Triestina Calcio|Triestina]].
===Palermo=== [[File:Matteo_Darmian.jpg|thumb|200px|Darmian playing for [[US Citta di Palermo|Palermo]] against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in 2010]] On 11 July 2010, it was announced that Matteo Darmian would join [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]]'s pre-season training camp in [[Austria]], after Milan and the Sicilian Serie A club agreed in principle about a transfer move involving him.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ilpalermocalcio.it/it/0910/news_scheda.jsp?id=20988 |publisher=US Città di Palermo |language=Italian |accessdate=11 July 2010 |date=11 July 2010 |title=DA DOMANI I ROSA IN RITIRO}}</ref> The move, unveiled as a [[Co-ownership (football)|co-ownership]] bid, was officially announced by Palermo the next day.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ilpalermocalcio.it/it/0910/news_scheda.jsp?id=20994 |publisher=US Città di Palermo |language=Italian |accessdate=12 July 2010 |date=12 July 2010 |title=MATTEO DARMIAN AL PALERMO}}</ref> The fee was €800,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2010/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_10.pdf |title=AC Milan Group 2010 Annual Report |date=April 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011 |work=AC Milan |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120515220657/http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2010/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_10.pdf |archivedate=15 May 2012 |df=dmy }}</ref> Darmian made his debut for the ''Rosanero'' on 16 September 2010, in a [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] game against [[AC Sparta Prague|Sparta Prague]], which also earned him his debut in [[UEFA competitions|European competition]]. His Palermo league debut was during the fourth game of the season, coming on for [[Javier Pastore]] in a 3–1 win against [[Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|title=JUVENTUS 1 – 3 PALERMO |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/-/match-report/Juventus-Palermo/25279 |work=legaseriea.it |publisher=Lega Serie A |accessdate=14 May 2014 |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515135815/http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/-/match-report/Juventus-Palermo/25279 |archivedate=15 May 2014 |df= }}</ref> On 6 February 2011, he played his first game as a starter in the league in a 4–2 victory for Palermo away at [[U.S. Lecce|Lecce]], but was substituted in the 33rd minute due to injury.<ref>{{cite web|title=PER DARMIAN DISTRAZIONE MUSCOLARE|url=http://palermocalcio.it/it/1011/news/scheda.php?id=22618|work=palermocalcio.it|accessdate=14 May 2014|language=Italian}}</ref> He finished the season with 16 appearances among [[2010–11 Serie A|Serie A]], [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] and [[2010–11 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]].
===Torino=== After Milan and Palermo renewed the co-ownership on 23 June 2011,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=03906b62-a7b9-4a9d-b2f8-4e87e36e4c8e&groupId=10192 |work=Legaseriea.it |title=RISOL. ACC. PART. |accessdate=12 May 2014 |page=2 |format=pdf |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723184534/http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?uuid=03906b62-a7b9-4a9d-b2f8-4e87e36e4c8e&groupId=10192 |archivedate=23 July 2011 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=COMUNICATO COMPARTECIPAZIONI|url=http://palermocalcio.it/it/1011/news/scheda.php?id=24431|work=palermocalcio.it|accessdate=12 May 2014|language=Italian|trans-title=Darmian and Glik loaned to Torino}}</ref> he was officially loaned to Serie B side [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] on 12 July 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Darmian e Glik ceduti al Torino|url=http://palermocalcio.it/it/1011/news/scheda.php?id=24636|work=palermocalcio.it|publisher=U.S. Città di Palermo|accessdate=12 May 2014|language=Italian}}</ref> He made his debut for the ''Granata'' on 13 August 2011, in the [[2011–12 Coppa Italia#Section 5|second round of Coppa Italia]] against [[A.C. Lumezzane|Lumezzane]];<ref>{{cite web|title=TORINO VS. LUMEZZANE 1 – 0|url=https://it.soccerway.com/matches/2011/08/13/italy/coppa-italia/torino-fc/ac-lumezzane/1182974/|work=soccerway.com|accessdate=12 May 2014}}</ref> and scored his first goal on 30 October 2011, against [[Empoli F.C.|Empoli]], allowing his team to win 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|title=Torino-Empoli 2 1|url=http://www.legaserieb.it/it/serie-b/campionato/matchreport/-/match-report/Torino-Empoli/35839|work=legaserieb.it|publisher=lega serie b|accessdate=12 May 2014|language=Italian|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512220501/http://www.legaserieb.it/it/serie-b/campionato/matchreport/-/match-report/Torino-Empoli/35839|archivedate=12 May 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 13 November 2013, he was injured against [[A.S. Bari|Bari]] and sidelined for five games.<ref>{{cite web|title=torino grave infortunio per lex rosanero darmian|url=http://www.tuttopalermo.net/altre-squadre/torino-grave-infortunio-per-l-ex-rosanero-darmian-40563|work=tuttopalermo.net|accessdate=16 April 2014}}</ref> At the end of the season, he was promoted to Serie A, having played 33 games in the league and one in the Coppa Italia.<ref name=soccerway-profile>{{cite web|title=M. Darmian|url=https://it.soccerway.com/players/matteo-darmian/17720/|work=soccerway.com|accessdate=12 May 2014}}</ref>
On 20 June 2012, Palermo redeemed his 50% share from Milan for €500,000<ref>[http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2012/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_12.pdf AC Milan Group 2012 annual report] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150501041522/http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2012/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_12.pdf |date=1 May 2015 }}</ref><ref name="tuttopalermo.net">{{cite web|title=Palermo, Succi al Cesena e Darmian al Torino|url=http://www.tuttopalermo.net/calcio-mercato/palermo-succi-al-cesena-e-darmian-al-torino-45965|work=tuttopalermo.net|accessdate=12 May 2014|language=Italian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Partecipazioni |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?p_l_id=58608&folderId=159875&name=DLFE-47629.pdf |publisher=Legaseriea.it |page=2 |language=Italian |format=PDF |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130626172007/http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?p_l_id=58608&folderId=159875&name=DLFE-47629.pdf |archivedate=26 June 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref> and on 5 July 2012, his return to Torino was formulised under a co-ownership agreement for €825,000.<ref name="tuttopalermo.net"/><ref name=Palermo2013bilancio>US Città di Palermo SpA ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 30 June 2013, PDF purchased from [[Camera di Commercio, Industria, Agricoltura e Artigianato|CCIAA]] (in Italian)</ref> With Torino he played 30 games in [[2012–13 Serie A|Serie A]] and two in the [[2012–13 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]]. On 20 June 2013, Torino redeemed the remainder of his contract from Palermo for €1.5 million.<ref name=Palermo2013bilancio/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://palermocalcio.it/it/1314/news/scheda.php?id=28573|title=GLIK E DARMIAN COMPROPRIETA' RISOLTE A FAVORE DEL TORINO|work=U.S. Citta' di Palermo}}</ref>
In the 2013–14 season, he played 37 games in [[2013–14 Serie A|Serie A]] for Torino, who finished 7th and qualified for the [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] after [[Parma F.C.|Parma]] failed to obtain a [[UEFA]] license.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2014/10/20/why-manchester-united-wont-get-darmian-in-january/|title=Why Manchester United won’t get Darmian in January|work=Here Is The City}}</ref> He featured in the [[Serie A Team of the Year]], along with teammate, [[Ciro Immobile]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/2014/12/15-315387/Serie+A,+Gran+Gal%C3%A0+del+Calcio+Aic.+Tutte+le+frasi+e+i+premi?print|title=Serie A, Gran Galà del Calcio Aic. Tutte le frasi e i premi|date=15 December 2014|work=www.tuttosport.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160118110540/http://www.tuttosport.com/calcio/serie_a/2014/12/15-315387/Serie+A,+Gran+Gal%C3%A0+del+Calcio+Aic.+Tutte+le+frasi+e+i+premi?print|archivedate=18 January 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 18 May 2014, he made his 100th appearance for Torino during the 2–2 draw away to [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]].<ref>{{cite web|title=FIORENTINA VS. TORINO 2 – 2|url=https://it.soccerway.com/matches/2014/05/18/italy/serie-a/acf-fiorentina/torino-fc/1552217/?ICID=PL_MS_10|work=soccerway.com|accessdate=21 May 2014}}</ref>
In his first appearance of the [[2014–15 in Italian football|2014–15 season]], on 7 August 2014, he scored his first goal in European competition, in a 4–0 victory against Sweden's [[IF Brommapojkarna]], in the second leg of the [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League|2014–15 Europa League]] [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League#Third qualifying round|third qualifying round]].<ref>{{cite web|title=TORINO VS. BROMMAPOJKARNA 4 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/07/europe/uefa-cup/torino-fc/ildrottsforening--brommapojkarna/1802665/|website=soccerway.com|accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> On 29 October 2014, he scored his first goal in Serie A to secure a 1–0 win over [[Parma F.C.|Parma]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.soccerway.com/matches/2014/10/29/italy/serie-a/torino-fc/parma-fc/1836277/|title=Torino vs. Parma – 29 October 2014 – Soccerway|work=soccerway.com}}</ref> before returning to the score-sheet on 11 December 2014 in the Europa League [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League group stage|group stage]], won 5–1 away at [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it/calcio/1_gol_europaleague/2014/video/64612/copenaghen-torino-1-5.shtml|title=Copenaghen-Torino 1–5 – Calcio – Sportmediaset|work=Sportmediaset.it}}</ref> On 26 February 2015, he scored the match-winner against [[Athletic Bilbao]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://it.soccerway.com/matches/2015/02/26/europe/uefa-cup/athletic-club/torino-fc/1974621/|title=Athletic Bilbao vs. Torino – 26 febbraio 2015 – Soccerway|work=soccerway.com}}</ref> qualifying Torino for the [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League#Round of 16|round of 16]] after a historic 3–2 victory in Spain.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/serie-a/torino/2015/02/26/news/athletic_bilbao-torino_2-3_darmian_manda_i_granata_agli_ottavi-108287485/|title=Athletic Bilbao-Torino 2–3: Darmian manda i granata agli ottavi|date=26 February 2015|work=Repubblica.it}}</ref> He concluded the season with 47 appearances and five goals between Serie A, Europe and the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]].<ref name=soccerway-profile />
In total, he played 151 matches and scored six goals for Torino.<ref name="soccerway-profile" />
===Manchester United=== ====2015–16 season==== On 11 July 2015, Darmian signed for English club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for an undisclosed fee, believed to be £12.7 million. He signed a four-year contract with an option to extend it for a further year.<ref>{{cite news |title=Matteo Darmian: Man Utd sign Torino and Italy defender |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33495877 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=11 July 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 }}</ref> He made his debut for the club against [[Club América]] during preseason on 17 July, playing the first 45 minutes, with United winning 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jul/New-signings-Schneiderlin-Depay-Darmian-Schweinsteiger-impress-vs-Club-America.aspx |title=Four new signings shine against Club America |website=manutd.com |first=Ben |last=Hibbs |date=18 July 2015 |accessdate=19 July 2015}}</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut on 8 August 2015 as the season opened with a 1–0 victory against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Old Trafford]], with manager [[Louis van Gaal]] selecting his performance as the best of the match.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Man Utd 1–0 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744640|accessdate=8 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 10 September, Darmian earned his first official accolade at the club, after he was voted Manchester United's August 2015 player of the month. "It's important to know this is from the fans," Matteo told United's official website. "I want to thank them. I am happy. I also want to thank my team-mates and everyone at the club for making me feel welcome."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Sep/matteo-darmian-wins-manchester-united-player-of-the-month-award-for-august-2015.aspx|title=Matteo Darmian wins Manchester United's Player of the Month award – Official Manchester United Website|work=manutd.com}}</ref>
In his twenty-seventh league appearance of the [[2015–16 Manchester United F.C. season|2015–16 season]], on 20 April 2016, Matteo scored his first [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and Premier League goal, a powerful [[volley (football)|volley]] from the edge of the [[penalty area]], in a 2–0 victory against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35733434|title=Manchester United 2–0 Crystal Palace|work=BBC Sport}}</ref> He was presented with the club's [[Man of the Match]] award for his performance in this fixture and hailed his 55th-minute strike as the best goal of his career, thus far.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Apr/player-reaction-matteo-darmian-reflects-on-first-goal-for-Manchester-United.aspx|title=Darmian hails best goal of his career – Official Manchester United Website|work=manutd.com}}</ref> His cross, in the fourth minute of play, had also previously forced an own goal from [[Damien Delaney]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/barclays-premier-league/match/422366/manchester-united-crystal-palace/report|title=Matteo Darmian stunner seals Man United win over Crystal Palace|publisher=ESPN FC|date=20 April 2016|accessdate=21 April 2016}}</ref> Darmian featured in the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] against Crystal Palace on 21 May, coming on in the 66th minute for [[Marcos Rojo]], helping United achieve a 2–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265 |title=Manchester United 2–0 Crystal Palace |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>

on 27 January, helping United advance 3–2 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |first=Luke |last=Reddy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38672990 |title=Hull City 2–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 January 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>
Darmian's appearances in the league became limited after a 1–1 draw against [[Liverpool F.C.–Manchester United F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 15 January,<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38545987 |title=Manchester United 1–1 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 January 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> with him not featuring again until 19 March when he came on as a stoppage time substitute in a 3–1 win against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Louise |last=Gwilliam |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39246750 |title=Middlesbrough 1-3 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 March 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> On 9 April, he started for United, his first in the league since January, in a 3–0 victory over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] at the [[Stadium of Light]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39470442 |title=Sunderland 0–3 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 April 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> In May 2017, Darmian played in both of the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Semi-finals|UEFA Europa League semi-final]] games against Spanish-side [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]], helping United go through to the final 2–1 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2017/matches/round=2000796/match=2019699/index.html |title=Celta 1–0 Man. United |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2017/matches/round=2000796/match=2019701/index.html |title=Man. United 1–0 Celta |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> On 24 May, Darmian started at left-back in the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|UEFA Europa League Final]] against Dutch-side [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], playing the full 90 minutes as United won 2–0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Ajax 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40004559 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 May 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Darmian made his first appearance of the [[2017–18 Manchester United F.C. season|2017–18 season]] on 8 August 2017 against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in the [[2017 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]], which United lost 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Jurejko |title= Real Beat Man Utd in Super Cup |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40788621 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> His first Premier League appearance of the season was on 9 September, in a 2–2 draw against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Matthew |last=Henry |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133352 |title=Stoke City 2–2 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 September 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> He didn't feature again in the league until 14 October in a 0–0 draw against Liverpool at [[Anfield]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41534299 |title=Liverpool 0–0 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 October 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> While not featuring in the league, Darmian did play in the [[UEFA Champions League]] in a 2–0 win over [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] on 31 October and in a 1–0 defeat against [[FC Basel|Basel]] on 22 November.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000881/match=2021636/index.html |title=Man. United 2–0 Benfica |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000881/match=2021660/index.html |title=Basel 1–0 Man. United |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> On 20 December, he played in United's 2–0 defeat to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup#Fifth round|EFL Cup fifth round.]]<ref>{{cite news |first=Brendon |last=Mitchell |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42334221 |title=Bristol City 2–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2017 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> Darmian made his first league start since October on 18 April 2018, playing against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] in a 2–0 victory. Three days later, he came off the bench in the 80th minute to see out United's 2–1 victory over Tottenham Hotspur in the [[2017–18 FA Cup#Semi-finals|FA Cup semi-final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43762296 |title=Manchester United 2–1 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 April 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> Darmian started in United's last league game of the season on 13 May, overseeing a 1–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] at Old Trafford.<ref>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Davis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44020156 |title=Manchester United 1–0 Watford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 May 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> He was left on the bench for Manchester United's 1–0 defeat to Chelsea in the [[2018 FA Cup Final|FA Cup Final]] on 19 May.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44091559 |title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 May 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> After falling out of favour with [[José Mourinho]], Darmian only managed eight league appearances the whole season, five of which were starts.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=45704&season_id=150 |title=Games played by Matteo Darmian in 2017/2018 |website=Soccerbase |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Despite speculation that Darmian would depart Manchester United in the summer for more playing time, he ended up staying for the [[2018–19 Manchester United F.C. season|2018–19 season]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Luke |last=Edwards |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/07/27/matteo-darmian-still-keen-leave-manchester-united/ |title=Matteo Darmian still keen to leave Manchester United |newspaper=The Telegraph |location=London |date=27 July 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Higgins |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/jose-mourinho-believes-matteo-darmian-will-stay-at-man-united |title=JOSE: I THINK DARMIAN WILL STAY AT UNITED |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |website=manutd.com |date=17 August 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> He started United's first game of the season on 11 August at right-back in a 2–1 victory over [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Emlyn |last=Begley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45053886 |title=Manchester United 2–1 Leicester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> Darmian's chances were limited until 24 November, when he started against Crystal Palace in a 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46244419 |title=Manchester United 0–0 Crystal Palace |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 November 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> On 5 December, he started at left-back in a 2–2 draw against Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46367294 |title=Manchester United 2–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 December 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> He played at right-back in United's 3–1 defeat to Liverpool on 16 December.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46497598 |title=Liverpool 3–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 December 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> On 5 January 2019, Darmian played at centre-back in Manchester United's 2–0 [[2018–19 FA Cup#Third Round Proper|FA Cup third round]] win over [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Davis |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46706809 |title=Manchester United 2–0 Reading |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 January 2019 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref> Caretaker manager [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]] praised Darmian's performance by saying, "He was one of the few who settled us down and tried to pass it and I don’t think he put a foot wrong.”<ref>{{cite news |first=Jamie |last=Allen |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/ole-gunnar-solskjaer-reaction-to-fa-cup-tie-with-reading |title=SOLSKJAER PLEASED WITH FA CUP PROGRESS |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |website=manutd.com |date=5 January 2019 |accessdate=5 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:20150616 - Portugal - Italie - Genève - Matteo Darmian 2.jpg|thumb|Darmian in action in a June 2015 friendly match in [[Geneva]], Switzerland.]] After playing for Italy at [[Italy national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[Italy national under-18 football team|under-18]] levels, he made his debut for the [[Italy national under-19 football team|under-19 squad]], led by [[Francesco Rocca]], in June 2007. At the [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2008 UEFA European U-19 Championship]] he played in the starting lineup, always in the role of a right full-back. In 2009, he took part in the [[Mediterranean Games]], playing seven games for the [[Italy national under-20 football team|under-20 side]]. On 25 March 2009, he made his debut for the [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy under-21 side]] in a 2–2 friendly match draw against [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria]], which was played in [[Vienna]]. From 10 to 12 March 2014, he was called up to the [[Italy national football team|senior national team]] by coach [[Cesare Prandelli]] as part of an internship to evaluate young players ahead of the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]],<ref>{{cite web|title=STAGE A ROMA DAL 10 AL 12 MARZO: SONO 31 I CONVOCATI DI PRANDELLI|url=http://www.figc.it/it/204/39145/2014/03/News.shtml|work=figc.it|publisher=Federazione Italiana Giuoco Calcio|accessdate=12 April 2014|language=Italian|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626110530/http://www.figc.it/it/204/39145/2014/03/News.shtml|archive-date=26 June 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and was also part of the next meeting between 14 and 15 April 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=TEST A COVERCIANO: PRIMA CHIAMATA PER ROMULO E BERARDI, TORNA CASSANO|url=http://www.figc.it/it/204/2523796/2014/04/News.shtml|work=figc.it|publisher=Federazione Italiana Giuoco Calcio|accessdate=14 May 2014|language=Italian|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924050254/http://www.figc.it/it/204/2523796/2014/04/News.shtml|archive-date=24 September 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Given his excellent season with Torino,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/it/news/2/serie-a/2014/06/10/4871550/la-vera-storia-di-darmian-freccia-torino-al-milan-con-abate|title=La vera storia di Darmian: freccia Torino, al Milan con Abate senior...|work=Goal.com}}</ref> on 13 May 2014, he was included in the list of 30 provisional players for the [[2014 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=ECCO I 30 PRE-CONVOCATI PER IL MONDIALE. IL 19 MAGGIO IL RADUNO|url=http://www.figc.it/it/204/2524143/2014/05/News.shtml|work=figc.it|publisher=Federazione Italiana Giuoco Calcio|accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref> He made his debut for the ''Azzurri'' on 31 May 2014, at the age of 24, playing as a right-back in a goalless friendly match with [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Ireland]] which was held in [[London]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/altre-notizie/italia-irlanda-0-0-il-tabellino-della-gara-560487|title=Italia-Irlanda 0–0: il tabellino della gara|website=tuttomercatoweb.com|language=Italian|accessdate=1 June 2014}}</ref> The following day, he was included in the list of 23 players selected for the 2014 World Cup.<ref>{{cite web|title=PRANDELLI HA SCELTO: ECCO I 23 AZZURRI CHE PARTIRANNO PER IL BRASILE|url=http://www.figc.it/it/204/2524458/2014/06/News.shtml|website=figc.it|publisher=Federazione Italiana Giuoco Calcio|accessdate=1 June 2014|language=Italian}}</ref> On 14 June 2014, he made his debut at the [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]], starting Italy's opening game against [[England national football team|England]], which Italy won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Italy 2–1 England|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285071|accessdate=15 June 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=14 June 2014}}</ref> He also played the next two games against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] and [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]], both of which were 1–0 defeats for Italy who failed to qualify for the next round.
In early 2015, he was awarded with the ''Pallone Azzurro'' as the best player of the national team for 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.quotidianopiemontese.it/2015/01/03/il-torinista-darmian-vince-il-pallone-azzurro/?fb_action_ids=767512486657189&fb_action_types=og.likes&fb_ref=.VKkX7pygPA4.like&fb_source=feed_opengraph&action_object_map=%7B%22767512486657189%22%3A871909262829807%7D&action_type_map=%7B%22767512486657189%22%3A%22og.likes%22%7D&action_ref_map=%7B%22767512486657189%22%3A%22.VKkX7pygPA4.like%22%7D#.VKks1NKG9A2|title=Il torinista Darmian vince il pallone azzurro|work=Quotidiano Piemontese}}</ref> On 10 October of that year, he scored his first international goal, which was the final one of a 3–1 away win over [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]] which sealed Italy's qualification to [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Azerbaijan 1–3 Italy|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33543966|accessdate=10 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 October 2015}}</ref> On 31 May 2016, he was named in [[Antonio Conte]]'s 23-man Italy squad for Euro 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/85206/official-italy-squad-euro-2016|title=OFFICIAL: Italy squad for Euro 2016|publisher=Football Italia|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> In the round of 16 of the tournament, at [[Stade de France]] in [[Paris]] on 27 June 2016, he came off the bench and set-up [[Graziano Pellè]]'s 91st minute volley to give the ''Azzurri'' a 2–0 win over defending champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Jim |last=Foulerton |title=Dominant Italy brush aside champions Spain |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000744/match=2018002/postmatch/report/index.html |website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |date=27 June 2016 |accessdate=27 June 2016 }}</ref> On 2 July 2016, he missed Italy's final penalty in a 6–5 shoot-out defeat to reigning World Cup champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in the quarter-finals of the competition.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Adams |title=Hector the shoot-out hero as Germany finally defeat Italy |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000449/match=2017903/postmatch/report/index.html |website=UEFA.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |date=2 July 2016 |accessdate=3 July 2016 }}</ref>
==Style of play== Although he started his career as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]], and has occasionally continued to be used in this role, and even played as a central or defensive midfielder for the Milan youth team, in recent years Darmian has predominantly played as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|wing-back]], or even as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] on occasion; due to his ability with both feet, he is capable of playing on either flank, although he prefers to be deployed on the right side of the pitch. An intelligent, dynamic, hard-working, and versatile player, he is known for his good quality of offensive and defensive play, as well as his tactical awareness, pace, and stamina, attributes which allow him to cover the wing effectively and provide width to his team when attacking; his professionalism, as well as his promising and consistent performances in his youth, led him to be compared to several esteemed Italian former full-backs, such as [[Antonio Cabrini]] and [[Paolo Maldini]].<ref>{{cite Manchester United player profile |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-utd-scott-mctominay-wiki-12965015 |work=Manchester Evening News |publisher=MEN Media |date=29 April 2017 |accessdate=30 April 2017 }}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | clubnumber = 39 | youthyears1 = 2002–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | caps1 = 26 | goals1 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2018– | nationalteam1 = [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 17:42, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:24, 21 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Scott Francis McTominay''' (born 8 December 1996)<ref>{{cite web |title=Scott McTominay |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/scott-mctominay-255193/ |work=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref> is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and the [[Scotland national football team|Scottish national team]].
==Club career== ===Manchester United=== ====Youth career==== McTominay was associated with the [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Manchester United academy]] from the age of five after attending the club's development centre in Preston.<ref name="ManUtd">{{Cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Who is Scott McTominay? |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Apr/who-is-scott-mctominay-inside-united-youth-focus.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=30 April 2017 |access-date=30 April 2017 }}</ref> Having played as a centre forward in the earlier years of his youth career, McTominay converted to a central midfield role under [[Warren Joyce]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Scott McTominay |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Scott-McTominay.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |access-date=30 April 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201075310/http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Reserves/Scott-McTominay.aspx |archive-date=2017-12-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> He signed his first professional contract in July 2013.<ref>{{Cite news |first=Joe|last=Short|title=Who is Scott McTominay? Everything you need to know about the Manchester United youngster|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/798394/Manchester-United-news-Scott-McTominay-bench-reserves-midfielder-rating|work=Express|date=30 April 2017|access-date=30 April 2017}}</ref>
He made seven appearances for the [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-18s]] between 2013 and 2015, but struggled due to his small size.<ref name="youthhawk">{{Cite web |title=Scott McTominay |url=http://youthhawk.co.uk/wiki/Scott_McTominay |website=youthhawk.co.uk |access-date=30 April 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170812173849/http://youthhawk.co.uk/wiki/Scott_McTominay |archive-date=2017-08-12 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> McTominay missed most of the 2014–15 season due to injuries relating to growth and development issues, growing 14 inches within two years.<ref>{{Cite news |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-utd-scott-mctominay-wiki-12965015|title=Who is Scott McTominay? Manchester United midfielder profile |work=Manchester Evening News |date=30 April 2017 |access-date=30 April 2017 }}</ref>
McTominay struggled again during the 2015–16 season, making 11 appearances across the [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-19s]] and [[Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Under-21s]], but commanded a place in the team the following season with three goals in 21 games prior to his senior call-up.<ref name="youthhawk"/>
====2016–17 season==== On 30 April 2017, McTominay was named on the substitutes' bench for a match against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in the [[Premier League]]. He made his first Premier League appearance on 7 May, coming on as a substitute against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]],<ref>{{Cite news |first=Stephan |last=Shemilt |title=Manchester United 1–1 Swansea City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39682899 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=28 April 2017 |access-date=30 April 2017 }}</ref> before starting Manchester United's final Premier League match of the season on 21 May, a 2–0 win at home to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |title=Manchester United 2–0 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39912026 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2017 |accessdate=31 July 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Ahead of the 2017–18 season, McTominay was named as a member of Manchester United's touring party for their pre-season tour of the United States, as well as for matches against [[Vålerenga IF|Vålerenga]] and [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Manchester United's Tour 2017 squad |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Tour-2017/Tour-2017-News/2017/Jul/jose-mourinho-names-his-manchester-united-squad-for-Tour-2017-presented-by-Aon.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=9 July 2017 |accessdate=31 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170813020832/http://www.manutd.com/en/Tour-2017/Tour-2017-News/2017/Jul/jose-mourinho-names-his-manchester-united-squad-for-Tour-2017-presented-by-Aon.aspx |archive-date=2017-08-13 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> In the match against Vålerenga on 30 July 2017, McTominay came on as a substitute for [[Paul Pogba]] just after the hour mark, and 10 minutes later, he scored his first senior goal for the club – the third in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |first=Joe |last=Ganley |title=Valerenga 0 Manchester United 3 |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Jul/Match-report-Valerenga-v-Manchester-United-Tour-2017-30-July.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=30 July 2017 |accessdate=31 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170730224611/http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2017/Jul/Match-report-Valerenga-v-Manchester-United-Tour-2017-30-July.aspx |archive-date=2017-07-30 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> McTominay made his first appearance of the season against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the [[EFL Cup]] on 20 September 2017, replacing [[Marcus Rashford]] in the 64th minute, in a 4–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=Manchester United 4–1 Burton Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249725 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref> He made his European debut on 18 October, against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], coming on for [[Henrikh Mkhitaryan]] in injury-time, winning a free-kick and getting [[Luisão]] sent off before seeing out the 1–0 away win.<ref>{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |title=Benfica 0–1 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41624728 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 October 2017 |accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref> Two days later, McTominay signed a new contract with United, keeping him at the club until June 2021, with an option to extend for a further year.<ref>{{cite news |title=Scott McTominay signs new contract at United |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Oct/scott-mctominay-is-rewarded-with-new-contract-at-united.aspx |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=20 October 2017 |accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref> He made his first start of the season on 24 October, in a 2–0 win over Swansea at [[Liberty Stadium]] in the EFL Cup fourth round.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard |title=Swansea City 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41647091 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2017 |accessdate=30 October 2017}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 21 January 2019, McTominay signed a contract extension, keeping him at United until 2023, with the option of another year.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/11613825/scott-mctominay-signs-new-manchester-united-contract|title=Scott McTominay signs new Manchester United contract|date=21 January 2019|work=Sky Sports|access-date=21 January 2019}}</ref> McTominay played more regularly for the United first team after this, as he replaced the injured [[Nemanja Matic]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/manchester-united/360/blog/post/3787696/scott-mctominay-takes-the-chance-to-show-his-worth-at-manchester-united |title=Scott McTominay takes the chance to show his worth at Manchester United |first=Andy |last=Mitten |date=1 March 2019 |accessdate=7 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== McTominay was born in England but has Scottish ancestry through his father coming from [[Helensburgh]].<ref name=helens>{{cite news|url=https://www.thenational.scot/sport/17507147.alex-mcleish-scott-mctominay-can-be-a-scotland-great-but-fans-shouldnt-expect-george-best/ |title=Alex McLeish: Scott McTominay can be a Scotland great - but fans shouldn't expect George Best |work=The National |publiher= |date=18 March 2019 |accessdate=}}</ref> McTominay attended training camps with the Scottish youth sides. In November 2017, McTominay told [[Scottish Football Association]] performance director [[Malky Mackay]] that he wanted to concentrate on securing a place in the Manchester United first-team.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41890205 |title=Scotland: Scott McTominay yet to decide on his international future |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=6 November 2017 |accessdate=7 November 2017}}</ref>
Speaking in February 2018, club manager [[José Mourinho]] suggested that new Scotland manager [[Alex McLeish]] should select McTominay "because it looks like England is missing him".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43105205 |title=Manchester United's Jose Mourinho says Scott McTominay deserves Scotland call |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=18 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}}</ref> McTominay pledged his future to Scotland and was selected in their squad for two friendlies in March.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43279384|title=Scott McTominay: Man Utd midfielder pledges international future to Scotland|date=4 March 2018|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43369364 |title=Six new faces in Alex McLeish's Scotland squad for March friendlies |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=12 March 2018 |accessdate=12 March 2018}}</ref>
Later that month, McTominay's grandfather revealed [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] wanted him to represent Scotland. Manchester United academy coach [[Brian McClair]] explained "McLeish made a huge effort getting to [[Trafford Training Centre|Carrington]] to meet up with him, because it was in the middle of the bad weather that we had. He made it, put a case. [[Gareth Southgate]] sent him a text."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/scotland/580/blog/post/3427665/scott-mctominay-choosing-scotland-over-england-was-a-no-brainer|title=Choosing Scotland easy for McTominay|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-03-24}}</ref>
On 23 March, McTominay was one of four players to be given their international debuts in McLeish's first game in charge.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.scottishfa.co.uk/news/scotland-defeated-1-0-by-costa-rica/?rid=14258|title=Scotland v Costa Rica {{!}} Match Report {{!}} Scottish FA|website=www.scottishfa.co.uk|language=en|access-date=2018-03-23}}</ref> He played the first 57 minutes in a 1–0 friendly defeat to [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] before being replaced by [[Stuart Armstrong]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43380252|title=Scotland 0–1 Costa Rica|date=2018-03-23|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-03-23|language=en-GB}}</ref> He made his first competitive appearance for Scotland in September 2018, as a 79th minute substitute for [[Callum McGregor]] in a 2–0 win against Albania.<ref name=sfa/>
