In May 2015, Tuanzebe won the Jimmy Murphy Young Player of the Year award.{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Bostock |title=Tuanzebe is United's Young Player of the Year|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/May/Axel-Tuanzebe-wins-Jimmy-Murphy-Young-Player-of-the-Year-award.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=19 May 2015 |accessdate=15 November 2016}} Academy coach [[Paul McGuinness (footballer)|Paul McGuinness]] noted that Tuanzebe was the first first-year scholar to captain the under-18 side since [[Gary Neville]]. |accessdate=29 January 2017}}{{cite web |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Tuanzebe closer to realising his dream |accessdate=29 January 2017}} ====2016–17 season==== On 29 January 2017, Tuanzebe made his Manchester United debut as a 68th-minute substitute, replacing [[Timothy Fosu-Mensah]] during a 4–0 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] victory over [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] at [[Old Trafford]].{{cite news |title=Manchester United 4–0 Wigan Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38709050 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 January 2017 |accessdate=29 January 2017}} Four days later, he extended his contract at Manchester United until 2020, with the option of a further year.{{cite news |title=Axel Tuanzebe signs new Manchester United contract |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10753590/axel-tuanzebe-signs-new-manchester-united-contract |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 February 2017 |accessdate=2 February 2017}} On 7 May 2017, Tuanzebe started a senior match for the first time, in a 2–0 defeat against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the Premier League.{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Lovett |title=Manchester United's Axel Tuanzebe 'chuffed' after making full debut and taking on Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-news-axel-tuanzebe-full-debut-chuffed-taking-on-alexis-sanchez-a7724446.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=8 May 2017 |accessdate=14 May 2017}} He won the Denzil Haroun Reserve Team Player of the Year award in May 2017.{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |title=Manchester United player Ander Herrera wins Player of the Year award|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-news-ander-herrera-13058295 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=18 May 2017 |accessdate=19 May 2017}} ====2017–18 season==== Tuanzebe made his first start of the season against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] on 24 October 2017, playing a key part in the second goal of the 2–0 victory.{{cite news |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard |title=Swansea City 0–2 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41647091 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2017 |accessdate=30 October 2017}} On 5 December 2017, he made his European debut in a 2–1 victory over [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]].{{cite news |first=Hafez |last=Shamoon |title=Manchester United 2–1 CSKA Moscow |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42229382|publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 December 2017 |accessdate=7 December 2017}} ====Aston Villa (loan)==== On 25 January 2018, Tuanzebe joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for the remainder of the season.{{cite news |title=Villa sign Man Utd defender Tuanzebe |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42818253 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 January 2018 |accessdate=25 January 2018 }} However, injuries meant he was only able to make five appearances before returning to Manchester United. He joined Aston Villa on loan again for the 2018–19 season.{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Tuanzebe heads back to Villa Park |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/axel-tuanzebe-rejoins-aston-villa-on-loan-for-season |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=6 August 2018 |accessdate=6 August 2018 }} ==International career== Tuanzebe began his international career in June 2016, when he made his first appearance for England at [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] level, against Mexico.{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Tuanzebe primed for first international tournament with England |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Jun/young-manchester-united-defender-axel-tuanzebe-first-international-tournament-with-england-under-19s.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=7 June 2016 |accessdate=29 January 2017}} He was a member of the [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] squad which won all three matches at the Four Nations tournament in October 2016.{{cite news |title=England Under-20s win mini-tournament after 2–0 win over USA |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/oct/10/england-u20s-2-0-usa-report-101016 |publisher=The Football Association |date=10 October 2016 |accessdate=29 January 2017}} Tuanzebe was withdrawn from selection for the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] due to club commitments.{{cite news |title=Man United's Axel Tuanzebe left out of England U20 World Cup squad|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/manchester-united/story/3121904/manchester-uniteds-axel-tuanzebe-left-out-of-england-u20-world-cup-squad |publisher=ESPN |date=8 May 2017 |accessdate=14 April 2018}} On 10 November 2017, Tuanzebe made his debut for [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] against [[Ukraine national under-21 football team|Ukraine]].{{cite news |title=Ukraine U21 0–2 England U21|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41884793 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2017 |accessdate=14 April 2018}} ==Style of play== Tuanzebe's preferred position is at [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]], but he can also play as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]], and has featured as a [[Midfielder#Holding midfielder|holding midfielder]].{{cite news |first=James |last=Ducker |title=Axel Tuanzebe out of England U-20 squad as Mourinho wants him to play more for Man Utd |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/09/axel-tuanzebe-england-u-20-squad-mourinho-wants-play-man-utd/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=9 May 2017 |accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Marshall |title=Axel Tuanzebe is coming of age at United |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2017/May/axel-tuanzebe-if-you-are-good-enough-you-are-old-enough.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=25 May 2017 |accessdate=30 October 2017}} His playing style has been compared to that of teammate [[Eric Bailly]] and Bayern Munich's [[Javi Martínez]].{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Tighe |title=Manchester United's Axel Tuanzebe Has Hallmarks of Eric Bailly and Javi Martinez |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2663571-manchester-uniteds-axel-tuanzebe-has-hallmarks-of-eric-bailly-and-javi-martinez |work=Bleacher Report |publisher=Turner |date=14 September 2016 |accessdate=10 May 2017}} Tuanzebe's performance on his first-team debut in a friendly against Wigan Athletic in July 2016 led manager [[José Mourinho]] to remark, "10 minutes is enough! The potential is there, you see it immediately."{{cite news |first=Simon |last=Bajkowski |title=Mourinho praises Manchester United youngster Tuanzebe for his EIGHT minutes against Wigan |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-axel-tuanzebe-mourinho-11624047 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=16 July 2016 |accessdate=10 May 2017}} ==Personal life== Tuanzebe was born in [[Bunia]], Democratic Republic of the Congo. He attended [[St Cuthbert's RC High School]] in [[Rochdale]] and captained the Year 7 football team to the final of the English National Schools Cup at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in 2009, with a team that also included [[Connor Ronan]] and [[Johny Diba]], both of whom went on to turn professional.{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |title=Manchester United youngster Axel Tuanzebe 'born for greatness' |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-youngster-axel-tuanzebe-10396435 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=11 November 2015 |accessdate=15 November 2016}} In the same year, he was awarded Sports Boy of the Year by the Mayor of Rochdale. He also represented his school in cross-country and triple-jump. He is the younger brother of ex-[[Clitheroe F.C.|Clitheroe]] striker Dimitri Tuanzebe.{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Luckhurst |title=Who is Axel Tuanzebe? Manchester United youngster in profile |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-is-axel-tuanzebe-united-11620920 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=29 January 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2017}} In July 2018, he broke the Guinness World Record for fastest time to clear a game of [[Hungry Hungry Hippos]].{{cite news |first=Charlotte |last=Dunker|title=Axel Tuanzebe breaks bizarre Guinness World Record on Manchester United pre-season tour|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/man-utd-tuanzebe-world-record-14923653 Kortrijk|Kortrijk]], on loan from English {{English football updater|ManchesU}} club [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. ==Club career== [[File:Manchester United v Burton Albion, 20 September 2017 (28).jpg|thumb|left|Pereira playing for United during a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in 2017.]] Born in [[Boudevilliers]], in the Swiss [[Canton of Neuchâtel]], Pereira began his career in the youth ranks of local [[Neuchâtel Xamax]] before transferring to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2012. He was part of the team that won the [[2014–15 Professional U21 Development League#League 1|2014–15 Under-21 Development League]] title, and extended his contract on 13 August 2015, amidst a goalkeeping saga at the club.{{cite news|last1=Magan|first1=Tony|title=Manchester United: Joel Pereira signs new contract amid Old Trafford goalkeeping uncertainty|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/manchester-united-joel-pereira-signs-new-contract-amid-old-trafford-goalkeeping-uncertainty-1515526|accessdate=26 February 2016|work=International Business Times|date=15 August 2015}} On 17 October 2015, he was loaned to [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] in [[Football League One]] for a month.{{cite news|title=Joel Castro Pereira: Manchester United goalkeeper joins Rochdale|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34560074|accessdate=26 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 October 2015}} Later that day, he had his first senior call-up, remaining an unused substitute as the team drew 0–0 away to [[Bury F.C.|Bury]]. On 10 November 2015, he made his debut in a 1–0 loss to [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]] at [[Spotland]], in the quarter-finals of the [[Football League Trophy]]. Manager [[Keith Hill (footballer)|Keith Hill]] praised the goalkeeper's performance after he was named [[man of the match]] and saved a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]].{{cite news|last1=Dawson|first1=Rob|title=Manchester United goalkeeper Joel Castro Pereira backed to be Reds' next star|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-goalkeeper-joel-castro-10429520|accessdate=26 February 2016|work=Manchester Evening News|date=11 November 2015}} On 19 November 2015, he extended his loan until 3 January 2016.{{cite news|title=Joel Castro Pereira: Man Utd goalkeeper returns to Rochdale|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34871938|accessdate=26 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 November 2015}} Two days later, Pereira made his [[The Football League|Football League]] debut, in a 2–0 away win against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34817294|title=Doncaster Rovers 0-2 Rochdale|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 November 2015|accessdate=26 November 2015}} He totalled eight appearances for Rochdale, six in the league.{{Soccerbase season|id=88427|season=2015|accessdate=27 June 2017}} On 25 February 2016, he had his first call-up to a senior Manchester United game, sitting on the bench for their 5–1 home win over [[FC Midtjylland]] in the last 32 second leg of the [[UEFA Europa League]].{{cite news|last1=Thompson|first1=Gemma|title=United squad energised by injection of youth|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Feb/louis-van-gaal-says-the-recent-introduction-of-young-players-has-lifted-the-first-team.aspx|accessdate=26 February 2016|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=25 February 2016}} On 31 August 2016, he joined [[Primeira Liga]] club [[C.F. Os Belenenses|Belenenses]] on loan.{{cite news|last1=Marshall|first1=Adam|title=Pereira moves to Belenenses on loan|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Aug/manchester-united-goalkeeper-joel-castro-pereira-joins-belenenses-in-portugal-on-loan.aspx|accessdate=29 September 2016|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=31 August 2016}} His loan spell ended on 5 January 2017, due to Manchester United's third-choice goalkeeper [[Sam Johnstone]] joining [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan.{{cite news|last1=Luckhurst|first1=Samuel|title=Manchester United goalkeeper Sam Johnstone leaves on loan|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-transfer-news-johnstone-12409499|accessdate=5 January 2017|publisher=Manchester Evening News|date=5 January 2017}} Pereira made his Manchester United debut on 29 January 2017, in an [[FA Cup]] fourth round tie against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], coming on as an 80th-minute substitute for [[Sergio Romero]].{{cite news|title=Manchester United 4–0 Wigan Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38709050|accessdate=24 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 January 2017}}{{cite news|title=FA Cup match report: Manchester United 4 Wigan Athletic web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/manchester-united-man-utd-joel-pereira-transfer-contract/iuq0ot2y6rp5zgap36m6szqa|title=Man Utd keeper Joel Pereira gets four-year deal - Goal.com|website=www.goal.com}} On 20 September 2017, he appeared as a substitute against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] and conceded a last-minute goal.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/20/manchester-united-vs-burton-albion-carabao-cup-live-score-updates/|title=Jose Mourinho suggests scrapping League Cup - 'Could English football survive without this competition? Maybe'|first1=James|last1=Ducker|first2=Rob|last2=Bagchi|date=20 September 2017|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}} On 2 August 2018, he joined [[Vitória F.C.|Vitória de Setúbal]] on loan for the 2018–19 season.{{cite news |title=Man Utd keeper Joel Pereira joins Vitoria Setubal on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45052507 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2018 |accessdate=3 August 2018 }} After making 10 appearances in all competitions, Pereira's loan spell was terminated in January 2019 and he returned to Manchester United.{{cite news |title=Joel Pereira regressa ao Manchester United |trans-title=Joel Pereira returns to Manchester United |url=https://vfc.pt/2019/01/09/joel-pereira-regressa-ao-manchester-united/ |website=vfc.pt |publisher=Vitória FC |language=Portuguese |date=9 January 2019 |accessdate=10 January 2019 }}{{cite news|title=Duo return to United from loan spells |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/duo-return-to-united-from-loan-spells |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United|date=10 January 2019|accessdate=10 January 2019}} At the end of January 2019, he went out on loan again, this time to Belgium with [[K.V. Kortrijk|Kortrijk]].{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Higgins |title=Joel Pereira moves to Belgium on loan |url=https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/man-united-goalkeeper-joel-pereira-makes-loan-move-to-belgian-side-kv-kortrijk |website=ManUtd.com |publisher=Manchester United |date=31 January 2019 |accessdate=31 January 2019 }} ==International career== In July 2016, Pereira was selected in the [[Portugal Olympic football team|Portugal]] squad for the [[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics|2016 Olympic Games]].{{cite web|title=Bayern Munich's Renato Sanches left out of Portugal's Olympic squad|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/portugal/story/2912862/renato-sanches-left-out-of-portugals-olympic-squad|publisher=ESPN FC|date=14 July 2016|accessdate=29 September 2016}} He was an unused substitute in all four of Portugal's matches in the tournament.
